  • Fluent English.

  • Readiness to re-locate.

item.title: Machine Learning Researcher Deep Learning (m/f) at Avira (Tettnang, Deutschland)
item.description:
Position Summary


With its approx. 100 million customers and about 500 employees, Avira is a globally leading provider of self-developed IT security solutions for private and professional consumers. It has more than 25 years of experience and is one of the pioneers in this industry. In Germany, Avira is located in Tettnang close to Lake Constance and one of the biggest regional employers. In addition, it has offices abroad and also maintains partnerships in Europe, Asia, and America.

For delivering the best possible protection against digital threats to our customers and due to the expansion of our team, we have an exciting career opportunity for a:

Machine Learning Researcher – Deep Learning (m/f)

As a member of the Advanced Research and Technologies Team, you will design, implement and maintain Machine Learning Systems with a focus on Deep Learning technology. You constantly interact with an international team of open-minded computer scientists located in Germany and Romania to find the very best solutions to a diverse set of interesting problems. You closely collaborate with other teams within the Avira Protection Labs in order to react to the newest malware trends when designing new products.

Your challenges



  • Research, Design, implement and maintain innovative Machine Learning systems for security related problems.

  • Collaborate within other teams within the Avira Protection Labs to leverage their security expertise and make sure our products provide the best protection to our customers.

  • Stay up to date with the latest Machine Learning and Deep Learning technology advancements in order to find new possibilities for innovation within the company.


Key to hiring



  • You have an advanced degree (MS./Ph.D) in computer science with a focus on Machine Learning/Deep Learning or related subjects.

  • You have a strong background in Deep Learning including a solid knowledge of different Deep Learning architectures, a profound theoretical understanding of analysis of algorithms, optimization techniques as well as strong awareness of best practices when designing Deep Learning systems.

  • You have demonstrated practical experience in Deep Learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Torch, Theano etc.

  • You have versatile programming skills in writing and reliable code in Python and are used to develop in a Linux environment 

  • You never stopped learning and are keen to extend your skills regarding Machine Learning and new technology stacks for any upcoming project.

  • Publications at top-tier international conferences (ICML, NIPS etc.) or significant contributions to open-source projects are considered a strong plus.


Performance objectives



  • Starting from day one you will familiarize yourself with our current Machine Learning environment, which we leverage to protect our customer base. Within one month you understand the software and hardware architecture of the existing Machine Learning systems.

  • In addition, within the first six months, you will collaborate in the design and implementation of a prototype for our next deep learning project. The learning system you design and develop will scale for a very large amount of data and provide high-performance and low maintenance. Your project will process security-related data and help in protecting our users on a global scale.

  • A year into the job you are part of a team that delivers the most up to date security solution to our millions of customers. You take ownership of cross-department projects and collaborate efficiently with other teams. You are keen to improve existing technology and implement new innovative features. You play a big part in securing and supporting the digital lifestyle of our customers and making the internet a more secure place.



If you are enthusiastic about broadening your technical expertise and have a desire to work in an environment that promotes creativity, research, innovation, and fun, we would love to hear from you!


Our offer




  • Freedom to develop innovative ideas and projects as well as implement them

  • Flat hierarchies and open door policies

  • Opportunity to work in an international team using the latest technologies

  • Extensive onboarding


If you are enthusiastic about broadening your technical expertise and have a desire to work in an environment that promotes creativity, research, innovation, and fun, we would love to hear from you!

This position is based in Tettnang, Lake Constance.

Please submit your application including your salary requirements and availability by clicking on the “Apply now” button. Online applications preferred.

item.title: QA Engineer at BESTSELLER (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As our new Test Engineer you will be part of our E-commerce department in the centre of Amsterdam, where you will be working with more than 100 colleagues from all over the world in a young, fast-paced and agile environment. You will play a key role within our Amsterdam office, leading the way to help BESTSELLER E-commerce push quality of the systems to the next level. You will take responsibility and pride in assuring quality for our E-commerce platform, omni-channel initiatives and our backend systems.  

Daily tasks will include 

  • Developing and improving a future-proof test strategy with our development lifecycle  

  • Taking responsibility for the quality of the application and the new features delivered 

  • Defining new improvements of the applications you’re working on  

  • Analyzing and determining the impact of defects and new enhancements 

  • Error analysis using all available information and tools 

  • Working closely with the scrum team in estimating, planning and coordinating testing activities 

  • Researching and driving the latest test process improvement that will lead to higher quality products  

  • Implementing Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery practices 



Why BESTSELLER?  

Besides being a challenging and inspiring place to work, we value a good work atmosphere and equally offer good benefits. To this extent, you can think off an excellent daily lunch made by a professional cook, a ‘fit for less’ plan, regular Friday events with colleagues. Last but not least, we have employees from all over the world and encourage international candidates to apply. If applicable, we will assist you in relocation formalities, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.  

Your qualifications

  • 3-5 years of experience in agile software engineering  

  • Extensive experience with manual and automated software testing  

  • Experience in preferably Java, JavaScript or any other Object Oriented programming language  

  • Experience with TDD, Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery and DevOps   

  • Experience in JUnit, Mockito, Spring and Selenium  

  • Excellent English communication skills (our company language)  

  • Bachelor degree or higher computer science / software engineering (or similar)  



Your Profile 

We are looking for an engineer with a passion for testing. You will be working in an environment with a genuine start up culture, making it important that you are pro-active and a real team player. You pro-actively work on improving the applications and our development lifecycle through validation and test automation. You feel responsible for the quality and stability of the application. You are an outgoing person who values an open and relaxed atmosphere, where quality and automation are of the highest importance. 

Interested?

We look forward to hearing from you! Please apply directly below. In case you have any further questions about the role, you are welcome to contact Stephanie Byrne, Recruitment Specialist on phone +31623217546 / stephanie.byrne@bestseller.com

item.title: Web Analyst at Helloprint (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Web Analyst


As a Web Analyst at Helloprint, you’re the beating heart between our technology and our business. You’re the analytical engine that powers our growth and the proactive business partner who provides all of our departments with spot-on insights in online customer behavior and performance. Not only that, but you are our internal expert in customer insights, analytics and web behavior.


You work at the Marketing & Business Intelligence department, along with a team of highly motivated young specialists at the top of their field. You make a thorough analysis of our customers' behaviour on our web portals in 8 countries, with the goal of growing faster and performing better. You’ll be working closely with Marketing, PPC, CRM and Product Team.


You analyze sales funnels, campaigns, channels and bugs, and you signal trends. You‘ll make your recommendations to our stakeholders at all levels in the company and create a report cycle that truly adds value to the business. You’re a true leader in this. You are proactive and come up with insights and recommendations that provide a direction for our teams. Your technical knowledge, business and analytical mindset form the basis for everything you do.


In addition, you are the evangelist when it comes to the design of our Analytics environment. You’re responsible for the Google Analytics 360 set up on all of our international web domains, tagging implementation through Google Tag Manager, the design of our test tooling, and the implementation of other measurement software and tooling. You spread that knowledge companywide - you are the expert in this area and are constantly working on the latest developments within your domain.


How you'll do this



  • You analyse the complete behaviour of all visitors and customers from the different brands at Helloprint in all 8 countries and you make sure your analysis leads to strong conversion improvement;

  • You translate in-depth web analytics into intelligent advice for our stakeholders with the goal of growing faster and becoming better;

  • You are the driving force behind creating report cycles that really add value to the business;

  • You translate goals into clear KPIs to ensure that each team can be sent in the right direction and has the necessary insights;

  • You lead the technical setup and implementation of our web tracking environment, using Google Analytics 360, Google Tag Manager, and various other web tracking and test tooling;

  • You work closely with our Marketing, Product, IT and Growth teams to strive for maximum performance;

  • You provide teams with clear guidelines about tracking and analytics.


What a regular day looks like


08:30: You arrive at the office on time and start the day with a delicious breakfast in the Living, freshly prepared by Juffrouw Janny. Once you're behind your laptop, you check the top KPIs in Google Analytics immediately. They look good which is a great start to your day! As soon as you dive into weekly reports, you notice that the Conversion Rate in the UK made a big drop this weekend. You start a thorough analysis to find the underlying problem and schedule a meeting for this afternoon with the Country Manager UK.


9:30: The daily stand-up meeting begins. One of your team members indicates that he’s having trouble gathering the right data. By chance, you know about a new feature that has just been implemented in Google Analytics. After the stand-up, you explain it to him. It’s always nice to help someone. To prepare for this afternoon's meeting, you dive into Google Analytics. You make an overview of the stats and make sure you are completely prepared for any questions. While you’re doing this, you notice the timeslots and there is still room for improvement. You quickly summarise some explanations, calculations and prepare a number of recommendations plus a killer presentation, inviting your Head of Marketing, Martin and CEO, Hans. Of course, you do not want to keep this valuable information from them.


12:00: Time for a delicious lunch in the Living. After lunch, you have a meeting with the new Category Marketer from Promotional Products and you have a few insights for him. Within 30 minutes, you make it clear to him where the problem lies based on your analysis and more importantly, what he can do to improve performance. You show him how to learn this online and invite him to the Google Analytics training you give each week to keep everyone informed of the latest developments.


14.00: After your meeting with the Category Marketer you have a meeting with Team Growth. At the moment, there is no data on how our customers use the editor tool. During the conversation, it becomes clear to you what their needs are and you get started immediately after the meeting. Afterwards, you will share it on our Wiki.


16:00: You use the last hours of the day to check our UTM parameters. Unfortunately, they are not working properly, so you decide to manually convert them. Manually performing tasks that can be done automatically is a waste of your time and so you plan a meeting later this week with your team members to see how you can prevent this in the future. You grab dinner in the Living before heading to the gym. Busy day!


What we're looking for



  • You have a masters degree in Econometrics, (technical) Business Administration, Mathematics, Psychology or Marketing Intelligence and you were top of your class;

  • You have at least 3 years of experience in a large e-commerce environment, but you're ready for a new step to really make a difference;

  • You can communicate complex analyses in a clear, understandable and convincing way to stakeholders across all levels of the company and show leadership in doing so;

  • You are extremely result-oriented: You always want to win;

  • You have extensive knowledge of A / B testing, Customer Journey Analysis, and Online Marketing and you are a Google Analytics and Tag Manager expert. You have extensive knowledge of Javascript and SQL (and a little Python is a huge plus);

  • You are not afraid of change, it gives you energy. You know like nobody else how to get the best results by making changes and have no trouble convincing others.


What we offer



  • Competitive compensation, including a bonus scheme;

  • A unique challenge at one of Europe’s fastest growing e-commerce companies;

  • A fast-paced learning curve: you get big challenges instead of tasks to work on, which makes you learn faster;

  • A unique culture with 21 nationalities, an average age of 28 and an environment where freedom and responsibility are central;

  • The most beautiful office in Rotterdam, right on the Witte de Withstraat, the best street in Rotterdam it’s just 5 minutes from Rotterdam Central Station;

  • Breakfast, lunch and dinner arranged for you, super healthy and delicious, with lots of love made by our own Juffrouw Janny;

  • Opportunities to grow, even into our Leadership Team. We don’t look for age or background, if you are extremely good, you will grow quickly;

  • The opportunity to make yourself better: Courses, events and more, if you want to develop, you have that opportunity;

  • The best hardware and software to work with and a laptop of your choice.

  • Seriously: The best business bubbles, Team Events, our own HelloSkybar ™, do we need to say more?


Up for it?


Apply today for the challenge of your life. Our process is simple: you apply through our website and you will hear from us within 5 working days. If you do not hear from us, you did not make it to the next round. If you have, we will schedule a short phone call to let you know. What will follow are three interviews at our office: one to get to know you, a ‘performance check’, and one in-depth interview accompanied by a “personality test”. Perhaps a case or inhouse day will follow because we only want the very best at Helloprint.


Welcome to Helloprint. Design Yourself!

item.title: AWS Software Architect at dormakaba Schweiz AG (Rmlang, Switzerland)
item.description:
We are one of the top 3 global providers of access and security solutions. With around 16,000 employees, we support our customers in over 130 countries worldwide. And anyone who gets to know us as an employer immediately senses: we are curious about people and always expect the best from them. Openly approaching new colleagues and confidently welcoming them - for us, that is part of the culture that has been making us successful for years. Trust is what connects us deeply. And is the perfect starting capital for your career path with us.


For our dormakaba digital team in Rümlang we are looking for you: an experienced, motivated team player as:


AWS Software Architect (w/m)


Your tasks:



  • Design and deploy scalable, highly available and fault-tolerant systems on AWS

  • lift and move an existing on-premises application to AWS

  • Ingress and egress of data to and from AWS

  • Select the appropriate AWS service based on data, compute, database or security requirements

  • Identify the appropriate use of proven AWS architectural best practices

  • Estimate AWS costs and identification of cost control mechanisms


To successfully perform this function, you will meet the following requirements:



  • One or more years of hands-on experience with the development of available, cost-efficient, fault-tolerant and scalable distributed systems in AWS

  • in-depth knowledge of at least one high-level programming language

  • Ability to identify and define requirements for an AWS-based application

  • Experience in providing hybrid systems with on-presis and AWS components

  • Ability to provide best practices for building secure and reliable applications on the AWS platform


Would you like to actively support us in our tasks with your experience and your knowledge? Then please send us your complete application documents which you please submit via the button below . Mr. Jochen Übele from the HR Team AS EMEA in Wetzikon is your contact person for this job.

item.title: Android Developer (Shanghai) - LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY at Booking.com (Shanghai, China)
item.description:
We are looking for a talented Android Developer to join our Technology team in our Shanghai office and help Booking.com BV to make the best travel app in the world! Booking.com’s application has millions of downloads and a huge amount of active users. You will be a part of our newly formed China Product Development team in Shanghai. Join us and support Booking.com BV’s #1 accommodation platform with some of the industry’s smartest people!


B.responsible


Our guiding principle is that by helping users we help the business, so we listen to Booking.com users and give them features they want to use.  As a developer in our mobile team you’ll be part of the idea generation process, working in a small startup-like group which takes ownership of its part of the projects. You’ll be working on the iterative improvements we make as part of our high-speed release cycles, as well as looking ahead and implementing broader changes to the mobile app. Important aspects of the job include:



  • Rapidly develop new features and A/B test them with users

  • Solve issues with the app, prioritizing based on user impact

  • Collaborate with Back-end Developers, Product Owners and Designers to constantly improve the Android app

  • Contribute to growing the team through interviewing, on-boarding, or other recruitment efforts.


B.skilled


We expect our developers to know the ins and outs of the Android framework and to deliver polished products customers want to use. We need self-starters who are great at solving problems, initiate solutions and discussions and are not afraid of solving challenges due to our huge scale.


We have found that people who match the following requirements are the ones who fit us best:



  • 3+ years of Android application development using Android SDK

  • 5+ years of experience as a developer with Java and other languages

  • Be able to work on a primarily Chinese version of our app

  • Strong interaction and design sense, excellent attention to detail

  • Self-motivated to explore new technologies, applications and environments

  • Self-starter, highly motivated, team-player


Bonus Points for:



  • Experience with Android Market place & Distribution Process

  • An approved Play store app

  • SQL knowledge and/or willingness to learn

  • Experience working with A/B testing

  • You are passionate about open source and contribute

  • You’re not afraid to solve deep technical challenges of a whole new level at a huge scale

  • You have an intrinsic curiosity in technological innovations and you are always on top of the latest trends

item.title: QA Automation Engineer (m/w) at Shpock (Wien, sterreich)
item.description:
Shpock is the marketplace app for the smartphone generation. We launched just 4 years ago but already we have set a new trend in online selling. We have become one of the leading marketplace apps in the German speaking countries as well as the UK and Italy with more than 10 million users. We continue to fulfil our vision and grow like never before! That's why we are constantly looking for new and motivated team members to work with us from our beautiful office in Vienna. Apply now and become part of Shpock and our success story.


What you will do:



  • You are responsible for setting up and improving efficient and thorough testing procedures together with the product and development team.

  • You will test our iOS and Android app, as well as our website throughout the whole software development cycle and help out in the other technical areas when testing is needed.

  • You will help build and improve the continuous integration setup and write test automation scripts.

  • You will continually record test cases and results, communicate issues clearly to the developers and product management.

  • Report bugs and follow up on fixes.

  • Check stability of our apps using crash report aggregation services.

  • Have the main responsibility for the apps and website working perfectly, to give our users the best experience.


Skills & Requirements


Who are we looking for?



  • You are an experienced tester with a strong focus on native apps and websites with extensive test automation experience and excellent knowledge of test methodologies.

  • You have experience with testing tools like XCTest framework, Espresso, Appium, Selenium and Jenkins to automate test processes.

  • You have a strong attention to details and can identify possible usability issues and actual technical bugs.

  • You are a good communicator and can feedback to both management and developers.

  • You ideally have:

    • A degree in Computer Sciences, in a similar field of study or a completed apprenticeship in a HTL.

    • The ISTQB certificate.

    • Experience with setting up automated testing.

    • Experience with JIRA.



  • You have very good English skills (German is a plus).

item.title: Senior Frontend Engineer (f/m) at Delivery Hero AG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Delivery Hero is building the next generation global online food-ordering platform. Our awesome international team already operates in over 40 countries worldwide to ensure hungry customers get to their favorite takeaway food the fastest way possible. The company has grown from its inception in 2011 to become the world's largest food-ordering network. This is an exciting time for Delivery Hero with a huge and rapid amount of growth in countries, market size and opportunities. Our ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, innovative and good at "getting things done." You will play an active role in our future - an exciting job and a workplace in the heart of Berlin is waiting for you!



Your mission



  • Working with Pizza.de web application, bleeding edge technical stack (ES6, React + Redux, Webpack).

  • Implement new features and improve user experience of existing solutions.

  • Be data-driven, analyze impact of features, make hypothesis and implement new solutions.



Your heroic skills



  • You have 3+ years overall professional web application development experience

  • Excellent knowledge of JavaScript (ES5 and ES6)

  • Proficient in React + Redux / Flux, knowledge of Sagas is a huge plus

  • Experience with NodeJS, NPM (Yarn) and Webpack

  • Experience with different testing approaches

  • Working experience with CSS and pre/post processors - SASS, PostCSS, understanding BEM principles; CSS modules is a plus

  • Interest in new web technologies

  • Good understanding of SEO principles and ensuring that application will adhere to them

  • A well-structured way of working and the ability to meet deadlines

  • Fluent in English

We offer you:



  • International working atmosphere and cross-cultural teams.

  • Flexible working hours.

  • Great career opportunities.

  • Safety of a large company: pension scheme and stability.

Have we caught your attention? Then please send us your application including cover letter, CV, salary expectations and earliest starting date. We’re looking forward to your application!

We are looking for a flexible, experienced and ambitious QA Analyst with the right attitude and skill-set to work with us.

  • Monthly contract renewal


What we ask of you:



  • Lead our QA effort focused on functional testing of our core SaaS platform, websites, touch screens and mobile apps.

  • Identify bugs through automated and manual testing, and assess their criticality

  • Create and improve automated QA processes on all stages (continuous integration)

  • Create and improve test plans and usability scenarios for our portfolio of products

What we offer you:

  • A young, diverse, fun and dynamic team at a fast-paced startup.

item.title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer at BESTSELLER (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Technology is everything in e-commerce, it’s your job to build the smoothest front-end combined with implementing the business logic in the back-end for the best performance according the latest standards and for every device. Do you want to be part of a dynamic and fast-growing fashion E-commerce department? Then we are looking for you!


As a Full-Stack Engineer you will be part of our E-commerce department in the center of Amsterdam, where you will be working together with more than 140 colleagues from all over the world in a young, fast-paced and agile environment. You will play a key role within our Amsterdam office, leading the way to help BESTSELLER E-commerce push for quality systems and high converting websites in 12 countries and for more than 17 different brands.  


Moreover, your tasks will include:



  • Building new features in the front-end and integrating them in the back-end of our websites using; Salesforce Commerce Cloud, JavaScript (server & client), Java, SASS

  • Improving performance, standards & SEO to always adapt to the latest standards

  • Conducting code reviews, pair programming and writing automated tests 

  • Implement Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery practices, we try to automate everything

  • Sharing knowledge with your team members


Your Qualifications



  • 3-5 years of experience in agile development

  • Experience in preferably JavaScript or any other Object Oriented programming language

  • Knowledge of software design patterns and principles such as DRY and SOLID

  • Experience in SCSS, & style guide driven development is a plus

  • Experience in Scrum, Git, Grunt, TeamCity, JIRA and Commerce Cloud (is an advantage)

  • Bachelor degree or higher computer science / software engineering (or similar)

  • Good English communication skills (our company language)


Your Profile



Your work is used and seen by a huge group of users and the applications are cutting edge on every thinkable device.  You will be working in an environment with a genuine start up culture, therefore it is vital that you are pro-active and a real team player. Solid knowledge of e-commerce and the processes within is essential, as you will be navigating in an international and dynamic e-commerce department. Our ideal candidate will be an all-rounder with extensive knowledge of the backend and OO programming.


Interested?


We look forward to hearing from you! Please apply directly below. In case you have any further questions about the role, you are welcome to contact Elin Akerstrom, Recruitment Specialist on phone +31657459894.

item.title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer at Bitnami () (allows remote)
item.description:
Bitnami is at the forefront of innovation that scales up to the largest production clouds, as well as down-to-laptop development environments. Millions of applications are launched every month with Bitnami technologies.


Our Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team deploys microservices to clouds leveraging modern practices such as containers, Kubernetes and immutable infrastructure.  The SRE team is responsible for the availability and performance of the production infrastructure as well as partnering with the other engineering teams to successfully build, deploy and manage Bitnami’s services. We are all about tools and automation, not toil and firefighting. If you enjoy working with the cloud, containers, automation and instrumentation, you should join our mission to bring awesome software to everyone.


You must bring an understanding of the IT business (typically gained by having built or worked extensively with a private or public cloud); a broad perspective of the cloud industry and where it is headed; and experience in building solutions that scale. You will be collaborating with engineers around the world to bring cutting-edge solutions to market. Working with all of the significant cloud providers and container infrastructures will provide you with challenges and opportunities rarely found elsewhere.


Responsibilities




    • Design and execute our Kubernetes clusters strategy to help our development teams deliver faster and more reliably

    • Drive adoption of Kubernetes and Kubernetes best practices across the company and industry

    • Create and/or provision reliable tools and infrastructure that enable rapid iteration amongst the product, research and development teams

    • Automate our infrastructure following the pattern Infrastructure as Code

    • Monitor, measure and troubleshoot infrastructure and services

    • Optimize business continuity capabilities and drive down incident recovery times

    • Capacity planning and management

    • Provide support during office hours

    • Mentor other members of the team (both inside and outside the SRE team)



Requirements




    • At least 5 years of experience deploying, monitoring and troubleshooting multi-tier SOA applications and distributed systems at scale

    • Software development with any or all these programming languages: Ruby, Go, Java, Javascript, Python

    • Instrumentation for status and trend monitoring experience (CloudWatch, Prometheus, Graphite, etc.)

    • Experience with modern application system log management (Syslog, SumoLogic, Fluentd, Loggly, Splunk, etc.)

    • Container or cloud orchestration experience with at least one scheduler (Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, Mesos, etc.)

    • Highly developed cloud literacy with strong knowledge of AWS, GCE and Azure

    • Broad experience with Linux kernel and shell, TCP/IP and HTTP

    • Designing networks and systems for security, encryption, performance and agility

    • Backup and restoration automation, business continuity planning and testing



Nice to Haves




    • Database administration experience with MySQL replication and high availability

    • Knowledge of networking and security best practices with software defined networks

    • Experience with big data, streaming and search systems like Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Kafka and ElasticSearch



Benefits/Perks




    • Competitive salary and stock options

    • Flexible time off policy; we believe everyone needs to recharge

    • Your choice of operating system and hardware

    • Annual trips to Spain (if working remotely)

    • Benefits vary based on location

item.title: SysAdmin/DevOps Engineer for Berlin-based international food delivery company! at foodora (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
foodora - bringing good food into your everyday! 


foodora is a Berlin-based food delivery service that partners exclusively with beloved local restaurants to deliver quality meals in 19 countries around the globe. We know the best that our cities offer and we’re bringing it online, enabling our customers to order their favourite food through our app (for iOS or Android) or web portal. We provide our restaurant-partners with an on-demand fleet of bicycle couriers, making it simple for customers around the world to access delicious meals.  


We're currently expanding through Europe, Asia, Canada and Australia and we are always on the hunt for the brightest minds to join our team. Not only do we want to bring quality food to customers around the world, we also want to redefine delivery food to include the very best meals from beloved local restaurants.


We are currently looking for multiple hires - from mid level to Senior System/DevOps Engineer (m/f) for our Berlin HQ!


Responsibilities:



  • Help us to launch and maintain successful websites all over the world

  • Take actively part in the design, building and maintenance of our complex, large and decentralised infrastructure

  • Ensure the technical success, development and enhancement of our international business

  • Support the teams that are using the infrastructure including taking part in an on-call rotation

  • Work in a team and have the chance to work across various challenging tasks


Requirements:



  • University degree or an equivalent education

  • Solid knowledge in Cloud-based infrastructures, mainly AWS

  • Proficiency in Containers, mainly Docker

  • Hands-on experience in several Configuration Management Systems

  • Fluency on Bash and either Python or Ruby

  • Experience in solving problems and strong troubleshooting skills

  • Proficiency in designing, implementing, optimizing and maintaining infrastructures combined with a clear understanding of caching technologies and DDoS protection

  • Enjoy working and learning as part of a team


What We Offer:


A modern office in the heart of Berlin, close to amazing restaurants and bars. Inside the walls of this office you’ll find:



  • An empowering, international and agile working environment

  • Responsibility from day one in an innovative and rapidly expanding tech business

  • Regular office parties and exciting team events

  • And a bunch of cool extras including a kicker table, table tennis and a playstation room, as well as free language classes and of course a monthly corporate discount for foodora!

item.title: Engineering Lead - Retail Core (Java/Scala) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
The Opportunity


Zalando is the leading online Fashion platform and one of the biggest Tech companies in Europe. We re-imagine Fashion for the good of all and see technology as the key driver to get there. The 1,600+ members of Zalando Technology across our offices in Germany, Ireland and Finland build most of our 40+ platform products in-house and open source, and Retail Core is at the heart of all of this. In Retail Core, we are building the most advanced and automated procure-to-pay IT solution in the Fashion industry. Our systems automate the key process steps in fashion buying, fully integrate with our suppliers through EDI and REST APIs, and provide easy-to-use UIs and workflows to our 800+ internal users and 1500+ suppliers, incl. a fully-fledged supplier portal.


As an Engineering Lead Retail Core, you will lead up to 2 of our agile Engineering Teams, each with between 4 and 7 software engineers. You will be providing technical direction, coaching and ongoing leadership for your teams to drive the core of our business: Fashion buying and merchandising. This means that you will be as close to our core business as possible, work on key business problems and have a lot of interaction with the internal and external users of our systems.


You Are Setting Standards


Impact. You drive team mastery in world-class development techniques to deliver a high-performance, stable and auto-scaling production system.


Vision. You develop and execute the mid- & long-term technical vision and architecture with your team while fostering close collaboration with other Engineering Managers to be in line with our overall tech strategy.


Collaboration. You define OKRs with your team to achieve a high-level alignment on a half-year basis and facilitate collaboration, communication, and decision-making between different engineering teams and stakeholders. You act as a sparring partner to Product Owners / Managers when creating the product vision, and you co-own the product roadmap.


Development. You develop your team members, help them solve technical challenges and enable them to discover their full potential. You develop tomorrow’s bar raisers.


Growth. You attract, assemble and retain the right engineering talent while cultivating a culture of ownership, mastery, innovation, and purpose. You proudly represent Zalando at conferences and meetups and give technical talks.


You Are Skilled


Experience. In designing and operating large-scale applications on a PaaS/SaaS cloud, preferably AWS, and you bring 5-10 years of direct coding experience to the table.


Technologies. You master object-oriented programming languages like Java and Scala (for backend components) and can also help your teams develop front-end components using today’s most popular frameworks. On top, you can work with SQL databases and REST APIs in a highly distributed, scalable and resilient microservice landscape.


Leadership. You excel at developing and mentoring software engineers and have 4+ years of experience in team leadership and agile development methodologies. You can also work cross-functionally and manage complex projects with various stakeholders throughout the company.


Passion. You stay on top of latest developments in software design, architecture and web services and you are passionate about well-structured, readable and testable code. Knowledge of event-based systems and event queues in general will be considered a big plus.


Drive. You want to have impact by effectively managing conflicts and priorities, in thinking creatively and solution-oriented. You enjoy driving continuous improvement and innovation.


You Are Offered


Culture. Culture of trust, empowerment and feedback; 100+ internal guilds; tech talks; product demos; coder dojos.


Package. Very competitive salary (base and equity) and many perks, such as great shopping discount on a wide range of products on zalando.com; discounts from external partners; public transport discounts; relocation assistance for internationals; municipality services*; family service and parent & child rooms*; additional holidays & volunteering time off; diverse sports and health offerings.


Development. Extensive onboarding; personal branding support focused on leadership; opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.


Peers. International, accomplished experts and great self-organized teams.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact Rebecca Kurzbuch.

item.title: Full-Stack Developer in GeoLocation Team (f/m) at Delivery Hero AG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Delivery Hero is building the next generation global online food-ordering platform. Our awesome international team already operates in over 40 countries worldwide to ensure hungry customers get to their favorite takeaway food the fastest way possible. The company has grown from its inception in 2011 to become the world's largest food-ordering network. This is an exciting time for Delivery Hero with a huge and rapid amount of growth in countries, market size and opportunities. Our ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, innovative and good at "getting things done." You will play an active role in our future - an exciting job and a workplace in the heart of Berlin is waiting for you!


Your mission:



  • Develop highly reliable global services used across 40 countries.

  • You would be a part of a cross-functional and multi-cultural Team, which builds and supports geographical services.

  • Be data-driven, analyze impact of features, make hypothesis and implement new solutions.

  • Grow and expand your expertise in Delivery Hero’s technology stack.



Your heroic skills:



  • You have 3+ years of professional hands-on experience in web services development with Python, Flask and SQL.

  • You take care of your products. Testing, monitoring, debugging is your bread and butter.

  • Experience and interest in working with existing and emerging cloud technologies.

  • Passion for new technologies.

  • Proficiency in reading and writing documentation.

  • Experience with Git and the collaborative GitHub workflow.

  • Hands on experience with React+Redux, PostGIS, Pandas and Kubernetes as an advantage. 



We offer you:



  • International working atmosphere and cross-cultural teams.

  • Goal oriented environment.

  • Flexible working hours.

  • Great career opportunities.

  • Safety of a large company: pension scheme and stability.

  • Nice work environment and English as working language.

  • For applicants from abroad: relocation package and German lessons.




Have we caught your attention? Then please send us your application including cover letter, CV, salary expectations and earliest starting date. We’re looking forward to your application!

item.title: Senior/Lead Drupal (PHP) Engineer at Compucorp Ltd. () (allows remote)
item.description:
We like to build stuff… sometimes complicated stuff… for Art Galleries, Non-Profits and Charities.


We’re an innovative bootstrapped startup based in London in the UK. We've grown to over 30 staff in the past 2 years based solely on the quality of the work we’ve been producing for our clients and we’re on the lookout for a talented Senior Drupal/PHP Engineer to join our team.


We do things a little differently, basing all our solutions on open source products, our work covers web design, app development and branding for Charities and non-profit organisations across the country. Our clients include Charities such as Wikimedia and Farm Africa, galleries such as the Photographers Gallery and Craft Central but we've got a long client list that includes other companies, trade associations and government bodies making us a rich and rewarding place to work.


We are an established and growing Drupal agency, working on many exciting and challenging projects. Most of our solutions are based on Drupal and a widely used CRM module known as CiviCRM that integrates well to the CMS. The combination of the two platforms adds an extra layer of complexity to our work and will give you exposure to other technologies then standard Drupal and a chance to further develop your skills.


The ideal candidate will have:


- 4+ Years Drupal experience
- Expert knowledge of configuring and building Drupal 7 sites
- Demonstrable experience of having contributed to the Drupal community
- Strong Git experience (you know your submodules from your subtrees!) and knowledge of working with Drupal in a team environment (i.e. using features).
- Applicable Acquia certification a bonus
- Strong Linux Skills
- Experience writing PHP unit tests for Drupal
- Object oriented PHP skills (and/or experience with Drupal 8)
- Experience with CiviCRM or working with CRM's in general


What were looking for is someone who can grasp concepts quickly, has great attention to detail, and most importantly loves a tech challenge. In short, we’re a young team of self confessed geeks who love tinkering and tweaking until something is just right and are looking for someone who thinks and acts like us. If you're interested in the role, please send your CV through to us with a short covering letter explaining what got you interested and why you think you will fit in.

item.title: Senior/Lead QA (Test) Engineer at Compucorp Ltd. () (allows remote)
item.description:
Are you the QA engineer to help us implement a robust QA process for our open source platforms developed for non profit organisations?


We like to build stuff… sometimes complicated stuff… and sometimes it breaks! So we’re looking for a confident and ambitious Senior QA Test Engineer to join our distributed team.


We do things a little differently, basing all our solutions on open source products, having flexible working hours and real team mentality. Our work covers web design, CRM, app development and branding for Charities and non-profit organisations across the country. Our clients include Charities such as Wikimedia and Farm Africa, galleries such as the Photographers Gallery and Craft Central but also companies, trade associations and government bodies.


We are also developing several open source products that are used by non profit organsiations worldwide and the role will be uniquely rewarding as you will have the opportunity to influence and support these valuable projects.


The ideal candidate will be an experienced QA engineer who has worked on many complex web applications in the past.


The role will involve a mixture of writing and executing manual test scripts, feeding back to developers on bugs or issues noted. There may also be some future work on automation testing although the primary focus for this role will be manual testing. The ideal candidate would have some existing CRM and CMS experience (ideally Drupal), be an expert in developing comprehensive test plans and submitting bug reports. SQL knowledge and the ability to setup a basic development environment with Git would be a major advantage but are not essential for the role.


What were looking for is someone who can grasp concepts quickly, has great attention to detail, and loves picking holes in (other people’s!) logic. In short, we’re a team of self confessed geeks who love tinkering and tweaking until something is just right, and we’re looking for someone who thinks and acts like us to join our growing team.


The idea candidate will have:


- 5+ years experience developing test cases and plans for complex web applications
- Experience with implementing solid testing methodologies and processes within an existing organisation
- SQL skills a plus
- Basic git skills and an understanding of git workflows a plus
- A keen interest in developing open source technologies for non profit organisations

item.title: Senior/Lead PHP Engineer at Compucorp Ltd. () (allows remote)
item.description:
We like to build stuff… sometimes complicated stuff… for Art Galleries, Non-Profits and Charities.


We’re an innovative bootstrapped startup based in London in the UK. We've grown to over 30 staff in the past 2 years based solely on the quality of the work we’ve been producing for our clients and we’re on the lookout for a talented Senior/Lead PHP Engineer to join our team.


We do things a little differently, basing all our solutions on open source products, having flexible working hours and a real team mentality. Our work covers web design, app development and branding for Charities, Art Galleries and Non-profit organisations across the country. Our clients include Charities such as Wikimedia, Amnesty and Farm Africa, galleries such as the Photographers Gallery and Craft Central but we’ve got a long client list that includes other companies, trade associations and government bodies.


Your principle focus will be on developing functionality as part of the CiviCRM and Drupal frameworks for the CiviCRM and CiviHR projects (https://civicrm.org/ and https://civihr.org) but there's a lot going on at Compucorp so expect to be exposed to other technologies too!


We're looking for someone who can join a great team in mid-flight, have instant results and can help us to create great products for Charities around the world.


What we are looking for:


The ideal candidate will have:

What were looking for is someone who can grasp concepts quickly, has great attention to detail, and most importantly loves a tech challenge. In short, we’re a team of self-confessed geeks who love tinkering and tweaking until something is just right and are looking for someone who thinks and acts like us.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist - Pricing & Forecasting at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics to big brands, to manufacturers - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


Forecasting is at the core of our commercial operation. Forecasting tools help to determine how much of each product to buy, to recommend the best prices, and to ensure that we have the right level of logistics capacity to fulfil customer demand. We use cutting edge Machine Learning technology to forecast demand and pricing with a focus on business and customer experience.


YOUR ROLE


As a Senior Data Scientist, you are part of a cross-functional agile team.



  • You have end-to-end responsibility. You are accountable for all aspects of your work, from data analysis and research, to KPI definition, testing and deployment. You have +3 years of professional experience and you are passionate to drive and develop a great product as part of an agile team.


  • You support product discovery. You are working with product management and stakeholders to define the scope of data science products. You have great communication skills to translate data science topics to business stakeholders.


  • You pick the right approach for a given problem. You have a deep understanding of standard Machine Learning methods such as Generalized Linear Models, (Recurrent) Neural Networks, State Space Models (SSMs), in particular how to leverage them to handle temporal data. You’re holding a degree (PhD or M.Sc.) in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or other similar quantitative field.


  • You know how to deal with data. You have the skills to query, analyze, and cluster data and know how to set up monitoring and data quality assurance.


  • You bring machine learning systems to production. You collaborate with engineers to translate forecasting prototypes into production systems. You have experience with Python, ML-related libraries such as pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, and big data frameworks such as Spark.


WHY SHOULD YOU APPLY



  • You have impact. Your contribution to our business critical forecasting products will have a broad visibility across the company and management levels.


  • You can influence. Zalando’s dynamic structures and processes give you a huge opportunity to drive ideas and influence your working environment.


  • We create career opportunities. Our tech departments are ever growing, offering various career opportunities for your future, whether you want to become a Principal Data Scientist, or step into a new role.


  • We support your networking. You have the opportunity to attend and speak at related conferences and meetups, and encouragement to publish your work (open source commitment), we host game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, Hack weeks, parties and events.


  • The Benefits. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.


WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


Please make sure your application is written in English. If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact our recruiter Almog Greenberg.

item.title: Security Engineer at Clevertech () (allows remote)
item.description:
DESCRIPTION


Clevertech is looking for a Security Engineer to join our global team. We are looking for team members to help us develop world-class software products for the most exclusive organizations in the world. We have been at this since 2000, and continue to grow off our best asset, our people.


You are comfortable with security protocols and DevOps development. You have worked extensively with the Zed Attack Proxy Protocol and understand vulnerabilities and engage in proactive problem-solving.


REQUIREMENTS


Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code. You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like-minded individuals.


Technically, you have an excellent background with AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, logging, monitoring, and build tools. Well qualified applicants will have deep experience in the latest libraries and programming techniques. You enjoy being on the bleeding edge of technology and are well versed in modern programming languages.


BENEFITS


Own Your Time


We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.


Focused Work


You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.


Learn at your edges


We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.


And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.


Recharge Time


We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.


Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz.

item.title: Sr Ruby on Rails Developer at whitespectre () (allows remote)
item.description:
We are a globally distributed Software Development Consultancy, with offices in Barcelona. We partner closely with our clients to provide long-term embedded expertise as an integral part of their product/engineering team. Our focus is product excellence, Rails platform and mobile application development.


We have been working on an iOS application for our client and, for the next phases, need to build out greenfield backend services to support the next level of functionality. This will be APIs based on Rails - and that is where you come in. And BTW, we have positions open for 3 developers - 1 Senior and 2 Mid level. So, depending on your experience level we may have the right role.


What do we offer?



  •  A new greenfield project; the chance for you to help define the solution from the ground up.

  • Work as part of a talented, globally distributed, successful team

  • A focussed adherence to our agile/scrum processes (we really believe it helps getting good work done)

  • Hard problems to solve (you won't find all the answers on Stack Overflow) - and the opportunity to own the solutions

  • A great working atmosphere where you can share and learn with other smart people - on this and on other projects.

  • The best-in-class toolsets: Slack, CI/CD with Docker etc

  • Meetups in our Barcelona offices for our remote folks

  • Competitive rates

  • A long term working relationship: this project, then others.


You'll be:



  •   Working within a fast moving team (working 11am - 8pm Central European time) of both Rails and iOS engineers

  • Designing clean APIs and interfacing with other legacy backend systems.

  • Solving hard business logic with elegant software design

  • Identifying bottlenecks, using tools to diagnose and refactor code for scale

  • Ensuring the robustness, performance and failure characteristics of the system.

  • Writing well tested (rspec), defect free code with CI/CD

  • Taking ownership of production applications - managing issues, releases and ensuring quality


Good English verbal and written communication skills are essential.


This is a contract position with a long term outlook (12 months+ full-time project) for the right candidate. We are looking for remote workers (most of the company is remote) or have openings based in our Barcelona office. This project starts on Jan 2nd 2018.

item.title: iOS Developer (m/f) Hamburg, Barcelona, Athens, Bucharest at mytaxi (Intelligent Apps GmbH) (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
Hamburg (DE), Barcelona (ES), Athens (GR), Bucharest (RO)


This is your opportunity to live and work in one of these great places: Hamburg, Barcelona (mytaxi), Bucharest (CleverTaxi) or Athens (Beat)! We are one big “taxi app family” and with our world class engineering teams we are transforming the future of urban mobility! And we are looking for you!


Are you a talented iOS Engineer (m/f) who has a deep understanding of the iOS mobile device, with excellent problem solving skills?


Do you love technical challenges?


You like to build an amazing product of international reach?


You want to be part of our constantly growing world class engineering teams?


...then let's transform the future of urban mobility together!


 
What you'll do:




    • Be involved with a variety of projects to extend and enhance our iOS applications.

    • Participate in the entire app development life cycle from project and feature setup to app store deployment.

    • Identify and solve complex technical issues as they arise.

    • Working in a motivated and innovative team with flat hierarchies



 What you’ll bring:




    • Bachelor’s degree in computer science is preferred.

    • 3+ years of software development experience.

    • At least 2 years of native iOS app development experience.

    • Strong development skills in Objective-C, Swift and good general programming and algorithm skills.

item.title: C++ development without deadlines? 120k at think-cell (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
At think-cell expect a wide array of extremely challenging C++ development tasks.


think-cell is looking for smart, creative C++ developers with a solid theoretical background. You should be able to look at a problem from the user's perspective, discuss abstract concepts with fellow developers, as well as produce an elegant implementation. Developers we have hired in the past mostly hold an exceptional master's degree in computer science or even a doctorate.


We pay very competitive salaries, and offer our developers EUR 120,000 annually following one year of employment. If necessary, we will go out of our way to help you relocate to Berlin, and will do what we can to help you acquire a work permit.


At think-cell, we like flat hierarchies. You will work largely independently and will be responsible for the whole range of activities when implementing a new feature. We expect each of our developers to do architecture, design, implementation, customer feedback and bug fixing,  rather than splitting these activities between several people. We thus minimize communication losses and put everyone in control of their own work. Your ideas are welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better.


We have published several scientific articles in the areas of Artificial Intelligence and Computer Graphics and we will encourage you to do the same. We sponsor visits to conferences and have close connections to universities and research institutes in the U.S. and Germany.


think-cell encourages a healthy work-life balance. We do not work at night or on weekends, and support our staff's families with a full-time company nanny. She is available for free when children are sick, or if you just feel like spending an evening out.


Skills & Requirements


Do you believe in beauty when it comes to programming? Do you have a vivid interest in elegant algorithms? Are you fluent in C++? If so, we would like to meet you.

item.title: Help us as Frontend Web Developer to become the standard for personalized audio at Mimi Hearing Technologies GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for a Frontend Web Developer as full-time position in our office in Berlin.


// This is your workplace:


Mimi Hearing Technologies, founded in 2014 in Berlin, is one of the most promising startups in the mHealth / sound space. We develop tools for people to explore their hearing health and enjoy a unique listening experience - we strive to be the forefront of sound innovation.


Our skills are deeply rooted in science, psychoacoustics and engineering. The Mimi team is a diverse group of innovators with strong expertise in audio- and sound engineering, product, communication and business design.



  • Mimi Hearing Test is the number one hearing test app in the AppStore with over one million tested ears worldwide

  • Mimi Music is revolutionizing the way, how people listen to Music and the upcoming Mimi SDK will enable even more use cases for our technology

  • Total number of app downloads: 650K

  • Two patents filed + two patents in the pipeline

  • Close cooperation with Charité Berlin and medical certification of our products


Our vision is to set a new standard for the way we listen and become the #1 technology for personalized sound and hearing health.


// Who are we looking for?


We are committed to create a culture which nourishes personal growth as the base for company growth. We are a learning organisation which means, we love to work with people who start doing things, fail and learn fast in order to keep moving instead of waiting and drafting the perfect solutions.


As our Frontend Web Developer you will:



  • Build responsive web applications with a clear focus on frontend development

  • Work closely with our backend developers to create new user facing products as well as internal company tools

  • Collaborate with our cross-functional team to define, design, and ship new product features

  • Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies


You must have



  • 5+ years of working experience in frontend web development

  • Strong knowledge of HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript (including the latest features in ES6)

  • Production experience with modern JS frameworks, specifically React/Redux or Angular

  • Highly motivated in learning, excellent communication and execution skills, and an open mindset


It would be great if you have



  • A BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related study is a plus

  • Solid knowledge of software design patterns and system architecture

  • Experience with third-party libraries and APIs

  • Experience with REST-API's

  • Fluent in English, as the company language is English

  • Continuous integration and backend technologies

item.title: UX Design Lead for CarTrawler at CarTrawler (Dublin 14, Ireland)
item.description:
The purpose of your role:



  • Lead and manage a team of UX and UI/UX Designers

  • Mentor and develop your team

  • Liaise with the Insights Team to define business requirements

  • Liaise with Product Manager to understand business requirements and input on the design aspect in order to solidify the product deliverables and timelines

  • Design user and product flows to meet and enhance user expectations by consistently improving the usability, accessibility and joy! in using the product

  • Lead thought process around user flow to drive the right user-centric design for the product end-to-end – fundamentally understanding the end-user expectations and perceived value proposition

  • Actively conduct research to drive insights into the product teams – actively testing the product via moderated user research, remote user testing, prototype testing, analysis of on-site feedback and consultations with key business stakeholders

  • Map out the user journey and make sure it works! – prototype testing and remote testing features/product ideas

  • Produce user flows, wireframes, flowcharts, prototypes, user interface specifications and models across multiple device platforms and applications

  • Create engaging interactive solutions across multiple platforms – adhering to latest and greatest web design principles to meet both end-user and business specifications

  • Lead workshops across teams and key business stakeholders – driving insights, concepts and ideas into real end-user solutions.


What background we’re looking for:



  • 2-4 years of experience in a similar UX role

  • Expertise and understanding of visual user-centric design, information architecture, interaction design, usability and user interaction to deliver high-quality products 

  • Proficiency in driving solutions to end-user problems and passion for delivering the highest quality product

  • Excellent workshopping, project management and organisation skills

  • Effective communications skills and proven ability to influence and drive ideas across the business

  • Strong analytical skills with an attention to detail 

  • Demonstrated abilities in relationship management and smart collaboration across all levels of the organisation

  • Strong design skills in Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Invision (or other similar prototyping tools) Desire to continuously learn and grow – keen interest in current and future UX trends in online retail and merchandising

  • Keen interest in current and future UX trends in online retail and merchandising

  • Most importantly, you must have curiosity and an overall passion for new and innovative approaches to the user interface and experience!


 We are looking for someone who is able to demonstrate the following competencies: Is this YOU?



  • Creative thinking and passionate about design

  • Good verbal and presentation skills

  • Good analytical and problem solving skills

  • Strong influencing skills

  • Demonstrated abilities at relationship management and smart collaboration across all levels of the organisation

  • Strong organization skills with attention to detail

  • Positive and enthusiastic disposition

  • Must be a Self-Starter

item.title: Senior Datenbank-Architekt / Database Architect (m/w) at Webtrekk GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Werde mit uns ein wichtiger Teil der Digitalisierung bekannter Marken.


Webtrekk ist eine Customer Intelligence-Plattform für Analyse, Data Management & Marketing mit mehr als 150 Mitarbeitern an 5 Standorten weltweit. Bereits seit 2004 sind wir Innovationstreiber für High-End Digital Analytics und arbeiten täglich daran, neue Maßstäbe im Digital Marketing zu setzen. Unsere leistungsfähige HighTraffic-Plattform ist derart konzipiert, dass sie mehr als 300 Terabyte Raw Data und bis zu 60k Requests/sec verarbeitet. In dieser Position bist Du Teil unseres DevOps- und IT-Operations Teams und verantwortest die Planung unserer Datenbankarchitektur.


Das sind Deine Aufgaben:



  • Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Software-Architekten zusammen und beeinflusst dabei maßgeblich jegliche Datenbankentscheidungen

  • Du definierst Datenbankkonfigurationen, um effiziente System-Antwortzeiten zu erreichen, die Duplizierung von Daten zu reduzieren und Systemlogik zu integrieren; die Qualität Deiner Konzepte belegst Du mit Tests

  • Du führst neue Datenbanktechnologien ein und analysierst, aktualisierst und optimierst unsere bestehenden Datenbanken hinsichtlich Skalierbarkeit, Performance und Kosteneffizienz

  • Du sorgst für den reibungslosen Betrieb unserer Produktiv- und Testdatenbanken, inklusive des Löschens und der Archivierung von Daten


Das bringst Du mit:



  • Mindestens 5 Jahre relevante Erfahrung im praktischen Umgang mit SQL-Datenbanken, vorzugsweise mit MySQL (alternativ: Exasol, MariaDB, PostgreSQL)

  • Tiefergehendes Verständnis von NoSQL-Systemen, wie z.B. Cassandra, MongoDB, ElasticSearch und Couchbase

  • Erweiterte Expertise im Database Performance Tuning

  • Erfahrung mit verteilten ortsunabhängigen Systemen

  • Praktische Entwicklungserfahrung und tiefes Verständnis für Softwareentwicklungsprozesse

  • Großes Interesse an DevOps-Automatisierungs-technologien (Puppet, Ansible, Docker, usw.) sowie an neuesten Technologien und bewährten Architekturen

  • Stark ausgeprägte analytische und lösungsorientierte Denkweise

  • SQL ist Deine Muttersprache, Du verfügst aber auch über gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

item.title: Frontend JavaScript Developer at Webtrekk GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Your Responsibilities:


In this position, you will strengthen one of our agile development teams and create user friendly single-page B2B web applications and highly performant JavaScript plugins to be used on our customer’s websites.



  • Get involved in all phases of the product lifecycle: requirement analysis, design process, implementation & testing

The assets you bring to the team:

  • Team spirit and enjoyment for agile procedures, preferably with Kanban experience

  • Very good level of English, German language skills are a big plus

item.title: Senior DevOps / System Engineer (m/w) at Webtrekk GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Das sind deine Aufgaben:


In dieser Position verstärkst Du unser System Administration Team und verantwortest gemeinsam mit der Software-Entwicklung und IT den Betrieb unserer Plattform mit mehr als 82 Milliarden Requests im Monat.



  • Aufsetzen, Warten und Weiterentwicklung von Entwicklungs- und Testsystemen für den Produktivbetrieb

  • Erkennen und Prüfen neuster Technologien und Trends auf Relevanz und Anwendbarkeit im Unternehmen

  • Umfangreiche Kenntnisse und Erfahrung im Anwendungsbetrieb, wie z.B. mit Shell-Scripting, automatisierten Deployments / Provisionierung und Configuration Management

item.title: (Senior) Software Developer - Java at Webtrekk GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Your responsibilities:


As part of our cross functional agile team, you will program, test and complete user stories along with the rest of our developers, but your background will make you the 'go to guy' when it comes to concepts and technologies like Event Sourcing, Queuing, Microservice Architectures, Continuous Delivery, Configuration Management, Virtualisation, Containerisation, for example.


You will ensure the successful delivery of high quality software products, be involved in the functional and technical conception and delivery of new releases and components. You drive the design and development of new innovative products and services from the technical side.


The assets you bring to the team:



  • At least three years of relevant experience in software development with Java 7 or 8

  • Interested in learning other languages for the JVM, like Groovy, Kotlin or Scala

  • Strong experience with distributed systems and RESTful services

  • Strong experience in working with SQL databases like MariaDB, MySQL, EXASOL or PostgreSQL

  • Practical experience with asynchronous systems including message queuing

  • DevOps mentality and practical experience with tools for build and deployment automation (Ansible, Gradle, Jenkins, Maven)

  • Quality awareness throughout the complete software development lifecycle

  • Ability to think and learn quickly, outstanding analytical skills, creativity and the word to convince people doing the right things first

  • Willingness to pair and get things done, enjoyment for agile methodologies like Kanban or Scrum

  • Very good level of English, German is a plus

item.title: Mobile SDK Developer - Android & iOS at Webtrekk GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)

You will participate in the implementation of highly complex software projects and be in charge of the development of our SDK for both Android and iOS (watchOS, tvOS).
