item.title: Hadoop Engineer at Inovalon (Bowie, MD)
item.description:
Inovalon develops cutting edge software solutions that help revolutionize the Healthcare Informatics industry. Our sophisticated tools are used to enhance the clinical quality outcome, care management and financial efficiency of our clients. We are seeking highly qualified professionals that will contribute to our ongoing growth and success. The System Engineer is a fast paced position in a rapid growth enterprise environment. The ideal candidate is a person that strives to achieve excellence backed by strong architectural, system design, and automation experience.



The Big Data Engineering team designs, builds, and maintains the software, hardware, network, and computing technologies that power all of Inovalon's Big Data services. We are the foundation upon which Inovalon's innovations are built, from high octane data analytics horsepower to insightful healthcare data solutions that will change the future. You seek a challenge, demand excellence of yourself, and harbor a fierce desire to produce infallible solutions.



Responsibilties

  • Contribute to evolving design, architecture, and standards for building and delivering unique services and solutions;

  • Implement best-in-industry, innovative technologies that will expand Inovalon's infrastructure through robust, scalable, adrenaline-fueled solutions;

  • Participate in the enterprise infrastructure vision and strategy;

  • Focused on service reliability and sustainability;

  • Develop and execute plans for complex systems backed by excellence, confidence, and thorough engineering analysis;

  • Leverage metrics to manage the server fleet and complex computing systems to drive automation, improvement, and performance;

  • Serves as an escalation point for Operational teams;

  • Support and implement DevOps methodology; and

  • Develop and automate robust unit and functional test cases.


Qualifications



  • Experience engineering Hadoop solutions;

  • Technology experience required; Kafka, RabbitMQ or other Enterprise messaging solution

  • Other technologies good to have; Storm, Spark, Flink, Flume, Sqoop, NIFI or Horton DataFlow

  • In depth experience with HortonWorks or one of the major Hadoop distributions

  • Java scripting and application support experience strongly desired;

  • Working experience in at least one automation scripting language such as Ansible, Puppet/Chef, etc.;

  • Working experience in test case automation tool;

  • Experience with virtualization technologies required;

  • 5-10 years' experience with Unix management, complex computing platforms, and/or cutting-edge technologies involving virtualization, distribution, and high performance computing;

  • You are driven to solve difficult problems with scalable, elegant, and maintainable solutions;

  • Expert troubleshooter – unwilling to let a problem defeat you; unrelenting, persistent, confident;

  • A penchant for thinking outside the box to solve complex and interesting problems;

  • Bachelors degree in Computer Science, technical field, or equivalent experience;

  • Extensive knowledge of existing industry standards, technologies, and infrastructure operations; and

  • Manage stressful situations with calm, courtesy, and confidence


Inovalon provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

PI100340177

item.title: Customer Support Engineer at Platform.sh () (allows remote)
item.description:
We're looking for strong technologists who are good at talking directly to customers.


Company:


Platform.sh the award-winning PaaS solution is looking for a talented customer support engineer who is passionate about site uptime and happy customers.


Our customers run thousands of web applications in over 100 countries consuming 10s of thousands of CPUs on multiple public clouds. We were shipping containers before Docker, our sales team can explain the CAP Theorem. We can clone whole running systems, including the data, services, and networking in a matter seconds. The main API to operate and orchestrate our clusters of LXC containers is Git. We're hardcore technologists with equally hardcore customers. 


Our customers need top-notch support to master the Platform.sh fun. Can you explain the intricacies of command line tools? We run OEM PaaS services for famous brands like Magento Enterprise Cloud Edition and Sensio Cloud - can you help us build and run these vibrant software products?


Responsibilities:


As a Customer Support Engineer, you liaise with customers with concerns and feed the engineering team with feedbacks. You will also be essential for diagnostics and debugging of failing applications and systems, and you have a strong mandate to help us automate and streamline everything we do. You are periodically on call in case disaster strikes. You're our front line, and when our customers think of how great Platform.sh is, they think of you.



  • diagnose and debug failing applications and systems

  • respond to customer inquiries concerns and suggestions about our product in a timely manner

  • deploy and configure cloud resources

  • participate in on-call response to high priority tickets and incidents

  • troubleshoot issues pertaining to the infrastructure running customer applications

  • active participation to automation and streamlining projects


Must have: 



  • Extensive experience with web applications of various kinds. PHP, Node.js, and Python applications are especially important to our current business

  • Experience with IaaS solutions, such as AWS, Microsoft Azure

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills: demoing products, explaining value and fielding technical, process and business-related questions

  • Ability to do the job in exquisite written and spoken English

  • Deep understanding of complete, modern hosting stacks

  • Experience with CDNs

  • Knowledge of DNS

  • Understanding of SSL certificates and encryption

  • Ability to use Git


Nice to have:



  • Knowledge of Magento Ecommerce, Symfony, Drupal, eZ Platform, or Typo3

  • Relational database skills

  • Public speaking experience

  • Blogging or writing experience

  • Experience as a performing musician, competitive athlete, dancer, actor, scout, sailor, or magician

  • Ability to kick ass in Chess or Go

  • A passion for photography, painting, or home brewing beer

item.title: Web Software Engineer at Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute (Hinxton, UK)
item.description:
Salary in the region of £50,000 plus excellent benefits


Fixed Term for 8 months


The Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute and Centre for Genomic Pathogen Surveillance is seeking a motivated and talented Web Software  Engineer  to focus on data processing / visualisation and delivery of genomic data, via the web, as part of the Gates Funded Global Pneumococcal Sequencing Project.  The postholder will work within a team expanding and improving bioinformatics services, increasing code test coverage and automated integration testing. The postholder will also have domain responsibility for delivery of information to the community of pneumococcal researchers, public health labs and policy makers key in influencing decisions based on outputs of data analytics.


The most complex part of the role will be the development of scalable visualisation, management of data and collaborators for delivering analysis of complex biological datasets from whole genome sequences of pneumococcal pathogens.

item.title: Software Developer at European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) (Hinxton, UK)
item.description:
The Ensembl Production Team is looking to appoint a skilled and highly motivated Software Developer to join the team at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI), which is located on the Wellcome Trust Campus near Cambridge in the UK.

The Software Developer will focus on developing software used for production of data releases for Ensembl and Ensembl Genomes, as part of the Ensembl Production Team. The team is responsible for:



  • Coordination of the production of new releases of Ensembl and Ensembl Genomes data;

  • Developing new automated pipelines for use in the production process;

  • Designing and implementing infrastructure for automated production processing;

  • Ensuring the quality and integrity of data for release.


Specific day-to-day duties will include:



  • Design and implementation of software infrastructure components for automated processing using messaging queues and microservices;

  • Design and implementation of new production pipelines;

  • Participating in the planning and coordination of Ensembl and Ensembl Genomes releases, including collaboration with other members of the Ensembl and Ensembl Genomes teams;

  • Execution of production processes and pipelines.


Qualifications and Experience


You must hold a degree in computer science or bioinformatics or a degree in biological sciences and a post-graduate qualification in computer science or bioinformatics. You should have one of the following: a minimum of two years professional programming experience, a bioinformatics based PhD; or research experience with next generation sequencing data. It would be highly desirable if experience had been gained working in other areas of genomic biology or bioinformatics.

Experience of data processing workflows either with traditional compute farms (e.g. LSF, SGE) or with distributed processing systems (e.g. Luigi) is necessary and you must be able to demonstrate understanding of these workflows. Evidence of working in a dynamic, team-based environment or contributing to a large, shared code-base is desirable..

You must have knowledge of Perl, though experience in a related scripting language (e.g. Python, Ruby) or compiled programming language (e.g. Java) would be applicable. Knowledge of MySQL, writing SQL statements and designing database schemas is essential. Experience of handling large data sets, and knowledge of other database technologies (NoSQL and traditional RDBMS) would be desirable. Experience of messaging queues (e.g. ActiveMQ and the STOMP protocol) and modern reporting frameworks (e.g. Kibana) would also be desirable.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer - Retail Core (Java/Scala, JavaScript/React) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
The Opportunity


As a Senior Full Stack Engineer in our Retail Core Teams, you work on the systems that power the heart of Zalando. You build the procure-to-pay solutions that handle Zalando’s multi-billion Euro purchasing spend. Your systems are used by hundreds of internal users and 1000+ of our suppliers every day to provide our millions of customers with the fashion they love. With a strong focus on automating all relevant business processes and on digitizing all interactions with our suppliers, we are looking for outstanding software engineers that can understand complex processes and data structures, and who enjoy seeing the impact they deliver through close interactions with our users and clearly defined KPIs. If you also enjoy building state-of-the-art cloud applications using a microservice-based architecture and working in small and dedicated agile teams, you should join us and help us build the future of Zalando.


You Set Standards


Ownership. You and your team will take ownership of the whole development cycle - from architecture design to implementation and testing as well as maintenance.


Excellence. You write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture, and technology.


Impact. You use your world-class development techniques to deliver a high-performance, stable and auto-scaling production system that delivers business value in weeks, not quarters or years.


You Are Skilled


Experience. You consider yourself a full stack engineer. You are fluent in both backend (Java and/or Scala) and frontend (React, Aurelia) technologies with at least 5 years of industry experience. Ideally, you have also developed complex internal systems (e.g. ERP, Supply Chain Management) or Web Applications for complex business domains.


Technologies. You have experience in system architecture and RESTful API design and you can build microservice-based systems, preferably in the cloud.


Variety. You can design, develop, deploy, operate and improve important software solutions with a DevOps mindset that impact hundreds of colleagues, thousands of suppliers and millions of customers.


Drive. You want to have an impact by effectively communicating with colleagues, leading team meetings and finding creative solutions to complex problems. You enjoy driving continuous improvement and innovation.


You Are Offered


Culture. You will be welcomed by a culture of trust, empowerment, and feedback.  


Package. Competitive salary and many perks, such as great shopping discount on a wide range of products on zalando.com; discounts from external partners; public transport discounts; relocation assistance for internationals; municipality services*; family service and parent & child rooms*; additional holidays & volunteering time off; diverse sports and health offerings.


Development. Extensive onboarding; personal branding support focused on leadership; Career framework with clear opportunities (including technical impact tracks); opportunity to attend and speak at conferences; 100+ internal guilds; tech talks; product demos; access to a wide variety of learning sources (e.g. Safari books, “video tutorial platform”); coder dojos.


Peers. You will work together with accomplished experts coming from all over the world and great self-organized teams.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact Rebecca Kurzbuch.

item.title: (Cloud) Data Engineer at Optiver (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Are you the missing link between our Technology and Research department? Do you get excited about designing, developing and implementing improvements to our (big) data processing systems? Then you might be our new Data Engineer.


What you'll do


As a Data Engineer you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our data pipeline. You will be working with researchers and other engineers on the Quantitative Trading team, turning market data into successful trading strategies. Besides the challenging day-to-day engineering you will also explore new technologies and better ways to solve current and future problems. You will work in a fast-paced environment where your actions have an impact on our P&L and thus on the success of Optiver.


What you'll need



  • Solid Python development and scripting skills, web and UI development experience a plus;

  • Experience or interest in some of the following tools: Spark, AWS, Mesos, Docker, Tensorflow, GPU’s

  • The drive and technical skill to take charge of our pipeline end-to-end, from the researcher’s notebook to driving our cloud.

  • A will to develop trading knowledge and deepen your technical skills;

  • A hands-on mentality and a critical mind;

  • The ability to implement and follow through with your innovative and creative ideas.


What you'll get


Optiver is above all a state of mind. We are looking for you when you believe in daily improvement, when you like to be seriously rewarded for your performance and when you easily adapt to change and enjoy some humor and fun. To be concrete, we offer excellent remuneration and great secondary benefits, such as an attractive profit sharing structure, training opportunities, fully paid first-class commuting expenses, a premium-free pension, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, even weekly chair massages and of course Friday afternoon drinks. We are used to guiding expats through their relocation and offer relocation packages and discounts on health insurance.


Interested?


The first step after applying for this job is an online (HackerRank) test assessing your problem solving and programming (in Python) skills. No prior trading knowledge needed.

item.title: Software Engineer C++ at VSTEP (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Come help us create the future of VSTEP. We are looking for passionate, creative Software Engineers who are excited about solving new problems. As a Software Engineer at VSTEP, you’ll be working in a team of five. There are three software engineering teams in total that work together with the art team and the test team. Your work will have great impact on the project that you are working on and therefore you have a direct influence on end-user satisfaction. Together with your team you are responsible for the development, refinement and maintenance of maritime simulation and virtual training software. As a Software Engineer your key responsibilities include providing innovative and creating cost-effective engineering solutions. In the past twelve months, we have delivered seventeen simulators to clients in various countries including the Netherlands, Vietnam, South-Korea, Indonesia and the USA. Are you curious? Yes!? Good! Then read the requirements and see if you match the profile we are looking for.

item.title: PHP Senior Back End Developer (100% Remote Work) at Time Doctor () (allows remote)
item.description:
This is a 100% remote position. We prefer to hire people from Europe and Asia because of team collaboration, all of our current dev team is in Asia or Europe and so it is unlikely (although not impossible) that we will hire in north or south america.


 You will be working from home with mostly flexible hours although you will need to attend the team meeting which is at approximately 8:30am GMT and to work for 3 hours after this time for team collaboration (This is 3:30am to 6:30am New York time, so you can see that’s the reason we are not likely to hire in north, central or south america).


WHAT YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR


You will be working in a team of around 10 other developers. You primary areas of work will be:



  1. Building and maintaining external integrations with partners through different communication protocols - REST / SOAP etc …

  2. Integrations with Zapier

  3. Working on queue management back-end solutions helping these integrations to operate properly

  4. Working on developing back-end modules / services part of the whole product infrastructure

  5. Working with databases with millions of records and hundreds of thousands of requests per day.

  6. You are going to get involved into continuous integration processes, different branching models for version control and strict coding standards.

  7. Work on highly scalable cloud infrastructure including multiple instances connected by load balancers for traffic distribution


TO BE A BEST FIT FOR THIS JOB YOU NEED TO:



  • be an expert in PHP at least 5+ years. Expert means that you have solid experience in building web based applications with high level of abstraction

  • be an expert in External API Integrations and have a quick understanding how an integration can be done - REST / SOAP

  • have a good experience in MVC frameworks

  • have a good experience with Symfony Framework

  • have a good experience of building DDD oriented architecture

  • have a solid experience in code optimization and performance improvements

  • know how the core of MySQL is working, make decisions about the storage engines, database structure and scalability of the database

  • know how to optimize database performance

  • be able to solve complex bugs often quite quickly

  • always document your code on a good level

  • have a basic understanding of any Javascript Framework but preferably React

  • have a good understanding and experience with MongoDB or other no SQL databases

  • know what is continous integration and how it works


Experience or knowledge how Amazon services like EC2, RDS, CloudFront work is a plus


To apply for this job, you MUST apply in this link https://timedoctor.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0fpji and  make sure you answer the questions and attach your UPDATED resume.



NOTE: ONLY those who apply in the application link and email the requirements will be accepted.

item.title: Global Technical Support Engineer - AGODA - Seoul Based, Korea at Big Wednesday Digital (Seoul, South Korea)

item.title: AWS / Kubernetes Senior Data DevOps Engineer M/F at FlixBus (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
To support our team we are currently looking for Senior Data DevOps Engineers (m/f) to join us in our Berlin office as soon as possible.


Your tasks


On Flixbus's DevOps Team, you are going to participate in engineering the next generation of our infrastructure platform. Our stack is highly sophisticated and composed of many cutting edge components. It's implemented based on a self-hosted kubernetes cluster that sits on top of AWS. Continuous operations are facilitated by Gitlab and Jenkins. Centralized logging is powered by Elasticsearch and Graylog. Monitoring and application instrumentation is handled by Prometheus and Grafana.

We believe in automating everything and are strongly inspired by Google's Site Reliability approach, so we strive to commit a maximum of 50% of our time to operations and a minimum of 50% to further automation of our infrastructure. The final vision is to have an elastic, self-healing and highly available computation cluster that provides a platform that's capable of handling our massive growth and offers great flexibility for our autonomous product teams.

Right now we are in the process of disassembling our PHP and jvm based monoliths, turning them into fine grained microservices and moving them into our new container based application layer. Soon our internal web-based tools, booking engine, mobile and iot backends, APIs and customer facing webservices will all *run* on the cluster.

Here another short video about why it is interesting to work for us:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TUWB7cW8UTg

Your responsibilities:
Full stack development, you will build and adapt Golang, Lua, Python and Ruby based applications
Teach our delivery teams on how to use the stack
Contribute to open source projects (e.g. Kubernetes, Openresty and many more)
Write configuration scripts to further automate our infrastructure
Evaluate technology decisions and implementation strategies
Troubleshooting and disaster recovery
Build automated tests to make sure all components work properly


Skills & Requirements


Your Profile


Strong knowledge of designing cloud architectures
Fluent in English
Experience working with multiple development teams
Solid Linux, networking and database skills
Excellent communication skills
Be result driven and value oriented


Our offer


Be part of an incredibly fast growing company with a strong brand
Join a passionate and experienced team
Office location near Alexanderplatz
Competitive salary
Flexible working hours
Conference visits
Lots of opportunities for personal growth
International relocation support

What you can expect:
Trust and great responsibility
Constant learning
Having a fun time
Professional training and continuing education
12 free bus rides for you and great discounts for your family and friends

So if you are passioned about the new stack and you want keep up with promising emerging technologies, Flixbus is the place to be. Apply now!

item.title: Senior Wireless Software Engineer at MediaTek (Cambourne, UK)
item.description:
The Role


We have an excellent opportunity for a Senior Wireless Software Engineer to join our Modem Technology and Architecture team. The main goal of this position is to contribute to the design, implementation and verification of the modem software used in MediaTek’s latest and most advanced chipsets.  As MediaTek’s next Senior Wireless Software Engineer, you will engage with experienced cross-disciplinary staff and will have the chance to work on the latest cellular communication standards, such as 5G NR and NB-IoT.


The Modem Technology Architecture team is currently involved in the architecture definition and design of MediaTek’s 5G NR chipset. In your role as Senior Wireless Software Engineer, you will be involved in the prototyping, implementation and verification of key software modules.  Performance (MIPS, memory) and power consumption are key metrics that we need to optimize for our products to be world-leading and as a Wireless Software Engineer, you will design and use different tools to quantify these.


This role will be varied and will give you exposure to the modem architecture across the different software layers.  As MediaTek’s Senior Wireless Software Engineer, you will also have opportunities to directly interact with hardware, DSP and standards engineers, both locally and across MediaTek’s global R&D sites.  As your experience in our technology increases, you will be asked to provide your valuable insight into ways to improve our future hardware and software platforms.  Solving difficult and demanding issues will be a key motivator for you.


About You



  • You’ll have the ability to learn quickly, innovate and take responsibility for new and unfamiliar areas

  • You’ll be a clear and concise communicator of complex ideas

  • You’ll have a flexible working style and the ability to adapt

  • You will thrive in a collaborative team environment, where colleagues are willing to listen to and learn from one another

  • You’ll be able and willing to travel internationally (from time to time)



Required Skills & Experience



  • Experience with specification, design and implementation of real time embedded SW in C/C++

  • Exposure to cellular/wireless communication systems such as 3G, 4G and WiFi

  • Familiarity with build systems and source control


Desirable Skills & Experience



  • Familiarity with L1 and protocol software for 3GPP cellular systems

  • Experience in SW design for multi-threading processors

  • Understanding of processor subsystems, memory and bus architectures

  • Experience with DSP programming

  • Experience defining system architectures and exploring technical feasibility trade-offs


Qualifications



  • Good degree in Computer Science (or equivalent)

item.title: Principal Engineer (SOA) Paid Relocation & Visa to Amsterdam at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
At Booking.com we combine the best traits of a start-up with the resources of planet Earth’s  #1 accommodation website. We are working towards creating the ultimate travel experience, building and improving great products for both travelers and the accommodation partners.


We are not afraid to experiment, think big or aim high!


Based in the beautiful city of Amsterdam, our technology department is over 1500 strong.


We believe that diversity makes us stronger – with over 60 different nationalities in the technology department alone, you will be able to absorb new skills and develop your career in a multicultural environment.


As well as working independently, you will also be responsible for making technical decisions within a team and across teams/sub departments. Our development strategy is agile and we work in small Scrum teams of 5-7. We do several code rollouts every day, are data-driven and do extensive A/B testing on both user and partner facing platforms.


B.responsible



  • Lead design of a successful highly distributed, large scale service that has a major impact on the internal and external users

  • Serve as a back-end tech lead on large scale, multi-team, cross-functional projects

  • Hands-on development of proof of concepts, evaluation of new technologies and direct communication to stakeholders

  • Drive and align back-end development strategy across cross functional teams

  • Work closely with product owners and engineers to design, implement, continually improve highly scalable web applications and services

  • Provides technical guidance to other team members

  • Maintain a current understanding of industry and technology trends

  • Drive technical discussion, be a subject matter expert, and have strategic influence


B.skilled



  • 10+ years of software development experience

  • Proven experience in designing, building, improving and running high-performance, highly-available and scalable distributed systems

  • Extensive experience with service oriented architecture and web services

  • Expert knowledge of computer science, with strong competencies in data structures and algorithms

  • Proven ability to design and solve complex business problems by writing simple, effective code

  • Experience working in multiple languages and frameworks, constantly striving to raise technical excellence of products that effect large number of customers

  • Expertise in developing products using agile methods and tools

  • Provide work direction and leadership to colleagues who do not directly report to this role

  • Demonstrated ability to use data to influence and drive decisions

  • Strong customer focus and passion for doing the right thing for the customer


B.offered



  • Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe

  • Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real time impact of your work on millions of travelers worldwide

  • Working in a fast paced and performance driven culture

  • Opportunity to utilize technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit

  • Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions

  • Technical, behavioral and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation

  • Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com


This position is open to worldwide candidates and, in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.  We have successfully relocated 300+ Technology professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!

item.title: (Senior) Java Back-end Developer @ Backbase at Backbase (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Millions of people around the world rely for their daily banking activities on the products we create at Backbase. Hundreds of financial institutions use the Backbase platform. Not one implementation is the same as another. As we become more successful, the demands of technology become more complex.


As a Java Back-end Developer, you and your fellow team members are working on the integration of our platform with our customers’ systems. You will take on the expert role for anything related to back-end. The implementation may take around half a year, during which you will find yourself travelling to build relationships and liaise with developers on-site. The pressure is always on, the clock is constantly ticking, and customer expectations are sky high. You will encounter situations that demand prompt, yet smart actions.


What will you be doing?


It’s your job to seamlessly integrate the Backbase platform into our customers’ systems. You will build beautiful code, run tests and coach a team of developers on the client and partner side. You will also provide training to those who work with the platform. With your confidence and skills, you meet and exceed customer desires. You leave behind an impeccable impression and you will bring home components that can be reused or developed further.


Who are you?



  • You are a creator, sensitive to product enhancement – you evolve and adapt to changing software landscapes.

  • You talk Java, you love Spring, you like Microservices and you have more than five years’ experience with integration patterns and frameworks (Apache Camel, Spring Integration).

  • You also know about TDD and agile development methodologies, and last but not least, you don’t mind putting your hand to server configurations.

  • You’re a team player with a can-do mentality.

  • You know when to use your creativity and when to consult your colleagues.

  • Because you will be working on a global scale, you easily blend into any work culture.

  • You definitely over-deliver without under-promising.

  • You have the courage to learn, and to share your learning process with us.

  • You have strong hands-on programming skills and you like to create smart code.

  • We won’t have to tell you anything about enterprise software architectures, nor web technologies, because your expert knowledge is up to date.

item.title: Senior Backend Developer at Eurail.com B.V (Utrecht, Netherlands)
item.description:
Calling all senior backend developers with a passion for train travel! If you love well maintained code and collaborative environments where you can innovate, read on.


We are on the search for a dedicated backend developer with creative ideas that will help to realise our best business ideas and serve travellers in the greatest way possible.


If that’s not exciting enough, you will also be working with us to set up a dream in-house development team. Come and help us to revolutionise the digital travel experience.


Job description and role


This is a hands-on role that requires both strategic thinking and execution, and will take our digital experiences to a new level of excellence. You will ensure the readiness of our backend related projects and initiatives.


Your primary focus will be the development of all server-side logic and the definition and maintenance of our code. You will ensure high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end, taking into account scalability and peak traffic. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your colleagues into the application so a basic understanding of front-end technologies is necessary.


You and your new team will build, maintain and support our existing sites throughout the product lifecycle, including implementing functional enhancements and resolving issues. Your playground will consist of an AWS environment (elastic compute cloud and lambda) with Adobe Experience Manager as the CMS and Commercetools as the e-commerce engine.


You will join forces with our IT team and will work closely with suppliers, product owners, a QA team, IT ecommerce specialist, solution architect and front-end developers following an Agile/Scrum methodology. Next to that you will get the chance to work alongside other IT, Marketing and Ecommerce experts in cross-functional teams.


Boxes to tick


You are the Senior Backend Developer we are looking for if you have the following characteristics:




  • Bachelor or Master degree in Computer Science or a related field and at least 4 years of experience building e-commerce tooling with demonstrated success;




  • Familiar with, or happy to learn how to use our main back-end system Commercetools and our other back-end systems;




  • In-depth and hands-on experience with web technologies including XHTML/HTML5, CSS/CSS3, JavaScript/JQuery, AJAX, XML, JSON, REST based APIs and other relevant technologies;




  • Strong experience using SDKs for Python, NodeJS and Java;




  • Comfortable developing (relational) databases such as MS SQL and/or MySQL;




  • Experience working with Source Code Management Tools, OTAP environments and tools such as Jira/Redmine, Confluence and Jenkins;




  • Good understanding of accessibility, security compliance and the OWASP security principles;




  • Proven experience working Agile/Scrum;




  • Driven and focussed on achieving successful results you can be proud of;




  • You have a valid work permit for the Netherlands.




Why work for Eurail.com?




  • A positive environment with helpful colleagues;




  • Maximum freedom in your work with a professional outlook;




  • An attractive salary and benefits;




  • An annual training budget of €5,000 to be used for your own personal and professional development;




  • A healthy work/life balance, including flexible working;




  • A young, growing and informal organisation;




  • The opportunity to make a concrete and directly visible contribution to the development of a young company;




  • An international working environment;




  • A 32- to 40-hour work week.




Your development is important to us


Personal development is very important to us. For that reason, we invest in all our employees. With your very own education budget you can develop your personal and professional experience. You can follow a training course over a short or longer period, with a coach or through a peer support program. We encourage you to think beyond your own position. As an employee of Eurail.com you will take part in cross functional team projects.


Eurail.com core values:




  • Enthusiastic, passionate about the product, the job, the company, train travel, internet;




  • Helpful, towards customers, the Eurail Group, the railways, and each other;




  • Knowledgeable, we strive to be experts about the train products and e-commerce;




  • Dedicated, we work hard and are committed to represent the brands responsibly, in all levels of our organisation;




  • Proactive, we are full of energy to act on the fast changes in the world surrounding us;




Do you have more questions?


You can send questions about this vacancy to jobs@eurail.com, we will respond to you as soon as possible.

item.title: UX Web Designer (html/css) at Tripaneer (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Tripaneer.com is looking for a Creative UX Web Designer to improve the user experience of our products.


Full time and long term | Join our international team in Amsterdam


This is your opportunity to join a fast growing startup and to make your mark. We believe that a great customer experience is key to the success of our business and in our small but growing team you will have the responsibility and freedom to ideate, implement, test and deliver improvements to our websites and other future products.


We’re looking for a highly customer focused designer that is motivated to understand our customers and business, and to build products and make measurable improvements that solve real customer problems. The Tripaneer.com team works in a highly collaborative environment of critique and iteration, involving experienced developers and the founders of Tripaneer.


Since the launch of our first website in April 2013 our revenues have mostly funded our growth, and recently we received additional investment.


Skills & Requirements


Responsibilities:



  • Increase conversion and visitors to sites

  • Take ownership of the whole design process

  • Create user friendly functionality

  • Improve the user experience

  • Provide design input and expertise in our main focus areas


Requirements:



  • Excellent English communication skills

  • 5+ years of relevant experience

  • Pragmatic and down to earth approach

  • Experience in a commercial environment

  • Expert understanding of core front-end web technologies (html, css)

  • Experience with data-driven product development: analytics, A/B testing, etc.

  • Passion for superior user experience

  • Collaborative and team oriented

  • Willingness to learn our proprietary tools


Plus-points:



  • Mobile experience.

  • Entrepreneurial

  • Experience working in or with medium to large software development teams

  • Currently available

  • Javascript

item.title: DevOps engineer at Strossle (Malm, Sweden)
item.description:
Strossle is a rapidly growing, venture capital backed, digital media company with global leadership ambitions. We are looking to strengthen our system team with a devops engineer to help us develop our infrastructure and deployment automation further and provide a continuous integration and delivery platform to our developer teams.

If you like the challenges of automating and monitoring a cloud infrastructure in a rapidly changing company? Then Strossle system team is right place for you. We have a highly elastic, cost efficient infrastructure based on Amazon Web Services and their different services, which we constantly develop and refine. There is also a continuous integration and delivery platform to support application developers, and giving them the benefits of our infrastructure.

At Strossle we believe that a high degree of flexible work offers employees freedom and more creativity, which will bring us the results were looking for.

Key responsibilities

  • Refine and develop our continuous integration and delivery platform
  • Supervise our security
  • Develop our elastic infrastructure in Amazon Web Services
  • Monitor our infrastructure and applications

About Strossle

Strossle helps publishers and brands to increase page views, attract new visitors and generate more revenue. At the core is a proprietary platform using algorithms and massive data collection to ensure that the right visitors are exposed to the right content and the right ads in the right context. This is often referred to as Content Discovery.

Strossles revenues are primarily generated from Native Advertising, which is the fastest growing ad format today. We have partnered with more than 1,000 publishers in 10 countries. This is only the beginning of a journey that will extend far beyond ad revenues. Our vision is to facilitate a profitable future for all content creators by providing them with the same reach and data as the social platforms have today.

Strossle was founded in 2013 and has 60 employees, of which more than half is in development. The company holds two registered patents.


Benefits


  • Flexible working hours
  • Recurring hack days
  • Great amount of freedom
  • Monthly allowance for health promoting activities
  • Yearly allowance for conferences and educational material

item.title: Big Data Engineer for Autonomous Driving (f/m) at BMW Group (Mnchen, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are offering you an interesting and challenging role as a Big Data Engineer (f/m) contributing directly to the development of algorithms in the field of autonomous driving. Data-driven software solutions are at the core of the autonomous driving project, serving agile feature teams that develop sophisticated algorithms for environment perception, situation analysis and driving strategy selection.

As a (Senior) Big Data Engineer (f/m) you will contribute your ideas and knowledge in designing and implementing solutions for ingestion, storage, retrieval and analysis of data from test vehicles that is used to train machine learning models as well as for functional validation. In addition, you will support machine learning scientists to scale their algorithms to big data.

In your daily work, you will find yourself in an international and interdisciplinary environment and collaborate intensively with our high-tech industry partners. Our brand-new Autonomous Driving Campus offers the infrastructure you need to work productively and focus on the software for the automobile of the future.


Qualifications


- A university degree in Computer Science or a comparable qualification.
- Advanced industrial experience on the Hadoop ecosystem (e.g. Yarn, MapReduce, Spark, HBase, Kafka, etc.).
- Expert knowledge in software development in at least one of the following languages: Java, Python, Scala.
- Deep knowledge in distributed processing principles and frameworks.
- Background in data analytics and experience in modelling complex big data architectures is a plus.
- Working experience in automotive data processing is a plus.
- Experience in working according to agile methodologies (e.g. Scrum, LeSS).
- Business-fluent English.

item.title: Software Engineer, Shipping 80+ times a day! at Intercom (London, UK)
item.description:
The way businesses talk to people online is broken. Intercom is fixing it.


Intercom is the first to bring messaging products for sales, marketing & customer service to one platform, helping businesses avoid the stiff, spammy status quo and have real conversations that build real connections. Designed to feel like the messaging apps you use every day, Intercom lets you talk to consumers almost anywhere: inside your app, on your website, across social media and via email. In


February 2017, Intercom announced it had surpassed $50M in annual recurring revenue, an increase from $1M in ARR just three years prior, making it one of the fastest-growing companies in tech. Today more than 20,000 businesses use Intercom to connect with a billion people worldwide. Intercom has raised $116M in venture funding and has 400+ employees across San Francisco, Dublin, Chicago, and London.


What's The Opportunity?


Operator is the Intercom bot. It is a hugely important part of our product strategy, and one of the things that we are most excited about. Operator launched in August 2017 but we’ve been writing about bots for a few years. We’ve built and tested lots of different types of bots, trying to understand where they work and where they don’t, and the state of maturation of technologies that bots tend to leverage. Operator was the culmination of that work, our first attempt. We deeply believe in shipping to learn, and so we’ve a long way to go with Operator, and some very big plans for its’ future. We want you to join this team and do the best work of your career.


What Will I Be Doing?


As a Software Product Engineer you will:



  • Contribute to our technical architecture as we grow. We scale to service requests from all our customers’ customers. We’re growing and so are they.

  • Care about agility as much you care for scalability and availability. Continuous deployment keeps us focused on incremental releases. Even our biggest technical achievements roll out piece by piece, feature flagged out of sight. Projects are kept short and tightly scoped. Teams build a weekly cadence of releases

  • Ship a change to production on your first day and a significant public release in your first week. That “day one” change is automatically deployed to production along with 80 other deployments (on average) each weekday

  • Be proud of what you work on, obsess about the quality of the work you produce.

  • Have regular opportunity and support for career growth. We are constantly growing and forming new teams. For those who are motivated to lead, we hugely bias internal promotions to Engineering Lead and Engineering Director roles. Public speaking, blogging, open source contributions and community participation is something we strongly encourage (and reward). We run events to share how we think and how we go about building great product - our last one was very well received.


How We Work? 


Intercom is growing fast. We’ve created an environment where product teams, with big ambitions, can ship high-quality product to our customers every week. Across a team of more than 80 engineers, we ship changes to production around 100 times each weekday. Our mission is to make web and mobile business personal. Come help us build a world-changing product, a long-lasting company and the most effective R&D team possible.


You’ll be part of our Operator product team which is a multidisciplinary team with design, frontend and backend engineering combined. While specialization is important, we discourage pigeonholing. Our most effective people work across design and implementation, making the right technology decisions to build the best product.


One of our senior engineers, joining from a major PaaS provider, described his experience as “Before, I saw customers through a very large telescope. Now I’m right beside them.” We love the satisfaction of hearing how happy our customers are with what we build for them.


Benefits 


We are a well-treated bunch and greatly care about you, we've awesome benefits! If there’s something important to you that’s not on our list, talk to us! :)

item.title: Innovative software developer for augmented reality solutions at 3Shape (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
Are you looking for a challenging job where you can use your development skills and curiosity to build the future solutions for a dynamic and growing company?


3Shape is looking for an enthusiastic and highly skilled software developer for our architecture and technology group. You will become a driving part of investigating augmented reality and other emerging solutions for the dental industry. Working in small teams across our R&D department you will implement prototypes and evaluate their feasibility. The job will be varied and will evolve based on our experiences and new bright ideas.


You are a highly accomplished developer who possesses knowledge of image analysis, computational geometry, 3D and graphics. You like to explore technologies, to think out of the box, and to make the effort to solve difficult problems, and you spread your enthusiasm to those around you. You believe in sharing knowledge, and find it natural to connect with others in the company to find the best solutions.


Responsibilities



  • Develop software for augmented reality prototypes

  • Communicate and plan with project members and stakeholders

  • Investigate emerging technologies and collect ideas for the future


Your Profile



  • You have a Master’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering

  • You have several years of experience as a Software Developer

  • You have active experience with AR, image analysis, 3D modelling, Rendering, computational geometry

  • You are an experienced programmer, preferably in C#.

  • You have experience using one or more Augmented Reality SDKs

  • You have good communication skills - must be fluent in spoken and written English


We offer



  • An attractive and informal work environment with highly skilled and committed colleagues.

  • A huge possibility to influence your job and specialize according to your interests

  • A well-structured organization focused on development of high quality and professional products.

  • Competitive employment terms and benefits and a good work-life balance

  • A great location in central Copenhagen, near the Kongens Nytorv metro station


Read more about working at 3Shape at www.3shape.com/Corporate/Careers


Please apply by clicking on "send application" and uploading your motivational cover letter and resume.


We look forward to hearing from you!

item.title: Software Development Manager - Must be based in the UK at ByBox () (allows remote)
item.description:
Job Title:          Software Development Manager


Location:          Home-working, although frequent travel is required (UK and international).


Hours of work:  37.5 hours per week 


Reporting to:Head of R&D


At ByBox, our software solutions and smart locker technologies are keeping our UK distribution, warehousing and technical services divisions working 24/7, 365 days a year, minimising delivery times and inventory levels. As the market leader for field service supply chain solutions in the UK, we rely on our software team to innovate and build new solutions, as well as developing our existing systems, keeping ByBox ahead of the competition and reinforcing our position as a successful innovator within UK field support.


We are also successfully re-positioning ourselves as a global technology provider for locker delivery solutions, predominantly focussing on the field service supply chain. This is an exciting departure from the previous market position as a distribution company with a strong technology capability. This change of position is allowing us to operate a different revenue model, through software subscriptions and licensing, rather than through logistics services.


To support this, the software development department must deliver the correct short and long-term projects to enable that re-positioning.


The Position


As a Software Development Manager at ByBox your duties include:


Leadership. Lead, motivate and influence a team of expert software developers to deliver value for ByBox while ensuring software quality. Ensure the developers have all the tools they need, be it hardware, software, or training, to do their job to the required level.


Relationships. Work closely with colleagues in the software development department to ensure the development team are aligned to business priorities and strategy. Develop strong relationships with internal customers to understand their perspectives and to positively influence the reputation of software development.


Recruitment. Take a highly pro-active role in the recruitment of software developers. Work with the ByBox recruitment team to ensure the highest-quality candidates are identified and engaged effectively. Also, engage with external organisations to seek the right talent and to promote ByBox as a forward-thinking employer of software developers.


Resourcing. Work closely with the Business Interface Manager and Project Managers to ensure the right developers are available at the right time for delivering the Software Development Pipeline. Where necessary, own the relationship with outsourced-development teams and the process for bringing on additional software developers on a temporary-contract basis. Ensure the software developers are appropriately assigned to projects, and given opportunities to work on other projects as required and fairly. Respond to business needs through the appropriate deployment of developers, while protecting long-term contingency in capacity so we can quickly respond to opportunities.


People development. Develop and retain our people by fostering a positive environment for personal and professional development through continuously engaging with developers, appraisals, objectives and training plans. Provide a platform for developers to raise concerns or offer new ideas, support one another, and resolve conflict, and where necessary manage performance or disciplinary concerns. Promote and develop the key values from our Ways of Working, including innovation, trust and openness.


Continuous improvement. Drive continuous improvement and adoption of best practices within the software development team to optimize the performance of the team. By pragmatically weighing the business need for delivery with the need to keeping technology current, help to ensure the team is producing the right solution at the right time.


Documentation. Define and own the good practice for technical documentation, demos, and handovers amongst the team for the benefit of colleagues, and customers requiring technical API documentation.


Technology. Support your team in ensuring they are abreast of the latest developments in technologies, and they have the tools they need to adopt appropriate technology. Be familiar with the current technologies in your team, and be aware of upcoming technologies. You do not need to be the technology expert within your team, but must be able to articulate the pros and cons of competing technologies and justify investment to senior management.


Quality Assurance. Work very closely with the Quality Assurance Manager to ensure QA practices are aligned across the department, particularly in the adoption of Test Automation and the Test Automation Engineers reporting to the QA Manager.


Workload. Manage your own objectives and priorities effectively and without close supervision. Although you won't be directly managing the work of your direct reports (this will be done by Software Project Managers), a good awareness of their current work will be crucial in making good decisions. You will be able to escalate issues to the Head of R&D and will also be required to make recommendations. You will also be involved in the technology strategy by supporting the Head of R&D with departmental planning activities as required.


The Person


The Software Development manager does not need to be currently active in writing code, and the role does not entail any code-writing, but there is room for a successful candidate to define the level of their technical involvement, based on their knowledge. The ideal candidate will:



  • Have a passion for Technology and good understanding of trends in Software Development.

  • Have a strong technical foundation in Software Development.

  • Embrace a cross-functional approach to team management and appreciate the challenges therein.

  • Foster an open, collaborative environment, and balance people's needs with company objectives.

  • Appreciate the challenges of managing a team of home-workers, and home-working yourself.

  • Understand how to lead and manage a team of highly talented, distributed Software Developers.


Essential qualifications and experience:



  • Team Leadership or Management, particularly teams of Software Developers

  • Technical background.

  • Worked with home-working or distributed teams.

  • Management of outsourced development partners.

  • Excellent command of written and spoken English.


Desirable qualifications and experience:



  • Experience working in a team of primarily .Net & JavaScript developers.

  • Experience in the logistics industry.

  • Knowledge of the ByBox domain

item.title: C++ expert; web crawling or web API experience strongly preferred at Core Data () (allows remote)
item.description:
Core Data has an opening for two (2) experienced senior-level C++ programmers to add to our EU-based remote work team.  This work-from-home contract style position offers a full time opportunity to each developer selected for the position.  Candidates selected for this position will work under a full-time independent contractor relationship with our EU-based division.


C++ is the main programming language used on company projects; however, candidates are expected to be "full stack" and have experience in web APIs, web services, JSON, etc, since nearly all of our in-house applications either produce or consume web services.  Many of the services we interact with are undocumented or legacy code, so patience and investigative skills to determine how a given remote API works and how to extract the needed information from it are of the highest importance.  Many projects will involve creation of web bots, crawlers, or automatic web scraping programs to gather data from specified sites or endpoints.


For this position, emphasis is placed on the applicant's ability to produce solutions with minimal outside help.  As this is a senior-level position, all applicants are expected to be able to write the required applications from start to finish, including design of any database queries or tables.  Design specifications will be provided for each project prior to commencement.  While actual programming ability is one of the key requirements of this position, applicants for this senior-level posting are expected to show initiative and take a practical approach towards solving real-world problems.


Most of the applications developed at Core Data are related to data feeds for sports odds, betting, and statistics.

item.title: WANTED: Senior Software Engineer (f/m) - in Heidelberg at Verivox GmbH (Heidelberg, Germany)
item.description:
• You will work in an agile cross-functional team which is self-organized

  • You are interested in how we utilize Docker and Kubernetes to continuously deliver our applications using Microservice-Architecture

  • Our applications are built on .Net Core, NodeJS, PHP, .Net with Angular and React supplying the Frontend work


Skills & Requirements



  • You have strong Software Development skills in C# and JavaScript

  • You enjoy working in multi-cultural teams

  • Good English skills are required and German is a bonus

  • You are open to new ideas, highly motivated and possess very good analytical skills

  • You also share our enthusiasm for developing high quality software, Continuous Integration and new Technologies


Have we caught your interest?

Then we would like to get to know you. Convince us that you will help us to progress!
Please send your job application, with salary expectation and your availability/notice period electronically to jobs@verivox.com.

item.title: Software Development Manager (Mobile Application IOS/Android/Web) at Faith Capital Holding (Kuwait City, Kuwait)
item.description:
Role Overview:


We are an organization that thrives on a high-performance culture marked by fearlessness and achievement. We are focused on developing key technologies that will advance our mission of providing world class e-commerce network that will bring phenomenal customer experience. We are looking for a superstar Software Development Manager who can enable us to work faster and smarter without sacrificing technical excellence. Who dreams about changing the world using his/her passion for engineering. As a Software Development Manager, you will be given the opportunity to make a direct impact on the innovation of cutting edge technologies. The work you will do will be hugely impactful. The experience you will gain will be unique and unmatched.


You will be driving the structure and the strategy of the new central team, architecting, building, leading, and automating a robust mapping and technology infrastructure that can scale to our aggressive growth and tackle the challenges we face.


Working closely with the full cross-functional leadership team and interact with broad groups including product development, architects, infrastructure engineering and operations to understand and solve problems in a collaborative fashion.


You will ensure that we enable developing, engineering and operations productivity through well-orchestrated, automated services. This is a hands-on technical role with a balanced amount of technical and people management.




Responsibilities:



  • Creating scalable enterprise architecture that can drive the company's technology to new heights (best in class) and deliver services across multiple countries

  • Deliver services across multiple platforms

  • Strong ability in designing systems and processes and leading in design reviews

  • Building core, foundational technology and services to drive productivity (product, ops productivity) and scale across multiple areas of the business.

  • Building features and infrastructure that will help to completely re-engineer mobile technology, the Software Development Manager is responsible in building mechanical platform in terms of performance and capabilities and to build mechanisms within the team to allow for idea process of improving platform performance and operational capability

  • Create a better experience for our partners.

  • Leading software engineers in development, application, quality testing and integration of new systems

  • Providing technical leadership to software engineering team by directing and tracking team activities, while managing tasks and project schedule

  • Implementing project customizations and configurations; and propose software modification to adapt to business change

  • Developing intuitive user interfaces

  • Motivating the team in writing the best code, unit tests, and building and deploying scripts (however as we are building a team you will have to take on a hands-on approach in when needed)

  • Troubleshooting and supporting production systems when required

  • Working with external groups such as QA, Performance, Integration and third party tools

  • Monitoring the work log and internal ticketing system (need to build performance management platform tools for teams and platform).

  • Managing stakeholder management with the leadership team by providing visibility about strategy and metrics reporting

  • Ensuring smooth and efficient running of production system supporting the technology

  • Thorough understanding of the software development lifecycle from specification, through implementation and testing, to final deployment and operation.



Requirements:



  • 10+ years of software development experience, at least 5 of which were in leading development teams - keeping team motivated, productive, and on-target, with the ability to manage multiple concurrent projects

  • Strong Commercial acumen and huge sense of innovation.

  • Must have strong experience and knowledge of E-commerce business.

  • Must have experience in developing mobile application on both platforms Android and IOS.

  • Must be passionate about delivering infrastructure as fully automated services.

item.title: Senior Front-end Developer / Consultant - Work in an open source company! at Vaadin (bo, Finland)
item.description:
Are you looking for new challenges in your career? Would you like to work in an international environment with the newest web technologies, in a company that is world-known for its open source products? Well, I have good news for you. We are looking for experienced frontend developers to join our team in Turku and help our customers build solutions with web components and its surrounding technologies.


This is what your day might look like:


It’s Monday and you actually enjoy coming to the office after the weekend. The day starts with our weekly buffet breakfast - you pick your plate full of your favorites and head to the lounge. You sit down at a table with some colleagues and start digging into your food while another colleague from R&D is hooking up his computer to the projector. He’s there to give a presentation of the latest releases we are doing later in the week.


After breakfast, you head to your desk and have your daily stand up meeting with your team. Last week we received some feedback from an early end user about a new feature and how it felt a bit unintuitive to use. Our UX designer has already made an improved design and you promise to make the changes in the implementation.


After lunch you join a customer call together with sales. You are going to visit the customer onsite in Rome in a few weeks, to do some architecture consulting and the purpose of the call is to get a bit more details about the assignment and its length - maybe it would make sense to spend the whole week there, as their team also want you to show them some best practices.


After getting back to your desk, you put your headphones on, turn on your “get into the zone” playlist and spend the rest of the day working on the tasks together with your project team.


To succeed in this position, we expect you to have


- Strong technical skills, especially with JavaScript and its ecosystem - experience of Polymer is a plus


- Experience working directly with customers


- Experience building web applications, not quizzes for a marketing web site


- Excellent communication skills


- Fluent verbal and written English


- Willingness to travel from time to time (how much depends on you, trips are always agreed upon commonly by all parties)


- Willingness to relocate to Turku


We offer you


- A chance to be a part of the Vaadin team and work with cutting edge technologies and tools


- Excellent opportunities for career development in a growing and prosperous organization


- Possibility of using 10% of your work on your own projects that help moving Vaadin technology or community forwards


- A creative and friendly work environment with minimal bureaucracy


- Flexible working hours


- Competitive salary & benefits


The position is located at our HQ in Turku, Finland, and we offer a comprehensive relocation package should you need one.


Apply today! For questions or more info don't hesitate to contact us at jobs@vaadin.com.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at JW Player (New York, NY)
item.description:
Do you enjoy writing tools for others to use? Is automating processes your thing?  Does the idea of figuring out how to test new infrastructure programmatically excite you?  Do you like evangelizing good practices and spreading knowledge? If so, JW Player's DevOps Engineer role may be exactly what you're looking for. 



As part of the DevOps team, you will:



  • Create and maintain services to provide Developers with infrastructure.

  • Automate configuration and templating of AWS infrastructure created by our services

  • Create services which interact with third-party tools to provide Developers with the tools they need

  • Measure and maintain reliability through instrumentation and monitoring of our systems and the underlying infrastructure

  • Work to improve our processes and systems iteratively.

  • Be part of a production support on-call schedule (Roughly six weeks between rotations)

  • Work as part of an Agile Team, in two-week sprints.



Experience We're Looking for:



  • 3+ years of experience as a DevOps Engineer or Python Developer

  • 2+ years of experience with AWS

  • 2+ years using configuration/provisioning management systems (Salt, Ansible, Terraform, Puppet, etc.)

  • 1+ years of experience with large-scale web systems

  • BS in computer related field or 3+ years comparable job experience



Technology Familiarity We're Looking For:



  • Python Development

  • Docker Configuration

  • Container Orchestration (Kubernetes, Mesos, etc.)

  • Elastic Stack Product Administration

  • Configuration Management (Salt, Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Terraform)

  • Database Administration (Postgresql, MySQL, MongoDB, etc.)

  • Continuous Delivery/Continuous Deployment pipelines

  • Jenkins Administration

  • Monitoring systems (Datadog, Nagios, Zabbix, etc.)

  • Scripting Experience (Bash, Python, Perl, Ruby, etc.)

  • LDAP Administration

  • ChatOps Development

  • End to End Python Testing

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer at JW Player (New York, NY)
item.description:
Scale matters. When it comes to our video platform, scale means ingesting tens of thousands of hours of video a day, and serving thousands of videos every second.


We are looking for a senior level Infrastructure Engineer to join our rapidly growing Media Engineering team at our New York City headquarters. Responsible for our media Transcoding, Delivery and Live Streaming systems, the right candidate will relish the opportunity to build, lead and mentor a continuous delivery organization.  This means designing the processes and building the APIs, infrastructure, pipelines, testing, monitoring, and all other tooling you feel is necessary to ship code frequently of the highest possible caliber.


As a member of the Media Engineering Team, you will:



  • Contribute to the architecture of a production-scale service layer

  • Build features which serve customer-driven product goals

  • Code as part of a highly technical team in a fast paced, agile environment

  • Prototype new ideas and explore new solutions to the growing list of problems the platform solves


You have the skills to be successful in this role if you have:



  • 7+ years of software development and engineering

  • Bachelor's in Science or greater in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field; or experience equivalent

  • Proven track record of ownership of maintainable, stable and scalable software

  • Experience with microservices architecture: designing, creating, deploying, testing and monitoring

  • Experience doing test-driven development (TDD) and/or behavior-driven development (BDD)

  • Strong database design and RDBMS concepts, experience doing domain-driven design

  • Strong understanding of source control management systems

  • Strong Unix/Linux skills


It is a plus if you have:



  • Contributed to existing open-source projects as well as your own

  • Experience building scalable systems with cloud infrastructures like AWS or Google Cloud Platform

  • Experience with event-driven or message-driven architecture

  • Knowledge of video encoding, ad networks, content management platforms, and/or streaming protocols

  • Experience with web video (HTML5 and/or Flash)

  • Experience with Docker and/or Linux Containers
