item.title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer (f/m) for mobile app testing (iOS and android) at moovel Group GmbH (Stuttgart, Deutschland)
item.description:
moovel represents a new type of mobility. Our goal is to radically simplify individual mobility and to build products and services which enable true flexibility. moovel combines and offers innovative mobility services. Our app compares transportation services from various providers based on fare and duration to determine the best way to travel from A to B. You can use moovel to reserve, book and pay for your journey.
moovel Group GmbH is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Daimler AG and organizationally assigned to Daimler Financial Services AG.
 


Are  you  passionate  about  quality?  You  love  when  everything  runs  without  hiccups?  Are  you  fascinated  by  any  forms  of mobility?  Then  we  should  talk. You  will  be  working  among  our  best  developers,  designers  and  product  managers.  As  a Quality  Assurance Engineer  you  will  need  a  great  technical  depth,  a  love  for  detail  and  polished  products,  strong perseverance and a high quality standard. 


 Your responsibilites as Quality Assurance Engineer (f/m)



  • Collaborate daily with Development, Design, Product and Customer Service team to ensure that quality standards are met 

  • Develop and implement a QA process for development of our mobile applications

  • Test applications throughout the process and ensure quality

  • Create detailed bug reports and help development teams to reproduce, retest after fixing

  • Create detailed bug reports and help our dev teams to reproduce them if needed

  • Manage bug reports, take care that they are associated to the appropriate teams

  • Create a toolchain for automated testing on relevant devices  

  • Prepare test concept, test specifications and test cases

  • Develop and extend automation test environment

  • Help our QA team with automation of our apps using Java and appium

  • Create and implement ideas for continuous improvement of Quality standards

  • Interact with external testing suppliers and manage their results

  • Manage test devices 


Your profile as Quality Assurance Engineer (f/m)



  • Degree in Informatics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar qualifications

  • Minimum 3-5 years of experience in working in agile development environment

  • Passion for mobile apps and ability to keep up with development trends

  • Proven track record in testing on iOS and Android platforms and in-depth knowledge from testing perspective

  • Solid iOS and Android platform fundamentals

  • Experience in UI test automation (eg appium, selenium)

  • Good knowledge of management system such as Jira and HP Quality Center

  • Scripting languages like Java, Python is a plus

  • Experience with Continuous Integration with Jenkins is a plus


We offer



  • Opportunity to work with leading experts and chiseled, experienced colleagues

  • You work in a modern and creative work atmosphere

  • Trust-based working hours and “Duz” culture/informal culture to enable a casual interaction with colleagues

  • Opportunity to shape the future of urban mobility

  • Attractive benefits such as mobility allowance, pension plan, profit sharing and individual professional development are part of the deal

  • Extra Perks: Centrally located office, trendy cafes and restaurants, bright, modern office with open kitchen, italian coffee, and a relaxing roof-top terrace


Let’s shape the future of urban mobility together!


Interested? Apply now as Quality Assurance Engineer (f/m) by clickling on the "Apply Now" button.


If you have any questions or are in need for further information feel free to contact Nicole Armatowski +49 176 309 53172.

item.title: Fullstack Developer at freshcells systems engineering GmbH (Dsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Currently, we’re looking for a full-time Fullstack Developer to bolster our Dusseldorf team.


Your responsibilities...



  • Development of modern PHP web applications with Symfony2/3 as well as event-based and asynchronous JavaScript

  • Conceptual design and implementation of new features for sophisticated software solutions in cooperation with the project management, design, and development teams

  • Testing and deployment of web applications

  • Participating in continuous improvement processes


Your qualifications...



  • Several years of hands-on experience in web design

  • Very good knowledge of PHP 5.5+, OOP and MVC

  • Comprehensive experience with classic JavaScript, advanced knowledge of frameworks such as reactJS, nodeJS, webpack and require.js

  • Proficient in Git in combination with git-flow, as well as a knowledge of HTML and CSS

  • Experience in consuming and creating web services using ResT and, ideally, SOAP

  • Experience with ElasticSearch, as well as software testing with PHPUnit or Behats, are a plus

  • Experience in agile development in a team and an organized and result-oriented work ethic for sustainable and scalable Web systems

  • Good knowledge of the English language, regardless of your mother tongue


 What we have to offer...



  • Room for your ideas – we believe in you and your expertise and want to know your vision.

  • Varied and exciting IT projects – we don’t do anything that doesn’t excite us.

  • Help and support relocating (particularly for visa/blue card, work permit and finding accommodation) – home is where the heart is and we want to set yours racing for the work we do here.

  • A friendly, young team that’s open to anyone wishing to actively contribute to it.

  • An agile and relaxed work environment – we want you as you are and we’ve employed agile workflows since the company was established.

  • Fun working in an international environment (12 nationalities) – our diversity is one of our strengths, which we treasure, maintain and promote.

  • A peaceful working environment (not open plan) and the latest technologies – ensuring your optimal development and growth.

  • Allowances for a range of sports programs and clubs – because the hardware needs maintaining too.

  • Regular social events – because we’re people, not machines, and we like each other.

  • Table tennis, a foosball table and a chill-out area – for before, during and especially after.


We could also mention our deluxe espresso machine, the pantry stocked with soft drinks (and even beer) and the daily chocolate rations... Likewise, we could also talk about how we foster a culture of open, direct communication and genuine appreciation, because we truly believe in these things and not because they sound good. Instead, we’d rather warmly invite you to come and see for yourself.


Also important to us are:



  • That you enjoy web development, that you’re looking for a challenge and that you want to work as part of a team!

  • That you know that freedom and responsibility are two sides of the same coin! And that you want to contribute yourself and your ideas and grow together with us!


freshcells was established over 12 years ago on the conviction that client relations work best as a partnership and that an appreciation and space for creativity are essential components for a positive company culture. With this approach, we’ve been sustainably growing since day one – thanks too to our passion, commitment and, naturally, to the technical expertise of our founder and staff. If you also identify with our philosophy, then send your application and samples of your work to recruiting@freshcells.de.


If you have any questions, please contact Sandra in HR by email (sandra.reichert@freshcells.de) or by phone (+49 (0)211 933 01 34).


We look forward to getting to know you!

item.title: Principal Data Scientist - Pricing & Forecasting at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics to big brands, to manufacturers - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


Pricing & Forecasting is at the core of our commercial operation. Our tools help to determine how much of each product to buy, to recommend the best prices for these products, and to ensure that we have the right level of logistics capacity to fulfill our customers demand. The Pricing and Forecasting engineering team uses cutting edge technology to forecast demand and pricing with focus on business and customer experience. Partnerships happen with all key engineering and product teams, business and customer experience teams.


We are looking for a Principal Data Scientist to join us to be part of a team of highly accomplished data scientists and research engineers.


YOUR ROLE


As a Principal Data Scientist, you’ll combine both worlds. You know the latest trends from research and innovation and have the experience to bring Machine Learning projects to production.



  • You consult and coordinate several data science projects across our department, such as price optimizations, discount recommendations, and order return predictions.

  • You drive problem definitions. You work closely with Product and Business to understand the requirements, define KPIs, and set expectations. With a team of Engineers and Data Scientists, you structure the research and development process.

  • You develop models. You analyze data and features, explain trade offs of various solutions,  and build sophisticated algorithms and models for pricing-related forecasts and recommender systems, such as demand, returns, cancellations, and discounts.

  • You develop solutions. You apply innovation and technology to fashion e-commerce and develop highly scalable and robust systems that meet business requirements.

  • You network and help our team to find the right contacts inside and outside the company to solve challenges around our product.


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR



  • You are a wizard. You are experienced in the latest technologies and processes to transform an insight into a model and to deploy a highly scalable service. You also posses good programming skills (preferably Python), ML frameworks (TensorFlow, R), SQL/NoSQL, AWS.

  • You are a researcher. You are proud of your excellent academic achievements and your proven track record in research and innovation in the field of machine learning and optimization. Ideally you hold a Ph.D.

  • You are a leader. You can act as a role model and a mentor for a highly qualified team of data scientists.

  • You are a storyteller. You are an excellent communicator, who is proactive in solving customer centric problems in collaboration with business. Your strong analytical skills help you easily translate data insights into business opportunities.

  • You are an expert. You hold subject expertise in traditional and statistical models including but not limited to generalized linear modeling, regression, time series, naive Bayesian classifiers, parametric statistical analysis, error calculation. You also hold knowledge of optimization techniques and linear programming.


YOU BENEFIT FROM


Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties and events.


Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.


Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at data science conferences and Meetups, and encouragement to publish work.


Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.


Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.


WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact our recruiter Almog Greenberg.

item.title: Software Engineering Intern, Summer 2018 at Quantcast (London, UK)
item.description:
Quantcast is hiring Software Engineering Interns to join our Engineering teams in our London office.

We have created one of the world's largest, living data-sets and we use it to bring unparalleled relevance to online advertising. By utilizing technology and big data to understand digital audiences, Quantcast solves the biggest challenges in marketing.

As a software engineering intern, you will be mentored by engineers from different technical backgrounds who share passions for technology and solving challenging problems, in addition to a desire to make a tangible impact.

You’ll have the opportunity to learn software engineering best practices and own projects from start to finish with teams that specialize in machine Learning, distributed storage systems, big data platforms, API development and data visualization.


Internship Program



  • 10-12 week summer internship program

  • Comprehensive introduction to the advertising industry

  • Opportunities to engage with industry leaders through intern and company wide events

  • Full project ownership and the autonomy to build impactful products

  • Perks include catered lunches, dinners & weekly happy hours




Requirements



  • Excellent command of one or more programming language in Java, Scala, Python, JavaScript

  • Strong understanding of algorithms and data structures

  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills

  • Pursuing a BS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science or related field

  • Graduation date between Dec 2018 and June 2020

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer at European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) (Hinxton, UK)
item.description:
We are seeking to recruit two enthusiastic, highly motivated Full-stack Software Engineers to work at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) located at the Wellcome Genome Campus near Cambridge in the UK.


You will be working in the Technology Science Integration group led by Steven Newhouse, the Head of Technical Services, on a series of projects benefitting EMBL-EBI’s internal and external communities. This work may include:



  •  Deploying, developing and integrating technologies provide functionality such as:
    a) a portal allowing creation of bespoke cloud deployments
    b) a service to provide authorization and profile functionality to a range of products

  • Evaluating new tools and technologies for integration into our service offering coming from the open-source communities

  • Assisting development teams in troubleshooting production issues


You will be working with members of EMBL-EBI’s Technical Services Cluster (to integrate your software with the other services operated at EMBL-EBI and from other service providers) and with internal and external users (to gather their initial requirements and support their use of your software) supported through internally and externally funded projects.


Please note that this is a 12 month maternity cover position.


 Qualifications and Experience


You will have a bachelor’s degree or higher in computer science, software development or have equivalent experience and demonstrated experience in full-stack web applications development (i.e. back-end and front-end tiers, including web-based clients, programmatic access APIs, and data access layers). Java technologies and frameworks (e.g. Spring) are widely used within the organization, so experience is required, together with modern component-based front-end technologies (e.g. Angular). Scripting language experience such as Perl/Python is also desirable.


Prior work experience should include two or more year’s software development in a team environment and supporting production systems in an academic or commercial setting. The ability to work within a team is critical to this position and excellent communication skills, verbal and written, are essential. The software engineer will be required to communicate technical documents, take part in the daily Scrum, as well as provide user orientated communication with external and internal users of the systems. An ability to work to tight deadlines is essential as are excellent English language skills and the ability to work with minimal direction when making technical decisions.


 Desirable skills include:



  • Previous experience evaluating open-source software and its subsequent integration to a production system

  • Familiarity with agile development practices and the full software development lifecycle in a team environment

  • Experience with VM and/or container deployment in public or private cloud environments

  • Experience of working within a dev/ops environment


You will be able to pay attention to detail but also meet deadlines. You will also demonstrate innovation and a willingness to take on new challenges. You will have a passion for code development and making software that can be used. You have the knowledge and experience to make technical decisions with minimal supervision.

item.title: Fellowship seeks Android Developer at IDT Messaging (Helsingfors, Finland)
item.description:
Our owl apparently failed to find you, this leaves us with few ways to contact you. Hopefully, we’ve pointed the tractor beam in the right direction. This is the job you are looking for…


A little about us:


We have MagicWords (No, really, we do). Our MagicWords technology turns every message into a portal to related information. But one does not simply find the relevant words, for that, you need an AI, an AI so advanced, knowing how to administer the Turing test is considered a plus for a role at IDT Messaging.


About you:


We’re looking for an Android developer who has a high initiative stat and can add at least +5 intellect to our team, and the force strong in you must be.


You will work on our current mobile offering, as well as some truly groundbreaking things we are building in our dungeon. The code must flow.


You:



  • Are at least a Journeyman Android developer/wizzard.

  • Are capable of growing your own potatoes on Mars.

  • Do not sparkle.

  • Know where your towel is at all times.

  • Have passed the Kobayashi Maru and Voight-Kampff tests.

  • Must know the airspeed velocity of an unladen swallow.

  • Must not be a red-shirt, we’d prefer you come back from lunch in one piece.


What we can provide:



  • Elevenses.

  • Ample gold.

  • A work environment that could, at a push, be considered awesome (at very least, great).

  • Exhilarating chat sessions with Kabouter the AI bot.

  • Answer to the question of life, the universe, and everything.


If you close this ad, nothing will change, if you click the apply button, you stay in wonderland and see how deep the rabbit hole goes.


Please send us your CV and tell us how many of the sci-fi & fantasy references you caught (and a little about yourself and why you’re applying) in the form below! We promise HAL will behave.


Apply soon, winter is coming!


P.S. We’re not all geeks, just the people writing this ad. Geekiness is about passion and that we do all have. We want to change the world with our services and if that sounds like something you’d like to do, get in touch.


Our Messaging app is available in an app-store near you, with group conversations, media sharing, cloud storage, and messaging micro-services. Just search for Presto Messaging!

item.title: Application Support Analyst - Vice President at JP Morgan Chase (Geneva, Switzerland)
item.description:
JP Morgan Asset and Wealth Management seeks an individual in its International Private Bank Businegroup to support systems used globally within the Wealth Management business. This position will be based in Geneva, Switzerland.



The individual must have excellent problem solving skills and be able to demonstrate how they are applied within a global support environment. Good communication skills are a must for this position, as a key element is to be able to work with business stakeholders and technology staff across the globe. Technical skills, including coding and development, should complement the problem solving and communication skills to deliver a highly effective individual capable of adding value individually and as part of a team.



Familiarity with financial instruments and understanding of a lifecycle of a trade is a big plus. Prior experience of working in global support environment is also desirable. Candidates must be demonstrating a willingness to learn new technologies and business processes as required.


Responsibilities for this role include: 



  • Work on a team to categorize, prioritize and resolve software application issues dealing with all levels of the Asset Management technology organization.

  • Provides hands-on support for products and applications at agreed service levels.

  • Interface with internal and external business and technical partners.

  • Participate in the Incident and Problem Management processes as a resolver accountable for root cause analysis, resolution and reporting.

  • Establish processes that will help incident prevention, and create/develop tools to improve monitoring and automate support tasks.

  • Proactively identify opportunities for change within the production environment.

  • Delivering JPMC initiative and process improvement projects on time and in-scope.

  • Continued dedication to providing best of class service at all times

  • Provide on-call support during off-hour time and a weekend per month on a rotational basis
    • Qualifications


    Skills required are:



  • SQL, Java, JavaScript, Bash scripting : expertise in at least two

  • Hands on experience on both Unix and Windows environments

  • Knowledge of monitoring tools (Splunk, AppDynamics, Selenium) is a plus

  • Awareness and exposure to REST Services, Multi-tier Web applications and/or Cloud Services.

  • Awareness and exposure to Big Data software (e.g. Hadoop, R, Pentaho) and techniques (Machine learning, business intelligence).

  • Able to perform within a DevOps culture.

  • Knowledge of Banking products.

  • Experience working within a service delivery function (product support, help desk, post implementation, support for projects)     

  • Experience handling multiple requests and queries at the same time

  • Communication skills, analytical skills and validation skills

  • Good command of English, team player and leadership skills

item.title: Data Engineer (f/m) at Delivery Hero AG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Delivery Hero is building the next generation global online food-ordering platform. Our awesome international team already operates in over 40 countries worldwide to ensure hungry customers get to their favorite takeaway food the fastest way possible. The company has grown from its inception in 2011 to become the world's largest food-ordering network. This is an exciting time for Delivery Hero with a huge and rapid amount of growth in countries, market size and opportunities. Our ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, innovative and good at "getting things done." You will play an active role in our future - an exciting job and a workplace in the heart of Berlin is waiting for you! 


Your mission:



  • Develop and maintain internal tools used by the department.

  • Designing, implementing and maintaining a business facing data warehouse that will support our company's commitment to analytics and a data-driven business philosophy.

  • Designing, implementing and maintaining batch, near time and real-time data processing pipelines and analytical workflows.

  • Communicating with different teams regarding coding consistency and data availability.

  • ETL and data sync processes for cleaning and structuring data.

  • Extracting data from various 3rd party tools and APIs

  • Write documentation for your scripts as well as for internal knowledge sharing.

  • Proactively make suggestions on how the team can leverage new technologies and architectures to improve the performance of our data platform.


Your heroic skills:



  • 3+ years data engineering.

  • You have at least a Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative subject, e.g. computer science, physics, mathematics, economics, engineering.

  • Expert knowledge of SQL and experienced with column oriented databases (preferably AWS Redshift).

  • Very good knowledge of an object-oriented language (preferably Python or Java).

  • Good knowledge of Linux platforms and scripting capabilities (bash/zsh)

  • Experience with database administration

  • Good English communication skills

  • Creative problem solving abilities and an eye for detail.

  • Independent and rigorous working style.

  • You are a team player and love to think outside the box.

  • Experience with Spark, real-time streaming ETL would be a major bonus.


We offer you:



  • International working atmosphere and cross-cultural teams.

  • Goal oriented environment.

  • Flexible working hours.

  • Great career opportunities.

  • Safety of a large company: pension scheme and stability.

  • Nice work environment and English as working language.

  • For applicants from abroad: relocation package and German lessons. 


Have we caught your attention? Then please send us your application including cover letter, CV, salary expectations and earliest starting date. We’re looking forward to your application!

item.title: Senior Technical Product Owner (m/f) for FinReach at FinReach GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We’re currently looking for a Senior Technical Product Owner (m/f) to join our strong product & engineering team of 12 and counting. For more information visit our website: www.finreach.com.


Your Role & Responsibilities



  • You manage the entire product portfolio from strategic planning to tactical activities, reporting directly to our CT/PO;

  • You ensure that development and product, processes and tools are in place to meet business objectives and operational needs in terms of customer demand, quality, and delivery targets;

  • You translate product strategy into detailed software  requirements (using UML)  and prototypes (wireframes for UX and swagger/json definitions for APIs);

  • You make sure that every story is in READY state and fulfills the INVEST mnemonic;

  • You scope and prioritize activities based on business and customer impact;

  • You coordinate SCRUM teams into a cohesive product plan and release strategy;

  • You support us to identify the optimal technology solutions and implementations to execute product strategy;

  • You support our CT/PO to further develop and grow our product & design team.


Our Perfect Match



  • 4+ years of proven work experience in product management, engineering and/or project management;

  • Strong technical background with excellent English language skills  (German is  a plus);

  • Ready to work hands on in a no-ego environment, to further build our product(s) towards our international expansion;

  • Skilled at working effectively with cross functional teams in a matrix organization;

  • Proven ability to work with  strong Agile teams that achieve high standards of performance;

  • Prior experience and passionate about UX and always listens to the voice of the user;

  • Extra points for proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful (SaaS/banking) product throughout its lifecycle;

  • Master’s or bachelor’s Degree; Computer Science/ Engineering degree or work experience is  a strong plus.


About Us



  • We enable retail banking excellence; build  consumer-centric B2B products that bring decisive changes in user experience and deliver long-lasting benefits for banks and their customers;

  • Our team is fun, talented, international and experienced mix of engineers and entrepreneurs; our employees have a big impact on the further development of our company;

  • We support an inclusive workplace; enabling everyone to excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance;

  • We’ll support you in relocation, getting a work permit and other administrative issues if needed;

  • We believe hard work and success deserve to be celebrated—both in and out of the office.


Apply online with your one-page CV or LinkedIn profile.  We're looking forward to hearing from you!

Best, Satu (People & Organization team FinReach)

item.title: Data Engineer, Business Intelligence - Turning trips into amazing experiences! at GetYourGuide AG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a DataEngineer to help make the vast amount of data we produce organized and valuable so everyone in the company can make great decisions through insights. You will work on data pipelines, data storage, analytics tools, data quality and more.


 About GetYourGuide:


With 400+ employees from 50 nationalities, GetYourGuide is on a mission to turn trips into amazing experiences, using our product and technology to change the way travelers find and book things to do and explore their destination. We connect these travelers to our vast catalog of amazing experiences through our online marketplace.


Team Mission:


The Data Platform team plays the central role in our data-driven strategy, designing and developing our data infrastructure, processes and analytics capabilities. We work on problems such as event pipelines, analytics or large-scale applied machine learning. The team is also responsible for making the vast amount of data accessible, reliable and efficient to query, so our teams can make the best data-driven decisions. We work with a wide variety of tools and technologies, from Spark to Looker, making this team a great place to learn new skills.


Responsibilities:



  • Ownership of the data warehouse and reporting/analytics processes (e.g. ETL, Log processing)

  • Develop initiatives on ensuring data quality, accuracy and reliability

  • Optimize and improve existing data pipelines to support our growth, initiatives around performance and scalability

  • Develop new data pipelines and work with data scientists, data engineers and product managers to add new data sources or new views in our data

  • Implement and maintain data models using business intelligence tools in order to allow our business users access the data directly and drive decisions.

  • Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports

  • Serve as a liaison between the product teams and the data engineering team


Requirements:



  • 3+ years of relevant experience in a business intelligence role, including data warehousing and business intelligence tools, techniques and technology

  • Expert knowledge and expertise with SQL & OLAP

  • Advanced knowledge of data warehousing concepts and schema optimization based on usage patterns

  • Experience in multiple RDBMS (PostgresQL, MySQL) and database administration

  • Experience in developing cross platforms ETL processes, maintaining systems for tracking data quality and consistency and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex data sets

  • Knowledge and direct experience in data visualization concepts using business intelligence reporting tools (Looker, Pentaho)


Nice to have: 



  • Experience with big data technologies (e.g. Spark, Kafka, Hive, Hadoop)

  • Experience with data manipulation tools and libraries (e.g. Python, Pandas, R)

  • Prior experience in start-up environment


We Offer:



  • Work on a product that helps create memorable travel experiences

  • Smart, engaged co-workers

  • Speak English in the office with people from over 50 nationalities

  • Virtual stock options - be part of our success story

  • Monthly Hackathons and weekly tech talks

  • Annual external training budget - be constantly learning

  • Well stocked kitchen and our famous pizza & beer Friday’s

  • GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons

  • Relocation Assistance


Curious?


Do you have the skills for the job, enthusiasm about our vision and fit our culture?  We are looking forward to hearing from you! For any further questions regarding this position contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.


In the meantime, you can check our blog to see what happens behind the scenes at GetYourGuide and check out Tech Radar for an insight into the stack we use to turn trips into amazing experiences!

item.title: Data Engineer, Data Product (Spark & Scala)-Turn trips into amazing experiences! at GetYourGuide AG (Berlin, Germany)

As a Data Engineer - Data Product you will be working in a small and multi-disciplinary team solving unique relevance challenges. You will have significant ownership and responsibility in using data and machine learning to impact our customers and business.


About GetYourGuide:


With 400+ employees from 50 nationalities, GetYourGuide is on a mission to turn trips into amazing experiences, using our product and technology to change the way travelers find and book things to do and explore their destination. We connect these travelers to our vast catalog of amazing experiences through our online marketplace.

  • Work in collaboration with data scientists, back-end engineers, front-end engineers and product managers to deliver updates in the product experience

  • Experience applying relevance and machine learning approaches to problems such as recommendations, content relevance or personalization

Nice to have:

We Offer:

Curious?

item.title: Software Engineer at RedMart (Singapore)
item.description:
As one of the fastest growing e-commerce companies in Asia, RedMart offers an unparalleled startup experience. Our culture: entrepreneurial, fiercely intelligent, team oriented, deeply creative and whatever you add to it!  We’re fanatical about improving our customer experience and providing “wow” customer service.


We're interested in talented, creative and passionate people joining our All-Star team who believe in our mission: To save our customers time and money for the important things in life!


Some things to know before you apply:




  • We have big plans to disrupt the traditional grocery retail market and become a $Billion+ company in the next few years




  • Everything we do is focused on empowering our customers




  • We work really hard




  • We have a lot of fun!



  • Try this coding challenge, and we'll look at you resume before others.



RedMart now seeks a talented, creative and motivated Software Engineer with strong analytical skills, a collaborative work ethic and cutting-edge technical skills to join our development team. You will be responsible for tech deliverables including design, robust technical solution implementation, testing, and documentation. The ideal candidate is an expert in Java and/or Scala and has a good understanding design patterns, data structure and algorithms, multithreaded/concurrent programming and database interaction.


Roles and Responsibilities




  • Contribute to the team effort of defining, estimating, documenting, and ensuring quality of technology solutions.




  • Develop applications by designing database and service architecture; studying and establishing connectivity with network systems, search engines, and information servers.




  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.




  • Complete applications development by coordinating requirements, schedules, and activities; contributing to team meetings; troubleshooting development and production problems across multiple environments and operating platforms.




  • Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability.




  • Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.





Skills & Experience Required




  • Relevant Java/JEE and Javascript/JQuery/Ajax experience.




  • Fervent advocate and user of best coding practices and methodologies like TDD, BDD, CI, design patterns.




  • Knowledge of Scala, Play Framework, React, Angular.js, Backbone.js, NodeJS is a plus.




  • Good basics in SQL and experience with NoSQL databases, preferably MongoDB.




  • Experience with a distributed version control system (git, hg) is a must.




  • Experience and willingness to work in an agile environment.




  • Experience with large-scale distributed systems and client-server applications.




  • Experience with Json.




  • Experience with Linux , Unix.




  • PASSION and CREATIVITY




  • Ecommerce experience is a plus.

item.title: Software Development Engineer Testing at RedMart (Singapore)
item.description:
As one of the fastest growing e-commerce and logistics companies in Asia, RedMart offers an unparalleled scaling a startup experience. Our culture: entrepreneurial, fiercely intelligent, team oriented, deeply creative and whatever you add to it!  We’re fanatical about improving our customer experience and providing “wow” customer service. We're interested in talented, creative and passionate people joining our All-Star team who believe in our mission: To save our customers time and money for the important things in life!


As a SDET Engineer you will:



  • Work as part of a cross-functional team of talented software engineers and product managers that has full ownership of our Marketplace seller experience. (We call these RED teams.) The team builds software systems and processes to onboard sellers; to manage their stores, product information, inventory, prices and promotions; to communicate and track marketplace orders; to track finances, manage invoices and make sure sellers are paid on time. You’ll need to have superb communication skills and thrive in a collaborative environment and be committed to the success of the team as a whole.



  • Learn the business and get close to users and customers. To build software for marketplace sellers, first hand experience with their and our operations has no substitute. In addition to customer and user interaction, you will need to build close relationships with the internal business stakeholders for your domain.



  • Have significant influence on our overall strategy by helping define product features, using innovative test technologies, and spearheading best practices that enable a quality product.



  • Participate in design and code reviews. Ensuring testability in product features and measure code coverage data regularly.



  • Champion Engineering Excellence best practices, pushing quality upstream and drive the software development process toward quality-centric methodologies.



  • Lead the creation of a test strategies. Perform all aspects of non-functional testing like scalability, performance, security and privacy testing while simulating real life environments through automated/white-box techniques.



  • Perform debugging and troubleshooting in variety of local and remote testing environments as well as in production as required.



  • Design and develop automated tools or frameworks for highly optimized and effective test coverage.



Our Tech Stack:


Microservices written in Java or Scala using Play Framework and Akka.


React or AngularJs for web apps.


MongoDB, PostgreSQL for storage.


AWS infrastructure, with HAProxy, Nginx, Redis. Chef deployments.


GitHub, Travis CI and JIRA for development tools.


Testing with JUnit, ScalaTest, Mocha, FrisbyJS, Calabash and Selenium.


AWS Kinesis, Spark and AWS Redshift for our data infrastructure.



What do we look for in a candidate?



  • Customer focus and a passion for quality



  • Perseverance. Building a great company that customers love is hard work. Many challenges await and we are looking for team members we can count on when things get tough.



  • Impact. We are result oriented. We value people who focus on the right things and get them done.



  • Strong coding and design ability. You write code that's clean and well structured. Your designs are pragmatic, appropriate to the the problem at hand, but can also be evolved over time. You are able to write native JavaScript, not just glue libraries together.



  • 5+ years of software development and/or test experience with fluency in web related technologies. Familiarity with shipping large scale, distributed software services and broad understanding of quality engineering principles and test development methodologies and metrics. Experience testing REST APIs is ideal.



  • Experience creating simple, maintainable, reliable, secure and efficient test automation. Ability to work with and improve our test infrastructure, create reliable tests quickly, and understand the code you are testing.

  • Experience writing automated tests and Knowledge of testing tools. You should have experience with at least a few automation tools & frameworks like JUnit, JMeter, Selenium, Calabash, Karma, Jasmine, Frisby, Mocha.



  • Strong communications skills and ability to collaborate and work well with other disciplines and teams.



  • Bonus: Experience testing iOS/Android mobile platforms.

item.title: DevOps Engineer (Remote within Europe) at Hotjar () (allows remote)
item.description:
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.


Hotjar is looking for a driven and ambitious DevOps Engineer based in a European timezone to support and expand our cloud-based infrastructure used by thousands of sites around the world. The Hotjar infrastructure currently processes more than 16,500 API requests per second, delivers over a billion pieces of static content every week and hosts databases well into terabyte-size ranges, making this an interesting and challenging opportunity.

This is an excellent career opportunity to join a fast growing remote startup in a key position. 

In this position, you will:



  • Be part of the team setting up and maintaining the infrastructure that powers our sites and web applications.

  • Choose, deploy and manage tools and technologies to build and support a robust infrastructure.

  • Be responsible for identifying bottlenecks and improving performance of all our systems.

  • Ensure all necessary monitoring, alerting and backup solutions are in place.

  • Do research and keep up to date on trends in big data processing and large scale analytics.

  • Implement proof of concept solutions in the form of prototype applications.



Compensation Range


The budgeted compensation range for this role is €50,000 to €70,000 annually. Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Hotjar. The actual compensation offered to a successful candidate will be based on relative experience and skills. At this time we are only able to provide official employment status to those located in Malta. All other candidates will join our team as full-time consultants and will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees where they reside. 



Requirements



  • Strong working knowledge of Amazon AWS.

  • 2 or more years of professional experience with systems administration or DevOps.

  • Experience with Python, Nginx and PostgreSQL.

  • Not required but experience in any of the following is considered to be an asset: Kubernetes, Kafka, Hadoop, Elasticsearch, Redis, Memcached, Jenkins, Mercurial, Vagrant, Docker.

  • Must submit to a background check confidentially processed by our third party.

item.title: Engineering Lead - Pricing & Forecasting at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics to big brands, to manufacturers - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


Pricing & Forecasting is at the core of our commercial operation. Our tools help to determine how much of each product to buy, to recommend the best prices for these products, and to ensure that we have the right level of logistics capacity to fulfill customer demand. The Pricing and Forecasting engineering team uses cutting edge technology to forecast demand and pricing with focus on business and customer experience. Partnerships happen with all key engineering and product teams, business and customer experience teams.


You will have the opportunity to lead a team of talented data scientists and developers, to plan and deliver in an agile way, to develop the technical strategy to build robust platforms aligned with business, the freedom to launch your own open source projects, speak at conferences and strengthen your personal brand while receiving meaningful support at
every step.


YOUR ROLE



  • Developing and executing the mid- & long-term technical vision and architecture with your teams

  • Help your teams to find the right solution for complex problems by guiding them

  • Keep a close connection to Product Owners / Product Specialists and be a sparring partner when creating the product vision

  • Define Objectives and Key Results with your team to achieve a high-level alignment on a quarter-year basis

  • Facilitate communication and decision-making between teams and stakeholders

  • Coach and develop team members in technical questions

  • Identify and share your knowledge of state-of- the-art technologies

  • Represent Zalando at conferences and meetups, give technical talks and help to recruit great technical talent


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR



  • Significant experience (min. 8+ years) in web and backend technology concepts, agile development methodologies and team leadership (min. 2+ years)

  • Up to date on current trends in software design, architecture and web services

  • Skilled in object-oriented and functional programming languages like Java / Scala / Python (with relevant frameworks) as well as (No)SQL databases

  • Knowledge of event-based systems and event queues, in general, is a plus

  • Passion for well structured, readable and testable code

  • Experienced engineer who knows about scalability, high-availability, security, monitoring, architecture & design of state-of- the-art websites and the systems that drive them

  • Profound knowledge of REST APIs and highly distributed, scalable and resilient microservice landscapes

  • Experience with designing and operating large-scale applications on a PaaS/SaaS cloud, preferably AWS


MANAGEMENT AND LEADERSHIP SKILLS



  • Experience in building, developing and managing a team of engineers in an agile environment

  • You can lead projects and groups, including managing complex projects with various stakeholders through the whole company

  • You feel comfortable in coaching teams and finding the best possible solution

  • Ability to work cross-functionally with other teams, and to solve conflicts

  • You think creatively, are solution oriented, and continuously innovate

  • For your area of responsibility, you craft a technical vision that aligns well with the overall technology vision

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and English language fluency


YOU BENEFIT FROM


Culture. A culture of trust, empowerment and feedback, 100+ internal guilds, tech talks, product demos, coder dojos.


Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open-source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties, and events.


Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruit, and the hardware of your choice.


Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at data science conferences and Meetups, and encouragement to publish work.


Work Environment. Self-organized,  autonomous teams and flexible working hours.


Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.


WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact our recruiter Almog Greenberg.

item.title: Senior Python Backend Engineer - Pricing & Forecasting at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Develop cutting edge Machine Learning applications


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics to big brands, to manufacturers - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


Forecasting is at the core of our commercial operation. Forecasting tools help to determine how much of each product to buy, to recommend the best prices for these products, and to ensure that we have the right level of logistics capacity to fulfil customer demand. We use cutting edge Machine Learning technology to forecast demand and pricing with a focus on business and customer experience.


THE JOB


As a Backend Engineer, you’ll bring the engineering perspective into our cross-functional Data Science teams:



  • You drive system design and Implementation. You apply your Python development skills to build production systems, RESTful APIs, micro services (AWS), and the infrastructure for big data processing. You will use latest tech stack (Presto, Kubernetes, airflow, NoSql) in day-to-day work. You’re responsible for the system design and architecture, considering dependencies, scalability, and performance. Experiences with ML related libraries (e.g. numpy, pandas, scikit-learn)  and frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, Spark) would be beneficial.



  • You are comfortable with uncertainty in research. You know how to bring structure into explorative tasks and make appropriate technical trade-offs.



  • You bring machine learning systems to production. You collaborate with Data Scientists to translate forecasting prototypes into production systems. You either already have a good understanding of machine learning or a curiosity and strong mathematical background to quickly become familiar with them.



  • You set standards of engineering excellence. You will challenge our status quo, drive innovation and apply agile best practices. You design, develop, deploy, operate and improve software solutions, that your peers praise for its elegance and code readability. You push topics around code quality, reviews, test coverage. 


WHY SHOULD YOU APPLY



  • You have impact. Your contribution to our business critical forecasting products will have a broad visibility across the company and management levels.

  • You can influence. Zalando’s dynamic structures and processes give you a huge opportunity to drive ideas and influence your working environment.

  • We create career opportunities. Our tech departments are ever growing, offering various career opportunities for your future, whether you want to become an Expert Developer, or step into a new role.

  • We support your networking. You have the opportunity to attend and speak at related conferences and meetups, and encouragement to publish your work (open source commitment), we host game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, Hack weeks, parties and events.

  • The Benefits. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


Please make sure your application is written in English. If you have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, or if you are not sure whether your qualifications and work experience is suffice, please contact your recruiter: Almog Greenberg

item.title: Senior Java Backend Engineer - Pricing & Forecasting at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics to big brands, to manufacturers - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


Forecasting is at the core of our commercial operation. Forecasting tools help to determine how much of each product to buy, to recommend the best prices for these products, and to ensure that we have the right level of logistics capacity to fulfil customer demand. Zalando pricing and forecasting engineering team uses cutting edge technology to forecast demand and pricing with a focus on business and customer experience. Partnerships happen with all key engineering and product teams, business and customer experience teams. We are looking for backend Engineers to work on a broad set of real-world practical problems of massive scale that will have a direct and significant business impact.


As a Backend Engineer in Zalando - Pricing and Forecasting team, you’ll bring the engineering perspective into our Data Science teams. You will be building the required micro services serving large data from the models and also working as data engineers to build the pipeline for Machine Learning. You either already have a good understanding of these domains or your strong mathematical background allows you to become familiar with these trendsetting disciplines easily. You will challenge our status quo, drive innovation and apply agile best practices.


YOUR ROLE



  • To design and develop backend services that implement the pricing decisions and strategy. Your understanding of and interest in processing large amounts of data, and optimisation of algorithms make you a driver of innovation.

  • Write code that your peers praise for its elegance, readability, and maintainability.

  • Play a critical role in the team as a java developer working on key results.

  • Understand and communicate effectively with internal business customers, partners, and stakeholders.

  • Think abstractly and discover correlations between problems, methodologies, and solutions.

  • Implement possible solutions, evaluate outcomes, and update direction according to business goals and constraints.

  • Follow a feature through its entire lifetime from problem formulation to solution delivery.


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR



  • At least three years of professional programming experience in Java or Scala

  • Familiarity with microservices architecture, distributed systems, and RESTful APIs, particularly using cloud infrastructure such as AWS

  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services

  • Effective communication skills and ability to understand business requirements

  • A desire to work hands-on in analyzing large data sets. Experience with relational and NoSQL databases a plus

  • Experience with building and/or running large-scale applications is a plus

  • English language fluency


We particularly encourage Java / Scala Engineers with expertise in one or more of the following:



  • Distributed computing (Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc.)

  • Agile development practices (TDD, BDD, pair programming)


YOU BENEFIT FROM


Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties and events.


Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.


Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at data science conferences and Meetups, and encouragement to publish work.


Work Environment. Self-organized,  autonomous teams and flexible working hours.


Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.


WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact our recruiter Almog Greenberg.

item.title: Drupal Developer for Media Monks - World-class production company at Media Monks (Hilversum, Netherlands)

Focusing on the backend, you are a major cog in the development of the award-winning websites we produce for creative agencies around the world, always looking to make things better.

item.title: Product owner at Docler Holding (Luxembourg City, Luxembourg)
item.description:
Are you interested in working on a website that has 35 million unique visitors per day? Does the thought of working with Scalable Web Architecture intrigue you? Over 200 developers are working around the world (and clock) always ensuring that our service maintains its highest standard at all times. If you would like to join a diverse international team and work on interesting projects that challenge your knowledge and expertise, you’re the kind of person we want! Come and join us at our headquarters in Luxembourg!


What you will really be doing



  • Representing both the stakeholders and the business within the dedicated team

  • Managing communication with the stakeholders, including their expectations

  • Responsible for the vision, scope and scale of the product

  • Defining key features of the product & the criteria of its success

  • Preparing and updating the product's roadmap 

  • Continuously refining the business requirements 

  • Communicate overall status to stakeholders 

  • Creating and updating release plans and defining release dates and content alongside the PMs 

  • Accepting and rejecting complete work in the sprint reviews 

  • Remaining the single point of contact for the product (including new requirements and prioritizing backlog items)

  • Maintaining and prioritizing the product backlog         

  • Ensuring the product reaches the set milestones/goals

  • Constantly following our competitors and the industry to duplicate successful developements

  • Ensuring the team always has an adequate amount of prior prepared tasks to work on 

  • Helping to solve backlog dependencies 

  • Accepting or rejecting finished tasks in the sprint 

  • Giving feedback regarding a development's success


Requirements


Expectations



  • 5+ years of relevant Web Product Management experience

  • 3+ years of relevant product owner experience 

  • The passion and the experience to create consumer facing web and mobile applications with a strong understanding of usability

  • Strong user, customer orientation 

  • Time and project management skills 

  • The ability to use wire-frames to plan new functionalities and the ability to create UML diagrams 

  • Basic technical skills, especially in Web development technologies 

  • Skilled at writing User Stories, Acceptance criteria and Functional specifications

  • Familiar with Agile methodologies (Scrum) 

  • Upper intermediate English knowledge (B2) or higher


Desired Skills

  • Experience with Live Streaming Services

What we offer

item.title: Cloud Consultant (m/w) at Innovation Process Technology (Bern, Schweiz)
item.description:
Über ipt 


ipt ist die IT-Consulting Boutique in der Deutschschweiz, wenn es um Software-Integration geht. Wir bauen innovative Software-Lösungen und arbeiten in Teams von 2-4 Personen beim Kunden vor Ort. ipt ist gross genug, um sich bei den Schweizer Grossunternehmen Gehör zu verschaffen. Mit 110 Mitarbeitenden ist ipt auch klein genug, um den Team-Spirit zu leben. Wir sind «One Team» – Wissen wird geteilt und gegenseitige Unterstützung ist bei ipt zentral.


5 top Gründe um bei ipt zu arbeiten



  1. Top Arbeitgeberin: hochqualifiziertes und motiviertes Team

  2. Individuelle Entwicklung: wir investieren viel in Weiterbildung jedes Einzelnen

  3. Inhalt: Lead-edge Technologien, technische Beratung und abwechslungsreiche Projekte

  4. Fokus Schweiz: kein Near-oder Offshoring

  5. Soziales Engagement: wir teilen Erfolg mit der Stiftung Brändi


Deine Herausforderungen



  • Du berätst unsere Kunden im gesamten Software-Entwicklungsprozess und übernimmst die Verantwortung für Teilprojekte bei wechselnden Grosskunden in der Deutsch-Schweiz

  • Du arbeitest partnerschaftlich in Kundenprojekte mit Themen wie API-Management, DevOps, Cloud Integration, Security oder Simulation

  • Du entwickelst Individualsoftware mit «asset-based Software Solutions» unter Einsatz von führenden Softwareprodukten – mit so wenig Code wie möglich

  • Du implementierst JEE-Komponenten im Back-end und konfigurierst Produkte unserer Technologie-Partner


Skills & Requirements


Dein Profil



  • Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik oder Wirtschaftsinformatik: FH, Uni, ETH

  • Mehrjährige Projekterfahrung: Software Engineering (Java JEE und XML-Technologien)

  • Erfahrung mit IT-Architekturen: SOA, Web Services, EAI/Middleware, System-Integration

  • Du liebst die Abwechslung von Projektarbeit

  • Du arbeitest selbstständig, strukturiert und lösungsorientiert

  • Du lebst Teamspirit, Hands-on-Mentalität und siehst dich als Berater für den Kunden

  • Du trittst überzeugend auf, kommunizierst offen und sprichst Deutsch und Englisch

item.title: Senior Frontend Developer | Data Science Platform at Contiamo (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
About the role


The challenge: A sophisticated data science platform with a great user interface



  • We offer a flexible data platform enabling businesses to create interactive, data-driven decision tools and automations. Our mission is to combine sophisticated data science with a great user interface and experience.

  • Our frontend is an incredibly important part of our product. It makes our powerful analyses easily accessible. Your job will be to design and implement new features that allow our users to visualize and interact with their data.


The Stack


React, Redux, ES6, Typescript, D3, Webpack


Your Profile



  • You have a very solid understanding of separation of concerns, design patterns and testing.

  • You have working experience with React, and a strong understanding of its core concepts.

  • You see benefits in static typing - especially of core components and libraries.

  • We use D3 heavily. Bonus points for prior D3 experience.

  • If you're interested in a UI-focused role, we appreciate a strong understanding of visual design and user experience principles.

  • If you're interested in a role more focused on front-end application architecture, we appreciate a strong understanding of state management, application flow and server communication principles.


About us


Who we are



  • Contiamo is a Berlin-based, fast-growing tech company. We offer a flexible data platform enabling businesses to create interactive, data-driven decision tools and automations. Our mission is to combine sophisticated data science with a great user interface and experience.

  • We are a tech-driven company and keep a close watch on recent scientific developments and emerging technologies. We love open-source. We are a very international team with interesting people from all over the world (95% of us have relocated to Berlin).


How we work



  • We strongly believe in the importance of uninterrupted time to get stuff done and quality over quantity when it comes to working hours. We prefer to keep our schedule meeting-light and work in a library-like atmosphere during the core hours.

  • We believe the ability to give and get constructive feedback and express divergent ideas is crucial to make innovation come to life. We live a very open discussion culture and prefer the evaluation of ideas based on merit over top-down decision making.

  • We believe that that everybody should be able to find meaning in their work. We match assignments based on both ability and individual interests and discuss your progress and individual needs every 3 months.

  • We don't see people as "resources" and genuinely care about each other. We also understand that there's more than fancy perks and cool events to people's satisfaction and engagement. We continuously work towards an environment providing a lot of autonomy, transparency and development opportunities and rely on everybody's feedback to hold us accountable for maintaining our high standards.


How we get to know each other



  1. We like to start out with a brief 20-30min session for a mutual introduction. We tell you about our company, product and culture and are happy to answer any questions you might have. From your side, we're mostly interested in understanding what kind of challenges you're looking for, what technologies you'd like to work with and what role you'd like to be in.

  2. If both sides agree that this could be a good fit, we move on to a more technical session. We ask you to walk us through one of your past projects as if we were new colleagues joining you on the job. The ability to communicate effectively and concisely about complex systems and trade-offs between different approaches is key.

  3. In a second technical session, we discuss some of the technologies and concepts you have used. We also give you a walk-through of our product and solutions, discuss our architecture and components. Finally we try to scope your initial role and focus — should you be joining us.

  4. In the last session, we discuss the remaining details, logistics and plan your relocation.


We see the interview process as a mutual opportunity to get to know each other — at eye level. That's why we won't ask you to work for free on any coding assignments and always strive for responding within hours, not weeks.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (m/f) at AppLift (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The AppLift Engineering team works on a full-stack self-serve demand platform, which includes campaign management and analytics for real-time bidding. We help app developers to intelligently bid on advertising spaces in milliseconds. We are looking for an experienced Backend Engineer to join our team in Berlin. Have a look at our technology section: http://www.applift.com/technology and our tech blog: http://techblog.applift.com/.


AppLift Engineering has recently transformed into a collaboration between full-featured self-organized teams. Team tasks may vary from quarter to quarter and they are always driven by clearly defined goals and their business value. Every team is fully responsible for delivering their software and holding close contact with the stakeholders. We organize regular product demos where we share our progress with our stakeholders and collect their feedback. Typical team size is 3-5 people. A team includes Software and Tests Engineers and a Product Manager.


We serve both internal and external customers. We follow ‘best for the task’ approach when designing our platform and choosing technologies, as we are always willing to improve. We run our software in AWS and deploy it with help of Terraform, Docker, and Mesos.


We are looking for a skilled Backend Software Engineer to join our tracking solutions team and become an important contributor to our business and technology.



Your Responsibilities:



  • You own your software and drive its delivery together with your team.

  • You are pragmatic and goal oriented and set high delivery standards for yourself and your team.

  • You break down the problem, understand the tradeoffs and clearly communicate your concerns and vision.

  • You are enthusiastic and proactive in exploring ideas for new products and solutions with your team.

  • You are passionate about technology and stay up to day with recent developments. You are ready to help to build our team culture.



Our Requirements: 



  • Comprehensive Computer Science fundamentals.

  • 4+ years of work experience in designing, implementing and operating distributed software.

  • Solid knowledge and hands-on experience with Java/Kotlin. Knowledge of Golang is a plus.

  • Comfortable working with our technology stack, which includes Postgres, Redis, Kafka, Spark, ELK, InfluxDB, Mesos, Docker, AWS.

  • Knowledge of RESTful services, HTTP, and TCP/IP networking.

  • Understanding the concepts and challenges of implementing and running load intense, highly available, and resilient distributed systems processing a great amount of data. Ability to solve complex implementation problems and difficult production issues.

item.title: Software Engineering Manager (Distributed Systems) at Careem (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Careem is a leading ride-hailing platform and newest Tech Unicorn in the MENA region. Operational in 50+ cities and with 30% monthly growth, we are one of the fastest growing companies. Our recipe for success has been a team that thrives on challenges and is passionate about solving problems. 


With our recent Series D funding success ($500m+) , we are positioned on the cusp of significant scale and well on target to deliver our goal of creating one million jobs in the region by 2018. Read more about us here and here.



ABOUT THE ROLE


You will lead a team of amazing engineers to improve the developer experience for engineers at Careem. You will partner with engineering leaders across Careem to ensure alignment about engineering challenges and opportunities.


Key responsibilities include:




  • Lead a team of software engineers in implementing high quality services including design, development, and deployment of new business functionality.




  • Allocate available resources to meet operating objectives. Interacts with direct reports, customers and peers to share information and improve cross-departmental processes.




  • Assist your teams in developing roadmaps for system and product growth, then identify, plan, and execute projects to support that growth




  • Strong ability to coach developers, helping them improve their skills and grow their careers




  • Experience solving large-scale engineering challenges




  • Encourages and supports others to take on responsibility, authority, and accountability. 




Reqiurements:


The ideal candidate will have a passionate commitment to improving the lives of people, an insane focus on excellence and customer service, and a strong alignment with our core values: being bold, focused, agile and collaborative.


Must have:



  • Current hands on development experience. Your still able to and love coding.

  • Working knowledge of at least one of these Java, C++, Python

  • Track-record of technical leadership

  • Demonstrate ability to run and improve technical development processes

  • Software Development Manager / Head of Engineering in an organization that experienced huge scale.


Salary Package:

  • 25 working days annual leave

  • Entrepreneurial working environment

  • Flexible working arrangements

  • Mentorship and career growth

item.title: Ensembl Web Back-End Developer at European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) (Hinxton, UK)
item.description:
The Ensembl project and the Genomics Technology Infrastructure team seeks a highly motivated developer committed to the development our web infrastructure at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI), which is located on the Wellcome Genome Campus near Cambridge in the UK.

Big data management and dissemination is one of the most important biological information problems in genomics. Ensembl and Ensembl Genomes provides access to over 30,000 genomes served from one of the world's largest computer resources for genomic analysis developing open source software. Thousands of scientists worldwide depend on access to these data to help their research on a daily basis. We are looking for a candidate to drive forward our move to container based deployment of Ensembl’s web infrastructure.


As part of the Ensembl Containerised Deployment project you will report to the Ensembl Web Back-End project leader and work as part of a team of developers with responsibilities including:



  • Developing the new Ensembl deployment platform in conjunction with the Ensembl and Ensembl Genomes teams

  • Continuous evaluation of the current state of container technology

  • Developing prototype container based deployment and then rolling this out to more complex use-cases

  • Providing web support for other EMBL-EBI projects mainly based on Ensembl technology or data

  • Helping to maintain the public services delivered by the two projects both in the UK and on our AWS mirrors

  • Helping to ensure the regular scheduled releases of Ensembl and Ensembl Genomes are delivered on-time in conjunction with our front-end development team

  • Collaborate with EMBL-EBI’s technical services cluster to ensure our container solutions are in-line with EMBL-EBI directions


Qualifications and Experience


Applicants should have a masters level qualification or similar practical experience in biology, bioinformatics, computer science or a related subject.


You must have experience in developing and deploying websites into a production environment. You should also have experience of developing software within a collaborative environment and have been exposed to progressive software development techniques (Git, GitHub, software testing, continuous integration).


We are looking for highly motivated candidates with good communication and interpersonal skills. You should also be capable of communicating design ideas effectively. Skill in delivering a high quality product with excellent attention to detail and within fixed deadlines is essential.


You should have experience in two of the following technologies: Perl, Python, JavaScript (server side), MySQL, Apache, mod_perl. Practical experience in container technology (e.g. Docker, rkt) and knowledge of container orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes, Mesos, Docker Swarm) are essential. Knowledge of Unix/Linux command line, Git is essential. Knowledge of deployment tools such as Ansible, Chef or Puppet would be advantageous.

item.title: Quantitative Analyst at Circular Capital (Basel, Switzerland)
item.description:
Key responsibilities



  • Research and develop analysis, forecasting, and optimization methods.

  • Conduct independent quantitative research and contribute to key decisions.

  • Work with data sets and solve non-routine analytical problems, applying quantitative methods and machine learning as required. Conduct end-to-end analysis including: data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables and business recommendations with effective presentations.

  • Review the underlying assumptions, theory, derivation, empirical evidence, implementation and limitations of existing and new models. Identify and quantify associated model risk.

  • Maintain and iteratively extend analysis pipelines to provide insights at scale. Develop an understanding of data structures and goals, advocating for changes where needed.


Qualifications, skills, and experience



  • University degree in a quantitative discipline (Physics, Mathematics, etc.) with strong academic qualifications.

  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

  • Able to focus on details without losing track of the bigger picture.

  • Ability to analyze trade-offs and to recommend solutions.

  • Can-do attitude and results-orientation, using state-of-the-art technology to generate value to the business.

  • Programming experience, preferably in python or C++.

  • English mandatory; German optional.

  • Ability to communicate logically and precisely, including writing rigorous and clear mathematical model documentation.

  • Deep interest in financial markets.


We offer


A challenging and interesting position, working in an innovative company that meets highest standards and prevails in a very competitive international field. You will work on your own projects and participate in a collaborative environment with extremely talented people. You can expect versatile tasks and flat hierarchies, you will receive generous compensation and benefits, and you will be able to introduce your visions and ideas and utilize your professional skills to the fullest.


We look forward to receiving your online application including your complete documents.

With you on board, we’re looking to expand our team (currently 10 developers working across multiple European locations) and take our projects to a whole new level.

About you:
