item.title: Systems Integration & Data Analyst at Amadeus North America, Inc. (Waltham, MA)
item.description:
I. Summary of the role


Business environment


Amadeus Hotel Platform provides real-time shopping/booking services for 750,000+ hotels (over 290 hotel chains and aggregators) for Amadeus travel agencies and corporate bookers located in 90,000+ points of sale around the world.


Besides this distribution activity, our Hotel division is also providing a complete portfolio of IT solutions for hotel chains, enabling centralized hotel management services to the hoteliers.


It includes a Central Reservation System, a Property Management System, a Call Center application, an Internet Booking Engine, a Business Intelligence module and a Revenue Management System.


Core component of Amadeus Hotel Platform, the Central Reservation System is the central point for distribution of hotel descriptive content, rooms and services to all desired channels (e.g. Amadeus GDS, Booking.com, Sabre, Travelport, Google, Expedia ).


2016/2017 will be decisive years for Hotel IT. Amadeus has just signed a deal with Intercontinental, the biggest hotel chain in the world, for a migration towards Amadeus Hotel Platform. This project is the trigger for some important product evolution on Hotel side and the months/years to come are likely to be very exciting!


In the scope of that Migration project, The System Integration & Migration team is in charge of a very challenging implementation stream.



Overall Purpose


Discovery of Customer ecosystem. Analysis of migration scope. Management of all integration flows. Documentation and Service delivery management. Support of Customer systems integration to Amadeus Hotel Platform using Amadeus Web-Services standards. Customer facing in order to better discover/analyze/support needs toward optimum solutions.




II. Main Responsibilities



  • Build and maintain end to end knowledge of our products and their usage.

  • Build and maintain industry knowledge.

  • Analyse business and Technical requirements submitted by Customers

  • Manage project in total autonomy including Reporting, Risk management and delivery

  • Carry out functional design and present functional walk-throughs to all concerned stakeholders.

  • Interface with relevant divisions and departments to identify interaction with other Amadeus applications and ensure functional compatibility.

  • Interface and communicate with Business analyst and Development R&D teams

  • Interface with customer during functional definition, testing and implementation phases




III. Requirements


Education:



  • Post-secondary degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent experience

  • English fluent



Technical Skills:



  • U.M.L

  • Object Oriented design

  • Soap-XML / REST-json

  • SOAP UI

  • Microsoft Project

  • Notions of Java, Python, SQL would be a plus



Personal Skills:



  • Taste for challenges

  • Technical Curious

  • Multicultural approach

  • Accountability and proactivity

  • Change management and flexibility

  • Customer focus

  • Analytical and conceptual thinking

  • Adaptability to fast changing business and technical environment

  • Personal motivation

  • Communication

  • Information gathering

  • Innovation, industry and business expertise

  • Strong Project management skills



Job Experience:


6 years’ experience. Ideally:



  • 2 years development

  • 2 year in Business analysis

  • 2 years in Project management

item.title: Python Software Developer at UBIMET GmbH (Wien, sterreich)
item.description:
UBIMET has its headquarters in Vienna, Austria and ranks among the leading weather service providers in Europe. International experts in the fields of meteorology, physics, biology and geography issue customized, individual and precise weather forecasts for several million private and industrial customers in many countries. The company founders and the shareholder (Red Bull) pursue the goal to be the weather service with the world's best quality forecasts. In order to deal with a rapidly growing number of potential clients, we are looking for highly skilled, exceptional people to reinforce our team in the position of



Python Software Developer (f/m)


(Linux Environment, Full-time)

  • Design and implement scalable, maintainable services to make weather data available to the world

Skills & Requirements

  • Strong Linux skills




  • Analytical mind

If your experiences and skills match our job profile, we are looking forward to your application, including your detailed CV. With just a few clicks, you can apply online and start the sunny side of your career.

item.title: Digital Transformation DevOps Engineer (Senior Role) at Philip Morris International (Krakw, Poland)
item.description:
Digital Transformation – DevOps Engineer


Are you open-minded? Do you thrive in transformation projects where you can challenge the status-quo and drive change despite head-winds? Together we will have a unique opportunity to create a start-up like organization from scratch, but with the resources of a large multi-national corporation. Starting first with a baseline assessment, we will plot a course into the future where micro-services enable rapid pace delivery. Join us in our Digital Transformation.


Responsibilities include:



  • Collaborate with Agile Product Teams to determine how best to leverage tools and techniques involving infrastructure as code, configuration management and other DevOps-type techniques to improve delivery quality, speed and experience.

  • Work closely with the Team to design web scalable solutions leveraging Iaas/PaaS services such as AWS, Azure and OpenShift.

  • Evaluating the implications of key architectural decisions to guide team towards productive paths.

  • Define and implement new change management strategies supporting continuous integration and deployment.

  • Define and implement system management strategies optimized for rapid feedback and high availability.

  • Document procedures / processes and train others on those – be the DevOps Evangelist and Coach Teams on how to best leverage CI tools.

  • Administer and setup monitoring tools.

  • Providing daily management of version control, CI system, monitoring, and alerting.

  • Troubleshoot and resolve build automation failures.

  • Create, maintain and extend automated tooling for product delivery.


Requirements include:



  • Strong experience as Windows/Linux Administrator.

  • Substantial virtualization experience with VMware, KVM, Xen, Hyper-V.

  • Experience in cloud management technologies, specifically with the AWS, Azure and OpenShift.

  • Substantial experience in automation by scripting in Bash, Powershell, Perl, Ruby, JavaScript, Python including coding to RESTFUL APIs (assigning IP addresses, DNS reservation, etc).

  • Proven track record in automating continuous product delivery for a large customer-facing website.

  • Experience with configuration management tools (Puppet, Ansible, Chef, or similar).

  • Knowledge of monitoring and alerting solutions (such as statsd, DataDog, Confluence, Pager Duty).

  • Experience integrating test automation with builds under CI.

  • Experience working with SQL and non-SQL databases.

  • Experience working within Agile teams.

  • Ability to train others on technical and procedural topics.

  • Demonstrated verbal, presentation and written communications skills.

  • Strong business process/system analytical skills. Substantial experience in Quality Assurance testing, writing and executing test plans.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer to create internal ERP system (Python/Java) at zLabels GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
YOU ARE READY TO MAKE AN IMPACT


At zLabels we create inspiring fashion brands for the online generation, such as mint&berry, Even&Odd, Zign and Kiomi. Our data-driven way of doing business means that our decisions are backed up by consumer behaviors and translate directly into relevant product selections. Developed for the digital market from day one, we’re confident to navigate the changing retail landscape and take pride in being always fast, always fresh.


To extend the reach of our fashion brands and enter new markets, we are building our own technical platform, such as our own system to manage stock and completing business transactions systems separate to the Zalando tech platform. Being a member of a tech department, consisting of about 30 engineers and product managers, this position will allow you to directly impact the business mission of zLabels. As Senior Backend Engineer (Java and/or Python) at zLabels you will create and maintain our  internal ERP system, which will support key business units in enhancing its performance through technology.



YOU ARE SETTING STANDARDS


Variety. Together with your team you will build, scale and continuously improve our ERP platform improving functional areas of the business such as Finance, Procurement, Logistics, Merchandising and Selling. These different areas demand a lot of integrations (with multiple systems) and tooling to improve the daily business.


Autonomy. Due to the size and startup-like set up of the tech team you will have the opportunity to decide together with your team on technical frameworks being used and have the opportunity to implement best practices whilst the team is growing.


Ownership. You are taking ownership of, and being responsible for providing strong technical architecture of the distributed systems that you will provide to key business units, such as Procurement, Finance or Logistics.


Excellence. Due to your business mindset you are continually thinking about new ways on how to help zLabels scale through a strong technical platform and synchronize it with distributed systems of the Zalando tech platform.



YOU ARE SKILLED


Experience. You have a strong background in working on and setting up ERPs and integrating them with multiple systems. You have also worked on creating architecture for technical solutions that have direct impact on the business scalability and profitability.


Technologies. Your preferred choice of coding hands-on is in Java and/or Python. You also have an understanding of APIs, REST, SOAP and have previously worked with distributed systems that  included CRM or ERP tools. Previous experience with AWS and Javascript is a plus. Check our Tech Radar for more information on the technologies we use.


Business mindset. You have a business mindset and are continuously thinking about new ways on how to improve zLabels through effective and strategic development of internal systems.


Knowledge Exchange. You will lead and mentor team members in terms of best practices, code quality and tech frameworks.



YOU ARE OFFERED


Culture. A workplace where trust, empowerment and feedback are valued, 100+ internal guilds, tech talks, product demos, coder dojos.


Perks. Competitive salary, great shopping discount on a wide range of products on zalando.com, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, municipality services, flexible working times, family service and parent & child rooms, additional holidays & volunteering time off, diverse sports and health offerings


Development. Extensive onboarding, personal branding support focused on leadership, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.


Peers. International, accomplished experts and self-organized, autonomous teams.



WANT TO JOIN US?


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring process, please contact our recruiter Antonia Samanns.

item.title: Senior Java Developer (Spring, PostgreSQL, Cassandra, AWS) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


As Zalando transforms from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion, this is an exciting time to join us. As Senior Software Engineer, you’re part of a high performing team, building technologies that connect every part of the fashion industry.


We live Radical Agility, a methodology built on trust and backed by an architecture that lets us move fast while keeping complexity low. Open Source and InnerSource development is integral to our engineering practices and culture, supported at every level.


To keep Zalando’s competitive edge in the market we need to constantly improve our delivery and returns proposition. In Smart Delivery, the heart of Zalando Logistics, we know best how to bridge the last mile for our customers by offering the most convenient options to deliver their parcel anytime and anywhere. No parcels can leave Zalando warehouses without Smart Delivery Product hence our team has a long history within Zalando Logistics and direct impact on customer happiness.


You Are Setting Standards


Autonomy. At Zalando, you and your team will own your code and decide together on the technologies and tools to utilize as well operate high-performance applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (preferably AWS).


Purpose. You and your team will work truly cross-functional with an entrepreneurial mindset and drive building new last mile services  for our customers and a robust carrier platform that allows new carriers to be integrated plug-and-play via our integration partners.


Expertise. You drive proofs of concept, pilots and technology evaluations to accelerate the onboarding of new technologies and solution designs.


You Are Skilled


Technologies. Significant expertise with Java 8 and related popular frameworks such as Spring. Additionally, as added bonus you have hands-on experience with NoSQL Databases: PostgreSQL and Cassandra. Check our Tech Radar for more information on the technologies we use.


Code Quality. Skilled in automated testing, high-performance code and complex server environments.


Ownership. You deliver high-performance, resilient and scalable distributed system landscape that handles large amounts of data while continuously enabling a high pace of change and innovation by working with your development and product team.


Knowledge Exchange. In contributing to our growing tech community and encouraging knowledge sharing in an agile work environment.


You Are Offered


Culture. Culture of trust, empowerment and feedback, 100+ internal guilds, tech talks, product demos, coder dojos. A dynamic, international team where collaboration is our core mindset.


Perks. Competitive salary, great shopping discount on a wide range of products on zalando.de and discounts from external partners.


Development. Personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.


Technologies. Opportunity to work with a range of different and cutting-edge technologies such as Kafka, AWS SQS, MySQL, Postgres, REdis, Cassandra, Spark, Docker, Kubernetes, Grafana, Jenkins and Maven.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact our recruiter Georg Petersen.

Briefly who we are:


We are internetstores – the leader in Europe’s bike and outdoor eCommerce market since 2003. Millions of page views per day, over 30 online shops (including fahrrad.de, campz.de, bikester.at, addnature.com and Probikeshop.com), award-winning private label brands and numerous awards in all disciplines!


Your team:


You’ll be a part of our mobile team that was established in 2016. We are building a new mobile progressive web application from scratch. Many interesting technical challenges are waiting for you! We are proudly creating great products with the best technology stack. You will get experience with JS, latest ECMAScript, MeteorJs, MongoDB, Apache Cordova, EsLint, Flow, Mocha, etc.


Required experience:



  • 4+ years experience working with JS

  • Experience with NodeJS / MeteorJS or other Full Stack JS Frameworks

  • Understanding of OO principles & good code design

  • Understanding of full stack development

  • Knowledge of Cordova/PhoneGap would be awesome

  • Upper intermediate English to work within our international team


Responsibilities:



  • In our agile flow, you will not simply develop, you will have influence in decisions regarding core API and UI. You will be responsible for parts of the software.

  • Writing clear, tested and documented code that delivers real business value

  • Involved in creating application which our customers really want to use (majority of auditory)

  • Taking ownership of new generation systems based on progressive web app


Your benefits with us:



  • Work for stable, successful and growing company

  • Support with relocation

  • Internal language courses (English, German)

  • Great development opportunities

  • Time for self-development (technical research, experiments, etc.)

  • Employee discounts and bike leasing


About the company:


We all have something that drives and motivates us. At internetstores, we want to continue being the leading specialist for bikes and outdoor products in Europe. To achieve this we need you! Solid know-how in the core areas of web development, performance marketing and product range design have set us on course to become one of the most successful and profitable growth stories in eCommerce. For this reason, we develop and operate our ERP and shop system to 100% in-house and place importance on state-of-the-art technology wherever possible.


Diversity is one of our core strengths with IT. We are more than 40 specialists with different skills from more than 14 countries. Our main language is English and we all share a great passion for what we do.


Our office is located in the heart of Stuttgart, Baden-Württemberg, south of Germany. It is one of the most beautiful parts of the country and an economic hotspot.


Want to be part of this success story? Then send us an application - more than 550 colleagues in Stuttgart, Esslingen, Berlin, Lyon and Stockholm look forward to meeting you!


Internetstores GmbH | Friedrichstr. 6 | DE-70174 Stuttgart
