item.title: Systems Performance Engineer at IMC Financial Markets (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
SYSTEMS PERFORMANCE ENGINEERING AT IMC:


IMC is currently looking for a multi-talented and passionate hands-on System Performance Engineer to play a critical role in analyzing, optimizing, and continuously tune the complete trading stack, in order to improve performance of our low latency trading systems on financial exchanges.


As a performance engineer, you will interact heavily with other teams and be exposed to low latency technologies such as microwave links and FPGAs that are being used by thousands of trading applications daily.


Your primary source of information are full network captures that amount to terabytes of data per day. All these must be reliably captured, stored on an accessible medium, decoded and analyzed in order to find patterns, provide answers, verify theories and assumptions.


You will also be given the opportunity to try in a real environment any innovative state-of-the-art technology, be it in early initial commercialization phases or via collaboration with Universities / Research centers. This is done by implementing quick internal prototypes of early alpha versions that access both their latency improvements and their real-world applicability.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Prototyping: be able to quickly try-out many Ideas, Solutions and Technologies… all at the same time.

  • Automation: be able to fully automate all Measurement, Data collection and Analysis via scripting

  • Measurement: be a latency measurement detective; think Sherlock Holmes and the case of the missing packet sniffer microsecond

  • Communication: be able to share / route the appropriate level of information with both traders and other sister IT teams.


WHO YOU ARE:



  • Strong proven commercial experience in Python 

  • Knowledge: Proficient understanding of computer internals, networking and Linux (at least two out of three). Skilled in reverse engineering techniques.

  • Personality: Inquisitive mind, love solving brain teasers. After internal training, being able to work self-sufficiently with minimal guidance.

  • Experience: typically MSc + proven work experience. Preference to a “T-shaped profile” that mixes both wide + deep skills on a need basis.

item.title: Senior Java Software Engineer at Dimanex (Amsterdam, Netherlands) (allows remote)
item.description:
Do you know what Additive Manufacturing(AM), high quality 3D printing, will bring about in the next few decades?


At DiManEx we digitize the industrial supply chain, making AM an integral part of it.


Our mission is to print “Any (industrial) part, Anywhere” in the world.


It is about transforming the way Manufacturing is understood around the world and radically innovate the supply chain management bringing it to almost on-demand.


Our solution leads to less scrap material (waste) in the production of parts, having a significant positive impact to our environment.


Imagine the amount of parts in machines, domestic appliances, cars and everything surrounding you. This is our potential market.


By what we do, we bridge two worlds coming together: the old - traditional supply chain and ditto manufacturing; and the new - a digitized, optimized supply chain that has AM as integrated part of it.


To make it happen we need to build a ton of cool features, adopting technologies such as Machine Learning, Blockchain and a strong SOA architecture able to match the highest standards in quality, security and scalability.


We recently closed a $2.7m round of funding that will allow us to scale up our engineering team and bring our roadmap to market in a timely manner.


What kind of professional are we looking for?


There are a few skills you should master, but don’t be afraid though. We strongly believe it is your character that determines whether you are a good fit for our team or not. Besides your experience and expertise we would like you to bring excitement, speed, creativity and a moonshot attitude to the team. We thrive in a fast-paced, FUN startup environment, taking on many challenges at once. That is what we would like to see with you as well: that passion, the fire within.


Skills & Requirements


You would need to be able to show us some of your work and demonstrate your experience in the following:



  • Fundamental understanding of SOA architectures, micro-services architectures and RESTFul web-services

  • Experience in developing multi-tenant SaaS in enterprise environments

  • Good experience on managing large datasets and architecting data infrastructures for an efficient data pipelining and data warehousing

  • Experience with ERP or MES integrations (SAP, Oracle)

  • Java

  • Spring-boot

  • Proficient with Linux/Unix

  • Unit Testing


Non-technical requirements:



  • Fluent communication skills in English

  • Focus on details and quality

  • Strong problem solving skills

  • Able to work in a fast moving and highly flexible startup environment


Useful to have:



  • Familiarity with ElasticSearch, Logstash and Kibana

  • Familiarity with Amazon Web Service and its core products

  • Docker

  • Javascript

  • React.js


What we offer:



  • Being part of the beginning of something new

  • Competitive compensation package

  • Laptop

  • Work remotely

  • Flexible hours

  • 25 days holidays


* Please attach your CV


* We don’t consider third party applications or agencies.

item.title: Senior Python Developer at Holvi (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
Holvi is banking for Makers and Doers – a business account built by entrepreneurs for entrepreneurs. We are building financial technology with a purpose that makes a difference in the day-to-day life of European business owners. 


We are looking for a Senior Python Developer with an interest in financial and payment systems. Your role would be to work as part of a team building our core payment system. We're currently connected to the core European payment schemes (SEPA), Mastercard, Visa, and other international card schemes.


You have



  • Experience in web development and API integrations

  • Solid understanding of relational databases and data modelling

  • Understand patterns and know when to use one

  • Knowledge of financial systems is a strong plus

  • Love building software and are always looking for ways to improve your work

  • Interested in constantly learning new things but have the stamina to do some repetitive tasks now and then also

  • Get things done in a well structured manner

item.title: DevOps Engineer at LeadIQ (Singapore)
item.description:
Are you the type of engineer who punches juke boxes to make the music start? Do you consider riding your motorcycle off into the a sunset a personal hobby? Is automating stuff from ground up no big deal to you? We're looking for full-time DevOps to make this happen.


The Product


We are on a mission to revolutionize Sales industry using data science. Our product helps our customers to collect and enrich their target prospects. Our internal data processing combines human intelligence and data science to enable our customers to find perfect contact information and save to their existing platforms like Salesforce, etc.


The Challenge



  • We are at an exciting stage in our growth. We are getting traction with big customers, scaling out, and solving increasingly complex engineering problems. Having great DevOps engineering support is crucial in order to guarantee our micro-services based systems run smoothly and reliably. 

  • Our systems are mostly written in Scala. We have used Kafka as backbone to communicate between our API server and micro-services.

  • We're looking for someone who can drive our infrastructure operations, evaluate new technologies and becomes an important asset to the rest of the engineering team.

  • Data quality is one of the critical factors to make our product successful. We often have needs to process 3rd parties data and clean existing data using Spark. So you need to be comfortable writing code.


The Stack


GitlabCI, Docker, Ansible, Kafka, Spark, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, Scala


The Team


We want team members with attributes like:


- Focus on delivering value to the customer 
- Strong belief in collaboration 
- Passion that drives you to execute and innovate 
- Ability to self-manage and take ownership of a feature 
- Ability to juggle many projects and responsibilities
- Extremely entrepreneurial and self-driven
- Not afraid of a steep learning curve 
- Passionate about building a big business that transforms the sales industry
- Exceptional at writing scalable, production-ready code
- Thrive in a fast-paced environment
- Avoid over-engineering 
- Simple designs and fast execution 
- Discipline in following process and documenting your work


These personality traits define the culture we are building and are more important to us than a particular set of technical skills.


The Responsibilities


If you join LeadIQ, you will learn a lot: In terms of technical ability there are many cool tools, technologies, patterns and other great developers that will sharpen your skills. Personally you be given the chance to step up, lead and make your mark in a growing startup as we tackle the challenges in our next phase of growth.


On the technical front, we need you skilled in:


- 2+ years doing dev-ops in a complex production environment
- 2+ years of Docker (Ansible experience is a plus)
- 2+ years of Continuous integration and continuous delivery
- 2+ years of AWS administration
- Scala or Java (but experience in another functional language helps, e.g. Haskell or Clojure) 



So if you feel like you're a good fit for us, drop us a line! We love meeting developers who are excited by our product!

item.title: Full Stack Labs Creative Developer - Budapest at BlackRock (Budapest, Hungary)
item.description:
What we do:


At BlackRock we are building something great in Budapest, our new global technology and Innovation hub, where we want to shape a culture in which challenge, development and innovation happen every day. The Global Digital Team is a fast-growing global function at BlackRock which seeks to engage a multi-trillion-dollar audience of investors, advisors and institutions with our diverse range of investment products. We are at the centre of a company-wide focus on expanding our footprint in the digital space and we operate at the intersection of design, technology and data. We are constantly driving digital innovation across the domains of web, mobile apps, data models and analytics; while simultaneously driving their implementation, scale and local adaptations globally.


Your main task:


We are looking for an Associate – Full Stack Labs Creative Developer to form the core of our new Innovation Hub and report into the VP of Digital Innovation Labs in Budapest. This role is responsible for the incubation and delivery of our global digital road map and will help to build BlackRock into a world class Digital company. You will be an expert in web-, mobile-, and backend development with the ability to excel in an environment with little certainty but lots of opportunity. We aren’t looking for someone to maintain the present, we’re looking for someone to create the future.


You will help incubate, prototype and inform the road map for new digital products, working in agile squads alongside highly skilled global Product Owners, data analysts, designers, and marketers based in our other development centres (NYC and London). Our ideal candidate is a mid-level engineer who is equally comfortable working with a designer to build a beautiful front-end experience in Angular and writing an API spec to then brief into our wider microservice roadmap.


You’ll use the following technologies and methodologies:



  • Agile – we have release, sprint planning, standups, demos and retros – we are adjusting our own processes and ways of working

  • Frontend development (both web- and mobile development): Angular4, React-Native and all the newest technologies what you recommend

  • Backend development, API design and development: NodeJS, Express, KOA

  • Database development: SQL and NoSQL environment as well

  • Cloud development, infrastructure planning using AWS, and Docker for deployment

  • We write our own tests – we are using TDD principles


On a usual workday you’ll need to:



  • Be creative – work with global teams to create and evaluate the product roadmap – It will depend on you, what and how will we create

  • Raise your voice – we need and are open to your technical knowledge. Educate and guide the business on the right approach, technologies and trends

  • Do it –  take part in the full software development lifecycle from creating iterative prototypes for user testing, experimenting with how data science can configure the client experience, to building the product daily with your peers or lead developers

  • Take the initiative - Lead the development of our next wave of web applications; collaborate with designers, write front-end code and influence the roadmap of APIs and microservices to ship product increments


You’d need:



  • A minimum of 2 years of development experience, ideally across the full stack

  • Passion for technology and data science; meaning you possess a deep functional understanding of database architecture, APIs, algorithms and preferably CRM systems

  • Some experience and understanding of both waterfall and Agile project management disciplines, with an emphasis on Scrum, XP and LeanUX

  • B.S. / M.S. degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related discipline

  • Hands-on experience with modern web development practices, languages and frameworks: HTML, JS, CSS, jQuery and Angular (or equivalent application framework like React or Ember)

  • Familiarity with object-oriented programming, Node, SQL, stored procedures in MS SQL Server or Sybase, occasionally PHP

  • Experience with multi-tier application architecture and design

  • Flawless written and verbal communication and ability to gain buy-in on plans from a non-technical audience

item.title: Scala Backend Developer at VEON (London, UK)
item.description:
Our team & you


We are  looking for an awesome Back End Software Developer to join our team in London!


To continue changing the lives of our 235 million customers, we’re building a world-class Back End  organization and assembling the right team to begin scaling aggressively. This is an opportunity for someone who wants to be part of something big and transformative, someone who will play a critical role in driving our success.


Core technologies of our stack:


Scala, Akka, Akka Streams, Kafka, Play , Jenkins


Within 30 days  you will:


-Ramp up on VEON’s engineering stack and learn functional patterns by pair-programming with your teammates and attending engineering training sessions designed and presented by your peers in Amsterdam, where you will spend 2 weeks meeting key people from development and product teams


-Complete your engineering starter project and deploy your first changes to production!


- Have a clear idea of the role of the Engagement platform within VEON innovation patterns


- Apply standards for user authentication and authorization


- Participate in knowledge sharing sessions


- Discuss and challenge solutions with your colleagues (including some good old whiteboard brainstorming...)


Within 60 days  you will:


- Develop micro services for the back end of the international VEON chat application while managing different types of data (text, images, video, voices, events etc)


- Take ownership of the project you will be part of, ensuring it performs properly and can be monitored. You will help QA colleagues in troubleshooting and ensuring stable releases and deployments


- Propose new technical solutions or paradigms


Within 90 days  you will:


-Work closely with product engineering to educate on best practices: how to write efficient database queries, patterns for more performant tasks, identify performance bottlenecks


- Take ownership of a service or a set of services within the VEON platform


- Help your colleagues getting up to speed with the technology stack


- Work with other teams to design solutions that scale properly and perform robustly



A bit about you:


You’re smart and can find a way to show us.


You’re awesome with at least Scala


We are looking for someone who have rich experience of development in a load intensive environment. Someone who also have commercial software product development experience and not purely building internal or personal software projects.


You will have to demonstrate enthusiasm for learning and discovering new solutions and paradigms. We appreciate attention to quality and ability to create software that is maintainable and easy to understand.


You are resilient.  Pierangelo, your future colleague, has a great way to describe the excitement of creating from scratch at VEON. He says: “We’re like a green field—there’s a lot of room for introducing new ideas. But we don’t like you to sit in a room and code by yourself for three days. Solutions are best if built together”

item.title: Manager, Data Science at adMarketplace (New York, NY)
item.description:
Data Scientists at adMarketplace bridge the gap between data science and engineering while building our next generation of highly targeted search, bidding and matching platform. You will manage a small but highly talented team that has data scientists and data analysts. Our matching, categorization and user targeting services have only milliseconds to make accurate decisions using both historical and real time data. You will be enhancing and utilizing these services with scalable solutions. The ideal candidate will thrive on solving complex technical challenges involving big data and be motivated by pushing the boundaries of using real time data to make automated decisions. Our team uses cutting edge software, including Akka, Apache SPARK, Kafka, NoSQL and more.


Responsibilities:




  • Mentor and develop members of the Data Science and Data Analytics Teams






  • Apply deep, creative, rigorous thinking to solve broad, platform-wide technical and/or business problems






  • Teach, mentor and collaborate with members of the broader Data Science Data Analytics Teams, both to build out specific projects and to continuously teach and learn new technology and techniques






  • Design, conduct, and analyze real-time A/B tests.






  • Support and guide team in using machine-learning techniques, visualizations, and statistical analysis to gain insight into various data






  • Support and guide team in researching, designing, simulating and/or prototyping new algorithmic product features according to business need






  • Work closely with Ad Operations to deliver products that enhance campaign optimization






  • Represent a data science perspective in cross-functional projects and to the company at large





Requirements:




  • BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or related field, Masters or PhD is preferred






  • 6+ years of experience with at least 4 years of hands-on technical experience






  • Experience leading multiple teams






  • Experience with applying probabilistic and/or statistical methods to real-world data sets






  • Experience delivering multiple complex, scalable, mission critical products






  • Solid Computer Science fundamentals including complex distributed systems and space-time complexity






  • Experience optimizing machine learning algorithms; Experience with predictive algorithms






  • Experience with stream processing platforms such as Spark or Storm a plus.






  • Knowledge of and/or working exposure to the scikit-learn open source library is a plus






  • Experience with machine learning techniques; expert knowledge is a major plus






  • Strong coding proficiency in SQL and at least one other common scripting or compiled programming language (Python, Java, and/or Scala a plus)






  • Experience working in a Linux environment






  • Good team communication skills, with technical and non-technical colleagues






  • Experience in Digital Advertising is a plus






  • Experience in Ad Technology platforms is a plus.

item.title: Concepteur Dveloppeur MS BI (H/F) at LIEBHERR AEROSPACE TOULOUSE (Toulouse, France)
item.description:
Au sein du département Systèmes d'information, vous devez assurer l’expertise méthodes et technologies de conception et de développement des applications, en garantissant leur cohérence, leur qualité, leur robustesse et leur performance.


Dans ce cadre, vous serez amené à :



  • Concevoir, maintenir, optimiser et documenter les solutions informatiques BI

  • Effectuer les tests unitaires et/ou d’intégration des programmes réalisés. Identifier et traiter les dysfonctionnements.

  • Garantir la cohérence technique des solutions BI et leurs évolutions

  • Elaborer des standards technologiques internes

  • Coordonner les intervenants externes le cas échéant et être garant de la qualité et du bon respect des règles de conception ;

  • Assurer le support de niveau 3 pour les problèmes liés aux applications ;

  • Etre force de proposition, dans une logique d'amélioration continue, pour l'évolution des applications, de leurs usages.



De formation Ingénieur ou Bac+5 en informatique, vous vous justifiez d’une expérience reconnue, au minimum 2 ans, dans les domaines technologiques suivants SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power Bi, SQL Server.


Réactif, vous êtes doté de bonnes qualités relationnelles et d’un fort sens du service.  Vous êtes reconnu pour votre investissement et vos capacités d’analyse. Votre motivation pour la recherche de solutions  et votre esprit d’équipe seront des atouts indispensables pour réussir dans ce poste. Vous parlez un anglais courant.

item.title: Senior Frontend Developer (React) at Jimdo GmbH (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
Our passion is to help our customers become more successful with their projects. With Jimdo’s simple click to edit interface, our users can easily create their own beautiful websites. Jimdo offers graphical flexibility and high-quality presentation of images, videos, and text. Users from all over the world have created more than 20 million websites using Jimdo - and we’re happy to see the numbers growing continuously!


We are a motivated team full of smart people. Every one of us is an expert in what we do, and together we try to achieve the best possible results. Working in a young product company within a rapidly changing market comes with a lot of growth opportunities and many possibilities to contribute to our users’ success. To learn more about our story visit our website.


We’re seeking a frontend engineer to join our product development team. If you're passionate about building frontends our users love and like working with the latest technologies, then we're eager to get to know you.


You have the option to start immediately in our Hamburg office. This is a full-time, permanent position.


Responsibilities




  • Implement new features that help users to successfully share their business, projects and ideas. That’s what they love about us!

  • Support other (development) teams and individuals with your knowledge, skills, and expertise. We value mutual help as together we’re going to win that game!

  • Engage with other product engineering and design teams and continue to improve our customers’ experience


Requirements




  • Expert knowledge in JavaScript

  • Good hands-on expertise with React and optionally Redux

  • Experience with frontend development tools like Webpack, Grunt, or Gulp

  • Professional experience in developing web frontends with HTML and CSS (SASS)

  • Experience in significant cross-functional engineering efforts across multiple teams


Nice to have




  • Experience integrating modern APIs

  • Experience working with continuous delivery systems

  • Experience in web performance optimization / profiling


Abilities




  • Strong communication skills for finding simple and solid solutions

  • Positive attitude towards problem solving

  • Obsession with automation and simplicity

  • Ability to break complex problems down into manageable chunks

  • Drive to get things done

  • Solid spoken and written English communication skills


What technologies do we work with?




  • JavaScript (ES5/ES2015), TypeScript

  • React, Redux

  • Webpack

  • CSS, SASS

  • Jenkins and Travis CI (Continuous deployment)

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer - Retail Core (Java/Scala) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
The Opportunity


As a senior backend engineer in our Retail Core Teams, you work on the systems that power the heart of Zalando. You build the procure-to-pay solutions that handle Zalando’s multi-billion Euro purchasing spend. Your systems are used by hundreds of internal users and 1000+ of our suppliers every day to provide our millions of customers with the fashion they love. With a strong focus on automating all relevant business processes and on digitizing all interactions with our suppliers, we are looking for outstanding software engineers that can understand complex processes and data structures, and who enjoy seeing the impact they deliver through close interactions with our users and clearly defined KPIs. If you also enjoy building state-of-the-art cloud applications using a microservice-based architecture and working in small and dedicated agile teams, you should join us and help us build the future of Zalando.


You Set Standards


Ownership. You and your team will take ownership of the whole development cycle - from architecture design to implementation and testing as well as maintenance.


Excellence. You write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture, and technology.


Impact. You use your world-class development techniques to deliver a high-performance, stable and auto-scaling production system that delivers business value in weeks, not quarters or years.


You Are Skilled


Experience. You are fluent in Java and/or Scala and relevant frameworks (e.g. Spring) with at least 5 years of industry experience. Ideally, you have also developed complex internal systems (e.g. ERP, Supply Chain Management) or Web Applications for complex business domains.


Technologies. You have experience in system architecture and RESTful API design and you can build microservice-based systems, preferably in the cloud.


Variety. You can design, develop, deploy, operate and improve important software solutions with a DevOps mindset that impact hundreds of colleagues, thousands of suppliers and millions of customers.


Drive. You want to have an impact by effectively communicating with colleagues, leading team meetings and finding creative solutions to complex problems. You enjoy driving continuous improvement and innovation.

You Are Offered


Culture. You will be welcomed by a culture of trust, empowerment, and feedback.  


Package. Competitive salary and many perks, such as great shopping discount on a wide range of products on zalando.com; discounts from external partners; public transport discounts; relocation assistance for internationals; municipality services*; family service and parent & child rooms*; additional holidays & volunteering time off; diverse sports and health offerings.


Development. Extensive onboarding; personal branding support focused on leadership; Career framework with clear opportunities (including technical impact tracks); opportunity to attend and speak at conferences; 100+ internal guilds; tech talks; product demos; access to a wide variety of learning sources (e.g. Safari books, “video tutorial platform”); coder dojos.


Peers. You will work together with accomplished experts coming from all over the world and great self-organized teams.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact Rebecca Kurzbuch.

item.title: Mobile Test Engineer (iOS & Android) - Remote at Creatubbles () (allows remote)
item.description:
Creatubbles™ is the safe global community for creators of all ages. It is the perfect space for children, families and teachers to save, share, discover and interact with multimedia creativity portfolios. It lets anyone share their experiences and creations safely in more than 50 countries, whether they are at home, school, an event or activity.


We recognize creativity is a critical life skill to be developed and nurtured like any other form of expression. We believe in the importance of finding and developing your individual voice by being able to express thoughts and ideas freely.


Creatubbles™ is an integrated creativity ecosystem with a growing list of partners that believe in nurturing creativity through a safe and supportive environment.


About our company


We are an ambitious team of around 25 people, covering 14 nationalities and operating as a network of virtual teams around the world.


To fulfill our mission to nurture the original creativity of children around the world, we are constantly exploring new ways to incorporate the latest ideas, approaches, and technologies into our products and services.


At Creatubbles, you will be helping to build a product that serves not only the future of the world, but the parents and the teachers that guide them as well.


Main site: https://www.creatubbles.com
Blog: https://stateoftheart.creatubbles.com


About our development Team and Technologies
- We start the day with a standup call and organise our work in weekly iterations.
- Slack, Trello, Github, CircleCI and Amazon AWS are just a couple of the many friends we rely on every single day.
- ScreenHero allows us to enjoy pair­-programming sessions, even when members are located on the other side of the world.
- Our focus is to build and keep iterating on universal experiences and interfaces that work for and delight users between ages of 1 and 99.
- The back­end is made available to our web app, our native mobile apps and our partner's applications as a simple REST API.
- Security is extremely important to us as want our own kids to use our apps in a safe way.
- We follow a Balanced Teams approach whereby design/development/testing is tightly integrated.
- Our PMs keep tabs on the work to be done and prepare detailed acceptance criteria for each task.



About you
- You have experience working with testing native iOS and Android mobile apps (and Web app test experience is a big plus).
- You are a hero when it comes to manual testing but also know how to leverage crowd-based solutions like test.io
- You know your way with APIs and how to test apps that rely on them.
- You insist on clean and well-­maintained code with a good amount of test coverage that leads to beautiful user-­interfaces. You have experience with data­-driven product development: analytics, A/B testing, etc
- You have experience writing tests in some sort of xUnit framework.
- You take quality and testing very seriously. Very very seriously. Obviously.
- You are fluent in spoken and written English (knowledge of Japanese is a big plus).
- You have a pro­active personality, are a real team player and feel comfortable working in a fast-­paced tech startup environment.
- You have a fundamental interest in what we are doing and show empathy for our users.
- You have a general curiosity and an ability to embrace complexity.
- Ideally you are based somewhere in the European time zone to maximize work time overlap with our development teams.

item.title: Software Architect - Big Data at Siemens - USA (Princeton, NJ)
item.description:
Are you passionate about high-quality software, software architecture and big data? Do you want to work on innovative products? This position might be for you.


 The Research in Digitalization and Automation (RDA) department, as part of Siemens Corporate Technology (CT), is at the heart of Siemens R&D. Our deep competence and expertise make us the preferred partner for innovation. We develop technologies with wide applicability so that Siemens may successfully bring innovations to market. Our scientists located around the world help create and retain a technological edge for Siemens in the focus area of automation, electrification and industrial digitization.



Complex software-intensive systems are at the core of Siemens’s business. Siemens trains, power plants, factory automation, building automation, power grid control, medical devices, and others depend on the correct operation of software. Therefore, sustainable software architectures are essential for the success of our businesses. The software architects in our team help Siemens business units world-wide to improve their software architectures, making our products even more reliable, performant, scalable and maintainable. We also help business units translate new business ideas into software solutions and successful products. Our research results influence Siemens products and are reflected in patents and publications in journals and conferences. The Software Architect Big Data will help Siemens development teams leverage big data technologies to develop new products or enhance existing products.


What are my responsibilities?



• Provide technical leadership in the area of big data software architecture to the team, collaborators and customers.
• Participate in the definition of the research strategy for big data software architecture and perform research, development and consulting projects collaborating with colleagues, customers and universities.
• Supervise the work of graduate student interns.
• Design and implement customized solutions for Siemens business units.
• Define, articulate, document and apply architectural principles and patterns.
• Acquire and lead projects and travel to meet with collaborators and Siemens-internal customers.



What skills are needed to qualify for this position?



• Master in Computer Science or equivalent is required. PhD is preferred.
• Minimum of three years of experience in software engineering is required.
• Minimum one year experience with big data technologies, such as Hadoop and Spark.
• Minimum two years experience with SQL and NoSQL databases and data warehouses, such as Cassandra, MongoDB, Greenplum, Redshift, DynamoDB, Postgres, MySQL.
• Ability to write clean and efficient code in Java, Scala, and Python.
• Experience in software architecture methods and tools.
• Ability to work on a problem from the analysis phase to the implementation of a practical solution. 
• Experience with Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure or other public cloud is highly desired but not required.
• Publication record in high profile peer-reviewed journals and conferences is highly desired but not required. 
• Willingness to travel 20% (domestic/international)
• Outstanding written and verbal communication skills in English are required.
• Strong collaboration skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
• Successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. US Export Control laws and applicable regulations govern the distribution of strategically important technology, services and information to foreign nationals and foreign countries. Siemens may require candidates under consideration for employment opportunities to submit information regarding citizenship status to allow the organization to comply with specific US Export Control laws and regulations. Additional information on the US Export Control laws & regulations can be found on http://www.bis.doc.gov/index.php/policy-guidance/deemed-exports/deemed-exports-faqs?view=category&id=33#subcat34


Equal Employment Opportunity Statement 




Siemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, protected veteran or military status, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.


EEO is the Law 
Applicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination. To learn more, Click here.


Pay Transparency Non-Discrimination Provision 
Siemens follows Executive Order 11246, including the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision. To learn more, Click here.

item.title: Java Developer at Picnic (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Who are you?


You get excited by solving hard problems. You are not intimidated by grand challenges. You love building ultra-scalable systems. Reaching technical excellence gives you a deep satisfaction. Chasing operational excellence is your second nature. You flourish when your team reaches peak performance.



What are your challenges?



  • Design, develop, and test new user-facing features of our platform

  • Create high-quality code that is scalable, reliable and reusable

  • Innovate and advance the core planning, shopping, retailing and shipment algorithms

  • Optimize supply chain systems to maximize operational performance and efficiency

  • Analyze and improve the scalability and security of our platform

item.title: Senior Front-end Engineer at PropertyGuru Pte Ltd (Bangkok, Thailand)
item.description:
So you think you can code? Think you’re a kickass programmer?


You live for coding; you write code so beautiful that code-reviewers jump off cliffs from pure jealously?


You are highly motivated and passionately follow engineering best practices. You enjoy learning and mastering bleeding edge technologies?

You are driven to build solutions that make life easier for millions of people. You want to create web sites with amazing user experience that earn five-star ratings. You are not only well versed in front-end, back-end development, but also have a strong understanding of good UX and aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty in server configuration.

This is what we have done already:



  • We have developed 5 property portals with dominant presence in 4 countries

  • Our traffic has passed 100 million monthly page views and is increasing fast

  • We win prestigious awards for property online portals every year and our web portals always occupy top most visited sites in all 4 countries


What are typical challenges we face at PropertyGuru?



  • We’re dealing with massive amount of incoming data everyday

  • We’re dealing with massive traffic (130+M users)


Requirements:



  • 5+ years of web development experience

  • Experience in at least one of popular JavaScript frameworks/libraries (React, Angular or Vue)

  • Well-versed with front-end code in HTML5, CSS3

  • Great Knowledge of JavaScript

  • Knowledge of frontend testing tools like Karma, Jasmine, Jest or Protractor

  • Possess strong understanding of Functional Programming

  • Exposures to Scrum methodology and XP technical practices such as unit testing, pair programming, test-driven development, continuous integration or continuous delivery

  • Self-motivated, fast learner, detail-oriented, team player and a sense of humor

item.title: Are you a Scala Master? at VEON (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Do you want to be part of a team that engages over 235 million customers across 12 rising markets? Do you want to pioneer new experiences to hundreds of millions of customers in the markets of tomorrow? We are doing things never thought possible. We are writing a new story.  Enter VEON, a revolutionary personal internet platform that integrates powerful data analytics and artificial intelligence to finally put the user in control. With zero-rating as a fundamental component of the service, VEON allows users to stay connected for free, no matter the status of their data plan—even when they are out of credit. VEON’s fresh take on messaging capabilities enables users and communities to connect by voice, text, picture and video through a stunning designed interface.


We are already live in Italy and Russia and we are building the future. We also announced exciting partnerships with MasterCard, Deezer and i.am+ (by Will.i.am) and more very famous names are coming.


Our team & you  


We are looking for an awesome Scala Back End Software Developer to join our team in Amsterdam . 



To continue and change the lives of our 235 million customers, we’re building a world-class Back End organization and assembling the right team to begin scaling aggressively. This is an opportunity for someone who wants to be part of something big and transformative, someone who will play a critical role in driving our success


Core technologies of our stack:  Scala, Akka, Akka Streams, Akka HTTP, Kafka, Cassandra,Linux, Microservices


Within 1 month, you’ll…  


-Ramp up on VEON’s engineering stack and learn functional patterns by pair-programming with your teammates and attending engineering training sessions designed and presented by your peers.


- Complete your engineering starter project and deploy your first changes to production!


- Have a clear idea of the role of the Engagement platform within VEON innovation patterns


- Apply standards for user authentication and authorization


- Participate in knowledge sharing sessions


- Discuss and challenge solutions with your colleagues (including some good old whiteboard brainstorming….)


 Within 3 months, you’ll… 


- Develop micro services for the back end of the international VEON chat application while managing different types of data (text, images, video, voices, events etc) 


- Take ownership of the project you will be part of, ensuring it performs properly and can be monitored. You will help QA colleagues in troubleshooting and ensuring stable releases and deployments 


- Propose new technical solutions or paradigms 


Within 6 months, you’ll… 


-Work closely with product team to educate on best practices: how to write efficient database queries, patterns for more performant tasks, identify performance bottlenecks 


- Take ownership of a service or a set of services within the VEON platform 


- Help your colleagues getting up to speed with the technology stack 


- Work with other teams to design solutions that scale properly and perform robustly


A bit about you: 


You’re smart and can find a way to show us.  You’re awesome with at least Scala   We are looking for someone who have rich experienceof development in a load intensive environment. Someone who also have commercial software product development experience and not purely building internal or personal software projects.  You will have to demonstrate enthusiasm for learning and discovering new solutions and paradigms. We appreciate attention to quality and ability to create software that is maintainable and easy to undersand.  You are resilient.  Pierangelo, your future colleague, has a great way to describe the excitement of creating from scratch at VEON. He says: “We’re like a green field—there’s a lot of room for introducing new ideas. But we don’t like you to sit in a room and code by yourself for three days. Solutions are best if built together”

item.title: Quality Analyst/Assurance at SafetyCulture (Townsville City, Australia)
item.description:
Test Engineer at SafetyCulture:


SafetyCulture is the fast growing, global technology company that powers iAuditor, the world’s most used checklist app. We are looking for an exceptional Test Engineer to join one of our cross-functional feature teams, to develop test requirements, test cases as well as the execution of the tests. You will have the knowledge and enthusiasm to support our world-class software engineering teams and make them more efficient and productive. Quality must be your top priority!


At SafetyCulture we're focused on bringing our customer the best experience possible. Our products help save lives each day. We build with care. We want people who can use their passion for technology and our products to ensure we are shipping the highest quality products for our customers. If you can live and breathe our 'Build It Well' value we would love to hear from you. In return, you will be joining an awesome culture of highly motivated, enthusiastic and skilled people from around the world. We are embarking on a massive journey that you get to be a part of!


What you'll do:



  • Make our Software Engineers more efficient and productive

  • Build test cases and identify gaps and produce high-quality testing outcomes

  • Automate testing and manual testing

  • Identify issues with test execution and defects

  • Improve processes through building support tools

  • Create automation frameworks with Selenium and/or associated testing tools

  • Work in conjunction with Product Managers, Engineers and Business Stakeholders

  • Maintenance and support of the QA and user testing environments

  • Evaluate and integrate open source tool sets


Requirements:



  • Experience across automation and manual testing

  • Testing experience across mobile and web applications

  • Worked in a cross-functional team with Software Engineers, Product Owners etc

  • Worked in a fully agile environment

  • Always learning something new and wants to work with the latest tech and tools

  • Scripting experience

  • Communicates effectively with both technical and non-technical people


Please download our free app iAuditor and let us know why you would get excited working for SafetyCulture!

item.title: Senior Big Data Architect at GameDuell (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
The Senior Big Data Architect will be responsible for strengthening and further extending our data platform, which serves as a basis for analysis that drives decision making in the company.

GameDuell is one of the leading casual games companies in Germany located in the heart of Berlin. With more than 125 million users we are constantly looking for ways to improve our product and our players` experience. In order to fulfill our mission of bringing people together to have a good time with games, we are following a solid engineering approach. 


What you will do



  • Consolidation and optimization of the current Big Data infrastructure

  • Extension and continuous improvement of the architecture and implementation of our Business Intelligence and Analytics platform

  • Design and extension of data models

  • Design of ETL processes

  • Stakeholder management with different interfaces of BI, Product Analytics, Marketing, Data Science and Engineering


Your profile



  • University degree in the field of Computer Science, Business Informatics, Mathematics, or similar

  • 5+ years of relevant working experience with the design and development of database architectures

  • Experienced in open source data technologies (Hadoop, Hbase, Hive, Kafka, Storm, Spark etc.)

  • Profound knowledge and experience with real-time streaming systems

  • Experience with ETL, Reporting or BI tools

  • Stakeholder management experience with a high degree of comfort in speaking with senior executives and the ability to work on an abstract level

  • Several years of experience in leading teams, excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to foster consensus on future-proof solutions

  • Fluent English is mandatory, knowledge of German is an advantage

item.title: Team Lead Unity C# - Game Development at InnoGames GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
As Team Lead Unity/ C# - Game Development you play a key role in the development of one of our new mobile gaming titles. Together with your agile, highly qualified and cross-functional Unity3D/ C# and Java development team, you are responsible for creating a game that will be played by millions of players.


Your mission:


Your technical and architectural expertise combined with your leadership experience will be crucial to our game’s success. Your mission is to



  • Establish and lead a team of highly qualified game developers

  • Exchange and align with your product manager to define the technical roadmap

  • Closely collaborate with Game Designers, Artists and Quality Assurance

  • Maintain high standards of software quality together with your team

  • Ensure continuous optimisation of game performance in close collaboration with our operations team

  • Coordinate and encourage the further personal development of your developers through training, workshops and other activities

  • Foster a culture of sharing knowledge, best practices and standards



Your profile:



  • You have completed a Computer Sciences, Business Information Systems degree or can provide a comparable relevant professional experience

  • You have several years’ experience in building and leading agile development teams, ideally in the gaming industry

  • You take on a high level of responsibility and are able to make good leadership decisions based on an excellent understanding of business requirements

  • You know the advantages and disadvantages of various architectures and have experience implementing them

  • You have profound knowledge of 3D engines (e.g. Unreal or Unity3D) and you know how to analyse and optimise CPU and GPU performance

  • You have extensive experience in native and cross-platform software development

  • You have excellent communication skills and are willing to embrace our company culture and values

  • You have excellent English language skills



Why join us? 



  • Shape the success story of InnoGames with a great team of driven experts in an international culture

  • Competitive compensation and an atmosphere to empower creative thinking and strong results

  • Exceptional benefits ranging from flawless relocation support to company gym, smartphone or tablet of your own choice for personal use, roof terrace with BBQ and much more



Would you like to become part of a dynamic team and work as a Team Lead in our new mobile game. Then we look forward to receiving your application (cover letter, CV and references) as well as your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date through our online application form at innogames.com. Your contact person for this job offer is Katrin Hugo.

item.title: Mid-level Software Developer (f/m) - Java, Spring, AWS services at Smaato (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
About the role


The Java Developer we are seeking is experienced and passionate about software development, and willing to conduct hands-on development on our overall application ecosystem.
Currently our platform, divided in four verticals and built with cutting edge technology, is processing around 20 billion inbound advertising queries per day. Each incoming request generates multiple outbound requests to our partners. 


You can expect a very international team of Developers who are based in Hamburg. As part of our self-organizing Scrum teams you'd be structuring 2-weeks-sprints following iterative methods. Our team sizes vary between 4 and 7 Developers. The hierarchies are set efficiently and the management style can be called hands-off; in other words, you are trusted to manage your own work.


Your key responsibilities:



  • Developing solutions to User Story based requirements

  • Building software to pass automated acceptance tests and delivery of Sprint commitments

  • Mentoring Junior Developers

  • Sharing responsibility for all team deliverable, and favoring informal communications with Product Owners and other stakeholders within the company

  • Engaging positively on the Scrum Team, and committing to sprint agreements


About the requirements


Required:



  • Solid knowledge and understanding of Java 7/8 and object-oriented software architectures

  • Several years of relevant experience in Software Engineering

  • Experience with popular frameworks, such as Spring Framework, and Guice

  • Database optimization experience both on RDMS and NoSQL systems (e.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL, Aerospike)

  • Knowledge of AWS services like EC2, S3, CloudFormation


Preferred:



  • Previous experience with networking, API Design, REST services

  • Git, Maven, Jenkins, IDE Eclipse / IntelliJ, Jira and Confluence experience

  • Work experience in distributed high performance web applications

item.title: Senior PHP Developer at belvilla (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Belvilla is looking for a Senior PHP-Webdeveloper,  to help us continue to build our products and services. Together with a team of young, enthusiastic colleagues you develop new tools, maintain and expand existing services and help improve usability and conversion. Your primary focus will be development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. It’s key that you’re experienced with the Symfony framework. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your coworkers into the application. A basic understanding of front-end technologies is therefore necessary as well.


You feel comfortable working within an agile environment that focuses on delivering business value, at a fast pace, in a dynamic fast growing company. The team focuses on building user-centered, modern, mobile, flexible platforms.


What is expected of you



  • Come every day with the energy & drive to achieve greatness, always drive yourself and others to improve

  • Develop, test and implement LAMP stack based, user- centered solutions

  • You deliver software that goes beyond basic functional requirements

  • Building reusable code and libraries for future use

  • You feel the drive to always want to optimize the application for maximum speed and scalability

  • Integration of user-facing elements developed by a front-end developers with server side logic

  • You help boost the Symfony framework experience level within the team by coaching and help setting up standards

  • You believe that great quality code is the result of team effort. You have a positive attitude toward team Planning, pair programming, TDD and Lean/Agile Practices.


Skills & Requirements



  • You have a solid educational foundation through a computer science, electronic engineering or mathematics degree

  • 5+ years of hands on experience in software development with strong, up to date knowledge of software architecture

  • Over 3+ experience with Symfony Framework

  • You are a PHP specialist that make good use of design pattern, coding standards and You take pride of the quality of your code

  • You have extensive knowledge on code optimization and website performance

  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git

  • Experience with agile and other modern software development methodologies, services oriented architecture, LAMP stack, test driven development (TDD) & other testing methodologies, and a zeal for automation at all levels

  • You are a webtech wizard and you enjoy coaching your colleagues


What are we offering?


A dynamic position at the heart of the organization, actually contributing to the growth and the ambitions of @Leisure. Your personal approach will be validated and you will have ample opportunity to grow in an expanding business. Education will be part of your personal growth plan and your initiative and creative will not only be welcomed but they will also be rewarded!


We have an informal culture where we stimulate and support each other. We are proud to be the best in our business.


Interested? Then send us your CV, or contact Dasha Soroka at dasha.soroka@leisure-group.eu

item.title: Front End Developer at High Growth Social Media Company (AI/machine learning) EU at BrandBastion () (allows remote)
item.description:
DESCRIPTION


Full-time remote position available only for candidates in the GMT to GMT+3 time zones.


BrandBastion is a rapidly growing company focused on disrupting the brand reputation and ad performance services on social media with the use of AI and machine learning. We work with Fortune 500 companies, governments, start-ups and non-profits in North America, South America, Europe, Asia and Australia. We are backed by great investors such as Mårten Mickos (HackerOne) and Risto Siilasmaa (founder of F-Secure).


We are scouting for a front end multi-talent to join our A-team full time:


You are passionate about designing, developing and implementing web interfaces and apps for next-gen services using frameworks such as React. You want to lead and drive change in your own area. You function best in a fast-paced environment with focus on execution. You are self-organized, self-motivated, a good communicator and you inspire others through your work.


You will:



  • Lead the front end side of our software projects

  • Be actively involved in architecting new services and products together with our core team

  • Will work on building single-page real time web applications with focus on performance, usability and user experience

  • Be proactive and up-to-date with the latest changes in the industry

  • Share our values: focus on execution, adaptability and agility, knowledge above hierarchy, self-drive and constant improvement.


Skills & Requirements



  • Experience with any of the following would be an asset: SaaS, CRM, real-time web applications, interactive dashboards

  • Extensive JavaScript knowledge (+3 years)

  • Working experience with React (+Redux), Angular (optional)

  • You like fast responsive interfaces and know how to optimize them

  • ES6, Node.js, NPM, CSS (SASS), D3.js

  • Data APIs, Websocket

  • Extensive testing and CI knowledge

  • UI/UX prototyping, usability, responsive design would be an asset

  • Good team communicator and collaborator with excellent English skills

  • Innovative and entrepreneurial mindset

item.title: IT Developer Java / E-Commerce (m/w) at Publicis Pixelpark (Kln, Deutschland)
item.description:
Wir arbeiten bei Publicis Pixelpark, weil wir es lieben, digitale Produkte zu erschaffen. Dabei entwickeln wir digitale Produkte, die unsere Kunden besser am Markt positionieren. Zu ihnen zählen unter anderem DocMorris, Roller, Sanofi, RWE, Busch-Jaeger, BMAS, BMWi, BMBF. Gemeinsam mit Deinen Kollegen in der Entwicklung und den angrenzenden Bereichen Projektmanagement, Konzeption, Redaktion, Design und Betrieb arbeitest Du an der agilen Umsetzung wegweisender digitaler Lösungen mit. Im lokalen Team aus über 150 super Kölner Kollegen lernst Du ein anspruchsvolles technologisches Umfeld kennen. Da das nicht immer reicht, arbeiten wir auch eng mit unseren Kollegen aus den anderen Standorten zusammen.


Zur Unterstützung unseres Standorts in Köln suchen wir einen IT Developer Java / E-Commerce (m/w), der Lust hat, unser Entwicklerteam zu unterstützen. Jemanden, der begeistert an innovativen E-Commerce Lösungen mitzuarbeiten.


Was wir von Dir erwarten:



  • Studien- oder Berufsabschluss im Bereich Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation

  • Gute Kenntnisse in Java/JEE und Spring

  • Gute Kenntnisse in HTML, CSS und JavaScript

  • Kenntnisse in TDD und agilen Techniken und Methoden

  • Kenntnisse in GIT, Build-Servern und DevOps Themen

  • Erfahrungen mit MVC-Frameworks

  • Interesse an E-Commerce

  • Lernbereitschaft, Flexibilität, Umgänglichkeit und Kritikfähigkeit

  • Hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein

  • Englisch und Deutsch in Wort und Schrift


Nice to have:



  • Erfahrungen mit E-Commerce Systemen, vorzugsweise Hybris

  • Kenntnisse in GIT, Build-Servern und DevOps Themen

  • Erfahrungen mit Konfigurationsmanagement und CI/CD


Unser Versprechen:



  • Interessante Projekte im E-Commerce Umfeld

  • Ein anspruchsvolles technologisches Umfeld

  • Kurze Entscheidungswege und die Möglichkeit zur Mitgestaltung unserer Strukturen und Prozesse

  • Echte Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie durch flexible Arbeitszeiten und Gleitzeitregelung


Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt? Dann schicke uns Deine aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen sowie deine Gehaltsvorstellung an Alexandra Kramer, jobs@publicispixelpark.de, oder lade Deine Unterlagen direkt über unser Bewerbungsformular hoch – wir freuen uns Dich kennenzulernen.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Giraffe Games Ltd (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
At Giraffe Games, developers work in smaller, self-directed teams and are given opportunities to contribute to both the design and implementation across all of our games. As game developer you will work across multiple areas and make significant contributions to the games they work on.


We often reuse good designs between projects, so it is essential that you communicate and share knowledge among the rest of the team.


We are looking for an experienced game developer who is self-motivated, ambitious and a strong team player.






Skills & Requirements


Responsibilities



  • Maintain and optimise new and existing game features

  • Design, architect, test and implement game features

  • Support and contribute new ideas to game design

  • Write robust code to be used by millions of users

  • Create complete solutions independently

  • Work as part of a team, and share knowledge and ideas


Requirements



  • Wide understanding of different game technology areas (gameplay, graphics, tools etc.)

  • At least 3 years of experience working on mobile games or published at least 3 titles

  • Self-driven and independent

  • Experience using Unity3D

  • Good communication skills

  • Passion for sports games

  • Strong team player

item.title: VBA & Excel Engineer at Zalando SE (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
The Opportunity


Zalando is the leading online Fashion platform and one of the biggest Tech companies in Europe. We re-imagine Fashion for the good of all and see technology as the key driver to getting there. The 1,600+ members of Zalando Technology across our offices in Germany, Ireland and Finland build most of our 40+ platform products in-house and open source, and our teams in Analytical Buying & Replenishment are at the heart of all of this. We are building the solutions that determine on which merchandise (aka fashion products) we will spend our yearly EUR 2bn+ buying budget. You will build scalable production systems to improve pre-order quantity and size predictions to make sure our customers will always find the products they love.



You Are Setting Standards


Impact. You are part of a team that delivers to our buyers their most essential tool with which they refine their purchase orders.


Expertise. You will be joining a team that has pushed the limits of a VBA / Excel-based solutions for hundreds of users and follows the highest standards in stability, quality, and usability of their product.


Autonomy. You and your team own the code and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as provide the best usability.


Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.



You Are Skilled


Technology. You are fluent in Visual Basic and Excel, Office JavaScript APIs and Add-ins. You are knowledgeable in object-oriented programming as well as testing and agile development. You are well versed in a second programming language and have experience with Web development and REST APIs.


Experienced. In having at least 5 years of hands-on industry experience as a VBA / Office developer.


Motivated. In making a positive impact on our engineering culture, encouraging knowledge sharing and staying on top of technological developments in your field of expertise.


Ambitious. In delivering products that re-define the customer experience and making bold decisions about the means and tools of delivery and operation.



You Are Offered


Culture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events.


Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice.


Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.


Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.



Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact Rebecca Kurzbuch.

item.title: Developer Evangelist (US & EU) at Auth0 () (allows remote)
item.description:
Multiple positions available in US and EU.


You're a developer who is always trying to learn new shiny things. You also love to share whatever you've learned with all of your friends. Every time there's a new technology or framework, you always try it out and create an open source repository on GitHub with some code samples. This is the job for you!


You'll get to go to the best conferences in the world, speak to thousands of people and throw T-shirts at the audience. We want you to help us share our excitement with the world about learning all new things related to APIs, JSON Web Tokens, authentication, security, SPAs and much more!


Responsibilities



  • Research the latest technologies and stay on top of everything that's new.

  • Go to the best conferences in the world and give talks about APIs, JWTs, authentication, security, SPAs and more

  • Talk to developers on Stack Overflow, Quora, GitHub and other social networks

  • Create exciting open source libraries and tools like http://jwt.io


Requirements



  • Experience as a software developer

  • Desire to help people succeed

  • Experience presenting in conferences / meetups

item.title: Software Engineer (API + Services Team) at Auth0 () (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for an engineer to join our "API + Services" team, to help us refine our customer-facing APIs, Dashboard, and supporting services, while ensuring they remain stable, secure, and developer-friendly.


You will



  • Design, build, and maintain public APIs, used by Auth0 customers, as well as internal services and systems

  • Debug production issues across multiple levels of our stack

  • Collaborate with fellow engineers to build new features at large-scale

  • Refine engineering practices, standards, and tooling


You might be a good fit if you



  • Have a history of developing and supporting intuitive and robust APIs

  • Are familiar with the challenges and approaches for crafting interconnected, scalable systems

  • Take an iterative approach to development, dividing long-term goals into incremental work

  • Thrive in a dynamic and collaborative environment

  • Have familiarity with the tools we currently use such as NodeJS, React, ElasticSearch, and MongoDB. However, we always try to use the best tool for the job, therefore we care more about your general engineering skill than knowledge of a particular language or tool.

  • Have experience working in a remote-first organization

  • Place a high value on security


It’s not expected that you have expertise in all these areas. We’re looking for professional engineers, who can quickly learn and adapt as our systems and situation changes, rather than a rigid skillset.


You might work on



  • Building a new API endpoint for our users, or iterating on existing endpoints

  • Assisting our support and teams to help our customers make the best use of our APIs

  • Adding metrics to measure usage of a feature, and using the results to inform suggestions for improvements

  • Refactoring existing code to accommodate new features or standards

  • Tuning our ElasticSearch cluster to support arbitrary metadata searches

  • Growing visibility into our background job processing system, and improving its resistance to failures

item.title: Software Architect at EdLab, Teachers College Columbia University (New York, NY)
item.description:
EdLab at Teachers College Columbia University is seeking a Software Architect. The incumbent will bring educational and technological expertise and experience along with client-focused consulting skills to design and deliver new educational software applications. 


The Software Architect will oversee the application architecture on a variety of projects and work with a small group of educators and technologists on all phases of the development cycle, including design, specification, development, testing, and delivery. This role will include both hands on development () and architectural oversight (). 


Responsibilities:



  • Design systems at a high-level and participate in their implementation

  • Support and troubleshoot issues (process & system), identify root cause, and proactively implement sustainable corrective actions

  • Evaluate technologies to identify process improvements, come up with potential solutions and coordinate efforts with senior leaders and key partners

  • Mentor junior developers and coach them to solve technical problems and ensure that best practices are followed

  • Stay current with new and fast-changing technologies 

  • Collaborate with the Director of Software Engineering to set team strategy and performance goals


Minimum Qualifications:



  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience plus a minimum of three years of hands-on software engineering experience required

  • Demonstrated problem-solving skills on different scale issues with ability to undertake and complete software projects independently

  • Demonstrated ability to research and learn new technologies quickly and constantly

  • In-depth knowledge of all of the following areas necessary: Refactoring, automated testing, system and database design, application development, technical risk management, and software release management


Preferred Qualifications:



  • The successful candidate must also bring a demonstrated commitment to education

  • Familiar with our current stack or you can make it better

  • Experience with React.js, Node.js, Python, MySQL, Docker, and open source software preferred

  • Experience with Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Recommendation System, or related technical field is highly valued

item.title: Full Stack Developer - REMOTE POSITION at Xapo () (allows remote)
item.description:
This is a remote position, meaning you can work from wherever you are!



Overview:


Xapo is seeking a senior Full Stack Developer to join our team. We need someone passionate willing to work with first class engineers around the world. The ideal candidate will be a seasoned developer with proven experience in backend development using python, with strong knowledge of MySQL programming and Redis. The candidate must also be able to master front end development technologies using javascript, jquery and html. Developer profile mixture is 90% backend and 10% frontend. Experience with fin-tech and trading platforms development is required.


RESPONSIBILITIES


As a senior developer, you will work with a highly specialized multidisciplinary team that handles the complete development lifecycle of a product, from the envisioning phase to the production deployment. You will be mainly responsible within this team for building high quality software components that fulfill defined functional specifications and fit in the architectural designs for it. You will be responsible to work in an autonomous way following a defined plan and achieving schedule goals in time. You will also be required to participate in the design, test and deploy of your code. Excellent teamwork and good planning and communication skills are a must.


We are looking for experienced, passionate, enthusiastic and top quality engineers; if you think you have what it takes to help revolutionize the fin-tech future then come join us!


JOB REQUIREMENTS


Education and/or Experience:


Outstanding engineering talent proved by great work results and experience.


Experience developing forex trading platforms and real time quotation systems.


5+ years’ experience in software development for commercial projects.


Backend development. (90% of work)


Excellent proven Python development skills.
