item.title: iOS Developer at Badoo (London, UK)
item.description:
Our iOS team is made of dynamic and fun-loving coders at the top of their game! We take pride in our work, love our crew and live & breathe iOS. As part of our team, you will own and drive technical projects from specification through to delivery and beyond. You will impact millions of users, share know-how with the community and experiment a lot. If you get a buzz from taking initiative, redefining expectations but also getting involved in challenging technical debates with the team, this is your place. 


RESPONSIBILITIES/JOB ROLE




    • Hands-on development: analyse product specifications, design implementations, write code and rapidly deliver features

    • Mind performance metrics to draw conclusions and drive change

    • Contribute technical ideas and suggestions to enhance the direction of the product

    • Write efficient, maintainable and reusable code and tests. Pass code reviews and be a good scout in general

    • Be an efficient and responsible team member, communicate, participate and help

    • Work with QA in a weekly release cycle

    • Be enthused about teamwork in an AGILE environment: attend daily stand-ups, plan and demo your projects



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS




    • Product-focused iOS application development experience

    • Evidence of delivering consumer facing, mass market, networked, high-performance iOS applications available in the App Store

    • Up to date with the latest Cocoa and iOS trends

    • Understanding of UIKit, Core Animation, GCD & Networking

    • Excellent understanding of design patterns & Object Oriented Programming

    • Understanding of analytics, remote reporting and measurements

    • Experience of working with Continuous Integration (CI) and Unit Testing on iOS

    • Knowledge of socket based networking desirable

    • Experience performance profiling with instruments in Xcode



About You:




    • Think, live and breathe Cocoa

    • Self-motivated and able to achieve deadlines and work independently

    • Love to write clean, reusable code and have a passion for mobile development inside and outside of the office

    • Solid communication skills and team-working capability

    • Positive and logical approach together with willingness to learn

    • Attention to detail and a passion for quality

item.title: Senior JavaScript Engineer - (HTML/CSS, React, Angular/Angular 2 or Node) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will be building the technologies that are utilized as a base for further products and aim to connect all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility - a software development methodology that allows engineers to get work done while management keeps their distance. Along with our guiding set of principles - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.


Your individual impact at Zalando is limitless. It is not only about growth and improvement, it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue.Along with you, we strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.


You Are Setting Standards


Variety. As part of your onboarding, you will get to know some and join one of our teams that matches your interests and skills. As a team, you will build, scale and continuously improve a variety of web applications that redefine the user experience of our customers and partners.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code. You will decide together on the technologies and tools to utilize as well operate large-scale web applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Purpose. You and your team will work truly cross-functional with an entrepreneurial mindset and drive the whole development cycle according to its purpose - from implementation to testing and maintenance.


Mastery. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the scalability, performance and user-centricity of our software. You will add value through innovation by leveraging current trends in software design, frameworks and RESTful web services.


Skills & Requirements


You Are Skilled


Technologies. In working hands-on with JavaScript, HTML/CSS, modern libraries (eg. React) and frameworks (eg. Angular/Angular 2 or Ember). Check our Tech Radar for more information on the technologies we use.


Code Quality. In writing high-performance, reusable code and using version control systems.


Feature Development. In delivering bug free and fully functional features and products that are well tested and based on user requirements.


Knowledge Exchange. In contributing to our growing frontend community and becoming part of our internal Web Guild.


You Are Offered


Culture. Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coder Dojos, parties & events.


Perks. Competitive salary, subvention of your occupational pension plan, 40% Zalando shopping discount, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals as well as help with kindergarten and schools, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice, family rooms


Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.


Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Matthias Rempel, Matthias Schmeißer or Antonia Samanns.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer at Entropay (San Gwann, Malta)
item.description:
As part of the engineering team at Entropay, you will be responsible for building a more efficient and inclusive payment infrastructure. You will build new products, add and improve features, and scale and maintain the systems that real people rely on to keep their money secure, everyday.


Who are you?


You are familiar with a number of technologies and can develop across the entire technology stack. You thrive working as part of a team, and you find it exciting and fulfilling to work with others to find solutions to a challenge. When things don’t go your way, you’re ready to try something new to achieve your goal. Amongst your friends and colleagues, you’re always the first to know about the latest advancements in technology. You constantly raise the bar, and do not accept the status quo. 


What makes you a good fit?



  • At least 4 years of professional experience 

  • A solid understanding of Java EE 6+; Spring is also acceptable

  • Experience in REST API design and implementation

  • Experience in database design and MySQL

  • Experience using Angular4, HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

  • Experience in UNIX-based systems is considered an asset

  • Familiarity working with Git, Maven, Continuous Integration and other essentials


Assets



  • Familiarity with cloud infrastructure (e.g. AWS) 

  • Familiar with Docker and container technologies like Docker Swarm, Kubernetes, and/or AWS ECS2

  • Familiarity with any of the following is a plus, but not required - Grunt/Gulp, SASS/LESS, Karma, Jasmine, npm

item.title: Senior-Level Software Engineer - iOS (Biz Core Team) at Yelp (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
At Yelp, the Biz Core team empowers developers to quickly get high-quality features into the hands of our users. To make this happen, we build components shared across teams, maintain infrastructure for testing and releases, and promote best practices across Yelp's developer community. Engineers on Biz Core make changes that impact entire apps and teams in offices across the world.


We are an agile team that helps to create an amazing experience for millions of Yelpers. For us, solving a problem includes working with our peers to design a solution they want to use and finding a way to roll it out in constantly-updated apps with millions of users. If you’re passionate about maintaining a top-tier development ecosystem, you’ll fit right in.


Our Hamburg office is located in the heart of the city and brings with it the unique advantages of booming international teams, all of whom share the same floor and are brought together by the same goal: empowering Yelp’s business products.


What You Will Do:



  • Design and implement new tools and frameworks that will improve the development process for dozens of iOS engineers

  • Think holistically about the health, structure, and performance of our iOS apps and find ways to improve them

  • Mentor other engineers and share the best practices you’ve learned

  • Continue to learn, grow, and help us tackle brand new challenges

  • Be a key part of the larger iOS developer community at Yelp


What We Are Looking For:



  • Mastery of the iOS platform (Objective-C or Swift, preferably both)

  • Strong experience with iOS testing, from breaking controller logic into unit-testable pieces to automated UI testing

  • Experience automating iOS builds and releases with tools like Jenkins, Unix shell scripting, xcodebuild, and Fastlane

  • Pointers to past mobile applications you’ve built

  • Excellent English communication skills, German not required


What We Offer:



  • Full responsibility for projects from day one, an awesome team, and a dynamic work environment

  • Competitive salary, equity in the company, and an optional employee stock purchase program

  • Regular 2-day Hackathons and weekly learning groups, always with interesting topics

  • Flexible working hours and meeting-free Thursdays

  • Complimentary German lessons for international employees

  • Subsidization of your public transportation card and €50 per month toward any exercise of your choice

  • Central location, a fully stocked kitchen, team events, happy hours, foosball, and more!

item.title: Python Developer - Web Scraping at Scrapinghub () (allows remote)
item.description:
Scrapinghub is looking for experienced and senior software engineers to join our Professional Services team to work on web crawler development with Scrapy, our flagship open source project.

Are you interested in building web crawlers harnessing the Scrapinghub platform, which powers crawls of over 3 billion pages a month? Do you like working in a company with a strong open source foundation? Scrapinghub helps companies, ranging from Fortune 500 enterprises to up and coming early stage startups, turn web content into useful data with a cloud-based web crawling platform, off-the-shelf datasets, and turn-key web scraping services.

Join us in making the world a better place for web crawler developers with our team of top talented engineers working remotely from more than 30 countries.

Role Responsibilities: 


  • Design, develop and maintain Scrapy web crawlers

  • Leverage the Scrapinghub platform and our open source projects to perform distributed information extraction, retrieval and data processing

  • Identify and resolve performance and scalability issues with distributed crawling at scale

  • Help identify, debug and fix problems with open source projects, including Scrapy


Scrapinghub’s platform and Professional Services offerings have been growing tremendously over the past couple of years but there are a lot of big projects waiting in the pipeline, and in this role you would be a key part of that process. Here’s what we’re looking for:

About You: 


  • 2+ years of software development experience.

  • Solid Python knowledge.

  • Scrapy experience a plus.

  • Familiarity with Linux/UNIX, HTTP, HTML, Javascript and Networking.

  • Good communication in written and spoken English.

  • Availability to work full time.

item.title: Senior Backend Developer (Python) at Jimdo GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
We’re seeking a software engineer to join our product development team. If you're passionate about building and running software that adds features to the Jimdo platform and love working with the latest technologies, then we're eager to get to know you. 


You have the option to start immediately in our Hamburg office. This is a full-time, permanent position.


Responsibilities



  • Implement new features that help users to successfully share their business, projects and ideas. That’s what they love about us!

  • Full stack application development including python backend, frontend, configuration management, and operation tasks

  • Engage with other product engineering teams and continue to improve our users’ experience

  • Build APIs for our mobile and web clients

  • Envision architectural changes that help us splitting up core components into services

  • Enrich the Jimdo product by integrating external services

  • Help other teams with knowledge, skills, and expertise



Requirements



  • Expert knowledge developing and debugging in a backend programming language Python (Django Framework)

  • Expert knowledge in implementing payment providers and payment methods

  • 5+ years of web programming experience

  • Broad skillset from configuration management to software development

  • Experience developing and operating large-scale distributed systems, client-server architectures and microservices

  • Experience building modern APIs for different clients

  • Experience in significant cross-functional engineering efforts across multiple teams



Nice to have



  • Experience with AWS or similar cloud computing providers

  • Experience working with continuous delivery systems

  • Experience in application performance optimization / profiling

  • Experience with Thrift or Protobuf



Abilities



  • Strong communication skills for finding simple and solid solutions

  • Positive attitude towards problem solving

  • Obsession with automation and simplicity

  • Ability to break complex problems down into manageable chunks

  • Drive to get things done

  • Solid spoken and written English communication skills

item.title: Ecommerce Engineer at PropertyGuru Pte Ltd (Singapore)
item.description:
We are looking for a software engineer with a strong product and technical vision that is excited about being part of one of the fastest growing technology companies in Southeast Asia. 
 
You will work closely with the best and brightest Product and Engineering team, supporting each other in achieving the team goals, to build an integrated marketing and e-commerce solution to boost sales in our different Southeast Asia markets. The team works with a high degree of responsibility, coupled with a high degree of freedom of how to get the job done.

Ready for some challenging and fun work? Join the Guru family who pushes beyond good in everything we do, learn and grow together. Last but not least, have fun and celebrate success achieved. 
 
Unsure if you are a perfect fit for the role? Apply nonetheless! You might be a potential match for other roles across the organization!


Requirements:



  • Bachelor in Computer science, engineering or equivalent work experience 5+ years experience in software development or systems integration, with good knowledge of PHP, Java or NodeJS

  • Good working knowledge of SQL, data modeling and Web development technologies

  • Possess knowledge in developing custom API for 3rd part integration and good understanding of microservices architectures

  • Experience in custom or open source e-commerce development (Magento, Prestashop etc)

  • Good knowledge of at least one payment gateway

  • Excellent interpersonal skills working in a team environment


Good to have:



  • Experience in development in a serverless architecture, like AWS Lambda

  • Experience with CRM systems (commercial like Salesforce or custom developed)

  • Familiarity with Symfony or other PHP frameworks

  • Good understanding of ERPs such as Netsuite (highly preferred), SAP, JD Edwards, Oracle, MS Navision

  • Comfortable working within an Agile/ Scrum environment

item.title: Senior System Administrator / Cloud Engineer at trivago (Dsseldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
Do you want to join a team of entrepreneurs from over 50 different nationalities? To work in an environment powered by passion where no two days are the same?
At trivago we use the latest innovative technologies to empower our users to find their ideal hotel 100 times a second, across 55 different locales world-wide and in 33 different languages.


Our Data Centre Operations team is seeking a technology guru to help us maintain our multi-datacentre network infrastructure. Are you ready to tackle some of the leading software and system issues to ensure a smooth user-experience for our 120 million monthly users? In this critical position you will tap into your in-depth knowledge of both networking best practices and security flaws to protect trivago against attack and vulnerabilities. You’ll be working with top notch network equipment, systems and tools to keep our labs humming smoothly at all times. We’re a company that will let you work when, how and with whatever PC or Mac you choose. If you’ve got what it takes to tackle complex software and system issues and you have the drive to take trivago to the next level then we look forward to hearing from you!


What you'll do:



  • You monitor and maintain our multi datacentre network infrastructure to optimize and increase speed and ensure high-availability.

  • You monitor the workload of critical systems and predict necessary changes to cope with future workload. We’re growing, and growing fast, so we want you to make sure our systems and infrastructure stay at the the cutting-edge of computer technology.

  • You challenge the status quo and always try to think ahead to make sure our systems stay in good health.

  • Use your know-how and logical thinking to troubleshoot reasons for critical malfunctions in our complex technical environment.

  • Reduce manual work by setting up automated processes for monitoring, error detection and system setup.

  • You consult tech teams within trivago, and together setup "state of the art“ infrastructure.

  • You make sure our applications in AWS receive the love and care that they deserve.

  • You work with developers and business owners to find the best possible solution to their business needs.

  • Together with various teams you make sure our cloud projects are set up in a scaleable and cost efficient way.


Skills & Requirements


What you'll definitely need:



  • Bachelor or apprenticeship in Computer Science or equivalent experience. At least 5 years experience in organisations with large infrastructure deployments – web environment preferred.

  • Large-scale operational knowledge of AWS or GoogleCloud.

  • Hands-on experience working with and troubleshooting of network related issues using Linux or Unix (FreeBSD) based tools.

  • Advanced know-how of monitoring systems (Nagios/Incinga/Cacti) and Apache httpd webserver.

  • Solid scripting skills.

  • Customer oriented professional with good mediation skills.

  • Fluency in English (our company language).

  • Razor-sharp analytical abilities, coupled with a strong sense of responsibility, urgency, and drive.


Life at trivago is...



  • The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.

  • The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.

  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.

  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular free code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • Living in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highest quality of life in the world for expats.


Start date:




  • As soon as possible.




Additional information:



  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English. Please also note that all applications must be made online. We do not accept physical applications and any documents sent to us will not be returned.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Android) at mySugr GmbH (Wien, sterreich)
item.description:
SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER (ANDROID)


Full-time (Vienna)


Diabetes is a pesky monster. And that’s putting it mildly. However, if you’re serious about helping us face it head on, come join us.


Most of our customers live with type 1 diabetes, an incurable autoimmune disease. Everyday life with diabetes is often tedious and exhausting - and that’s exactly what we work on at mySugr; minimizing daily struggles and challenges in diabetes management. True to our motto "Make diabetes suck less", we develop award-winning apps and work with health insurance companies and industry partners to make life with diabetes a bit better. Learn more through our recent TV commercial.


Here's what we’re looking for:



  • You enjoy developing beautiful, responsive, fast Android applications

  • You have a passion for clean code and solid, future-proof architectures

  • You are familiar with the Android platform, Material Design, and test automation

  • You enjoy improving on existing code, making it ready for extensions

  • You love to work in an interdisciplinary teams

  • You are able to wear many hats and learn new technologies quickly


What to expect:



  • Passionate people building meaningful, global products

  • A candid environment where people love to learn

  • A competitive annual gross salary of minimum EUR 46k plus variable

  • Additional social benefits (fitness, public transport,...)


Interested? Great. We’d like to hear from you! Send your information and resume to jobs@mysugr.com! Impress us!

item.title: Support Engineer at Hazelcast () (allows remote)
item.description:
As a Support Engineer, you will work with Software Engineers and Operations staff at leading organizations, both small and large, around the globe. You are someone with a software engineering and/or systems administration background that is looking for a new challenge. You have a strong aptitude for troubleshooting. You will be investigating complex issues that may never have been seen before. Digging into source code or evaluating a network stack to understand how things work, or why they don't, sounds fun to you.


Above all, you are an enthusiastic team player who can communicate well, and is eager to learn and help others.


We are specifically looking for people who live in the US Mountain and Pacific time zones. This is a remote position. No matter where you work, you'll have opportunities to travel, meet, and work with some of the brightest minds in cloud and distributed computing.



Responsibilities:



  • Become an expert on our products.

  • Work directly with customers and the community to solve development & operational issues.

  • Research, identify, reproduce and document bugs.

  • Think outside your role.


    • Invent new ways to improve our company and products.


  • Write blog posts, speak at user groups/conferences, help with benchmarks, and other project work.


Skills & Requirements


This is a demanding role. To be successful you should:



  • Enjoy helping people.

  • Handle stressful situations with grace.

  • Demonstrate proficiency in Java

    • Spring, Hibernate, network programming, and concurrency.



  • Have production experience in Windows and/or *NIX system administration.

  • Be able to troubleshoot and tune for performance (TCP/IP, Multicast, JVM Garbage Collection)

  • Communicate complex ideas with simplicity and clarity.


Bonus Points



  • Experience with Hazelcast.

  • Experience with cloud deployment (Amazon, Azure, Google, etc).

  • Experience with large production deployments.

  • Experience with VM and containerization technologies.

  • Experience with distributed caching, scalability and high availability systems.

  • Involvement with other Open Source projects

  • Experience with data-storage (SQL, NoSQL, Graph, “big-data”).

item.title: Full Stack Developer at Lingoda GmbH () (allows remote)
item.description:
Who are we looking for?


We are looking for an outstanding Full Stack Developer to be part of our growing team. The position is full time working remotely from home. Do you have experience in the following?


Skills & Requirements



  • You love developing software and you love to learn every day

  • You have at least 3 years of solid experience creating web applications using backend and frontend technologies like PHP, Symfony, AngularJS, Typescript / ES6, ReactJS)

  • None of these technologies should leave you clueless: Node.js, RESTful, Angular, webpack, WebRTC, Redux

  • You know your way around common web technologies like HTML5, CSS (LESS/SASS/PostCSS),

  • You know how to use rebase, merge and fork in Git

  • You are passionate about code quality. Writing tests and documentation belong to your natural workflow

  • You have experience working in an agile team using SCRUM, Kanban or similar methodologies

  • A history of active contributions to open source projects is a plus.



What do we offer?



  • A dynamic and highly motivated team and flat hierarchies

  • Use of Open Source technologies (all of our team members are regular contributors to the Open Source community)

  • The ability to choose your OS (Linux, OS X) and IDE (Eclipse, IntelliJ, NetBeans, …)

  • Powerful hardware system environment (16 GB of memory, SSD hard drive, 2x 24″ monitor)

  • Regular technical exchange with other Berlin-based startups


How to apply?


Send your application, including CV and references of previous projects to stefan.ludwig@lingoda.com

item.title: Data Scientist at Haraj (Riyadh, Saudi Arabia)
item.description:
We are looking for Data Scientist; Data Analyst; to join our team. The job responsibilities will be as follows:




  •  Research, design, and implement algorithms to improve our local search engine.

  •  Design and implement personalized recommendations based on users' detected behavior.

  •  Perform data wrangling to extract exploratory insights.

  •  Analyze and extract relevant information from large datasets to make data driven decisions.

  •  Use data to predict future patterns and user behavior. 

  •  Design and experiment machine learning in deep learning models to predict future outcomes and meet our needs.



Requirements:



  •  Bachelor Degree in Computer Science/Statistics/Math or Engineering.

  •  Deep understanding and experience of NLP and Machine Learning.

  •  Strong knowledge of MySQL and ElasticSearch.

  •  Strong software development skills in R or Python.

  •  Experience in solving a real world problem.

  •  Proficiency in Arabic & English with excellent communication skills.

  •  Good working experience of Linux OS.

item.title: Technical Solutions Engineer @ Backbase at Backbase (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Backbase is expanding. There is no doubt that we have the best possible solution in our niche market. But if you think that winning over clients comes by itself, think again. It’s a tough process.


As a Technical Solutions Engineer, it is your core responsibility, together with your team, to support the technical evaluation process and to deliver remarkable results on a continuous basis. Your job is to take away all possible concerns that may exist with the prospect.


Whether you talk to the board of directors, the marketing team or the IT department; you turn every red light green. You like, no… You love to travel and stay abroad. We work on a global scale and our team operates without regions. So if you don’t already have a frequent flyer status, you will do so within a year.


What will you be doing?


You will join our tightly knit team where you will support prospects in their exploration of Backbase products. As an expert technician you navigate through the full sales cycle: from doing technology deep dives and creating code for the proof of concept to leading workshops and generating feedback. Your performance blows each prospect off its feet.


When we mention a getting-things-done mentality, you immediately recognise yourself. Not only do you feel comfortable talking business, you’re also a congenial companion during coffee breaks. And let’s not forget your organising skills. Those skills, by the way, also come in handy when planning leisure time. Because if we send you to the other end of the world and overload you with work, we do understand that you might want to loosen up afterwards and explore the surroundings.


Who are you?




  • You mastered in IT




  • A can-do mentality is of more importance than many years of experience




  • You think and act like an entrepreneur; experience in running your own business will be a big plus




  • You are a strong presenter; you know how to “own the room”




  • You definitely over deliver, without under promising




  • You have the courage to learn and to share your learning process with us




  • You have strong hands-on programming skills – You like to create smart code;




  • We won’t have to tell you anything about enterprise software architectures nor web technologies, you have your expert knowledge up to date




  • You are not afraid of the following Stack: Java, HTML, CSS, Javascript (Angular JS), iOS & Android




  • You don’t mind discovering the world by travelling 30% - 50% of your time, meaning a 2-week trip every other month

item.title: Research Scientist Control and optimization for power systems at Siemens - USA (Princeton, NJ)
item.description:
Here’s the right opportunity for You!

Join our research group Autonomous Systems located in Princeton, NJ, and investigate new control and optimization functional building blocks for power systems. We support our business units from the early phase of identifying opportunities through designing algorithms and building prototypes for customer solutions up to validating these solutions in the field. Our close contact to different business units enables the opportunity to participate in projects in all areas of power system automation, power generation, renewables integration etc., making for an exciting and challenging environment. Have a look at our recent Picture of the Future publications on Energy Systemsto get an overview of Siemens’ recent developments in this area.


What are your responsibilities?


  • You develop innovative control and optimization concepts and solutions for power systems.


  • You implement these concepts and solutions in quick prototypes, feasibility studies, technical specifications, and eventually into larger systems and product components.


  • You test and validate these solutions in laboratory and field tests.


  • You identify, define, acquire and lead industrial R&D projects.


  • You work with our business units to understand algorithm requirements and deliver solutions.


  • You protect the results of your work through patent applications and publish protected results at conferences or in top journals.



What skills are needed to qualify for this job?


  • Ph.D. in Engineering with focus on automatic control/optimization or power systems required; post-PhD experience in the same field, e.g. in an industrial research center or a national lab is a plus.


  • Strong theoretical background and practical experience in different advanced automatic control and optimization methods like MPC, robust and optimal control, nonlinear and mixed-integer optimization, e.g. proven through at least 3 years research in this field.


  • Good knowledge of power system modeling and control like detailed dynamic modeling and simulation (RMS/EMT), optimal power flow, unit commitment, e.g. proven through at least 3 years research in this field.


  • Proven ability to develop new research ideas as demonstrated by a strong publication record and early developments to the level of a working system prototypes as well as involvement in writing funding proposals for research grants.


  • Good knowledge of tools and languages typically used to support simulation, controller design, and optimization (incl. C/C++, MATLAB, Simulink, power system simulation software).


  • Real world problem solving and a hands-on, can-do mentality.


  • Excellent interpersonal and communication (verbal & written) skills in English required.


  • Flexibility and adaptability to work in a growing, dynamic, interdisciplinary team of experts.


  • Successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. US Export Control laws and applicable regulations govern the distribution of strategically important technology, services and information to foreign nationals and foreign countries. Siemens may require candidates under consideration for employment opportunities to submit information regarding citizenship status to allow the organization to comply with specific US Export Control laws and regulations. Additional information on the US Export Control laws & regulations can be found on http://www.bis.doc.gov/index.php/policy-guidance/deemed-exports/deemed-exports-faqs?view=category&id=33#







Equal Employment Opportunity Statement 
Siemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, protected veteran or military status, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.


EEO is the Law 
Applicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination. To learn more, Click here.


Pay Transparency Non-Discrimination Provision 
Siemens follows Executive Order 11246, including the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision. To learn more, Click here.

item.title: Senior-Level Software Engineer - Web (Biz Growth Team) at Yelp (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
Our Hamburg office is located in the heart of the city and brings with it the unique advantages of booming international teams, all of whom share the same floor and are brought together by the same goal: empowering Yelp’s business products.

The Biz Growth team continuously improves the claiming and onboarding experience for new business owners on both the web and mobile platforms. We move fast, and on our team you’ll never have an ordinary day, constantly shifting between experimenting, iterating, and implementing new features. If you're passionate about logging, metrics, and A/B testing, then the Biz Growth team is the perfect home for you!


Skills & Requirements


What You Will Do:



  • Design and document new systems

  • Lead cross-platform projects

  • Run experiments and analyze the resulting data

  • Constantly improve the monitoring and alerting of our services

  • Mentor interns or newly-hired engineers

  • Continue to learn, grow, and help us tackle brand new challenges


Technologies We Use:



  • Python and popular Python libraries/ tools (e.g., SQLAlchemy, Pylint, tox, PyPI)

  • Javascript, jQuery, Google Closure

  • Testing: testify, py.test, Selenium WebDriver

  • API: Swagger, Zipkin

  • Monitoring: Sensu, SignalFX, Splunk

  • DB: MySQL, Cassandra


We Are Looking For:



  • A strong team player who is always looking to improve their skills

  • In-depth command of your favorite scripting and/or programming language

  • Deep understanding of at least one popular server-side MVC framework (Django, Twisted, Rails, Pyramid, CodeIgniter, Play, etc.)

  • Understanding of web security best practices

  • Comfortable working in a Unix environment

  • Bonus: Participation in FOSS and interest in public speaking


What We Offer:



  • Full responsibility for projects from day one, an awesome team, and a dynamic work environment

  • Competitive salary, equity in the company, and an optional employee stock purchase program

  • Regular 2-day Hackathons and weekly learning groups, always with interesting topics

  • Flexible working hours and meeting-free Thursdays

  • Complimentary German lessons for international employees

  • Subsidization of your public transportation card and €50 per month toward any exercise of your choice

  • Central location, a fully stocked kitchen, team events, happy hours, foosball, and more!

item.title: Softwareentwickler (m/w) at synG4 GmbH (Hetzles, Germany)
item.description:
Softwareentwickler (m/w)

ber uns

Seit 2001 stehen wir unseren Kunden mit Rat und Tat rund um den Softwaretestprozess zur Seite. Wir finden eine Lsung fr Sie, genau dort wo Sie Untersttzung bentigen!

Als reines Familienunternehmen mit vier Angestellten gegrndet, vergrerte sich mit wachsendem Erfolg auch unsere Unternehmensfamilie. Inzwischen zhlt synG4 ber 80 feste und freie Mitarbeiter. Das familire Arbeitsklima konnten wir beibehalten, was uns besonders stolz macht.



Wir reden nicht nur ber ein familires und kameradschaftliches Klima am Arbeitsplatz, wir gestalten es auch!, meint Geschftsfhrerin Tanja Redel. Mit modernen und freundlichen Arbeitspltzen und gut funktionierenden Teams schaffen wir die entsprechenden Rahmenbedingungen. Ein kameradschaftliches Miteinander untersttzen wir durch transparente Strukturen, flache Hierarchien und kurze Entscheidungswege.
Auerhalb des Arbeitsalltages freuen wir uns auf gemeinsame Unternehmungen. Unsere Weihnachtsfeier hat einen ebenso festen Platz im Jahresplan wie ein gemeinsames Skiwochenende. Uns verbindet nicht nur die tgliche Arbeit miteinander, sondern hufig auch eine private Freundschaft untereinander!



Du bist kreativ, flexibel und willst Teil eines produktiven Teams sein?
Dann haben wir genau das Richtige fr dich!


Folgende Aufgaben warten auf dich

Du bertst und untersttzt unseren Kunden (Siemens Healthcare in Forchheim) bei der Umsetzung eines anspruchsvollen Toolsoftware-Projektes. Hierbei arbeitest du in allen Phasen der Softwarenentwicklung von der Spezifikation ber die Entwicklung bis hin zur Dokumentation und Test in unserem Team mit. Speziell liegt deine Verantwortung in einem Team Foundation Server-Projekt und beinhaltet Aufgaben wie die Erstellung von Anwendungen, das Erweitern von Installationen, Analyse von funktionalen und technischen Anforderungen und die Erstellung der dazugehrigen Fachkonzepte und Spezifikationen.


Mit diesem Profil begeistert du uns

  • Informatikstudium oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung

  • Programmiersprachen und Frameworks:


    • C#, Microsoft .net

    • Javascript (ECMAScript 6), Typescript, CSS, HTML


  • Praktische Erfahrung im Customizing aktueller TFS Versionen, idealer Weise webbasierter Extensions & Widgets (von Vorteil)


Du findest uns interessant?
Dann schicke uns deine Bewerbungsunterlagen zu!
Am besten per Mail an bewerbung@syng4.de
oder an unsere Postadresse:



synG4 GmbH
z.Hd. Herr Andreas Mayer|Schwabachstr. 3e|91077 Neunkirchen
www.syng4.de


Wir freuen uns.

item.title: Senior Python Engineer (Backend / Data Driven/ Zalon) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Zalon is the successful story of curating and delivering complete outfits for our customers. Part of Europe's Leading Technology Fashion Platform, we live and breathe excellent software engineering.

As part of our recruitment ramp-up for a designated Data Science & Research Engineering team, you, as a Python Backend Engineer will bring the engineering perspective into our products. Expect a role where you will have immediate impact as we iterate fast and experiment a lot, welcoming your innovative engineering ideas to the table. The teams work with full end-to-end responsibility on solving the challenges at hand - starting with ideating over prototyping and user testing to bringing features live and checking their performance.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR



  • Python skills (deep understanding of language internals, profiling, best practices, eg. Pandas, Scikit-learn). Java or Scala experience (or an interest) would also be appreciated.



  • Solid understanding of data structures, coding standards, best practices, software design, architecture.

  • Interest in setting up monitoring, tracking and reporting, designing and implementing pipelines for training and deploying new models and a real curiosity around "how algorithms work".

  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs, particularly using cloud infrastructure such as AWS. Knowledge of microservice architecture and distributed systems is also advantageous.

  • At least 3 years of professional programming experience in a commercial environment, backed-up by a Masters or Bachelor Degree in a relevant subject or additional working experience.

  • English language fluency


YOUR ROLE



  • You will communicate with the data scientists (or machine learning experts or research engineers) and exchange ideas about solutions to the existent and potential problems. You will do this by identifying the right components and putting them together in the correct manner.

  • You will work closely with product owners and the business counterparts, acting as a sparring partner on technical solutions to our immediate challenges.

  • You will be part of a team where Code Quality, Code Reviews, Test Coverage, etc. are kept at very high standards, therefore you should also be positive and firm in your attitude towards them.

  • You design, develop, deploy, operate and improve important software solutions, that your peers praise for its elegance and code readability.

  • You will be accountable for all aspects of your work as you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).

  • You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from ideation over design to implementation and maintenance.


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US



  • Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, Hack weeks, parties and events.

  • Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.

  • Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at related Conferences and Meetups, and encouragement to publish your work.

  • Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours. Zalon is a 2.5-year-old start-up backed up by Zalando SE, therefore you can expect that your work will have immediate impact and you will participate in developing significant improvements.

item.title: Fellowship seeks Magical Backend Developer (JVM stack) at IDT Messaging (Helsingfors, Finland)
item.description:
Our owl apparently failed to find you, this leaves us with few ways to contact you. Hopefully, we’ve pointed the tractor beam in the right direction. This is the job you are looking for…


A little about us:


We have The Core. The Core allows you to message, call and play with your friends. And not only that, our technology turns every message into a portal to related information. But one does not simply find the relevant words in a message, for that, you need an AI, an AI so advanced, knowing how to administer the Turing test is considered a plus for a role at IDT Messaging.


About you:


We’re looking for a Magical Backend Developer skilled in Java/Kotlin or other JVM languages who has a high initiative stat and can add at least +5 intellect to our team, and the force strong in you must be.


You will join the team that works on the The Core, our state of the art micro-services based messaging backend, in-chat app framework, integrate with AI components as well as other services. (Not to mention some truly groundbreaking things we are building in our dungeon. The code must flow.)


You:



  • Are a kickass Java and/or Kotlin developer/wizzard.

  • Have built highly scalable / available backends before.

  • Know your way around JVM.

  • Are capable of growing your own potatoes on Mars.

  • Do not sparkle.

  • Know where your towel is at all times.

  • Have passed the Kobayashi Maru and Voight-Kampff tests.

  • Must know the airspeed velocity of an unladen swallow.

  • Must not be a red-shirt, we’d prefer you come back from lunch in one piece.


What we can provide:



  • Elevenses.

  • Ample gold.

  • A work environment that could, at a push, be considered awesome (at very least, great).

  • Exhilarating chat sessions with Kabouter the AI bot.

  • Answer to the question of life, the universe, and everything.


If you close this ad, nothing will change, if you click the apply button, you stay in wonderland and see how deep the rabbit hole goes.


Please send us your CV and tell us how many of the sci-fi & fantasy references you caught  (and a little about yourself and why you’re applying) in the form below! We promise HAL will behave.


Apply soon, winter has come!


P.S. We’re not all geeks, just the people writing this ad. Geekiness is about passion and that we do all have. We want to change the world with our services and if that sounds like something you’d like to do, get in touch.


Our Messaging app is available in an app-store near you, with group conversations, media sharing, cloud storage, and messaging micro-services. Just search for Presto Messaging!

item.title: Senior Node.js developer (online travel) at FindHotel (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a Senior Node.js Developer at FindHotel, you will help to develop from the ground up a high-performance data platform that powers the website FindHotel, scaling up web traffic from 2M+ visitors to 10M+ by the end of the year.




What you tell your friends you do


"I am a great backend developer who can make code run safely yet fast as lightning!"




What you will really be doing



  • Building a high-performance data platform, dealing with the data for millions of hotels. Retrieving and handling data from multiple sources;

  • Developing our own APIs and deploy them as independent services;

  • Building the right suite of monitoring and alerting system, in order to have both the helicopter view and the magnifying glass at hand whenever needed;

  • Improving the code base, architecture, infrastructure, and overall quality of our product, in order to deliver a great experience to each and every one of our users.


How will you be doing this?



  • You are an experienced backend developer in a diverse team of talented experts, and you enjoy working on a product delivering quality code while meeting ambitious deadlines;

  • You choose the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you. We're always open to re-evaluating choices that were made in the past: there is always a budget for good ideas;

  • You understand speed is a feature: you love benchmarking and experimenting with different technologies to figure out new ways of improving your code over time.


What we worked on last quarter



  • Created a fast RESTApi, build on AWS Lambda's to serve the results of our machine learning models

  • We built a scalable infrastructure in the cloud, based on AWS, Docker, and Continuous Deployment, that serves on average 11M+ requests per day.


What a day in the office might look like


In the morning, after the daily stand-up, you pair program with a fellow developer to improve the performance of an API call which is not as fast as it could be. After lunch, you provide some feedback on the quality of a couple PRs from your teammates. Then you implement a new feature from the backlog or tackle an annoying technical debt issue that you've been keeping an eye on for a while.



Why join now?



  • We have successfully built the foundation of a great product, which will evolve in time and compete with the big players of the travel industry. By joining the team now, you will have the chance to have a strong impact on how we grow our tech stacks and the way approach work.

  • We are looking to grow traffic from 2M monthly visitors to 10M+ by the end of 2017. This is the perfect time to become part of the team working on the core behind our product, tackling exciting challenges around scalability and performance.

  • We are a company that is growing fast, hiring talent across many different areas of expertise (development, data science, data analysis, marketing, UX). Each team collaborates with the others on a lot of different tasks, making every day the day when you learn something new.

  • You will have fun writing code for existing and new applications, integrating them with internal and external systems, with room to explore new technologies and architectures!



Requirements



What we're looking for



  • 7+ years of professional experience in data heavy backend development

  • Relevant professional experience with Node.js for at least 3 years.

  • Relevant professional experience with other languages, such as Python, Scala, Java, C#, SQL, Go, Elixir

  • A solid understanding of the whole life cycle of (web) applications  including testing, deploying, monitoring

  • Experience with development and integration of SQL databases, ETL, message queues, REST APIs, third party integrations

  • Experience running high-traffic websites and strong focus on performance optimisation, scalability, and reliability

  • Professional Experience in working with AWS (EC2, ECS, RDS)



  • Bonus points if you have professional experience with other AWS services such as Lambda, Data Pipeline, Kinesis, Cloudformation

  • Bonus points if you have professional experience with Docker, Terraform


What we offer



  • The opportunity to work in a diverse international team within a profitable company with a startup mindset

  • An agile environment where communication and initiative is valued and cherished

  • Many chances to develop yourself, including access to courses and conferences

  • No nonsense! We’re proud of our flat hierarchy and short, democratic decision paths

  • A fun work environment at a great office in the city center of Amsterdam



Tip: read some of our blog posts before applying and have a look at our Github profile to find out what we are working on!

item.title: Infrastructure Engineer at Auth0 () (allows remote)
item.description:
Auth0 is looking for Infrastructure Engineers to help ensure that our services stay up and running while continuing to rapidly ship software that our customers love. An Infrastructure Engineer is a specialist in creating, deploying and running infrastructure and have a great knowledge of networking, the linux kernel and systems scaling.


We are looking for people that have a passion for building robust infrastructure components that others can reuse and have a track record of working with infrastructure at world scale.


Responsibilities



  • Manage our infrastructure and provide alerting for teams to detect common problems

  • Collaborate with development teams to introduce and test updated infrastructure components to be delivered as a service on AWS, using tools and technologies like TerraForm, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, and more

  • Design and develop the backup and restore procedures for storage services

  • Respond to on-call pages caused by failures related to the infrastructure services they own


Skills & Requirements



  • In-depth knowledge of Linux internals

  • Understanding of config management and immutable infrastructure (SaltStack experience preferred)

  • Significant scripting expertise (e.g., with Python, Node.js, Shell Script, etc.)

  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills

item.title: Researcher Internship - Finance, Data Science and Machine Learning at Rakuten (Setagaya, Japan)
item.description:
Position Summary:


Rakuten Institute of Technology (RIT) creates a vision anticipating trends of the world centering on the Internet in the near future, provides critical insights and develops exciting, new business services by focusing on new and innovative technologies.


We are looking for passionate R&D members to develop new technology solutions for improving and expanding Rakuten's business.  Successful candidates will also demonstrate enthusiasm and possess a commendable work ethic, team spirit, and communication skills.



  • Research and core technology development based on analysis of the data generated everyday across the Rakuten group.

  • In this position, you are expected to leverage your expertise in data analysis and machine learning to provide cutting edge solutions supporting the wide range of Rakuten businesses with a focus on financial services.


Minimum Qualifications:



  • Master's or Ph.D. student in a quantitative field such as computer science, mathematics, physics, electrical engineering or equivalent.

  • Experience or knowledge of statistics, data mining, machine learning, recommended systems or developing and analyzing predictive models.

  • Experience with general-purpose programming languages such as Python or C++.

  • Experience working in Unix/Linux environments.

  • Interest in the financial services industry.


Preferred Qualifications:



  • Strong research and analytical skills.

  • Good data visualization and presentation skills.

  • Substantial experience in software development with Python and its scientific stack.

  • Working knowledge of SQL and databases such as PostgreSQL.

  • Experience in the financial services industry or knowledge of financial concepts.


Other Requirements  
English Requirement:Business Level
Japanese Requirement:Business Level
You are currently university student 
You will graduate between 2018 December ~ 2019 December

item.title: IT Expert- DevOps Engineer at Younicos AG (Berlin, Deutschland)

You are passionate about working IT solutions?


You like to improve and automate test and deployment configuration?


You are a team player and keen getting things to work?


Then this job is for you


As IT expert at Younicos you will support our development team with your knowledge and experience by managing the development and productive environments. Together with the test and deployment team you will improve the test automation infrastructure and configuration management to build a CI/CD pipeline. You will support the development team to build and improve the high availability of our systems.


Your profile

  • Expert in Linux and virtualization.

  • Docker and orchestration tools, e.g. Kubernetes

  • System management and configuration tools, e.g. Ansible

  • Experience with network security is a plus

  • Good scripting skills, e.g. shell scrips, Python

  • Familiar with database, e.g. MySQL and Java, C++, PHP development and build tools like Maven, SCons is a plus

  • A strong focus on teamwork, solution oriented and a commitment to always let the best idea win

  • Open to new technologies

  • A will to continually improve your skills

Our offer



  • The opportunity to build the technology facilitating higher renewable energy shares

  • Motivated, passionate colleagues who love to get things done

  • Open discussion culture and the opportunity to shape every aspect of your work

  • Participation on trainings, meetings, conferences, etc.

  • Bright, spacious and comfortable offices in the lovely city of Berlin

Do you want to make the world a more sustainable place?


Please send your extensive CV, a cover letter as well as copies of degrees and work references via email to Anja Kubitz: jobs.europe@younicos.com.

item.title: Software Engineer, Backend - Pricing at Grab (Singapore)
item.description:
Get to know our Team:


Processing millions of bookings a day and billions of traffic data points per month, we are playing a vital role to drive South East Asia forward. While this is all great, we need to ensure that the pricing for the rides are affordable and at the same time, the drivers can earn enough to make a quality living. In this engineering role, you get the opportunity to build and maintain a rock solid system that scales in proportion to Grab’s crazy growth. At the same time, join the endeavor to find the right price for each ride using algorithms, machine learning and common sense.If you think you have what it takes along with the desire to impact lives and transform Southeast Asia, this is your opportunity.



Get to know the Role




  • Define and shape the fundamentals of engineering at Grab




  • Build safe, robust and reliable development resources and elevate the collective level of code quality.




  • Lead the journey towards Continuous Delivery by enabling teams across Grab to test and deploy their code with confidence. You will build frameworks and pipelines that will equip us to achieve CD.





The day-to-day activities:




  •  Engineer software system that solves a business problem, or solves a range of problems.



  • Work on software design / architecture geared towards scale and performance.

  • Participate in code and design reviews to maintain our high development standards.

  • Collaborate with product and experience teams to define and prototype feature specifications.

  • Work closely with infrastructure team in building and scaling backend services as well as performing root cause analysis of system issues.

  • Learn full stack performance tuning and optimization.

  • Debug and modify complex, production software.



The must haves:



  • Min 3 years of professional experience working as a backend engineer.

  • Strong Computer Science fundamentals including data structures and algorithms, databases, operating systems.

  • Familiarity with running large scale web services; understanding of systems internals and networking.

  • Possess excellent communication, no exception on this.

  • You can be a good coder in any language, but must be willing to work on Go (aka Golang)

  • Enthusiasm with economics, big data and machine learning will help, though it’s not a requirement.

item.title: Backend Developer Ruby at Runtastic (Vienna, Austria)
item.description:
YOUR MISSION


Ready to change the world with code?


With hundreds of millions of users we face the challenge of building a top-class backend infrastructure and applications every day. Our main tools of choice to scale our applications are jRuby, Sinatra, Sidekiq, MySQL and MongoDB. In your agile team, your tasks will include:

  • Working together with your team to envision the next great features and applications of Runtastic

With a proactive mindset there will be plenty of opportunities to bring in your own ideas to shape the future of Runtastic.


YOUR PROFILE

  • Knowledge of SQL and familiarity with NoSQL databases such as MongoDB or Cassandra.

  • Ability to speak JSON (preferably JSON API) and REST to clients.

  • Degree in Information Technology, Software Engineering or a related field (higher technical institute or university)

  • Very good German and good English skills OR very good English skills (written and spoken)

item.title: Backend Developer Python/ Python Backend Engineer (m/f) at CeleraOne GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Develop the future of journalism with us!


We are CeleraOne: A team of highly motivated software developers, architects and mathematicians with diverse backgrounds – from machine learning, routing algorithms and signal processing to compiler technology and theoretical mathematics. We combine our knowledge to improve the technology behind CeleraOne’s paywalls, real-time analytics and machine learning models to support newspaper publishers in Europe like Axel Springer or NZZ Mediengruppe.


About the job



  • Design and implementation of our Python-based REST API

  • Working on our storage layer based on MongoDB

  • Working with our technology stack, which includes Pyramid, Colander, Cornice, Nginx, OpenResty, Lua, Buildout and Robot Framework

  • Supporting implementation of specific requirements to the existing Continuous Integration system

  • Working in agile software development teams and participating in SCRUM activities (sprint planning, daily stand-ups, etc.)


Who we’re looking for



  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field

  • At least two years of experience with production systems written in Python

  • Excellent knowledge of Python and HTTP REST APIs

  • Knowledge of relational and NoSQL databases

  • Good command of English (fluent in written and spoken), German is a plus

  • Solution-oriented way of working

  • Initiative and ability to work independently


Why join us?



  • Professional and friendly international team

  • Full transparency of the company's strategy

  • Modern technology stack

  • Central location in Berlin

  • Flexible working hours

  • High-level trainings and language classes

  • Public transport ticket

  • Free coffee, fruits, soft drinks, etc.

  • team events and BBQs


We’re growing and looking for support!


Do you want to grow with us? Please send your application in German or English, including your résumé or CV, certificates, salary expectations and availability.

item.title: Data Scientist (e-Commerce/ Machine Learning/ Python/ Zalon) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Zalon is the successful story of curated shopping experience, part of Zalando SE. Being part of Europe's Leading Technology Fashion Platform, we live and breathe excellent data and software engineering.

As a Senior Data Scientist at Zalon, you will be at the heart of business, data and technology; your work having an immediate impact on customer satisfaction and company profitability.

As part of our empowering technology culture - Radically Agile - you will have the autonomy to develop innovative and complex algorithms for novel use-cases from scratch, while leveraging our rich data, spread across a large range of topics. From data exploration and model building, to algorithm implementation or data engineering, you will have our trust to choose the optimal approach to solve problems. Our wide range of topics to touch upon include several different areas of machine learning and statistics, such as ranking algorithms, supervised and unsupervised learning, Bayesian inference, and any approach that will help you shine in your role.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR



  • A degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics or another similar quantitative field (PhD, M.Sc.).

  • +4 years experience in the analysis of real data with the tools of Machine Learning.

  • Demonstrated expertise and desire to work hands-on in analysing and modelling data sets and an interest in statistics.

  • Ideally, at least three years of professional / academic programming experience in an object-oriented language, Python or Scala.

  • Willingness to work with microservices architecture, distributed systems and RESTful APIs.

  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services.

  • Effective communication skills, ability to understand business requirements and an interest in being a touch point for product, software development and commercial.

  • Deep scepticism, plus the ability to identify and debunk buzzwords, false assumptions and analysis.

  • English language fluency.


YOUR ROLE



  • Research, design, and implement algorithms to improve our various machine learning driven systems.

  • Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability.

  • Be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis, to testing and deployment.

  • Play a critical role in the team as a creative input, working on key results. Your role will span over a number of various topics; therefore, a curious nature would be advantageous.

  • Understand and communicate effectively with internal business customers, partners, and stakeholders.

  • Think in an abstract manner and discover correlations between problems, methodologies, and solutions.

  • Implement possible solutions, evaluate outcomes, and update research direction according to business goals and constraints.

  • Follow a feature through its entire lifetime from problem formulation to solution delivery.


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US

Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, Hack weeks, parties and events.
Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.
Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at data science conferences and Meetups, and encouragement to publish your work.
Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours. Zalon is a 2.5 year old start-up backed up by Zalando SE, therefore you can expect that your work will have immediate impact and you will participate in developing significant improvements.
Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.

item.title: Ruby on Rails Fullstack Engineer at Web Summit (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
About us
Web Summit is a global technology conference company based in Dublin, Ireland. We run a series of international gatherings across the world. Our flagship event is Web Summit, held in Lisbon. In less than 7 years, Web Summit has grown from a small team to a company of over 150 focused on disrupting the conference industry through technology and data science. In 2017, over 100,000 startups, investors, speakers and other attendees gathered at Web Summit events, including Collision in the US and RISE in Hong Kong.

About the team
We’re looking for software engineers of all levels to join our growing engineering team at Web Summit. The engineering team is broken up into smaller cross-functional teams which deliver different business projects; like ad-automation, core data APIs, attendee web applications and internal optimisation tools. 

At Web Summit we believe that the power of data and engineering can be applied to every facet of our events to make the attendee experience excellent, so whatever projects you work on you’ll work closely with our UX engineers, data scientists, event engineers and web developers across all our conferences: Web Summit in Lisbon, RISE in Hong Kong, MoneyConf in Dublin, and Collision in New Orleans.


What you’ll achieve at Web Summit: 



  • You’ll contribute to the architecture and development direction of the team to ensure quality code is written and excellent products are built.

  • You’ll work across the stack (Rails, AngularJS, PostgreSQL, Redis, Linux) to deliver quality, maintainable code in order to power the best conferences in the world.

  • You’ll collaborate and learn with other team members via mentoring, code reviews, and technical talks.

  • You’ll learn about and champion best practices in code, architecture & development process.



Who you are:



  • You have an analytical mind and love solving problems.

  • You care deeply about engineering culture and the quality of products you and your team build.

  • You have experience working in a Kanban or Scrum team driving everyone around you to perform to their utmost.

  • You love the web and new technologies (AWS Lambda looks cool).

  • You’re knowledgeable in a broad spectrum of products and recent developments; making smart choices about technologies to be adopted.



Skills and abilities we’re looking for:



  • Computer related MSc is a plus.

  • Commercial experience in Ruby or other object-orientated language.

  • Solid understanding of *NIX.

  • Solid experience with AWS, GCE or other cloud providers.

  • Experience with Ruby, Node, and/or Python.

  • Experience with AngluarJS, React and/or Ember.

  • Experience with Redis, Postgres or Neo4j.

  • Open source contributions to a project in any language (even English) is a plus.


Be healthy, curious and social:



  • Stay healthy with our fully subsidised healthcare cover.

  • Exercise your mind and body with our free gym membership and yoga.

  • Enjoy your own private garden with orchard, sports equipment, and vegetables right outside your office.

  • Enjoy an unlimited supply of fresh fruit, beverages and cereals.

  • Master new skills from those around you, onsite talks and training initiatives.

  • Become workmates, not just colleagues, with our active social calendar of company celebrations, trips abroad and sports.

  • Have the opportunity to travel to our global events and tap into the best tech network under one roof!

item.title: Experienced Backend Engineer at Citrusbyte () (allows remote)
item.description:
Citrusbyte is a software consultancy that believes in using simple tools to solve problems. We build custom systems for both startups and enterprises - You can see our portfolio for more information about our clients.


We have offices in Los Angeles and New York, but we work remotely with people from all around the world.



Our engineers have experience in a consultative environment, excellent communication skills and a desire to work with talented teams building innovative products. We work closely with our clients, sharing our experience and processes to help them define and create their products.



Most of our projects are written in Ruby, so significant experience in this language is required, but we are looking for polyglot engineers who have a hunger for learning new languages and tools. At Citrusbyte, learning is part of the job, and you should always be able to answer the question: "what have I learned this week?"



We believe that less is more and we vehemently value simplicity. This is reflected in the tools we choose to work with. For this reason we tend to avoid using big frameworks like Ruby on Rails and instead lean towards smaller tools like Sinatra, Roda or Cuba.



We have also done projects in Elixir, Rust, Node.js, Go, Python, Lua, etc. And strive to learn new tools and languages everyday. We believe in always choosing the right tool for the job and we are very open minded about trying different technologies.

item.title: Data Engineer at Jimdo GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are seeking a data engineer who will work with our ambitious team and take our data infrastructure to the next level to help make our customers successful. If you are passionate about empowering people in making data-driven decisions, then we're eager to get to know you.


You have the option to start immediately in our Hamburg office. This is a full-time, permanent position.


Responsibilities



  • Shape and execute a technological mid and long term vision for data engineering with the team

  • Provide data in a reliable and efficient way to our stakeholders by keeping the data warehouse and all incoming and outgoing data streams running and up to date

  • Help improving our product by finding and implementing new ways of using data

  • Research and implement a new and advanced tech stack

  • Build and improve software solutions to support the work of Data Analysts and other teams in their daily work

  • Define processes and contracts for providing clean and unified data


Requirements



  • Degree in Computer Science / Data Engineering or Backend Engineering or equivalent experience

  • At least 2 years of experience in Data Engineering

  • Knowledge and experience in distributed systems (e.g. Kafka) and database architecture

  • Skills in building and maintaining software components and infrastructure, especially AWS Stack

  • Demonstrated ability to process complex information and dependencies in a continuously evolving environment

  • Knowledge of statistics is a big plus


Abilities



  • Strong communication skills for finding simple and solid solutions

  • Positive attitude towards problem solving

  • Focus on automation and simplicity

  • Ability to break complex problems down into manageable chunks

  • Drive to get things done

  • Solid spoken and written English communication skills

item.title: Golang Developer with Russian at SEMrush (Praha 4, Czechia)
item.description:
EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS:

  • Tool development together with team;

WORK EXPERIENCE:

WE OFFER:
