  • Five weeks vacation, Corporate Events, flexible start / end of working hours, Individual budget for personal growth, Mobile Phone, Laptop, Contribution to sports, Education allowance;

  • Corporate training (workshops, seminars, visiting developer conferences);

  • Competitive salary (named individually), excellent co-workers and approachable leadership;

item.title: Senior Full Stack Java Developer M/F at FlixBus (Mnchen, Germany)
item.description:
Who we are


FlixBus is a European long distance mobility provider with headquarters in Munich, Berlin, Milan, Paris and Zagreb. Since 2013, FlixBus has offered a new, convenient and green way to travel which suits every budget. Thanks to a smart business model and innovative technology, the startup has established Europe's largest intercity bus network in less than four years and has no intention of stopping to expand anytime soon.


Your tasks


You work on one of our products as a full-stack developer in a self-organized, cross-functional team. For the frontend you use Javascript frameworks like AngularJS and for the backend you will code in the latest Java technologies, including the Spring ecosystem
You drive the development process using an agile environment with help from experienced agile coaches. As part of your daily work, you work closely with your team members, doing code reviews and defining tests
You deliver new versions of the product frequently using continuous integration and automation


Your Profile


3-5 years professional experience with Java and related technologies (Spring), relational databases and ORM tools
Familiarity with or willing to learn HTML5, CSS and JavaScript including AngularJS
Comfortable in test driven development environments and familiarity with TDD/BDD
An intimate knowledge of modern web-based development techniques – you share your knowledge with the team and support other members
Passionate about learning new tools and keeping yourself up-to-date
Always looking for opportunities to improve the code and the processes
Proactive in the search of solutions and a can do critical analysis
Willingness to take responsibility for the product and technical decisions
Fluent in English; every other European language is a plus


Our offer


Environment: 
- Be part of an incredibly fast growing company with a strong brand and highly motivated and international team 
- Work on your self-defined challenges during our HackRday once a month! 
- Cutting edge technologies, Agile development practices, and product-focused environment dealing with demanding engineering and scaling challenges 
- Training and Conference Opportunities 
- Office location in the heart of Munich 
- Flexible working hours 

Benefits: 
- 12 100% free bus rides per year, 5 50% vouchers for family/friends per year 
- Language course support 
- Relocation support 
- Competitive salary

item.title: Scala /Python Data Engineer M/F Green and smart mobility to experience the world at FlixBus (Mnchen, Germany)
item.description:
We want to grow our successful German business and therefore we are looking for Data Engineers (m/f) to join our team based in Munich, Germany.


Your tasks


You are in charge to build a data platform that manages our companies' data flows
The platform consists of several services (messaging, streaming, persistence, machine learning etc.) that can be used by our product development teams in a self-service way
As a member of one of our product development teams, you build data-intensive applications on top of our data platform, ranging from data ingestion to processing and making use of the data to provide smart services to our customers and internal business users


Your Profile


Several years of experience as Data Engineer or Software Engineer
Solid expertise in at least one programming language (preferably Scala, Java or Python) 
Working experience with structured engineering methods like test first (TDD, BDD)
Experience with big data technologies (Flume, Kafka, Spark, Hadoop, Redshift and NoSQL Databases) and practical experience with Amazon Web Services 
Previous experience in the design and implementation of complex data pipelines (AWS Data Pipeline) and familiarity with machine learning, real-time data processing, data warehousing and data visualization techniques are a plus
Fluent in English; every other European language is a plus

item.title: CAD Designer at EchoStar (Germantown, MD)
item.description:
Hughes is seeking a Designer II to join the Hardware Engineering team in Germantown, MD.

Responsibilities:



  • Creating, designing, and developing detailed electro-mechanical models, drawings, artwork and/or documentation for Mechanical Product Designs of ground based Satellite Communications equipment sold globally.

  • Developing custom mechanical board assemblies, enclosures, rack cabinets, and systems for these products.

  • Participating in the Industrial Design, concept and detailed product design iterations, prototype and production fabrication drawings, and final factory hand off.

  • Working with multi-disciplined engineering teams including Mechanical Engineers, Manufacturing Engineers, Digital EE's, RF EE's, suppliers, and the business office to meet cost, schedule, and performance objectives.



    • Basic Requirement:



  • AA / Technical Degree in a Mechanical Design field or 2+ years of equivalent work experience with various 3D modeling/engineering software's.



    • Preferred Qualifications:



  • Bachelor's Degree in a technical field (Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, etc).

  • 2+ years of experience in 3D CAD Software, Creo 2.0, Windchill 10.0.

  • 2+ years of experience in part/assembly modeling and drawings per ASME Y14.5M.

  • 2+ years of experience with sheet metal part design, die casting part design, plastic injection molded part design, and manufacturing techniques of each along with low and high volume design approaches.

  • 2+ years of experience with cabling design, wiring diagram layouts, label artwork layouts, and designs. 

  • Knowledge of EMI/EMC design considerations and shielding techniques for Electronic Circuit Boards.

  • Knowledge of thermal management solutions & best practices for electronic packaging.

  • Familiarity with Engineering Change Notice (ECN) review/approval.

  • Well spoken, self-starter, with high energy and motivation to succeed.


    • EchoStar Corporation (NASDAQ: SATS) headquartered in Englewood, CO, with additional locations world-wide, is a premier global provider of satellite solutions and technology services. item.title: Oracle DBA at EchoStar (Germantown, MD)
item.description:
EchoStar Corporation has an exciting opening for an IT Administrator to be located at our Hughes headquarters in Germantown, MD.

Responsibilities: 



  • Support HA and DR strategies for the Oracle database environment

  • Support database replication technologies (e.g., GoldenGate, Dataguard)

  • Perform Oracle software/database Installation and Upgrades

  • Implement and Maintain proactive and real time monitoring tools (including but not limited to OEM)

  • Perform backup and recovery activities using RMAN and other tools as required

  • Perform performance tuning of the database and applications

  • Support upgrades and patch management of Oracle environment

  • Support on-call maintenance activities and participate in rotating on-call coverage

  • Monitor and Manage database utilization and performance and tune as appropriate

  • Support O&M activities such as security, reporting, testing, troubleshooting application performance issues, and technical documentation

  • Support Oracle System Administration activities such as user and system profiles, and creating user roles and responsibilities

  • Serve as a database feature subject matter expert to the application teams



Basic Requirements:



  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or other related field

  • 10 or more years of general IT administration or operations experience

  • 3 or more years of experience in Oracle database administration – versions 11g and 12c

  • 3 or more years of experience using Linux and/or Unix, including shell scripting (Korn preferred)



Preferred Qualifications:

  • SQLPlus and PL/SQL development experience

  • Knowledge of computer network and application layer protocols

  • Knowledge of Oracle EBS 11.x middleware (OAS, Concurrent Manager, etc…)

  • Knowledge of ETL and Reporting tools (Informatica, Business Objects, Tableau, Crystal Reports, etc…)

  • Experience with Quest DB Monitoring Tools (Spotlight, Performance Analysis, Foglight)

  • Analytical, detail-oriented, and thorough when working on assigned tasks

  • Ability to quickly identify a problem and find multiple creative solutions

  • Ability to manage multiple projects, activities and tasks simultaneously and work them to completion with little supervision

  • Highly developed written and verbal communication skills to work collaboratively across teams and organizations

  • Ability to work under pressure with many assigned tasks and hard deadlines

  • Passion for customer service, continuous improvement, and technology

  • Working knowledge of Oracle ASM, RAC, Advanced Security, Golden Gate, and Multi-tenant technologies


EchoStar Corporation (NASDAQ: SATS) headquartered in Englewood, CO, with additional locations world-wide, is a premier global provider of satellite solutions and technology services. item.title: Search Engineer/Data Scientist - Discovery at RedMart (Singapore)
item.description:
As one of the fastest growing e-commerce and logistics companies in Asia, RedMart offers an unparalleled scaling a startup experience. Our culture: entrepreneurial, fiercely intelligent, team oriented, deeply creative and whatever you add to it! We’re fanatical about improving our customer experience and providing “wow” customer service. We're interested in talented, creative and passionate people joining our All-Star team who believe in our mission: To save our customers time and money for the important things in life!"


The Discovery team is responsible for driving customers to find and shop for relevant items on RedMart's e-commerce websites and mobile applications. We cover search technologies, catalog management and related services and recommendation services to deliver a great customer experience. We are looking for a Search Engineer/Data Scientist who cares deeply about customers and users to help develop the next generation of search and personalization at RedMart. You will build data mining systems to tackle hard problems in understanding and predicting consumer behavior to offer items to customers which are most relevant to them.


You will work with engineers, product managers, designers and business analysts in Discovery to develop innovative new technologies and data driven features and products. You will also work closely with other Data Scientists to collaborate on projects and share techniques and learnings. If you enjoy working with data to build products and solve hard problems in surprisingly creative ways, this is the role for you.


Qualifications:



  • Deep expertise in search, preferably in e-commerce. Excellent knowledge on improving search incrementally as well as making step-changes such as applying NLP, text mining, etc.



  • Proven track record building robust search systems and achieving strong results

  • Expertise in personalization and recommender systems

  • Able to guide a team of engineers to identify and break down necessary architecture and services to support search and personalization services

  • Able to guide and work well with a team of engineers to implement Machine Learning algorithms and models, as well as implementing necessary software

  • Solid understanding of search metrics and implementing tracking to measure performance

  • Solid understanding of search engines and utilizing features effectively. Familiarity with ElasticSearch is a plus

  • Hands-on experience developing and implementing Machine Learning algorithms and models.Background in Machine Learning,Statistics & Information Retrieval

  • Design, implement, test robust technical solutions that our high traffic site/apps can rely on

  • Write clean code that’s testable, maintainable, solves the right problem and does it well. Code you can be proud of.

  • Phd, Masters, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (computer science, physics, mathematics, bioinformatics, etc.) a plus, but by no means a must

  • Experience programming in functional languages (Scala,Golang,Haskell, Clojure etc.) a plus but not a must

  • Knowledge of scripting languages like  Python/R, familiarity with web frameworks a plus

  • Experience with Java and/or Scala and microservices is a plus

  • Understanding of A/B testing


Desired Skills:



  • Able to be a key influencer in the team’s strategy and contribute significantly to team planning, showing good judgement making technical trade-offs between the team’s short term and long term business needs, and the needs of the company as a whole



  • Strong team player: Superb communication skills, thrives in a collaborative environment and be committed to the success of the team as a whole.



  • Critical thinking: ability to track down complex data and engineering issues, evaluate different algorithmic approaches, and analyze data to solve problems

  • Creativity: you can conceive of new data driven products, features, and technologies

  • Results: you prioritize, focusing on ideas and features that will have significant, measurable impact

  • Planning & estimation: ability to set and meet your own project objectives & milestones

  • Communicate results and progress internally and externally in meetings, presentations, and tech talks

  • Passion for technology. Our developers are always evaluating new tools and technologies that can make us better. What has attracted your interest lately?

item.title: QA Engineer (m/f) at relayr GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Join a team that values automation, low-friction processes and developer driven decisions!


relayr has become Europe's leading platform for the Internet of Things, enabling the interaction between diverse systems, and creating new scenarios in which we interact with the world around us. If you would like to work with a great team and technology to build the infrastructure for the next generation of connected devices...


Then relayr is the right place for you!


We are looking to recruit a diverse group to be able to best handle the diverse problems in the emerging market of Internet of Things.


At Relayr we have an alternative approach to QA!


Our QA engineers are there to set up our processes and educate all involved people so we can guarantee the quality of our product. It is the job of the frontend and backend engineers to actually write the tests and do the testing. In this spirit we are searching for a process-oriented QA engineer to join our team in Berlin, who is focused on setting up the environment and methodology for their teammates to use. You would also be implementing tools for test automation and performance testing using Python, py.test, Gatling, RobotFramework, Selenium and more.


Your responsibilities:



  • Involve developers in your team to continually improve and follow a QA process

  • Driving test automation of our front-end applications

  • Assess and suggest improvements for the testability of our requirements

  • Maintain good coding practices in our existing test project


Your skills:



  • Previous experience as QA Engineer

  • Proven experience establishing test automation practices in frontend projects

  • Experience and understanding of testing backend applications

  • Experience with one or more frontend test automation tools/frameworks (e.g., jest, enzyme, Selenium, Py.Test, RobotFramework )

  • Experience in agile software development (e.g. Scrum, Kanban)

  • Familiar with Python (or some other scripting language (e.g. Ruby))

  • Experience with Jenkins and Docker is an advantage

  • Interested in IoT


We Offer:



  • Flexible office environment 

  • A diverse and friendly team with people from all over the world, speaking 20+ languages, of all ages and parental-status

  • Connecting you with a network of companies and people from around the globe

  • A learning environment where you can extend and build upon your skills and interests, as well as knowledge-sharing and an expanding library of books

  • Opportunities to attend events and conferences pertaining to your discipline

  • Competitive Salary and Stock Options

  • Cool office located in Kreuzberg with a relaxation room, standing-desks, 3D printer and free fruit and drinks

  • Free German courses at intermediate and advanced level (Working language is English)

  • We offer the ability to work in a cutting-edge field with the best people in the IoT industry!


Sounds interesting? Please follow the link to apply for this position: 


https://relayr.bamboohr.co.uk/jobs/view.php?id=37

item.title: Looking for web developers to build a new platform! at International Bike Group (Fietsenwinkel.nl) (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Fietsenwinkel.nl is expanding internationally and is ready to grow even faster and to become even better! For this, we are looking for some highly skilled web developers.


Starting as a Front-end developer at IBG, you will be a part of the process of building our brand new (Magento) platform. This gives you the opportunity to, together with your team, build everything from scratch. Choosing frameworks, building templates. Together with your team, you will be making the decisions on IBG's road to success. Never worked with Magento? No problem! We offer you a complete training to help you to learn everything there is to know, to make sure we have our whole team up and ready to play in important role when it comes to building the new platform.


Being part of a scrum team, you'll dedicate yourself every day to optimization and development of the IBG front-end platform. You will be responsible for designing and building reusable and reliable front-end code. You have an excellent eye for detail, a pragmatic approach and an absolute commitment to making sure features are well implemented and bug-free.



Requirements



This is YOU


• Bachelor or Masters degree in information technology (or similar);  


• 3+ years of experience in a similar function in a fast-paced environment;


• You preferably have experience with Magento (1, 2);


• Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS;


• Basic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS;


• Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery;


• Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them;


• Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git / Mercurial / SVN.


Ready to disturb the market?


Do you want to work at a typical Dutch company with an international spirit? A company where people are super driven, open-minded and obviously, “gezellig” from the moment you walk into the office? Join our team!

item.title: Software Engineer - Distributed Systems at Yelp (London, UK)
item.description:
Yelp’s Infrastructure teams design, implement, and maintain scalable software architectures that are at the heart of our technology. We do everything from building cluster data optimization tools, to designing APIs and developing libraries, and creating speedy and reliable infrastructure that’s easy to use for our relevance/machine learning developers.

Do you dream in service oriented architectures? Do you enjoy profiling and getting the last bits of performance out of complex systems? We do too! You might have used one of our open source projects like mrjob, pyleus, or firefly. Or maybe you’ve read our blog post on how we manage Elasticsearch using Apollo. We help enable hundreds of engineers to safely and quickly deploy their features into production, while serving millions of active Yelp users.

If this sounds like you, join the team that is the glue that connects Yelp’s feature teams to their underlying software infrastructure - in data centers, up in the cloud, or anywhere in between.


Skills & Requirements


What You Will Do:



  • Design, build, and deploy software systems that run 24/7 at increasing scale

  • Develop custom tools and automate processes to find answers to challenging questions and reveal the unknown

  • Write code, document, participate in code reviews, and mentor other engineers

  • Support the software your team works on


What We Are Looking For:



  • Strong knowledge of systems and application design, with an understanding of operational and reliability trade-offs

  • Solid foundation in data structures, algorithms and complexity analysis

  • Ability to work closely with information retrieval/machine learning experts on big-data problems

  • A hunger for tracking down root causes—no matter how deep it takes you—and fixing them in systematic ways

  • Strong understanding of operating systems, file systems and networking

  • Fluency in Python, C, C++, Java, or a similar language

  • Ability to work well with and influence many personality types at all levels of the organization


Pluses:



  • Experience building large-scale distributed systems

  • Experience at a large-scale consumer internet site

  • Experience with configuration management tools (Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Salt, CFEngine), monitoring (Nagios, Sensu, Monit), metrics (Graphite, statsd)

  • Experience with cloud computing services like AWS


What We Offer:



  • Full responsibility for projects from day one, an awesome team, and a dynamic work environment

  • Competitive salary, equity in the company, and an optional employee stock purchase program

  • Generous paid maternity and paternity leave

  • Regular 2-day Hackathons and weekly learning groups, always with interesting topics

  • Flexible working hours and meeting-free Thursdays

  • Subsidization of your public transportation card and £50 per month toward any exercise of your choice

  • Central location, a fully stocked kitchen, team events, happy hours, and more!

item.title: DevOps Engineer - Azure/Docker/Terraform at Clay Solutions (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Clay is looking for a passionate and experienced DevOps engineer that elevates our cloud infrastructure. As a DevOps engineer at Clay you enable developers to deploy new features by programming (automated) tools to help you do their work. You focus on redundancy and scalability. You implement infrastructure as code, moving our architecture towards a microservices based architecture hosted in a containerized way. By this you ensure the developers at Clay to work highly productive.


With our multidisciplinary team, Clay develops all components in-house. Being aware of the development team’s priorities, you provide and support them with state of the art tools to get releases to production in an Agile, efficient and timely fashion. You get the opportunity to use the latest tools such as Docker, Terraform and Ansible. You contribute to innovation and continuous improvement in the way of working in the development team. Joining Clay means creating the best access control solution which allows users from all over the world to unlock their doors, whenever and wherever they are.


Our ideal candidate is a professional with a pro-active approach towards gaining knowledge and a self-improvement attitude. Does all of the above make your heart beat faster? That’s good, because we need you!


Responsibilities



  • Maturing our (Azure) infrastructure

  • Help Clay moving towards microservices hosted in a containerized way

  • Ensure continuous deployment


Skills and expertise



  • Experience with and understanding of cloud hosting, preferably with Azure

  • Experience with containers (Docker)

  • Strong knowledge in the area of Continuous Integration/Delivery with tools such as Jenkins, Ansible, Bitbucket

  • Knowledge of agile development methodologies & tools (Scrum, Kanban, Jira)


We offer 



  • An office in the center of Amsterdam, near Central Station

  • An exciting spot in our team, talented colleagues from all over the world

  • Ongoing motivation to become the best you can be

  • A work hard, play hard environment (we like our Friday afternoon drinks -not mandatory- , play some pool or foosball and enjoy the company of our colleagues in an informal setting)

  • Great office atmosphere with foosball and pool tables, awesome coffee, herbal teas, cookies and fresh fruit

  • Flexible work hours & competitive vacation policy

  • Housing support for expats, help getting your visa and adjust to the Dutch culture

  • Clay is a recognised sponsor (IND procedure)


You bring



  • Working at Clay means becoming a “Brick”, and that means joining an international team of professionals who take initiative, own responsibility and share expertise

  • We expect everyone in our team to bring: Pride in, and vision for your profession Innovative perspectives and ideas

  • A drive to learn and apply insights from previous experience

  • Individuality and eagerness to learn from, and work with others

item.title: Python Engineer at Dubizzle - an OLX company (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
item.description:
What responsibilities will you get when working with us? 


Liaises with the other back end and front end engineers within your product stream, the QA team, the design team and your Tech Team Leads. As a Backend Engineer, you will be responsible for advancing our development stack and ensuring scale as we grow to millions of monthly active users across many countries.


What will you need to be successful in this role?



  • Backend Engineers build and maintain robust APIs - from the service that powers them right down to the line of code that perfects them.

  • They ensure all our services are healthy, monitored, automated, and designed to scale.

  • You'll work closely with other teams from the early stages of design all the way through identifying and resolving production issues.

  • You will support a wide range of products focusing on automation, availability and performance, and above all reliability as well as supporting mobile engineers and business intelligence leading up to, during and after each sprint.

  • You will live true to our ambitions of building an industry leading platform which is relentlessly focussed on innovation.

  • Inside-out knowledge of free and open-source web application frameworks, e.g. Django, Flask and Bottle;

  • In-depth understanding of Python; Meta-classes, decorators, descriptors, list comprehensions and multiple inheritance/mixins should be commonly used paradigms;

  • In-depth knowledge of database management technologies, preferably MySQL, PostgreSQL and understanding of NoSQL databases

  • Understanding of Agile Methodologies such as Kanban, Scrum and XP;

  • Driven to gain insight into different new and old technologies;

  • Experience working on high-traffic and large-scale web products;

  • Experience with web infrastructure, distributed systems, performance analysis, search infrastructure;

  • Must have experienced the whole development cycle from start to finish;

  • Experience with various queuing system/message bus technologies such as RabbitMQ, kafka, etc;

  • Should have good working experience with AWS technologies such as Elastic beanstalk, Elastic cache, RDS, Kinesis, etc;

  • Exposure to deploying and managing Docker containers


Qualifications & specialist skills



  • 3+ years of experience with Python;

  • 3+ years of experience in analysis, design, coding and implementation of next generation web applications in Python and Django;

  • 2+ years of experience in API based architectures (eg SOA, micro-services);

  • 1+ years of experience in AWS technologies;

item.title: Senior React Engineer - 100% Remote - North / South America & Europe at Citrusbyte () (allows remote)
item.description:
Citrusbyte is a software consultancy focused on using modern tools to solve complex problems for global businesses. We are a pioneer in remote workplaces with a diverse team of communicative, experts spread across 20+ countries.


We’re currently seeking a Senior Frontend Engineer with at least 5 years of JavaScript experience, including 2+ years with React The role is full-time, permanent, and 100% remote.


Our ideal candidate has experience building production applications using React and has a thorough understanding of the options and tools available for managing an application’s state and their underlying functional programming concepts.


Above anything else, the ideal candidate will show a passion for programming, learning, and researching new technologies, and adapting to the ever-evolving frontend landscape.


We’re looking for...



  • Minimum of 5 years of experience with JavaScript, including ES6

  • Minimum of 2 years of experience with React

  • Expert in HTML5 and CSS3, including CSS methodologies & build tools

  • Experience with Git and web-based version control platforms like Github

  • Proficient in designing, building, consuming and documenting APIs

  • Excellent communication and time management skills

  • Open-minded, open to receiving and providing constructive feedback, inclusive, collaborative, and always learning


We also like to see...



  • Experience with a variety of frontend frameworks & libraries, devops, and programming languages - Redux Thunk/Saga, Immutable, Docker, AWS, Glamorous, VueJS, TypeScript, Ruby, etc.

  • Active members in the JavaScript community - organizing/attending Meetups, contributing to open-source projects, teaching, blogging and conference appearances

  • Familiarity with design tools - Illustrator, Sketch, Zeplin, Figma, Principle, Framer or similar

  • Entrepreneurial and intrapreneurial - always on the lookout for new opportunities to improve the company externally and internally

  • Experience working in a distributed company


As a Senior React Engineer, you’ll...



  • Work in small teams with a product manager, designers, and other engineers to scope, design, and implement features

  • Provide input on app architecture

  • Cross-collaborate with internal teams and directly with clients

  • Code, create and review PRs on a daily basis

item.title: Software Architect-Image Guided Therapy at Philips North America (Rancho Cordova, CA)
item.description:
Job Description


We welcome you to join Volcano a Philips Company as an Software Architect  in our Rancho Cordova, CAlocation    


In this role, you have the opportunity to Work with cutting edge product line


IGT Devices is part of the Philips Image Guided Therapy (IGT) business group. 


Your responsibilities



  • Creates an environment for fostering “Software excellence” across software teams

  • Creates, defines and owns the Software roadmap  

  • Demonstrates judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results

  • Drives first time right culture by institutionalizing the software excellence practices including but not limited to reviews, root cause analysis, tooling, unit / integration / functional test automation

  • Develops, verifies, and documents software features or systems of the appropriate scope, or participates on a team developing software features

  • Learns and applies company policies and procedures to resolve issue

  • Participates in department design and code reviews

  • Adheres to coding standards and guidelines

  • Executes system and algorithm performance testing

  • Develops domain knowledge based on technical and academic literature, and may contribute to that literature

  • Contributes to feasibility studies for new software products

  • Manage multiple stakeholders needs within and outside business unit


Education



  • Bachelor’s / Master’s degree or equivalent years of experience in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Biomedical Engineering with 12+ years of experience in software development and at least 4+yrs as Architect of a business.  Experience


  • Experience developing C++ applications

  • Experience developing multi-threaded applications

  • Experience with Windows operating system

  • Knowledge of the software development life cycle including requirements, architecture and design, code development, and verification


Specific skills required



  • Demonstrates mastery of OOPS and various design patterns

  • Demonstrates skills with Microsoft Visual C++

  • Qt, Thrust, OpenCL, and Boost skills is plus

  • Learns and uses software engineering tools such as code review applications, configuration management applications, and integrated development environment

  • Demonstrates strong organizational and interpersonal skills working in a cross-functional, regulated environment

  • Good written and verbal communication skills

  • Good team player and has ability to work across teams


Additional skills



  • Leading 30-40 people – not direct reports

  • 12+ years in SW Dev on the job

  • 4+ min as SW Architecture on the job

  • Defining product Architecture

  • C++ / OO / a must

  • Medical Device – preferred.

  • Be able to present/defend SW Architecture to senior mgmt.. 


In return, we offer you


We offer you the opportunity to grow within the organization and Philips – working cross functionally with R & D, on various projects and initiatives to drive our products to our customers and be a part of saving people’s lives every day.


Why should you join Philips?


Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watch this video  Experience Philips Volcano in Virtual Reality


To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.


Philips is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, creed, citizenship, disability, and protected veteran or marital status.


As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants that require accommodation in the job application process may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance

item.title: Data Applications Engineer - AGODA - Real Time Microservices at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
item.description:
Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen.

Our Bangkok team is looking for top quality passionate engineers to build data applications across our business domains.

Why data application in Agoda?

In Agoda we adopt a data-centric approach to solve almost all business problems. We build real-time data applications to answer questions like ranking, recommendation, and how to serve prices most efficiently. Our systems scale across multiple data centres, handling a few hundred thousand requests per second, and respond within a few milliseconds. We also build machine learning jobs to do the heavy crunching.

This is a unique combination of hard-core engineering challenges (scalability, performance, sometimes really low-level tuning) and latest big data technology. This is also the best place to gain exposure to various business domains in the company.



Day to day
  • You'll work with experienced engineers and product owners to identify business opportunities, design and create new data system from scratch, all the way to deploying software
  • Improve scalability, stability, speed of existing applications
  • Debug and fix production problems
  • Collaborate with other team
  • Research new technologies and share across organisations




About you
  • 3+ years of industry experience, preferred at a tech company
  • Experience with at least following languages: Scala, Java, Python, or any functional/OO languages. We code primarily in Scala.
  • Experience building API products (knows protocols/formats/best practices)
  • Experience working in an agile environment using test driven methodologies.




Nice to have
  • Experience building large-scale API products
  • Experience working with big data technologies (eg. Spark, Hadoop)
  • Passionate about functional programming




A few of the technologies we use

Scala, Spark, Akka, Spray, Python, Hadoop, Yarn, MLlib,ElasticSearch, Logstash, Vertica, Grafana.



We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer - Build the smartest way to buy a car (Remote) at Unhaggle Inc. () (allows remote)
item.description:
Unhaggle is currently the #1 web portal in Canada for new car buying. The data we provide powers our own tools and products, including our flagship consumer car buying service at Unhaggle.com and leading automotive portals including Yahoo Autos, MSN Autos, Autofocus, AutoGuide, Globe Drive, and others. We have also recently partnered with auto makers to launch a large eCommerce platform allowing the complete purchase of new cars online.


We are looking for full stack developers with Strong Python skills and experience with web application development. This is a full-time remote position, we accept applications from anywhere in the world. 


We use GitHub to manage tasks and code reviews as well as tools/services like Travis-CI, Docker, New Relic, Sentry, Browserstack, Stripe, Twilio  and Redis. Our dev team is regularly connected in Slack for communication. We are constantly seeking the best tools available for our development team.


You will be primarily involved in the following projects/areas:


* Our new eCommerce platform for new car buying, serving major car brands
* Our web portal unhaggle.com
* Several enterprise SaaS products, some more info here https://www.motoinsight.com


* REST APIs, for integration with different partners
* An internal and innovative SaaS web application we built for industry clients
* Widgets we built for third-party integration, they run in some of the most popular auto websites in Canada.
* Maintenance of our test suite and code base
* Implementation of new features
* We take quality seriously and you should expect to be involved in well written code bases following standards such as PEP-8 and good software engineering practices.


Skills & Requirements


* Strong hands on experience with Python, experience with Django is important, but we might still be willing to consider candidates with strong Python skills and none or little knowledge with Django.
* Strong web development experience: we expect that you know XHTML, CSS and Javascript well. Hands on experience with Javascript frameworks  is a big plus
* Track record of delivering completed projects, preferably web-based
* Good SQL knowledge and databases, PostgreSQL is a plus
* You should be very familiar with Linux
* Experience using version control software, Git is a plus
* Understanding of code best practices and standards. We also expect that you follow PEP-8 style guide and are familiar with tools like Pyflakes and Pylint.
* Experience writing Python test cases is a plus. Prior experience with TDD and/or Selenium is a plus.
* Easy-going personality. You will actively participate in design discussions and code review


This position might grow into a technical lead position. Experience leading development teams is a plus.

item.title: Full-stack Rails Developer at BloodHub () (allows remote)
item.description:
It's no secret that health care providers are under tremendous pressure to be more efficient. At BloodHub, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful difference for blood centers and their customers. You will primarily spend your time creating new features and squashing bugs under reasonable, quarterly deadlines. We encourage sending pull requests to open source projects that our apps rely on. Very occasionally you will need to sit in on calls with customers and handle direct support tickets.

Because our team is remote, each member has the freedom to work where and when they please. All we ask is that tasks get done within the allotted timeframe. A traditional college degree is not mandatory but we do like to see that you can set long term goals and achieve them. We aim to provide satisfying challenges and a positive working environment because we want happy, productive employees who will be with us for many years.


We are willing to have you join us as a contractor or an employee depending on your availability and preference. Compensation is negotiable and based on your experience and skillset. If you're a headhunter or an agency, please propose specific candidates along with the associated costs. Vague submissions will be discarded.

item.title: Machine Learning Engineer Industrial Deep Learning (m/f) at CeleraOne GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Develop Revolutionary Machine Learning Applications with us!


We are a team of highly motivated software architects and mathematicians with diverse backgrounds – from machine learning, routing algorithms, and signal processing to compiler technology and mathematics. We combine our knowledge to advance CeleraOne’s machine learning models and applications every day.


Job Description


- Modelling industrial processes using advanced machine learning methods


- Utilizing modern machine learning frameworks: Google TensorFlow, scikit-learn, pandas, and more


- Tuning of deep neural networks and other machine learning processes


- Developing solutions for system-critical industrial problems in Python


Skills & Requirements


- Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Computer Science or Mathematics, Ph.D. in Computer Science or Mathematics is a plus


- Relevant industry experience especially with convolutional / recurrent neural networks, SVMs, CRFs, time series analysis, anomaly detection


- At least two years of development experience in industry (Python or C++14)


- Fluent in English. German or Russian is a plus


Why CeleraOne?


- Professional and friendly international team, full transparency of the company's strategy


- We model and predict the behavior of machines, not of human individuals


- Modern technology stack, no legacy code


- High-level trainings / seminars (Mathematics, Machine Learning, Metallurgy, and more)


- Central location in Berlin


- Free in-house German classes


- Free public transport ticket


- Free coffee, fruits, soft drinks, beer, etc.


- Regular team events and BBQs

item.title: FullStack Developer (Must be based in Europe) at Kodify.io () (allows remote)
item.description:
The team at Kodify is looking for a talented FullStack Developer to join our remote team. This specific role is open to remote candidates based in European Union only (a must for us). With you on board, we’re looking to expand our team (currently 7 developers working across multiple European locations) and take our projects to a whole new level. You will deliver Javascript development skills on the front and backend systems that power our sites. Good knowledge of HTML and CSS are also required, along with the ability to work with our designers and the business to implement the features required.


Your key responsibilities: 



  • Create Server and Client JS, HTML & CSS to deliver required functionality and design

  • Highly skilled in frontend templating engine using React

  • Ensure all code is modular, and where possible developed as reusable

  • End-to-end responsibility from technical design to deployment and testing

  • Work with Designers & Product Owners to ensure they understand possibilities / limitations

  • Always work towards minimising page load time & data transferred

  • Become a valued team member, providing feedback to the team

  • Take ownership of your code / tasks / role

  • Be proud of what you achieve, and of the product, and be one of the driving forces behind always making it better

  • When you cock-up - own-up! (We don’t do blame-storming here!)

  • Have fun and enjoy your job!


About you:



  • You’re a real team player. You love to help and find solutions together.

  • Your sense of humour will bring a new dynamic to the team - you love to have fun while you work!

  • You can think on your feet and adapt well to fast changing environments and priorities.

  • You are passionate about software development

  • You're able to think beyond code to architecture and user experience

  • You have a a real ‘Can Do’ work ethic - We are results based, not clock based!


Skills & Requirements


Must Have:



  • NodeJS

  • Javascript / HTML / CSS

  • React

  • MongoDB

  • Github

  • LESS / SASS

  • Bootstrap and JQuery


Bonus points:



  • Express / Connect

  • Redis

  • RequireJS

  • ZeroMQ

  • TDD

  • BusterJS / CucumberJS with WebdriverIO

  • Your own open source projects

  • DataTables

  • High traffic web sites

  • Linux

  • AWS Technologies (e.g. EC2, S3, Cloudformation, ..)

  • Chef

  • Streaming video technologies / Web playback tools (VideoJS)

  • Understanding of, and agreement with, Agile principles

  • Knowledge and experience in Git and JIRA


Other:



  • Experience working remotely and with remote teams

  • Experience managing high traffic and content heavy websites.


Education is compulsory, but where you got it is irrelevant for us! We are looking for someone who has worked in a similar role (or roles) for at least 3 years, and can show us examples of their work. We are not looking for a newbie, nor are we looking for a rockstar, we are looking for a mid to senior level developer who wants to both learn and contribute to our team.


Do you like what you read and want to be part of it? Please send us your CV along with a covering letter explaining why this job is right for you, and why you are right for the job!

item.title: Engineering Project Leader (f/m) Automotive Infotainment at Cinemo GmbH (Karlsruhe, Germany)
item.description:
We build cutting-edge, world-first and unique technologies for multimedia, media management, device connectivity and cloud that drives the performance and possibilities of tomorrow's passengers.


As a Engineering Project Leader, you will work directly with our customers, top brand automotive companies, and lead projects for integration of our next-generation embedded multimedia C/C++ middleware. You will ensure that your projects are running successful, from technical, quality and execution part. This role requires an energetic and motivated individual with strong communication, organization, and technical skills who works well in a fast-paced dynamic environment.


Our strength is our focus on performance, high-quality and service.


To support this, we need the best engineers and creative minds to thrive in our culture. 


If you enjoy writing high quality code, love C and have strong technical skills, are an enjoyable person, and want your code to end one day in millions of cars driving the future, then you are at the right place at Cinemo!


Skills & Requirements


This position requires someone who:



  • is willing to work in Germany (city: Karlsruhe, which is close to the French border)

  • is self-motivated, proactive and able to work under minimal supervision

  • understands detailed levels while taking account of interdependencies at higher levels

  • is able to interact with all levels of engineers and managers

  • has excellent written and communication skills

  • pays attention to the details and is highly organized

  • is fluent in software engineering processes with complex technical issues

  • has high interest in next-generation multimedia

  • has very good knowledge of C and C++ programming languages

  • has very good knowledge in English


Responsibilities:



  • manage customer projects by providing project leadership and daily management through project life cycle for all assigned projects

  • oversee all aspects of project information including timelines, resource allocation, scope and definition

  • communicate project schedules, status and potential risks

  • proactively identify, prioritize and drive resolution to project issues

  • design and create quality assurance for the projects

item.title: Team Lead Java - Game Development at InnoGames GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
As Team Lead Java - Game Development you play a key role in the development of one of our new mobile gaming titles. Together with your agile, highly qualified and cross-functional Unity3D/C# and Java development team, you are responsible for creating a game that will be played by millions of players.


Your mission:


Your technical and architectural expertise combined with your leadership experience will be crucial to our game’s success. Your mission is to



  • Establish and lead a team of highly qualified game developers

  • Exchange and align with your product manager to define the technical roadmap

  • Closely collaborate with Game Designers, Artists and Quality Assurance

  • Maintain high standards of software quality together with your team

  • Ensure continuous optimisation of game performance in close collaboration with our operations team

  • Coordinate and encourage the further personal development of your developers through training, workshops and other activities

  • Foster a culture of sharing knowledge, best practices and standards



Your profile:



  • You have completed a Computer Sciences, Business Information Systems degree or can provide a comparable relevant professional experience

  • You have several years’ experience in building and leading agile development teams, ideally in the gaming industry

  • You take on a high level of responsibility and are able to make good leadership decisions based on an excellent understanding of business requirements

  • You know the advantages and disadvantages of various architectures and have experience implementing them

  • You have a background in Java, and are open to new programming paradigms (e.g. functional programming)

  • You have proven experience with databases and alternative data storage systems

  • You have excellent communication skills and are willing to embrace our company culture and values

  • You have excellent English language skills



Why join us? 



  • Shape the success story of InnoGames with a great team of driven experts in an international culture

  • Competitive compensation and an atmosphere to empower creative thinking and strong results

  • Exceptional benefits ranging from flawless relocation support to company gym, smartphone or tablet of your own choice for personal use, roof terrace with BBQ and much more



Would you like to become part of a dynamic team and work as a Team Lead in our new mobile game. Then we look forward to receiving your application (cover letter, CV and references) as well as your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date through our online application form at innogames.com. Your contact person for this job offer is Katrin Hugo.

item.title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer at Lalamove (Kowloon, Hong Kong)
item.description:
Lalamove is now seeking an Amazing(™) Senior Infrastructure Engineer to join our growing Infrastructure team. The team is central within the Engineering organisation at Lalamove whose focus is on whole-platform performance, optimisation and uptime through automation. We are always seeking the best solution to a problem and thinks it is more important that things are done right, rather than quick. You will possess a high level of technical curiosity and be comfortable with not just solving problems but problems that few other companies have not yet had.

At Lalamove, we value the ideas of all our teammates and it is important that you can contribute right away both with your input and hands on engineering. You will have an opportunity to make an immediate impact that improves the quality of our infrastructure.

What you'll do: 


  • Continuous integration and delivery of the current platform on top of AWS with the aim of improving operations reliability, performance and cost

  • Defining and deploying monitoring and logging systems to help the business and engineering better understand the performance of the live system

  • Encourage best practices and systems operations in an always-up, always-available service

  • Take part in automation process, help and coach developers about getting code they’ve written into production safely and reliably

  • Participate in technical meetings to understand business requirements in order to plan and integrate a system that is viable and scalable and ensures business continuity

  • Exercise a high level of autonomy within the problem space, but also feel confident that you have the support you need to deliver


What you'll have: 



  • At least 3 years of professional experience with Linux or web application programming and excited to learn the other part

  • Experience with automation/configuration management using Ansible/Salt/Puppet

  • Experience in automation and testing

  • Understanding of agile and other development processes and methodologies

  • Ability to use a wide variety of open source technologies and cloud services

  • Experience with database performance and operations

  • A working understanding of code and script (PHP, node.js)


Bonus Points! 



  • Application programming experience in PHP/Python/node.js including writing tested code

  • Detailed experience with MySQL and performance profiling of queries

item.title: Data Engineering Lead at Grab (Singapore)
item.description:
Get to know the Role:
 


Grab is currently seeking a Data Engineering Lead to lead and develop the team. This position is based in our Cecil Street office in Singapore. As a Data Engineering Lead, you will be driving your teams to out-serve Grab’s customers. Therefore, your high-quality delivery is vital to Grab and our community. Every ‘Grabber’ is equally important and has the ability to directly impact Grab’s success. You will draw on your proven track record to lead, manage, motivate, and grow the Data team, while coordinating the resources.


With over 60 million mobile downloads, we are processing millions of bookings a day and billions of traffic data points per month. As data in Grab never stops growing, this team also never stops, learning, innovating and expanding so that we can bring in or build the latest and best tools, technology to ensure the company’s continued success.



The day-to-day activities:



  • You will oversee, manage and develop the Data Engineers, who are responsible to build, deploy and manage big data solutions that can adequately handle the needs of a rapidly growing data driven company


  • Spearhead the development of systems, architectures, and platforms that can scale to the 3 Vs of Big data (Volume, Velocity, Variety)




  • You prepare the plans and roadmaps for the team, working closely with engineering and operations team in building tooling to drive scalability, reliability, and performance




  • You will support the team in building out scalable and reliable ETL pipelines and processes to ingest data from a large number and variety of data sources




  • Research and develop new technologies and approaches for building highly available data persistence systems




  • Run Modern high-performance analytical databases and computation engines like Presto, Spark, Flink, Iguaz.io and much more





The must haves:



  • Engineering managers are expected to have deep technical expertise in their functional area and should be able to roll up their sleeves and get their hands dirty with hands-on work whenever is required.


  • Leaders in grab are expected to practice servant leadership, where the most important role of the leader is to enable the success of the people and teams they lead.




  • A core function of this role involves attracting, developing, and keeping a world-class engineering team. You would have a proven track record at building strong teams, making them even stronger, and successfully organizing and leading their efforts to deliver excellent results for customers.




  • Proven track record with handling large data sets (multiple TBs) and working with structured, unstructured and geographical datasets




  • Designed high performance scalable infrastructure stacks for Big Data Analytics




  • Deep understanding of databases and best engineering practices - include handling and logging errors, monitoring the system, building human-fault-tolerant pipelines, understanding how to scale up, addressing continuous integration, knowledge of database administration, maintaining data cleaning and ensuring a deterministic pipeline




  • Real passion for data, new data technologies, and discovering new and interesting solutions to the company’s data needs

item.title: R&D Software Engineer Java - Passionate about compiler technology? at GuardSquare (Leuven, Belgium)
item.description:
Passionate about software engineering, compiler technology and Java?


You are excited to solve challenging problems and build cool software that is used on billions of devices? Join our Java team!


Our technology


We develop the successful open source project ProGuard and the cutting-edge security product DexGuard. Using compiler technology and obfuscation, encryption and optimisation techniques we make Java and Android applications smaller, faster and more hardened against reverse engineering and tampering.  


Required skills



  • Deep knowledge of Java

  • Experience with Linux

  • Knowledge of compiler technology (Java bytecode, complex application processing) or obfuscation or optimisation technologies

  • Interest in low level programming


Useful skills



  • Knowledge of information security

  • Experience with reverse engineering and the commonly used tools

  • Familiarity with Android and the Android build tools: Gradle, ProGuard...


Profile


We are looking for a Master or PhD in Computer Science with good verbal and written communication skills in English.


Team


GuardSquare is a software product company with small international teams that want to solve challenging problems and create high quality products. You will be part of the team working on our open source product ProGuard, our commercial product DexGuard, and new products based on Java technology. This will give you a ton of opportunities to have a direct impact on the products, features and workflow. New techniques you come up with for the next wave of optimization and hardening could potentially be in use at really big companies within a couple of weeks (among our customers are many of the biggest payment processors, banks, social media companies…). Every team member designs, develops, maintains and improves our software and provides  email support to our customers. He also gets the opportunity to research the latest compiler and mobile security technology.


What you can expect from us?



  • Challenging, interesting and diversified work.

  • A good balance between research and implementation work.

  • The opportunity to improve your skills on a personal and a technological level.

  • An attractive salary package with benefits like meal and eco vouchers, retirement savings, hospitalisation insurance, phone, SIM card, compensation for commute...

  • An inspiring work environment with smart colleagues in the beautiful city of Leuven.


Become our colleague!


Send us your CV and the source code of a personal project in Java you are proud of.

item.title: R&D Software Engineer C++ - Passionate about LLVM? at GuardSquare (Leuven, Belgium)
item.description:
Passionate about software engineering, C++ and LLVM?


You are excited to solve challenging problems and build cool software that is used on billions of devices? Join our C++/LLVM team!


Technology


We develop a cutting-edge product iXGuard, based on LLVM, the immensely popular open source compiler framework. We deploy our knowledge about the iOS / MacOS kernel and low-level concepts and our experience with hooking, reverse engineering, protection against hooking frameworks to create the next layers of our hardening software.


Useful skills



  • Knowledge of modern C++

  • Knowledge of compiler technology (LLVM)

  • Experience with obfuscation technologies and reverse engineering

  • Familiarity with some or all of the following; Objective-C, Swift

  • Knowledge of Apple operating systems internals (OS X and iOS) and the latest iOS jailbreaks and comprehension of low-level security concepts (e.g. ASLR, PIE, code signing, etc.)


Profile


We are looking for a Master or PhD in Computer Science (or equivalent practical experience) with good verbal and written communication skills in English.


Team


GuardSquare is a software product company with small international teams that want to solve challenging problems and create high quality products. You will be part of the team working on our young product iXGuard. This will give you a ton of opportunities to have a direct impact on the features and workflow. New techniques you come up with for the next wave of hardening could potentially be in use at really big companies within a couple of weeks (among our customers are many of the biggest payment processors, banks, social media companies…). Every team member designs, develops, maintains and improves our software and provides  email support to our customers. He also gets the opportunity to research the latest compiler and mobile security technology.


What you can expect from us?



  • Challenging, interesting and diversified work.

  • A good balance between research and implementation work.

  • The opportunity to improve your skills on a personal and a technological level.

  • An attractive salary package with benefits like meal and eco vouchers, retirement savings, hospitalisation insurance, phone, SIM card, compensation for commute...

  • An inspiring work environment with smart colleagues in the beautiful city of Leuven.


Become our colleague!


Send us your CV and the source code of a personal project in C++ you are proud of.

item.title: Haxe/OpenFL Game Developer Forge of Empires at InnoGames GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)

As a Haxe/OpenFL Game Developer you will be part of our agile, cross-functional and international development team. You will start working on our HTML5 browser client based on Haxe/OpenFL. You will improve existing and start developing new features.   • Working in close collaboration with Backend Developers, Game Design and QA

  • Ensure high quality of our source code through reviews, unit-tests and usage of clean code

  • Solid experience in Unit Testing, Design Patterns, Code-Reviews

Would you like to become part of a dynamic team and work as a Haxe/ OpenFL Game Developer in our new mobile game. item.title: Java Developer - Anti Money Laundering at TransferWise (Tallinn, Estonia)
item.description:
Java Developer - Anti Money Laundering


Product engineers only


Here at TransferWise we don’t hire coders, who pick up tickets from a backlog and push code to production without considering value and impact.


As part of the Anti Money Laundering Team, you'll be making sure that we stay compliant, do the best we can to find people abusing our system for unlawful purposes, and still being relentlessly customer focused.


What you’ll be working on:



  • TransferWise is complex under the hood, but we’re just getting started. With our own payment rails, there are lots of opportunities to build new products and services on them.

  • At its core, our stack is Java microservices, using Netflix OSS offerings, and SPAs written in Angular 1/React, with a legacy Grails monolith. We are moving quickly to proven distributed technologies that can be scaled (Kafka, Zookeeper, Eureka, Bouncer +  much more)
    More details: http://tech.transferwise.com/the-transferwise-stack-heartbeat-of-our-little-revolution/

  • Integrating with a variety of partners and providers across the world, so our customers can send money across borders with minimal fuss and maximum confidence

  • Getting to the core of the customer’s problems by conducting interviews, answering support and figure out what TransferWise is to the customer and how it can be improved

  • What do you want to be working on? Autonomous teams come up with their own plans, there is no hierarchy telling you what to do.


Must haves:



  • Passionate about technology, its relationship with business, and customer experience.

  • Ability to work independently and plan your own solutions to problems.

  • Experience building backend systems, preferably using Java 8

  • Hands on with relational databases (e.g. MySQL), writing queries and schema design 

  • Built something with an MVC Framework

  • Comfortable with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

  • Understand test driven development (TDD), writing testable code, and the desire to write tests.

  • Excitement to work in a high-growth company and fully dive into the revolution.

  • Be creative, communicative, and fun to work with.


Nice to haves:



  • Experience with financial systems, compliance, risk, fraud, or Anti Money Laundering

  • Practice the teachings of Uncle Bob and Martin Fowler

  • PostgreSQL, advanced types and query features

  • Machine learning or other data driven development experience

  • Event driven architecture

  • REST microservices

  • Spring (Boot), Hibernate, Lombok

  • Groovy experience

  • PHP experience

  • Be a TransferWise customer


Benefits:


Apart from the all-expenses-paid company trips, stock options in one of Europe’s most hotly tipped startups, a laptop and team lunches every other Thursday, you won’t get much in the way of extras. However, we will give you 28 days holiday a year (plus public holidays), a fun, friendly atmosphere, plenty of opportunities to grow and the chance to be part of our little revolution. Oh, and coffee, there’s plenty of coffee.


Not from Estonia? - No stress, we will help you (and your family) to relocate from any part of the world!

item.title: Continuous Integration Engineer (m/f) at TeamViewer GmbH (Gppingen, Germany)
item.description:
For the immediate strengthening of our team at our offices in Stuttgart-Vaihingen and Göppingen, we are looking for software build engineers.



Your Responsibilities



  • Compilation process of new software versions

  • Assume further development and support of our system, update the tools currently used and automate further steps of the Build process on all platforms

  • Monitor the Continuous Integration Jenkins System and ensure its performance

  • Your main duties will include to automate and improve the Build processes

  • Ensure that released versions can be created and tested at a particular time and play an important role with our Quality Assurance


 What we Offer



  • Active input on a product that is downloaded and used thousands of times every day, all around the world. No matter what feature you are currently developing - it will be in everyday use with the customer

  • A pleasant and highly motivated team that deals with others in a respectful and confidence-building manner

  • An attractive workplace with modern equipment

  • Dynamic company that enjoys continual, healthy growth

  • Freedom for personal organization and the possibility of attaining real results as part of a fantastic Team


 Requirements



  • University degree in the field of information technology or a related subject

  • Experience in software development, software release management, automation of Build processes is a plus

  • Programming skills in different scripting languages for automating Build processes

  • Experience in dealing with different operating systems (e.g. Windows®, Mac®, Linux®, Android®, …)

  • Ideally experience in the following tools: Visual Studio, XCode and Jenkins

  • It appeals to you to work in an agile software development environment and to optimize processes constantly

  • A structured and analytical way of working

item.title: Trading Systems Engineer at IMC Financial Markets (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
MC financial markets – Where Technology drives Trading


Trading nowadays happens in a highly competitive technological landscape; the best trading idea alone doesn’t cut it anymore. Instead, only the best trading ideas that are enabled via robust, scalable and fast technology win. 


Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?


TRADING SYSTEMS ENGINEERING AT IMC:


IMC is currently looking for a multi-talented and passionate Trading Engineer to play a critical role in maintaining and perfecting our tradinginfrastructure.  As a Trading Engineer you will be part of highly experienced team, facing the daily challenge of managing a critical, high volume data flow in a complex trading environment distributed over a high speed datainfrastructure.  In this role you will be exposed to many technical and trading challenges while ensuring high availability, stability and performance of the end-to-end environment. 


The skills necessary to excel could range from system administration, network administration, database administration, development, release management and performance engineering. This role provides daily challenges as no day is the same as the next.  In other words, this role, unlike any other at IMC, opens up possibilities to make considerable impact as part of a dedicated, dynamic team, both locally and globally.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Provide continuity and stability to the production environment.

  • Provide quick response to production issues to help eliminate down time thereby ensuring high availability and performance of our trading platform.

  • Coordinate, prioritize and plan the changes to our trading software thereby ensuring smooth exchange migrations, quick time to market for new features and software.

  • Contribute towards improving the trading strategy as well as the trading infrastructure.

  • Translate trading requests into concrete technical requirements, work with various focus teams in our organizations towards generating innovative and scalable solutions and finally implement those solutions in order to continuously enhance our systems and processes.

  • Relevant education and relevant working experience

item.title: Backend developer at Forza Football at Forza Football (previously called Football Addicts) (Gothenburg, Sweden)
item.description:
This Opportunity

Forza Football is looking for Elixir developers to join our amazing team in Gothenburg, Sweden.

You will be working on the services that power our mobile appsfrom the API that serves millions of clients to the push notification system that keeps our users up-to-date on their favourite football teams and competitions. You will have the benefit of working together with Elixirs core team members in a small team of talented developers and designers dedicated to building great mobile apps for football fans all over the world. Our platform is built on Elixir and Ruby and at peak hours it handles thousands requests per second and send millions of push notifications.

The Forza Football app keeps users up-to-date on their favourite teams and competitions, the app covers over 500 leagues and competitions in 100 countries. The app has over 10 million installs and over 3 million monthly active users.


Why you want to work at Forza Football

Forza Football is a team of 45 people from 10 different countries, passionately developing Football applications using the latest technology. We're based in the heart of Gothenburg, Sweden. Our motto is that if the team is feeling well, the company is feeling well. That's why we created what we believe is one of the best ways of working where every employee has the autonomy to create a good balance between work and free time. Our award-winning open office environment has different sound levels across three floors including a gaming room, meditation room, library, ping pong table, shuffle board, ball pit and a smallish football pitch. As with everything, we strive to make the work environment and our products even better.

We are dedicated to building high quality mobile apps for football fans all over the world. We are in this game for the long term and we will exist for the next 100 years. With your help, we will be able to reach our goal of 300 million users and cover all matches in the world. Together we can truly democratize football with the power of the fans.

Forza Football is bootstrapped and profitable, which means no interference from investors. We have full control over our company and products, and we only build things we are proud of. We keep things simple, we have no middle managers and we void lengthy company policies and bureaucracy. All the employees become shareholders after 12 months.

We do not hire solely based on experience with a few specific tools or languages or university degrees. Rather, we want to hire developers who are smart, experienced and self-driven and can learn our tools and adapt quickly to change. We are an equal opportunity employer and are excited to expand our team with diverse talents from different backgrounds and cultures.



Benefits


  • Your choice of computer and gadget setup
  • Flexible work hours
  • Stimulating work
  • Being part of an autonomous team where your opinion matters
  • Five weeks paid vacation, unlimited time off
  • Amazing parental leave benefits
  • No middle managers or unnecessary bureaucracy
  • Breakfast every day
  • Friday beers
  • Ping-pong, shuffleboard, Futchi, meditation room and VR
  • Conference visits with all expenses paid
  • 10% of work time dedicated to personal projects and self-improvement
  • Become a shareholder
  • Relocation support
  • Visa sponsorship
  • One of the best offices around: http://blog.footballaddicts.com/bestoffice

item.title: Java Developer at SoftSolutions! Srl (Bergamo, Italy)
item.description:
SoftSolutions una realt FinTech che ha contatti e relazioni giornaliere con le maggiori Finanziarie Europee, molte delle quali con Headquater in Londra.

I nostri clienti ci scelgono per lelevata competenza ed abilit nellutilizzo di tecnologie avanzate, in un contesto complesso e molto specifico, quale quello dei mercati finanziari internazionali: proprio da questi ci giungono continue sfide e riconoscimenti, che ci hanno consentito di ampliare la nostra gamma di servizi e prodotti, oltre che rendere pi ricca, articolata e funzionale la nostra piattaforma nexRates.

Attualmente siamo alla ricerca di un nuovo talento Java da far crescere allinterno del team di back-end.

Di seguito la descrizione dellopportunit:

Tra le tipologie di sviluppo che vogliamo realizzare, ci sono:

  • Calcolo distributo con Grafi Diretti (DAG). Secondo te Akka/Spark sono adatti allo scopo?
  • Sviluppare API sulla base di HornetQ (e altri JMS)
  • L'uso di Rule Engines per rendere Agile i front-end.

Benefits


E previsto il contratto di lavoro a tempo indeterminato, il trattamento economico sar valutato individualmente, in relazione alle effettive capacit.

Lattivit sar svolta presso la sede, a Bergamo, Via San Francesco dAssisi, 3/B - raggiungibile con i mezzi pubblici. Le ricerche si intendono riferite a persone di entrambe i sessi (L.903/77).
