  • Strong understanding of graph algorithms and data structures

  • Solid C++ programming skills and engineering know-how (and a desire to keep learning).

  • Strong mathematical skills to create and improve complex algorithms


Perks



  • Free snacks

  • Health insurance


We value people that are passionate to learn, so even if you don't master all the skills described above and you are interested to work with us, feel free to apply.

item.title: React / MobX Developer at Mendix (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Mendix is a visual, model-based IDE to create mobile & web apps. On top of this, our platform supports cloud deployment, feedback & collaboration and reusable components via our app store. As a result, Mendix is the fastest and easiest way to create and continuously improve mobile and web apps at scale.


Our R&D team works with the latest technologies to create our innovative platform — React, Node.js, TypeScript, Cloudfoundry/Pivotal/AWS, C#, Scala, Internet of Things, Machine Learning, etc. And because more than 40,000 developers from 4,000 organizations around the world rely on Mendix, each commit has the potential to impact not just them but millions of end users.


We're investing to accelerate our momentum and we're looking to grow our global team. If you constantly strive for excellence, are passionate about innovation, and want to work with a collaborative, energetic team - then Mendix is for you.


Our team is responsible for all the core services of the IDE and some of its editors. Since this is a long-term project, we are always on the lookout for the best practices and latest technologies in the JavaScript landscape. To make sure our development processes are optimized for all parties involved. For example, the popular MobX library is an offspring of this quest.


You’ll help our customers drive digital innovation by:




    •         Having a BSc./MSc./PhD in Computer Science or related technical field    

    •         Fluent skills in English

    •         A passion about technology. Show us your hobby projects!



Skills & Requirements


You’re the innovator we need if you have:




    • You are fluent in JavaScript and its functional style. You’re a polyglot.

    • You are someone who gets things done. You understand what should be part of a first iteration and what can be done later.

    • You are able to think on an abstract level. Familiarity with meta-programming is a pro.

    • You want to become part of a work environment in which your ideas are valued. You are able to clearly communicate your ideas.

    • You are comfortable working as part of a scrum team.

    • You enjoy the occasional game of foosball and/or ping pong.

    • Familiarity with React, TypeScript, MobX is a pro



Experience a culture like no other at Mendix:




    • We are building something new, making stuff up as we go along.

    • We are working on a platform and we’re in it for the long haul. Thousands of developers and end users across the globe rely on your work and each commit could make them all very happy.

    • We dabble in all sorts of technologies when it takes our fancy. Although we focus on JavaScript / Typescript & C# we often branch out into HTML5, CSS3, Scala / Java. Other libraries we use include React, MobX, Webpack, Node, Jest.

item.title: Senior Java Software Engineer at Ultimate Software (Fort Lauderdale, FL)
item.description:
As a Java Software Engineer at Ultimate, you’ll be embedded on a development team consisting between 8-30 people where you can work on the next generation of internet software. You’ll get to work directly with other Developers, Software Testers, Business Analysts, Product Managers, and Directors, all of whom make up the team. In this highly-collaborative environment, you will have the opportunity to grow as a software engineer, and even help mentor others. Are you ready to get started? Apply Today!


A Day In The Life: 



  • Start your day off right by meeting with your teammates to make sure that yesterday’s challenges are today’s wins!

  • Get together with your Business Analysts, User Experience leads and Quality Assurance Engineers at the story kickoff meeting to make sure the code you write is building the software that you want to use

  • Want to talk shop? The tech standup is the place to do it where you meet with your fellow engineers and platform leads to make sure your code is using the latest and greatest practices and patterns

  • After lunch, head on over to a design meeting where you are working with the analysts and fellow engineers to determine what the code and product will look like just a few months from now

  • The team only gets stronger at monthly/quarterly retrospective meetings where your small ideas can have a big impact on how your teams days are going

  • When the day is over, by using our internal communication portal, Ulti Home, you plan on playing poker, volunteering, or going on a run with other Ulti Peeps!


Requirements:



  • Multiple years of experience in web technologies utilizing SOA patterns and REST

  • Knowledge of microservice architecture is a plus

  • Familiarity with Cloud based Software-as-a-Service applications

  • Familiarity using open source frameworks is a plus

  • Experience with NoSQL databases (MongoDB), Angular, and Spring is a plus

  • Knowledge of OOP design and patterns

  • Strong use of source code repositories, like GIT and understanding of GIT workflow


Education/Certification/License: A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or related field is a plus


Typical Interview Process:



  • If your application is selected, a Talent Acquisition Manager will reach out to schedule a phone screen with them.

  • If selected to move forward, you will complete a HackerRank Coding Assessment.

  • If you pass, you will either move forward to a technical phone call for an additional screening, OR directly to an onsite interview.

  • Offer stage.

item.title: Javascript Developer for NetSuite (m/f) at mycs GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Javascript Developer for NetSuite (m/f)


As one of our JavaScript Developer for NetSuite (m/f) you will play an important role in our development team and help us create a fabulous E-commerce platform with cutting edge 3D customization tools.


YOUR TASKS



  • Develop and maintain our ES6 codebase to improve and add functionality using Suite Script 1.0 and 2.0

  • Implement and change business processes in NetSuite using the UI

  • Develop integrations with other systems using RESTLets and webservices

  • Manage existing SuiteBundles and identify new bundles or third-party applications to improve upon existing processes

  • Integrate into the existing team and take responsibility for your projects



YOUR PROFILE



  • Good knowledge of or ready to learn JavaScript, prior experience in any programming environment/language can be of advantage (html, css)

  • Ability to communicate with non-technical staff and translate user requirements into technical requirements

  • Solution oriented working habits

  • Generally curious about technology

  • Good communication skills in English

  • Experience in NetSuite is a plus



JOIN MYCS AND...



  • Join a friendly team of passionate developers

  • Take responsibility on exciting tasks and develop further on a professional and personal level

  • Take part of great team events (hackathons, monthly workshops, multi-day team-event trips (e.g. to the French mountains)

  •  Enjoy a great working place with a loft feeling in Berlin

  • Take part in the success story of a fast growing company and contribute your ideas in its further development

  • Work in a dynamic international team and complement your working day with regular team events, free breakfasts and lunches and Friday drinks



...WORK WITH OUR STACK

Our frontend uses React. Webpack is our bundler that will transpile, minify, optimize, tweak our frontend to be as fast as possible for our beloved customers.
Jest is our test framework of choice, not only for our frontend but also for most of our APIs.
Our APIs are built using a Microservices Architecture and dockerized to facilitate deployment. We are using HapiJS, but slowly moving over to AWS Lambda (with the help of the awesome Serverless framework).
Our infrastructure is hosted on AWS and all resources are managed through CloudFormation.
Being DevOps proponents, automation is a key aspect of our work.
Having a developer-friendly environment is our priority.

item.title: Scala Developer at LeadIQ (Singapore)
item.description:
Are you the type of engineer who punches juke boxes to make the music start? Do you consider riding your motorcycle off into the a sunset a personal hobby? Is architecting a system from the ground up no big deal to you? We're looking for full-time Scala developer to make this happen.


The Product


We are on a mission to revolutionize Sales industry using data science. Our product helps our customers to collect and enrich their target prospects. Our internal data processing combines human intelligence and data science to enable our customers to find perfect contact information and save to their existing platforms like Salesforce, etc.


The Challenge



  • We are at an exciting stage in our growth. We are getting traction with big customers, scaling out, and solving increasingly complex engineering problems.

  • Our systems are mostly written in Scala. We have used Kafka as backbone to communicate between our API server and micro-services. Smart architecture design is crucial in order to guarantee our micro-services based systems run smoothly and reliably. 

  • We're looking for someone who can drive our product backend integration features, refactor existing code for faster responses and becomes an important asset to the rest of the engineering team.

  • Data quality is one of the critical factors to make our product successful. We often have needs to process 3rd parties data and clean existing data using Spark. So you need to be comfortable writing Spark scripts.

  • We have very complex integrations with 3rd parties systems like Salesforce, etc. These integrations are core to what we're offering to our customers. We're looking for someone who is willing to listen to customer feedback to improve existing features and provide new features for customer success.


The Stack


Scala, Kafka, Spark, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, Docker, Vue.js


The Team


We want team members with attributes like:


- Focus on delivering value to the customer 
- Strong belief in collaboration 
- Passion that drives you to execute and innovate 
- Ability to self-manage and take ownership of a feature 
- Ability to juggle many projects and responsibilities
- Extremely entrepreneurial and self-driven
- Not afraid of a steep learning curve 
- Passionate about building a big business that transforms the sales industry
- Exceptional at writing scalable, production-ready code
- Thrive in a fast-paced environment
- Avoid over-engineering 
- Simple designs and fast execution 
- Discipline in following process and documenting your work


These personality traits define the culture we are building and are more important to us than a particular set of technical skills.


The Responsibilities


If you join LeadIQ, you will learn a lot: In terms of technical ability there are many cool tools, technologies, patterns and other great developers that will sharpen your skills. Personally you be given the chance to step up, lead and make your mark in a growing startup as we tackle the challenges in our next phase of growth.


On the technical front, we need you skilled in:


- Scala (but experience in another functional language helps, e.g. Haskell or Clojure) 
- Play framework 
- Concurrency (futures, actors, basic understanding of threads)



So if you feel like you're a good fit for us, drop us a line! We love meeting developers who are excited by our product!

item.title: Senior Android Mobile Developer at Zooplus AG (Mnchen, Germany)
item.description:
• Developing Android mobile applications to support our growing and successful business

  • Strive for mastery in an exciting agile environment using state-of-the-art technologies

  • Solving digital challenges of delivering a full e-commerce stack

item.title: DevOps Engineer - FinTech at Deposit Solutions GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
• Work in an Agile team in which you contribute as an active team member

  • Operate and ensure the availability and performance of the software in different environments

  • Close cooperation with the development teams and departments

  • Provision and development of the IT infrastructure changes

  • Goal-oriented team member with the curiosity and willingness to understand and apply new technologies, concepts, and tools

  • Development of automated processes and self-services


Skills & Requirements



  • Experience in an agile DevOps environment

  • Linux (advanced, CentOS7, CoreOS), virtualization (ESX, Docker, Vagrant) as well as network

  • Self Contained Systems, Microservices, Loadbalancers, Webserver, Firewall, monitoring

item.title: BI Engineer (Java, C++, AWS & Spark) at Zalando SE (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. As a BI Engineer at Zalando Media Solutions within the Reporting and Data Infrastructure team, you will be responsible for creating and improving engaging reporting solutions, together with our Product Managers.


We live Radical Agility, a software development methodology that allows you to get work done while management keeps their distance. Along with our guiding set of principles – Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose – we entrust you to be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.


Our team in Hamburg spearheads our data-driven media buying efforts with a focus on fashion-oriented buying strategies for accurate and relevant consumer targeting. Machine learning, high-level database modeling, metrics definition, trend analysis and report generation are crucial to our business. We are Zalandos ad-technology forge and an integral contributor to Zalando Media Solutions.


You Are Setting Standards


Ownership. You and your team will consult and help our teams to develop, implement and maintain sustainable, high-performance, growth-ready data-processing and data integration systems.


Expertise. You will join a team that is focused on analyzing and making sense of diverse set of data, on the bleeding edge of eCommerce and advertisement. You and your team will work truly cross-functional with an entrepreneurial mindset.


Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will collaborate with our 120+ teams across Europe integrating our system.


You Are Skilled


Experience. Solid experience with OLAP analysis and tools (such as Microstrategy, GoodData, Eclipse BIRT, Tableau, Crystal Report, Pentaho). Experience in ETL/DWH and the relational Data Bases RDBMS (e.g. MySQL, PostgresDB, Oracle, SQL Server) or MPP (e.g. Teradata, Redshift, Vertica) are beneficial. Another plus is knowledge and understanding of the online advertising industry / eCommerce.


Big Data. Analyze advertising and eCommerce data. Demonstrate expertise and desire to work hands-on in analyzing and modeling large data sets. Design ETL processes, refine DWH architectures, build reportings and visualizations primarily in GoodData.


Ownership. Develop expertise in understanding our business. Own solutions that empower other teams and our clients to perform and enable profound analysis to allow data-driven Management decisions.


Technologies. Experience in the programming languages SQL and Javascript and desirably also in Java, Python or Linux scripting.


You Are Offered


Culture. Culture of trust, empowerment and feedback, 100+ internal guilds, tech talks, product demos, coder dojos. A dynamic, international team where collaboration is the core mindset.


Perks. Competitive salary, great shopping discount on a wide range of products on zalando.de and discounts from external partners.


Development. Opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.


Technologies. Opportunity to work with a range of different and cutting-edge technologies such as Python, R, SQL, Spark.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Georg Petersen.

item.title: Software Developer Search Algorithms (f/m) at MYTOYS GROUP (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
As a Software Developer Search algorithms (f/m) you are involved in the development of our e-commerce platform and the optimization of our search engine. You develop new components for text search function and suggestion, as well as analytics and optimization tools. You are passionate about search technologies and you have fun trying new stuff, such as Machine Learning or new search engines.


In cooperation with our product owner and search team, you will make a significant contribution to the success of our shop development.  Scrum is not just a slogan for us, but a living reality. Our team plans and organizes its work autonomously. The Scrum Master and team leader see themselves as supporters and enablers of team requirements. We are currently in the process of setting up guilds in which our developers deal with team-overlapping topics such as architecture, code quality, testing and continuing professional development. Contact us if you are interested in working in an agile team.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Platform Services) at comparethemarket.com (Peterborough, UK)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer within our Platform Services team at comparethemarket.com, creating and promoting the environment for realising Continuous Delivery- where change can be delivered to the hands of our customers as quickly as possible with the lowest risk to service, will be what makes you tick.


Reporting to the Lead Platform Engineer you’ll be responsible for building, running and owning the platform that comparethemarket.com runs its entire operation on, mixed with designing, engineering and operating performance critical services on that platform.


At comparethemarket.com (CTM) our passion is creating great software, we look to push the boundaries with new technologies so that we can deliver the very best for our customers. We value everyone’s opinion in building top class software, the role of a Senior Software Engineer is crucial in setting technical direction and building team consensus.


What will you be responsible for as a Senior Software Engineer (Platform Services) at comparethemarket.com?



  • Building, Running and Owning first-class solutions in an agile platform team

  • Evangelising the approaches and tooling that exist as part of the CTM Platform to the wider CTM Tech community, including curating and contributing to open source initiatives

  • Providing tools and services enabling product teams to improve their fault tolerance and QoS to our customers

  • Actively contributing towards the definition and extension of the underlying tech principles and operating model

  • Assisting in capacity planning and operating cost management, helping to identify opportunities for efficiency gains

  • Working with the Platform Lead to realise the architectural vision for CTM’s platform whilst considering the practicalities of delivery

  • Champion quality and technical excellence at all times, contributing to the agile process and continuously improving all aspects of delivery


What will it take to be successful as a Senior Software Engineer (Platform Services) at comparethemarket.com?



  • You’ll have experience working in a similar role with exposure to business critical problems and delivering on a high workload under pressure

  • You’ll have a breadth of knowledge across different business remits -working with our Marketing, Security and Data teams will be seamlessly easy for you

  • You display a focus on performance and reliability alongside great breadth and specific depth of technical skills, especially in our stack; Node.js, JavaScript, Docker and Linux

  • You’ll have deep knowledge of Microservices or SOA and be passionate about REST

  • A mental agility to become an expert in new technologies

item.title: Front-end Software Engineer at mimacom group (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
Your challenge

  • Show closeness, get feedback and build solutions for customers
  • Collaborate with team members in a multi-country environment and distributed teams
  • Write well designed, testable, efficient code
  • Design mobile-based features
  • Collaborate with back-end developers to improve usability and also, help them with coding and troubleshooting
  • Demonstrate high level of proficiency in Angular and in its different versions (1.5, 2.0, 4)
  • Stay up-to-date with emerging JS frameworks and technologies

Your chance

  • Flat hierarchies, direct feedback and room to stand up for your own ideas
  • Agile, international environment and the chance to be supported by some of the best minds in IT
  • Career growth opportunities (certifications, trainings, conferences, events, etc.)
  • Choose your own device: Apple or Windows
  • Small and efficient Agile teams
  • Flexitime and home office possibilities
  • Location: Barcelona (preferably) and/or Valencia

Your profile

  • A higher technical education level (Master Degree/ Bachelor Degree)
  • 3+ years experience in software development
  • Proficiency in JavaScript, ECMAScript 6 (ES6), HTML, CSS
  • Demonstrable experience of working in projects with of Angular 1.5 and latest versions 2.0 4.0
  • Experience in mobile app development with Ionic
  • Desirable skills: Java and Spring framework
  • Experience working with Agile methodologies: scrum
  • Familiarity with Test-Driven Development (TDD) is desirable
  • Hands-on mentality and problem solver able to go fast whenever needed
  • Proficient in English German is a plus

item.title: Senior Mobile Unity C# Developer at InnoGames GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
As a Senior Mobile Unity/ C# Developer you will be part of our agile, cross-functional and international development team. You will drive the development of new features as well as maintain and improve the current code of our new games.


Your mission:



  • Conception and development of mobile apps for our games, based on C# and Unity3D

  • Continuous refinement and optimization of existing mobile apps

  • Collaboration with different departments (e.g. Art, Game Design, Backend)

  • Conception of APIs, tools and workflows to optimize the interdisciplinary work

  • Expansion of the mobile apps for new devices

  • Ensuring a high product quality, together with Quality Assurance

  • Foster a culture of sharing knowledge, best practices and standards


Skills & Requirements


Your profile:



  • A degree in computer science or business / media information technology or relevant professional experience

  • At least 4 years of experience in using Unity or other 3D game engines like Unreal or CryEngine

  • Very good knowledge of object-oriented programming in C#

  • Professional experience in agile software development (e.g. SCRUM or Kanban)

  • Excellent understanding of software architecture, design and test-driven development

  • Deep understanding of the mobile platforms and their performance optimization strategies

  • Profound experience of writing shaders using GLSL, HLSL or Cg

  • Passion for computer games and the games industry


Desirable:



  • Experience in development of UI, audio and animation systems

  • Native mobile development experience on the iOS and Android platform

  • Good CPU and GPU optimization skills

  • Very good knowledge of 3D Math

  • Willingness to continuously learn and improve, plus an independent way of working

  • Good English language skills


Why join us?



  • Shape the success story of InnoGames with a great team of driven experts in an international culture

  • Competitive compensation and an atmosphere to empower creative thinking and strong results

  • Exceptional benefits ranging from flawless relocation support to company gym, smartphone or tablet of your own choice for personal use, roof terrace with BBQ and much more


Would you like to become part of a dynamic team and work as a Senior Mobile Unity/ C# Developer with us? Then we look forward to receiving your application (cover letter, CV and references) as well as your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date through our online application form at innogames.com. Your contact person for this job offer is Silja Bernecker.

item.title: Lead .NET Developer - Design Patterns, SDLC, cloud at Workstate (Thousand Oaks, CA)
item.description:
Seeking a strong senior developer with 7+ years of application development experience comfortable with well-architected code: gang of four design patterns, isolation, encapsulation, dependency injection, all the -ions. Configuration management, code reviews, pull requests, CI/CD, sprints and releases: these may take time away from writing code, but allow us to go home at night, confidently. DevOps is a mindset, not a job description. Do these statements ring true? Then this job might be for you.


You will be on our Los Angeles team, with daily onsite work required in Westlake Village, CA.


This position is only available to US residents based in the continental US who are eligible to work for any employer without need for visa sponsorship or transfer now or in the future.


Requirements



  • Microsoft .NET Framework

  • C#

  • Entity Framework, LINQ to SQL, etc.

  • Familiar with modern language concepts such as Generics, Annotations, Anonymous Functions (Lambdas), Extension methods, etc.

  • Web services (REST) development using ASP.NET Web API

  • Front-end web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SASS / SCSS, Gulp, Grunt, Compass, jQuery, KendoUI, etc.)

  • Microsoft SQL Server

  • Cloud development experience is a plus

  • Experience consuming web services in front-end frameworks

  • Experience both in building internally-facing web applications and customer-facing websites

  • Knowledge and comfort working on a codebase heavily invested in design patterns

  • Ability to contribute across the SDLC from technical design / architecture, through implementation, to production support and maintenance

  • Experience leading & mentoring a team of developers, particularly in an Agile environment

  • Experience / interest in applying SOLID principles is a major plus


General Attributes



  • Outstanding software development skills

  • Testing / debugging

  • Good written and verbal communication, including with non-technical people

  • Ability and interest to learn new technologies on the fly, as they become needed

  • The ability and interest to learn is one of our most desired attributes in a candidate. If you can demonstrate an aptitude to dig in up to your elbows and build experience in new technologies as you deliver projects utilizing those technologies successfully, your application will move to the top of the pile.

item.title: PHP programmeur at Activo.nl (Leiden, Netherlands)
item.description:
In verband met de flinke groei bij Activo zijn wij op zoek naar een allround webdeveloper met een focus op PHP.

Wij bieden

Benefits


Samen met een enthousiast team werk je aan de grootste merken en je ervaart de impact van je werk. Bij Activo.nl is er voldoende ruimte om te leren en door te groeien tegen een goed salaris.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Payments at Blackbaud (Charleston, SC)
item.description:
There’s an energy that’s created when smart people gather to do things that will change the world. It’s what inspires explorers and entrepreneurs. And it’s what inspires us at Blackbaud.


Blackbaud was founded on the idea that technology can be a medium for social change. Over the last thirty years, we’ve delivered software solutions to the nonprofit sector, helping mission-driven organizations manage operations and engage supporters. We have the satisfaction of knowing that our solutions are making a difference every day, allowing our clients to focus their time and resources on what they do best: changing the world. Our employees are innovators and difference-makers who are passionate about generating change. They see the huge impact their work has on organizations doing “good.” They’re socially involved. They work hard. And they have fun. 


As a Senior Software Engineer on our Shared Services Team, you will be responsible for helping to develop and enhance our merchant services offering as it penetrates into new markets, sustain our existing payments business, and help drive innovation in our software. We are seeking energetic software engineers that have a proven track record of developing solutions for payment services. Join our team of passionate engineers and help us develop world-class software that helps one non-profit at a time. 


Our Senior Software Engineers are the technical leads in designing and implementing complex modules and subsystems in a large application. They are involved with requirements definition, application architectural design, and heavily involved in the development process.


Responsibilities:



  • Implement important elements of the payments software architecture and application infrastructure. This includes application database design, architecture design, writing re-usable code, components and application functionality.

  • Work with Principal Software Engineers to define the application architecture and create software design for key elements of the application.

  • Implement complex components of the application

  • Evaluate performance of key elements of the application functionality and tune the performance to cover the range of customer use.

  • As the technical lead for a project, work with the manager to assign tasks to developers and monitor their progress against project milestones. Perform design reviews and code reviews for project staff.

  • Perform design reviews and code reviews for project staff. Provide scheduling estimates and assist with the scheduling process.

  • Mentor other team members in application development techniques and database implementation.

  • Participate in the definition of development processes.

  • Provide input to managers on the performance of team members for use in their reviews and participates in the interview process of new candidates.


Desired Qualifications:



  • B.S. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent work experience

  • Experience developing secure applications using OWASP guidelines is a plus

  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in software development; experience in implementing web services

  • Demonstrates comprehensive knowledge of .NET and object oriented development concepts

  • Understanding of SOA principles and implementation methodologies

  • Strong knowledge of T-SQL, experience with SQL Server 2008 / 2012 preferred

  • Highly motivated, self-starter, results-oriented team player willing to do “whatever it takes” in a dynamic and stimulating environment

  • In-depth understanding of several key application architecture elements; able to appropriately apply these elements in the implementation of application functionality.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Ability to learn and apply new concepts to build superior software products

  • Experience building high performance, scalable, robust, 24x7 applications

  • Ability to lead technical development projects

  • Recognized as a role model for mid-sized teams


#HelpGoodTakeOver

item.title: Full-Stack Developer, Unity Ads at Unity Technologies Finland (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
In Helsinki, you’ll be using technology like machine learning, micro-services and messaging-based architecture on a scale you won’t see many other places. Essentially, you’ll be doing what Google does on the web (only you’ll be doing it in games). What’s more, your work will have a positive impact.  It will help creators get paid for all their hard work by powering ads in hundreds of thousands of games. And it will give people the option to play for free by putting those ads in front of close to one billion gamers.


We’re looking for a talented Full-Stack Developer for our Unity Ads team in Helsinki. You should be well versed in modern web development methods, and understand the different requirements that are brought upon by responsive design, continuous deployment, and high-availability. You’ve already done frontend development for desktop and on the backend you are at home in working with REST APIs and complex data structures.


Our tech stack (here’s what you can learn if you don’t already know)



  • Services with Node.js & Golang

  • Front-ends with Angular.js

  • Messaging with NATS & Kafka

  • Databases selected by fit for purpose (we use: Redis, MongoDB, Cassandra, Redshift, Druid, Aerospike)


How we work



  • Agile environment

  • Highly autonomous teams

  • Continuous deployment with multiple deployments to production per day

  • Microservices


What you’ll do



  • Implement and maintain frontend interfaces for our internal and external dashboards

  • Create and deploy quality software all the way to production

  • Design and implement required backend API’s for our new features


What it takes



  • Experience with Node.js

  • Knowledge of modern web development frameworks and tools

  • Ability to quickly create prototypes of new features, while still maintaining quality

  • Able to clearly communicate your ideas, solutions and talk about them with the team

  • Strong collaboration and communication skills in English

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Machine Learning at Criteo Labs (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
What you will be doing:



  • Contribute directly to the development of a significant new line of business / product: high performance marketing for the CPG (consumer packaged goods) industry. Provide technical leadership for specific projects.

  • Write high quality, maintainable code. Mentor other engineers.

  • Build predictive models to understand shopping behavior.

  • Using Hadoop, Map Reduce, Python, Scala or Spark, implement distributed and scalable machine learning algorithms. Deploy to production.

  • Collaboratively architect the system design to scale machine learning algorithms and relevance related graph algorithms.

  • Find the signal hidden in tens of TB data, in one hour, using over a 1000 nodes on the Hadoop cluster. And iterate for improvement while measuring impact on the bottom line.


 What you bring to the role:



  • MS degree in Software Engineering or related field

  • 8+ years of programming experience in Java, Scala, C++ or C#.

  • 5+ years of experience with large scale big-data processing or with large scale real-time applications.

  • 3+ years of experience with Hadoop and MapReduce.

  • 3+ years of experience implementing machine learning algorithms.

  • Passion for exceptionally high quality code, algorithms, creative problem solving, empowerment, agility, teamwork and superb communication.

  • Curiosity and drive - you love solving the hardest problems.

item.title: Backend Software Engineer Core Java / Java Concurrency at trivago (Dsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Our Software Engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users search for their ideal hotel at the best rate.
We are looking for a versatile individual who is passionate about their craft, and has the ambition to push technology forward. You will be a leader in the design, implementation and ownership of major modules and sub-systems. With your technical expertise, you will manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, maintain and enhance software solutions.
We offer an international, results-driven and dynamic environment. If scale and complexity excite you, trivago should be your first choice.


Your responsibilities:



  • Build and maintain Java backend applications.

  • Play a leading role in the design and implementation of new functionality and platform enhancements.

  • Work closely and collaboratively with stakeholders and members from other teams (BI, Product, etc.).

  • Be creative, challenge yourself and spread the word: contribute to one of our lovely open source projects.

  • Initiate ideas from many different areas of computer science, including information retrieval, data processing, data storage, distributed computing, large-scale system design and many more.


Essential requirements:



  • A degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.

  • You have demonstrated the ability to master object oriented development in Core Java, especially Java Concurrency/ Multi-threading. (Please be aware that Pure JEE experience is not relevant for this position).

  • 3+ years' experience in designing and developing large scale web applications.

  • Extensive knowledge of software architecture, data structures and modern design patterns.

  • Extensive knowledge of building high performance, highly scalable and fault-tolerant web applications.

  • Experience in using NoSQL technologies (Redis, Cassandra, etc.).

  • Fluency in English (our company language).


Preferred requirements:



  • A master's degree or PhD in Computer Science.

  • Excellent communication skills.


Life at trivago is...



  • The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.

  • The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.

  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.

  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular free code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • Living in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highest quality of life in the world for expats.


Start date:



  • As soon as possible.


Additional information:



  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

item.title: Senior Ruby On Rails Developer (f/m) in Berlin/Germany at MODOMOTO (Curated Shopping GmbH) (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Your Role:


As MODOMOTO expands internationally, your work will have immediate impact on our customers and the many departments of MODOMOTO that are serving them. You will be continuously developing and optimizing our system with the goal of making it more reliable, scalable, and performant as we grow.


Therefore, we are looking for an experienced, passionate, and self-motivated engineer who will contribute to and influence the direction of this vision.


To be successful in this role, you must be a quick learner and have excellent software development skills. You must also be a great communicator and excel at working in a highly collaborative and cross-functional environment. There is no shortage of opportunities to shape the future of our product.

item.title: Platform Architect @ Backbase at Backbase (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
The Platform Architect is a member of the Backbase Products team, a multidisciplinary team of experienced and highly skilled UX designers, software developers, test engineers, technical writers and support engineers. The team is responsible for the entire software development life cycle of our digital banking product suite, including out-of-the-box portal solutions.


You will contribute to the quality of our software products, helping to realize successful customer implementations by our Professional Services consultants and Integration Partners. We work in Scrum teams in order to deliver new functionality in every release, closely cooperating with Product Managers and the Professional Services team.


As part of the Products team, you will report to the VP of Software Design, and will support one of our tribes in developing new functionality for the Backbase platform.


You are overall technically responsible for the tribe, you make sure the software architects are aligned to ensure alignment across R&D, and with platform architects of other tribes, developers, testers and other team members to ensure the technical vision is known and used during development activities. You drive technology innovation and refactoring initiatives. People turn to you for advice based on your sound experience and deep technical understanding of software development, practices and frameworks.

item.title: Front-end Technical Trainer @ Backbase at Backbase (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Do you want to become a member of the youngest team within our fast expanding company?


Backbase has been growing incredibly fast in the fintech market, more people use our platform and the demand for expert training is increasing.


You have done your fair share of programming and your ambitions have grown beyond your coding skills. The next career step is to share your knowledge and enable fellow developers all over the world to become power users of the Backbase framework.


If you value classroom dynamics just as much as after-work socialising and travelling abroad, this could be your dream job. You’re the ambassador of the product, course developer and blogger on best practices. As an Academy Trainer, your role exceeds the job title.


What will you be doing?


You really want people to understand the product, and therefore you truly adapt to your audience wherever you are and whoever is in front of you. You will travel a lot, and you will partake in multiple training sessions on-site or at home. The curriculum of the course is in constant evolution, and together with your team members you develop and adjust the training programme. And don’t worry, you do get to code as well.


In this unique position, where you drive the enthusiasm to work with the Backbase platform among developers, you amaze with your technical skills as much as your talent for social empowerment. You know your course schedule, but it will never run the same way twice. New hires, technical departments of banks, and teams of developers at partner side are your trainees. It’s up to you to establish a connection the moment you walk through the door. Upon leaving the classroom, everyone is equipped and inspired to become premium product users.

item.description:

Backbase has been growing incredibly fast in the fintech market, more people use our platform and the demand for expert training is increasing.

item.title: Linux Software Architect - Infotainment Head Unit (f/m) (112913) at BMW Group (Ulm, Deutschland)
item.description:
YOU CAN’T PREDICT THE FUTURE. BUT YOU CAN PROGRAMME IT.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR DEVELOPING SOFTWARE.


To revolutionise the future of mobility, one has to go ahead and set standards today. Intelligent technologies that are increasingly taking over driving tasks and providing greater safety and comfort are already in use in our vehicles. Increasing our lead in autonomous driving will need visionary thinkers and creative developers. Specialists in the fields of machine learning, artificial intelligence, sensor technology and software development will work in expert teams, in centres centres of excellence networked around the world, to redefine the limits of what is possible.


Linux Software Architect - Infotainment Head Unit (f/m)


BMW Car IT GmbH lives and breathes software. As a fully-owned subsidiary of BMW AG we are a cornerstone in the company´s transition into the next 100 years where software plays a crucial role. One of our many areas of activity is the development of BMW next-generation Linux-based infotainment
head unit systems: a hyper-connected multimedia information and entertainment hub in the car. As Linux Software Architect (f/m) you are the main technical leader for a set of system infrastructure SW components under your responsibility. Your main task consists in defining SW designs which are in line with the overall product architecture and are fulfilling system requirements. For your components, you ensure that transversal aspects such as reusability, stability, performance, security and cost effectiveness are permanently considered in the software design process. In order to achieve these targets, you support the Principal Engineers and SW developers in their daily development activities and ultimately approve or reject
code deliveries for your domain.


Skills & Requirements



  • A successfully completed degree in Computer Science or a similar field of study at university/FH level (BEng/BSc/MSc/PhD).

  • Strong overall architectural understanding of Linux based embedded systems.

  • Multiple years of experience in embedded SW development.

  • Very good knowledge of C++ and/or C programming.

  • Good knowledge of Linux tools for SW analysis, debugging and tracing.

  • Excellent teamwork and communication skills.

  • Self-driven, able to embrace complex SW topic and to work independently.

item.title: Oracle Application Developer (m/f) at MYTOYS GROUP (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
As an Oracle Application Developer  (m/f) you work autonomously in an international agile team. Within the framework of projects you develop and configure the company processes on our innovative ERP system (Oracle eBusiness Suite). In the course of your work you cooperate intensively with professional users, advise them, meet their requirements in a professional manner and receive direct feedback in a collegial atmosphere. You have a wide range of responsibilities which includes work in all stages of the software development process. You try out new methods, work with the latest Oracle technologies and expand your know-how in dialogue with other IT professionals.


Skills & Requirements



  • A successfully completed degree in (business) mathematics, informatics or business administration with good / very good marks

  • Several years of experience in Oracle Database Development (PL/SQL)

  • Ideally adept in Oracle Forms, APEX and/or JAVA

  • Analytical thinking and outstanding problem-solving skills

  • Ideally experience in all stages of the software development process

  • Very good English, German as a plus

item.title: Data Analyst - Agoda Hring Now! Bangkok at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
item.description:
Agoda is seeking talented data analysts to join multiple team's within Agoda, we have a range of roles open for persons straight out of university to experienced senior data handlers.

Please note due to visa restrictions we can only accept international applications with 2+ years experience. For Thai candidate's straight out of university or with 1-2 years experience within data analysis we have a range of roles we'd love to speak to you about.

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a start-up and the capital to make things happen. What's stopping you from getting in touch?

Bangkok: While it's 30+ outside, our team don't sweat, knowing they have the coolest jobs out there. Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe.

We move fast - why wait for ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, Agoda people come from over 74 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

Technology is not just what we do - it's at the heart of who we are. We put cutting-edge technology in your hands so you can help us change the way people run their lives. We want you to come here so they can get there - and get your career going places, too.

Responsibilities:
  • Provide problems and analysis results with valuable insights for management
  • Work closely with Business to identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using different techniques and tools such as R studio or Tableau
  • Analyse and optimise data usage, and precise for more data capturing if needed
  • Propose actionable solutions and options to solve problems


Qualifications:
  • Bachelor Degree in Computer Science/Statistics/Math or Engineering
  • 0-5 years in Data Analyst position or otherwise in projects involving big data (0 - 2 yrs exp Thai applications only)
  • Proficient in business intelligence tools and data warehouse i.e. T-SQL commands, Tableau and MS Excel
  • Must be data savvy and love crunching numbers
  • Strong analytical skills and excellent demonstrative ability in collection of data and analysis of trends in order to predict the conclusions and recommendations
  • Experience in R studio and data modelling is a plus
  • Fluent in English with strong communication skills


Please note due to visa restrictions we can only accept international applications with 2+ years experience. For Thai candidate's straight out of university or with 1-2 years experience within data analysis we have a range of roles we'd love to speak to you about.

Visa & relocation assistance available for international candidates - Please send us your CV today!

item.title: Lead Ruby Developer - help us build a disruptive gig economy startup! at Zone (London, UK)
item.description:
Do you want to lead a development team and help shape a product as it hits mass adoption? Come join our team at Zone and help us build a disruptive gig economy startup coordinating e-commerce, logistics, staff and customers. We’re looking for Lead Ruby Developer to work within a friendly team and write beautiful code. You will join a team of exceptional developers working in a fast-paced environment to deliver world-class software.


Main responsibilities



  • Lead a full-stack development team to build a combined web / mobile app based on Ruby microservices

  • Work with our technical director and the customer to set overall development priorities and make architectural and coding recommendations

  • Keeping abreast of the latest technologies and techniques, and helping spread them to the rest of the team

  • Mentor other team members

  • Write clean, tested, maintainable and efficient Ruby code

  • Build out Rails API-based microservices in a greenfield codebase

  • Design and build robust, scalable and secure features

  • Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle

  • Follow best practices (test-driven development, continuous integration, continuous delivery, refactoring and code standards

  • Working within a great agile team


Requirements 



  • Takes responsibility for problem solving, in both the technical and non-technical realm

  • Proven work experience as a Ruby on Rails developer

  • Some knowledge of front-end technologies for basic layout purposes when working on the Rails-based the admin client

  • Experience developing highly interactive Ruby applications with mobile clients

  • Microservices experience is a bonus

  • A firm grasp of object oriented analysis and design

  • Passion for writing great, simple, clean, efficient code

  • Good knowledge of relational databases

item.title: Full Stack Senior Software Engineer - Agoda - Bangkok at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
item.description:
A life less ordinary.



We're not just talking about the location; as Asia's fastest growing ecommerce hotel booking platform and the biggest pure Tech company in Thailand, you'll use every last ounce of your Engineering talent at Agoda!

This exciting opportunity is full-time, permanent based in Bangkok, Thailand!

Relocation support and visa sponsorship available for international candidates.

The Job

In essence you'll be responsible for the complete scope, design, build and testing of products and features for one of Asia's fastest growing e-commerce websites. As a part of the Agoda .net Engineering team, you will be exposed to numerous innovative technologies in the fields of data-processing, big data, efficient data storage structures, recommender systems / machine learning, natural language processing, and many more. Whichever technology we work with, it must operate at the performance needs of a hyper-scale infrastructure operating at thousands of requests per second.

If you have an Architect-level appreciation of system design and love to code come join us!

You'll be involved in the technical stuff, coding, hands-on but also working with design patterns, complex solutions design, implementation, devops, deployment, testing and much more. We're highly scalable and performance driven in our approach and our website is a best in class ecommerce solution that is highly user-centric and customer driven.

You'll be working across the full stack, including backend, front end, servers, web services, technology agnostic polyvalent programming & coding. It's a high traffic high transaction site with millions of daily unique visitors and we need your architectural, Engineering and coding expertise to help revolutionise the industry! Other techs / frameworks you'll use include html, css, react.js, bootstrap, knockout.js, ember.js, backbone, Javascript, jvm, caching, server side mvc, multithreading, TDD & BDD, object-oriented programming, continuous integration (Jenkins / docker), angularjs, react, mongoDB, UI concepts, XML API, test automation - it's all about scalability, performance, security and user experience

This covers search, SEO, orders, payment, check out, basket, booking form as you create readable, repeatable code and manage your codebase with pride to develop our .net ecommerce platform and ecommerce offering to build something amazing! What's more aws cloud-based datacenter experience is awesome, including any distributed systems, data structures, restful services, nosql and more.

What about Bangkok?

A big question, one we've answered many times before. Truly 'International' is one word to describe our Engineering Team here in Bangkok.

'Interesting', 'fun', 'friendly' and 'supportive' are among the other comments we've heard. And with 'all the latest toys' (tech) at your fingertips, Agoda's a great platform to push your career to the next level! Plus with a great salary package, the biggest decision you'll have to make is whether to have a Suburban Pad or City Condo

We spare no expense when it comes to the best technologies, nor do we pull any punches in relation to your workspace and office perks. Our offices are based in Central World - Thailand's ultra-modern business & leisure complex; right in the heart of the buzzing Bangkok metropolis.

With relocation support and visa sponsorship available we've got you covered, leaving you free to look forward to an amazing new experience!

About You.

We're looking for Engineers not just programmers. This means you're not tied down to a specific programming language, you adapt as the solution demands and can pick up new tech in no time.

You may well have worked on a raft of different projects before but you'll have the same enquiring mind and hunger for knowledge and to make things better for the end user.
  • Strong commercial experience with design principles and design patterns
  • Your technical expertise covers one of the following:
    • master in Java, C#, Scala, F# with some frontend coding expertise OR
    • you're a wizard on the MEAN stack OR
    • You've got amazing expertise on front end technologies like React.js and other modern frameworks, with strong OOP skills in PHP etc and willing to pick up the Microsoft stack
  • You have a deep level of Engineering experience through the stack and have touched on many elements that translate well to full e-commerce software architecture
  • You take full ownership of whatever you're building, and see it through to completion
  • You're confident in your ability
  • And passionate about your work (but not afraid to let others in to help too)
  • Your expertise spans the full SDLC thru' concept, design, build, test (automation if poss) and deployment
  • Your natural Engineering-mindset considers problem, solution and alternative in equal measure
  • The end user is at the heart of what you do, as is the commercial value to Agoda
  • You have a progressive outlook - TDD, BDD, Agile are second nature to you
  • You love working in a Change environment with fewer formal processes
  • Able and willing to test your own work and create automated tests along the way


Interested?

Get in touch and apply now!

Doubtless you'll have many unanswered questions; we'd expect nothing less after all an enquiring mind is what we're looking for. But fear not there's plenty of chance to discuss when we talk.

item.title: Senior Automation QA Engineer at Badoo (London, UK)
item.description:
Badoo is looking for an experienced Senior Automation QA Engineer for Android, iOS and Mobile Web to join our expanding mobile automation QA team. You will be responsible for developing & executing automated tests for mobile applications, and working closely with the development team to ensure the applications are of high quality. You should be open to learning new things, get in-depth into tools , in a fast-paced agile environment.  


RESPONSIBILITIES/JOB ROLE




    • Prepare automation test cases for Android, iOS & Mobile Web mobile applications

    • Find maintainable solutions to complex problems like mocking in-app purchases for Android and iOS, and interacting with third-party/system applications like Twitter, Instagram and Contacts

    • Set up and optimise automation projects with Continuous Integration

    • Minimise the manual efforts in application testing and delivery

    • Seek ongoing self-improvement through knowledge of advancements in test tools and techniques, with a view to improving Badoo QA infrastructure and processes

    • Prioritise own workload effectively in a pressurised and fast paced environment



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS




    • Extensive experience with test automation tools such as Appium, Calabash, Selenium, UIAutomator2, Espresso, XCTool

    • Experience with programming languages like Ruby (e.g. Java & Python)

    • Good understanding of mobile platforms ecosystem

    • Good working knowledge of Unix command line

    • Knowledge of BDD, Cucumber/RSpec, Git, Jenkins/TeamCity desirable 

    • Ideally more than 4 years test automation experience, coupled with development experience

    • Demonstrable experience working closely with development and manual QA teams



About You:




    • Self-motivated and able to achieve deadlines and work independently

    • Strong interpersonal skills and team-working capability

    • Passionate about technology and testing

    • A problem solver who thinks laterally both as part of a team or individually

item.title: Low-Latency Systems Engineer at Optiver (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Within trading, having the best IT solutions is the only way to be successful as a market maker on electronic markets. Which hardware to use, how to use it, the software setup; everything has to be perfect. Our trading infrastructure is a web of distributed systems spanning various locations across the world. Huge amounts of data and low latency systems come together in ways previously unimaginable.


Skills & Requirements


We are looking for engineers who consider this puzzle an interesting challenge. You get to know your systems inside-out, aware of every little detail that matters. You like autonomy in your job; you are the expert, you decide.


The first step in the process of applying for this job is an online (HackerRank) test assessing your engineering mindset and (python) coding skills. No prior trading knowledge needed.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Planday (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:

As a devops engineer you will be a key contributor to the development of Planday's devops and infrastructure function that bridges the gap between operations and development. You will ensure that everyone has an understanding of operational requirements, and take shared responsibility for designing and implementing infrastructure for delivering and running software services.

You will primarily operate as a hands on engineer, developing mechanisms to build, test, deploy and maintain plandays systems which are primarily .NET based, but also incorporate open source technologies such as Couchbase, React.js, Backbone.js, Gulp, etc. Our primary servers are windows, with linux being used for some of our caching and infrastrucuture needs.

You will also be providing a lot of input in how we manage our infrastructure, and which technologies to use.

Due to the companys growth and international ambitions, you will also play a key role in scaling out our infrastructure using both on premise and cloud services.


The culture at Planday is very dynamic and as a devops engineer your main tasks and responsibilities will be:

  • developing and maintaining plandays internal development infrastructure and networking
  • the development and maintenance of production infrastructure and networks
  • participate in discussions about architecture, scalability, security, development, methods, tools, etc.
  • champion modern build, deployment, and release practices
  • keep all teams operational from a technical perspective, whilst empowering teams to be self sufficient

Benefits


WHAT WE OFFER:

  • A key part of an exciting international growth journey
  • Opportunities to learn and develop your skills and career through hackathons, meetups, colleagues and other places.
  • Great colleagues and a social working environment
  • Great location in central Copenhagen
  • Lots of team and community events

About Planday

Planday is a SaaS (Software as a Service) Workforce Management solution that empowers managers and employees to work smarter. Planday is used by different sized companies in a variety of industries such as restaurants, hotels, retailers, call centers, fitness clubs, etc with a total of 100,000 users onboard. March 2016, Planday closed its Series B funding round of $14 million from French Idinvest and Nordic VC Creandum, an early backer of music streaming service Spotify, amongst many other investments, SEB Private Equity, and angel investor Arthur Kosten, co-founder of Booking.com. Planday will use the Series B funds to expand further into the US, strengthen its leadership in the European market, and develop integrations with other technologies that support shift-based businesses, including payroll providers, find and hire services, and Epos technologies.

We live and die by our company values, which means we're ready to go the extra mile to meet our customers' needs. But we also love to have a good time together. Our Copenhagen headquarters are three floors of cool, loft-style office space, and we're based in the heart of this beautiful city's startup community.

With over 10 different nationalities across our five global offices, we have a fun and multicultural work environment. Our company language is English, but we're always trying to pick up a couple of phrases in each other's languages.

PLEASE NOTE: Danish work permit is required and you need to be situated in or in close proximity to Copenhagen

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

a10:author.a10:name: Spartez Sp. z o.o. sp. k.

item.title: Java Developer at Spartez Sp. z o.o. sp. k. (Gdask, Poland)
item.description:
We're looking for developers who are passionate about writing great software, have a love for solving difficult problems, enjoy learning about new technologies and contributing to products used by millions of people.


If you:



  • Have knowledge of writing robust and reliable systems

  • Can ensure performance, quality and security aspects while building a product that delivers an awesome user experience

  • Enjoy discussing innovative ideas and code with your peers, coming up with great product solutions, and passing on your knowledge to others


Then we are the place for you!


What you will do:



  • Engage with other developers, front-end designers, product managers, and performance engineers

  • Liaise with technical leads and architects to promote great software design and quality

  • Drive innovation by coming up with new and surprising ideas for our products and processes

  • Develop awesome new features front-end to back-end as part of a team

  • Point out issues with the existing architecture and code, and clean it up


What we expect from you:



  • Excellent understanding and working knowledge of Java (However, if you're a strong developer with experience of building products, have used other OOP languages and have exposure to Java, we'd still like to hear from you!)

  • Deep architectural understanding of web applications

  • Good knowledge in some back-end technologies such as Spring, Hibernate, Lucene, SQL

  • Superior creative and innovative problem-solving skills

  • Initiative, and the ability to work independently and as part of a team

  • Excellent communication skills with fluent English (both spoken and written)


Preferred skills:



  • Knowledge of some of the standard front-end technologies such as CSS, JavaScript (we use JQuery), REST and JSON

  • Knowledge of open-source libraries, tools, and frameworks, e.g. for logging, wiring, testing, and building. The more the merrier!

  • Excitement for the latest trends in application design

  • Experience with agile software development methodologies like XP and Scrum

  • Interest in learning more about new languages and frameworks


From Senior Developers we additionally expect the following super-powers:



  • Broad knowledge and understanding of the industry

  • Wide experience of successful and failed projects

  • Ability to slice and dice problems so they can be worked on by several people

  • Desire and ability to mentor junior developers

  • Relaxed yet enthusiastic attitude

  • 5 to 10 years (or more) in a professional development role


What we can offer you:



  • Thousands of interesting customers, including NASA, Sony, and the United Nations

  • The opportunity to grow around people from Gdansk, Sydney, San Francisco and Amsterdam 

  • Impact! Atlassian tools are used by millions of users around the world

  • Education Bonus: 5000 PLN/year (you choose what kind of training you would like to spend it on)

  • Ergonomic and user friendly equipment (computers, standing desks, and Aeron® chairs)

  • Fully stocked kitchen (coffee, tea, yogurts, cornflakes, soft drinks, sweets at your disposal)

  • 20% of your normal working time for PET projects

  • ShipiIt Hackathons 

  • Mulitsport card - 50% covered by Spartez

  • Private medical healthcare

  • Life insurance


Remuneration



  • 5800 - 9200 PLN gross per month for junior positions

  • 9200 - 13700 PLN gross per month for mid positions

  • 13700 - 17800 PLN gross per month for senior positions

item.title: Django Engineer (m/f) for Germany's leading local marketing platform at RegioHelden GmbH (Stuttgart, Deutschland)
item.description:
Heroic deeds, tasks & responsibilities



  • As an engineering hero you will participate in all phases of the software development cycle from product definition and design through implementation, documentation and training

  • Continuously develop our intranet and workflow management system

  • Develop and improve our tools for business process automation and workflow optimization

  • Train employees on internal tools and systems

  • Develop superhero gadgets to supercharge our products

  • Be involved in technical decisions


Skills & Requirements



  • Relevant professional experience in Python and Django

  • Experience with relational databases and the usual web development technologies

  • Experience with Celery, RabbitMQ, Sentry and Jenkins a plus

  • Experience with Google AdWords or other Google APIs a plus

  • Experience building (fully functional) time machines will already have you hired yesterday

  • Heroic properties: integrity, engagement, fun at work and the desire to work together to achieve awesome things!


Heroic Benefits



  • Flat hierarchy and independent work

  • Personal and professional development in a dynamic team

  • Visit conferences (e.g. DjangoCon, PyCon, etc.) to enhance and deepen expert knowledge

  • Major contribution to the successful corporate development

  • Exceptional offices (e.g. free drinks, breakfast, football table, darts, etc.) and regular team events

  • Support moving to Germany and getting you started in your new life (e.g. work permit, bank account, apartment, etc.)


Apply now!


Exactly your kind of thing? Start your cover letter with the sentence “I am your new Django Hero, because…”. Send your cover letter, CV, salary requirements (EUR), as well as your date of entry with our online application form.


HR-Hero: Tanja
Any questions? For further informations please call
+49 711 128 501-888

item.title: C# Softwareentwickler (w/m) fr HMI at TRUMPF Werkzeugmaschinen GmbH + Co. KG (Ludwigsburg, Germany)
item.description:
C# Softwareentwickler (w/m) fr HMI



Das Hochtechnologieunternehmen TRUMPF bietet Fertigungslsungen in den Bereichen Werkzeugmaschinen, Lasertechnik und Elektronik. Die digitale Vernetzung der fertigenden Industrie treiben wir durch Beratung, Plattform- und Softwareangebote voran. Als Familienunternehmen denken und handeln wir langfristig. Unser Gestaltungswille macht uns zum Garant fr kontinuierliche Innovationskraft.



Ihre Aufgaben




  • Konzeption, Architektur, Weiterentwicklung und Pflege einer C# Applikation (HMI), welche technologiebergreifend zur Bedienung von TRUMPF Werkzeugmaschinen eingesetzt wird

  • Mitarbeit in einem interdisziplinren Scrum Team sowie Abstimmung der Schnittstellen mit anderen Entwicklungsabteilungen (z.B. SPS, NC, CAD/ CAM-Entwicklung, Cloud Services)

  • Untersttzung von internen Anwendern und des Servicebereichs bei Kundenproblemen

  • Bereitstellen von Daten und Funktionalitten fr die Industrie 4.0-Fhigkeit von TRUMPF Maschinen

  • Sicherstellung der Qualittsanforderungen mittels manueller und standardisierter Tests



Anforderungen




  • Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik/ Softwaretechnik oder des Ingenieurwesens mit Schwerpunkt Softwareentwicklung sowie Berufserfahrung in der agilen Softwareentwicklung

  • Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse in C# und .NET sowie idealerweise Erfahrung mit WPF und XAML

  • Hohes Qualittsbewusstsein und Begeisterung fr agile Entwicklungsmethoden

  • Spa an selbststndiger und eigenverantwortlicher Arbeitsweise

  • Gute Englischkenntnisse



Als Familienunternehmen ermglichen wir Ihnen interessante berufliche Perspektiven, eigenverantwortliches Handeln, attraktive Arbeitszeitmodelle und Freirume fr neue Ideen. Auf Ihre Onlinebewerbung freut sich Frau Bischler aus dem Personalbereich.
