item.title: Front-end Developer @ Backbase at Backbase (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Backbase products are used by people like you and I every single day. What we do impacts the banking experience of millions worldwide. Maintaining and developing our platform requires dedication, ownership and vision.


As a Front-end Developer, it is your core responsibility, together with your team, to maintain and extend components of the Backbase platform. In the seemingly dusty banking business, outstanding innovation is occurring. That’s why we develop new features and constantly release updates in two-week sprints.


It’s up to you to take our product to the next level and adapt to new technology. Your eye for functionality and convenience is excellent. The knowledge that what you build will be used all over the world (and will for years to come) is why you deliver only your best work.


What will you be doing?


Being part of a scrum team, you dedicate yourself every day to the maintenance and development of the Backbase front-end platform. You will engage in daily stand-ups, during which you and your fellow team members will discuss the work to be done, and priorities. We expect you to create your own vision and initiate improvements.


You provide the best possible user experience. The devil is in the detail, and nothing escapes your sight. You take ownership of the technical design and development of software. The code that write is beautiful and solid. We love maintainable code. We’re building a product that’s expanding, and we’re not even halfway yet. You want your code to last for many years to come.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer - (Java/ Scala/ Clojure/ Python/ Go) at Zalando SE (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility. With the set of principles that we give our teams - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust them to shape the future of Zalando. You will be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.


What makes your individual impact at Zalando limitless is the possibility to tackle and create new opportunities. At Zalando, it is not only about growth and improvement - it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue. We strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.


The Helsinki Tech Hub is growing fast.. We already outgrew our first offices in Punavuori and recently moved into custom designed premises in Kampii, right in the heart of Helsinki. The new office offers a fantastic work space where you can have a real impact on the world of e-commerce working with a great bunch of talented individuals (if we do say so ourselves!)


You Are Setting Standards 


Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will join one of our 90+ teams to build, scale and continuously improve a variety of products that create value for our platform.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


 Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.


Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Recommendation & Personalization (Java, Big Data) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY

As a software engineer in the area of "Recommendation & Personalization" you are working on Zalando state-of-the-art recommendation systems serving millions of customers with highly relevant and personalized content. You will be working with the newest technologies to build a SAAS component which can be fully leveraged within our Zalando platform.



Your main challenges will include working with large amounts of data, deliver high-quality recommendation results and at the same time provide a low-latency, rock solid and auto-scaling production system. You will be part of an autonomous and highly ambitious team consisting of experienced software engineers and expert data scientists working on the cutting-edge every day.


WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR



  • You have 4+ years of experience, working as a (Java or Scala) developer. A technical degree is a plus

  • You have in-depth experience of working with data-driven recommendation solutions, including creating, implementing, and tuning recommendation engines

  • You have worked with current Big Data technology (e.g. Hadoop/MapReduce)

  • You are experienced in building and deploying large-scale, distributed data-driven systems in a cloud environment

  • You are keen on collaborating closely with Data Scientists & Data Analysts and have passion to solve algorithmic problems

  • You have a keen interest in Data Mining & Processing as well as applied Machine Learning

  • You’ve worked with NoSQL databases before (e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB) and ideally also have experience in search engines (Solr, Elasticsearch)

  • You write well-structured and tested code in the spirit of Effective Java and Clean Code that easily scales to enterprise level

  • You love to improve & optimize software and to use new technologies

  • Knowledge of near-realtime stream processing and/or message-driven architectures (e.g. Spark, Storm, Aerospike, Kafka) is a plus

  • Experience with Cloud Computing platforms such as AWS is a plus


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • You will be part of an agile and very experienced team that will further develop our recommender systems in short release cycles

  • You will build and operate all services and stream-processed data infrastructure for low-latency personalized recommendations

  • You will implement highly-scalable solutions with state-of-the-art-technologies together with your team

  • You are ready to tweak and optimize our recommendations for various markets all across Europe for millions of customers

  • You will transfer algorithmic prototypes to enterprise level, highly-scalable and fault-tolerant solutions using the right technology for the job

  • You are collaborating with our data scientists to improve and extend our recommendation engine and other analytical customer experience solutions

  • You will be part of a multi-cultural team with different native languages, skills and backgrounds

  • Design, develop, deploy, operate and improve software solutions that impact millions of Zalando customers


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US


Community. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties and events.


Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.


Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences and meetups, and encouragement to publish work.


Work Environment. Self-organized,  autonomous teams and flexible working hours.


Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.




WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!

item.title: Embedded Software Engineers required to work in Software Defined Networking at Arista Networks Limited (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Arista Networks is looking for great Software Engineers interested in product development in C/C++ and Go to join the team in Dublin advancing the Software Defined Networking (SDN) revolution. Arista is a profitable, publicly quoted company with 2016 revenues expected to­­­­­ exceed $1B. Arista is the number 2 vendor for data centre switches in the world with over 4000 customers including such well known names as Facebook, Netflix and Spotify.


Some recent highlights



  • In May 2016, Gartner positioned Arista in the 'Leaders' quadrant of the Magic Quadrant for Data Center Networking.

  • Arista switches powered video transmission in both the Euro 2016 football championship and the Rio Olympics.

  • Jayshree Ullal (Arista CEO) and Andy Bechtolsheim (Founder) won the 2015 Ernst and Young entrepreneur of the year in the USA.


Dublin R&D


Arista opened the Dublin R&D office in the IFSC in 2015, and has ambitious plans to continue growing the Dublin team across all areas of Software Engineering.


Some interesting projects that we're currently working on in Dublin include:



  • Writing Linux user space and kernel code to allow 32-bit drivers to DMA 64-bit virtual memory spaces using both Intel and AMD IOMMU controller.

  • Accessing ASIC registers over SPI bus, SMbus, PCIe and I2C, to implement high resolution timers (sub-100ns accuracy) and read ASIC hardware specifications to gather near-real-time information on large numbers of packet flows and to generate network congestion statistics.

  • Development of configuration management services using Go and Python to support YANG, OpenConfig, NETCONF and RESTCONF over gRPC, ssh and ssl for standardised switch configuration, combined with tools such as git, gerrit, Jenkins, Slack and Trello.

  • Creating a streaming telemetry service for networking devices that will send real-time state updates from the switch to cloud-based data ingestion infrastructure. We work in Go creating gRPC and REST based services. We use modern development tools such as git, gerrit, Jenkins, Trello and we deploy our backend in a cluster using Kubernetes and docker containers.

  • Development of routing protocol agents (for BGP, OSPF, ISIS) in C/C++ within a Fedora Linux embedded environment. Coding of fault-tolerant, concurrent agents capable of handling the demands of future data centres where high performance and high availability are basic requirements. Fully automated, developer owned, Python based, continuous test harness with 100s of devices under test at any one moment.


Engineering Driven


One of the many attractions of joining Arista is that from the top Arista is an engineering company. The founders and engineering managers are all engineers who understand good software engineering and the importance of doing things right.


Arista hires directly into the broader team, regardless of geography. The languages we program in are primarily C, C++, python and Go, but if you aren’t an expert in any of these don’t let that stop you from speaking with us.


Our engineers have full ownership of their projects. Our management structure is flat and lightweight. Software engineering is run by software engineers who are in charge of delivering features from concept through to completion. We put a premium on building and using test automation tools.


No part of the company is off-limits, meaning that our engineers have the chance to work on a variety of different areas. If you have opinions on emacs vs vi, delve vs gdb, keyboard vs mouse, then you will find many like-minded developers at Arista.


Arista is headquartered in Santa Clara, California and has development offices in the US, Canada, India and Ireland. Arista treats all R&D centres on par with each other.



  • Arista is a software company with a unique culture building data centre switches done right.

  • Arista is hiring software developers to build products that will drive the networks of the future.

  • Arista is looking for developers who primarily enjoy writing code, solving problems and who appreciate a culture of invention, quality, respect and fun.

item.title: Application Security Engineer at Blackbaud (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Leading uniquely at the intersection point of technology and social good, Blackbaud provides software, services, expertise, and data intelligence that empowers and connects people to advance the social good movement. We serve the entire social good community, which includes nonprofits, foundation, corporations, education institutions, and the individual change agents who support them. We work with over 35,000 organizations, helping them realize their goals, fund their missions, manage their operations, and develop long-lasting supporter relationships.  Our customers are passionate about making the world a better place, and we’re inspired by the opportunity to help them.


About the role:


The Application Security Engineer is a specialized position on our Information Security team that plays a key role in securing all software built and/or used by Blackbaud.  You’ll work closely with application development teams and third-party organizations to ensure that security, privacy, and compliance constraints are built into the applications. In addition to securing applications you’ll develop and/or purchase tools to enhance the security processes and systems throughout the Software Development Lifecycle at Blackbaud.


We are looking for individuals who are passionate about identifying solutions for common security problems while participating in security reviews/audits and multi-component projects. You’ll be making an impact by promoting, designing, and evaluating application security in all phases of the application life cycle.


What you’ll be doing:



  • Performing vulnerability assessments and code reviews as well as developing tools to enhance & automate our security systems/processes

  • Recommending & creating security standards & guidelines

  • Assessing application risks and partnering with development teams to recommend mitigation strategies

  • Responding to security incidents and developing operations to detect potential incidents


What we’ll want you to have:



  • College degree in Computer Science, Information Security, Information Technology or equivalent professional experience with a minimum of ten (10) years (in excess of degree requirements stated above) of progressively responsible experience in the development of applications using various popular languages with at least five (5) years of formal experience in application security.

  • Certification in highly technical application security or application security disciplines such as: CSSLP, CASS, GWEB, GWAPT, GPEN, CEH, CISSP

  • Understanding of the full Software Development Lifecycle & expert understanding of web application technologies

  • Knowledge and understanding of ethical hacking and how it can help companies understand vulnerability gaps

  • Well-versed in security protocols as well as in software security techniques


Why you’ll want to come work here: 



  • Competitive salary (commission/bonus based on type of role), 4 weeks paid time off, great benefits (medical, dental, vision, FSA), 401K

  • Gift matching, volunteer for vacation program, and endless community involvement opportunities

  • Named to Forbes’ Fast Tech 25 and Fortune’s Change the World List; we are growing and offer incredible opportunity for advancement

  • Tremendous company culture and office perks like onsite gym, free snacks, café, and cutting-edge new headquarters to be completed in 2018

  • Check us out for yourself on The Muse!


Stay up to date on everything Blackbaud, follow us on Linkedin, Twitter and Facebook.  


Blackbaud is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.


#HelpGoodTakeOver

item.title: Principal Software Development Engineer - Compliance and Security at Chef Software (Belfast, UK)
item.description:
Chef is building the best infrastructure automation platform on the planet. We’re writing the rules of the cloud -- rules the world’s top engineers live, breathe and contribute to. Our platform is used to enable hundreds of millions of people around the world to chat, fly, present, bank, game, shop, and learn. Chances are the web applications you use everyday have infrastructure built, deployed, secured and managed with our code.


The partner engineering team is a fast moving and highly technical group responsible for designing and building the right product integrations with our Ecosystem partners. These range from the major hyperscale clouds like AWS, Microsoft and Google to a wide range of enterprise software vendors. Integration with our ecosystem partners is key to the successful adoption of Chef within an enterprise, as such you will play an integral role in the success of the company.


You would be a engineering leader in the team building content to allow enterprises to meet their compliance and audit requirements using InSpec and Chef Automate.  


WHO YOU ARE:



  • You’ve spent the last few years working with a range of Cloud Technologies and DevOps tools to deliver projects and solutions

  • You have experience taking the lead role in designing and implementing complex technical solutions for Cloud based solutions and complex software architectures

  • You have solid software development skills with experience in (one or more of) Ruby, Erlang, Python, Go, C/C++, C# or Java

  • Expertise with Linux and Windows operations and networking is a given

  • You like to dive in, learn new things, and want to build awesome productsYou can demonstrate deep knowledge for languages and technology stacks that you've worked with

  • Previous experience (8+ years) as a software engineer, technical consultant or partner engineerPrevious experience working in a security focused engineering role a plus

  • You’ll enjoy collaborating closely with Chef Customers and Partner teams to understand their complex issues, solve their problems and elicit frequent feedback on the solutions you provide

  • You believe quality is part of the process and not an afterthought

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline, or equivalent experience, is required


WHAT YOU’LL DO:



  • Become an expert and advocate on our Inspec Compliance Tool to ensure its usage by customers remaining compliant and secure in an ever changing DevOps landscape

  • Lead and mentor other engineers in developing InSpec profiles for common OS hardening and regulatory compliance standards

  • Create tooling and infrastructure to allow Chef to assert the high quality of such profiles that are created

  • Support open source contributors, new and experienced, with supportive and constructive code review, documentation improvements, and workflow changes

  • Advocate and support improvements to our APIs and improvements with core development and integration of our partners

  • Work on issues and improvements in our tools critical to the success of Chef’s customers and the broader Chef community



Work isn’t just about work though. We offer competitive salaries, equity, fantastic benefits, and flexible hours.  You’ll also get to work with some of the most down to earth, driven, intelligent and well read developers in their fields!  


Our Belfast site is growing and we want to ensure we create a team with a diverse worldview.  That are excited to build a high quality DevOps engineering environment that's an exciting, enjoyable and creative place to work.


If this sounds like a team you’d enjoy working with and technology you want to spend time on, for a product you can get behind, get in touch!


At Chef, we celebrate and support our differences. We know employing a team rich in diverse thoughts, experiences, and opinions allows our employees, our products and our community to flourish. Chef is honored to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation or Veteran status.

item.title: JS Frontend Engineer at Europes most popular home & living shopping platform at Home24 AG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Do you feel like the work you do makes a difference and moves the business in a meaningful way? Are you interested in building software used by millions of customers? Do you like writing performant, high quality code at a rapid pace? If you answered yes to these questions, you could be just the person we’re looking for to join our team at Home24.


We are looking for a great Senior Frontend Engineer who is passionate about developing customer-facing front end solutions that will deliver a great user experience - whether you’re on your smartphone, tablet or home computer. In joining our team you will get the opportunity to work on some of the most interesting and challenging problems we can offer. This position is full-time and based in our cool office in Berlin.


Responsibilities



  • Build beautiful, fast,efficient and reusable frontend solutions

  • Build prototypes and proof of concepts to demonstrate emerging technologies

  • Working with product managers and UX designers to implement the next generation of the Home24 e-commerce experience

  • Use RESTful APIs for communication with our backend services

  • Work in a small agile team collaborating with designers and other engineers taking features from concept to production

  • Identify and adopt best practices for software and front-end engineering

  • Make demos for the whole company to share achievements


What we can offer you



  • Opportunity to use state of the art front end development tools

  • Become a part of a highly motivated world class team of technology professionals

  • An open culture to learn, share new ideas, solve hard problems and opportunity to demonstrate your creativity to make a real difference

  • Opportunities for advancement, independence and the autonomy to take on responsibility

  • Benefits including relocation support, employee discount, team events, free fruit, drinks and much more


Skills & Requirements


Skills you should have



  • Expert knowledge of JavaScript and web technologies (HTML5/CSS3); 4+ years of experience in building web applications

  • Ability to write high-performance, reusable code for the UI

  • Working experience with React.Js, preferably with REDUX and ES2015

  • Working experience with Javascript testing, component testing and acceptance testing

  • Familiar with the use of RESTful APIs in modern Frontend Applications

  • You are passionate about mobile first thinking and development (responsive / adaptive)


Skills that are nice to have



  • Practical knowledge and experience in jQuery and JavaScript frameworks like Backbone and Angular is a big plus

  • Node.js and AWS stack experience is a plus

  • Experience in deployment automation and continuous delivery is a plus

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer Elixir / Ruby - London at Quiqup Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for ambitious Back-end/Fullstack engineers with Elixir and Ruby experience. Quiqup people are people that don't fit into one box and can adapt to solve problems in the same way that we adapt to the market. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining a cutting edge scalable logistics platform.


Your primary focus will be development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by you and your coworkers. An understanding of front-end technologies is therefore necessary as well.


We have many challenging problems to solve, your ability to be resourceful in finding solutions is paramount.



Skills & Requirements



  • Integration of user-facing elements developed by a front-end developers with our API

  • Building reusable code and libraries for future use

  • Optimisation of the application for maximum speed and scalability

  • Design and implementation of data storage solutions

  • Separation of centralised services into micro services

  • Support of the infrastructure and services

  • Pride in readable, well-designed, well-tested software.

  • Professional experience with Elixir (+1 year)

  • Professional experience with Ruby and Ruby on Rails (1+ year)

  • Experience with TDD

  • Experience with relational databases (PostGreSQL, MySQL) and key-value stores (Memcache, Redis)


Nice-to-haves:



  • Experience with APIs at scale (20krpm and above).

  • Experience with PostGIS, or any geography-heavy applications.

  • Experience with "NoSQL" data backends (Redis, MongoDB, ElasticSearch).

  • Experience with Node (or any other languages).

  • Experience with logistics.

item.title: QA Engineer at SendCloud (Eindhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a QA engineer you will join the development team and work on the SendCloud system. SendCloud integrates various carriers and online stores in a fast and intuitive tool. We release early and often. The development team is responsible for building the SendCloud system and keeping it running.


SendCloud enables online merchants to grow, we do this via automation, creating an efficient processing tool. We focus on offering a simple product, even when the complexity of the internals of our system increases. In your role as QA engineer, you will make sure that our system behaves as expected. You will help our developers understand the complex logic behind the automation and assist them that they implement these right.


You will help us further improve our development stack and train the developers in your team. You do not need to start from scratch, we run thousands of unit-tests and bunch of e2e tests, using Jenkins, Docker and Chrome headless.


This position is open to worldwide candidates. We will assist you with with relocating to ensure a smooth transition.


Benefits


  • A good salary and pension scheme.
  • An ambitious and inspiring working environment.
  • The possibility for your own initiatives in our fast growing organization.
  • Work hard, Play Hard mentality. We celebrate our successes with you!
  • Choose your own device.

Working at SendCloud

SendCloud is here to change shipping for ever! Our goal is to be the largest shipping service provider in the world.

We provide a SaaS solution that easily integrates with the major webshop systems and carriers to offer our customers a big advantage. This way webshops can compete with the big players. We believe that we offer our customers the best experience available in the market.


At SendCloud we love to keep things pragmatic, especially in our day to day job no thick layers of protocols and documentation. We move fast in small self organized teams, creating a place where you can really make a difference. Although our ambitions are huge, we are dedicated to keep our working atmosphere open, pleasant and fun! At the SendCloud office we have a gym, bbq, daily lunches and regularly go out on fun activities.

item.title: Hackers (m/f) wanted. at freiheit.com technologies gmbh (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Hackers wanted - We are looking for passionate Programmers/Developers (m/f) and Machine Learning Experts (m/f)! You have a first-class degree in computer science, physics, or mathematics. Maybe you already have several years of experience managing small, flexible developer teams. You can develop data-driven and value-oriented products, work closely with our clients and bring ideas to life. There is nothing better for you than to write code/programs in GNU/Linux every day. You “speak” Java, Scala, Go or C++ fluently but you are also interested in JavaScript, machine learning and functional programming languages such as Common Lisp, Clojure, and Haskell. You like to solve difficult problems. You want to work in small teams together with brilliant human beings. From project conception over development and testing to the final delivery, you are responsible for all software engineering phases within your project, your team, and your client. You are keen to learn new things every day. You are honest and have a sense of humor. You are not looking for any kind of job. You are looking to make a difference with your ideas and your abilities. Since 1999, we have been pioneers in developing large Internet systems. We only have managers that are also programmers. We have successfully established ourselves in the market and we are extremely well organized. Still, we have never lost our founder’s mentality and we have a strong open, personal and idea-driven company culture. Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Hamburg surrounded by many restaurants and excellent food.


Want to be part of it? Then apply here.

item.title: Senior Support Engineer - Various Locations - Middle East/ China / NL at Elastic () (allows remote)
item.description:
At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to real time Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.


Our Philosophy


We’re always on the search for amazing people. People who have deep passion for technology and are masters at their craft. We build highly sophisticated distributed systems and we don’t take our technology lightly. In Elasticsearch, you’ll have the opportunity to work in a vibrant young company next to some of the smartest and highly skilled technologists the industry has to offer. We’re looking for great team players, yet we also promote independence and ownership. We’re hackers… but of the good kind. The kind that innovates and creates cutting edge products that eventually translates to a lot of happy, smiling faces.


We are looking for talented and dedicated Support Engineers to join us in various locations: Middle-East, China and The Netherlands are our current main focus. Only candidates in those geographies can currently be considered. 


Responsibilities



  • Ensuring customer issues are resolved within our committed service level agreements.

  • Maintain strong relationships with our customers for the delivery of support.

  • Have a mindset of continuous improvement, in terms of efficiency of support processes and customer satisfaction.


Experience



  • Demonstrable experience in of support in technology businesses

  • Experience working across multi-cultural and geographically distributed teams


Key Skills



  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.

  • Customer orientated focus.

  • Team player, ability to work in a fast pace environment with a positive and adaptable approach.

  • Knowledge of databases or search technologies a plus

  • Demonstrated strong technical understanding of software products.


Additional Information



  • Competitive pay and benefits

  • Stock options

  • Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices

  • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life

  • Passionate people building great products

  • Employees with a wide variety of interests

  • Distributed-first company with employees in over 30 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages!



Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

item.title: Frontend Consultant @ Backbase at Backbase (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Within the fintech market Backbase holds a leading role serving worldwide recognized financial customers. How we got up there? By delivering a vast array of technical solutions and innovations along with outstanding customer service.


As a front-end consultant you may often find yourself abroad and on site during implementations and in case of solving issues. Together with your team it is your job to provide expert support for a seamless and on time integration of our products.


Since you are the closest link to our customers and partners it is part of your job to work closely with our R&D department for new product development. You think of cool modern features and you signal customer demand.


What will you be doing?


You will take part in projects focussing on the front-end part of the implementation of our products. You astonish by designing solutions that are UX focused and have a high impact visual effect. You train and mentor teams of developers and contribute to building enterprise solutions. Your considerate support encourages technical professionals on customer and partner side to expertly work with our platform.


Once you have started you will speed up a project and you will securely manage your planning. Dealing with time pressure is just another part of the job. As is living up to great expectations. Often a question arises and it is up to you to come with prompt and yet smart solutions. Since we work on a global scale, you will travel a lot, working from customer and partner locations all around the world.

item.title: Alfresco Software Developer/Help Desk Support at MYMIC LLC (Arlington, VA)
item.description:
Software Developer (Alfresco)


Posting ID       2017-1134
# of Openings  2
Category          Information Technology
Location:  The Pentagon
Clearance:  Top Secret, verifiable in JPAS
Period of Performance:  Contingent upon award

Overview

The eDocument, Task and Records Management (eDTRM) solution resides on the Joint Solution Provider (JSP) SIPRNet and NIPRNet Domains. The scope of this project includes the Operations and Maintenance (O&M) support and administration of the Enterprise Records Management (ERM) applications. The ERM application is supported on a Linux platform that is based on Alfresco Enterprise Content Management Repository and SQL Server 2012 R2 Database. The need is to maintain this system providing service sustainment support, engineering and deployment support, and project management and application accreditation support.  


O&M includes running operational components designed for administrators and/or operators, monitoring and maintaining the operational integrity of the system during operation cycles, configuration management, address defects or minor enhancements within the O&M context, communicating with external organization, and tracking activities performed through logs, status reports, matrices, and available statistical information and analysis.


Responsibilities


The Software Engineer/Developer works with the project team to determine software requirements and plans, designs, develops and implements customized software project solutions.



Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Updates, repairs, and modifies Alfresco Enterprise software application, residing on a Linux platform, following standard corporate software engineering processes

  • Design, develop and maintain open systems / J2EE Java web based applications

  • Tests software and corrects software deficiencies

  • Participate in requirements analysis and definition, data analysis and modeling, design, configuration, development, and test activities


Qualifications


Clearance:
Must have a current Top Secret clearance verifiable in JPAS


Minimum Qualifications:



  • Minimum of 5-6 years software development using Java (both Standard and Enterprise libraries) within the past 8 years. We will also consider Junior to Mid-Grade candidates for this position. Ideally, overall Java/J2EE experience requirement should be supplemented with the list of tools/technologies listed below. A viable candidate should have relevant experience with the majority of items on the list:

    • Alfresco Enterprise (required)

    • Alfresco Records Management (required)

    • Linux (required)

    • LibreOffice

    • ImageMagick

    • PDS2SWF

    • MS SQL Server 2012 R2 





  • DoD 8570.01-M certification to include Security+ and an OS/CE certification, at a minimum (IAT Level II)

  • Alfresco certification

item.title: Work at Zenjob in Berlin as React Frontend Developer at Zenjob (Berlin, Germany)

item.title: 3D Scientific Visualization Software Engineer at Schrdinger (New York, NY)
item.description:
Schrödinger, a technology leader specializing in software solutions for life science research and development, is seeking a highly skilled software engineer to help develop the molecular modeling and visualization application central to our solution suites. The ideal candidate is a software engineer with experience developing software in the field of 3D scientific visualization and graphical user interface. The candidate should be familiar with and eager to adopt and share good software engineering practices. Schrödinger has a strong commitment to engineering as well as science and uses continuous integration, extensive testing, and code review as part of our daily practices.


Responsibilities: 



  • Actively contribute to the design, implementation, and testing of our multiplatform molecular modeling application

  • Troubleshoot bugs and improve the performance of our tool

  • Collaborate with the team and other departments (UX, QA, support, backends)


Required skills:



  • B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related field

  • Object-oriented design with C++ or Java (the development will be done in C++11)

  • Knowledge of 3D graphics rendering and geometry processing

  • Ability to write code that is well-designed, modular, maintainable, testable and documented

  • Ability to work autonomously

  • Good verbal and written communication skills


Pluses:



  • We are using the following technologies, any familiarity with them is a plus: git, Qt, C++ boost libraries, OpenGL, VTK, Python, waf, bash, valgrind

  • Programming by contract

  • Experience with collaborative work

  • Experience with unit and automated testing

  • Experience with multiplatform development (Linux, macOS, Windows)

  • Experience with a large code base

  • Experience developing an elaborated UI, event-driven programming

  • Knowledge of scientific visualization

  • Knowledge of chemistry


Schrödinger, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

a10:author.a10:name: Cake Solutions - A BAMTECH Media Company

item.title: Senior Scala Engineer - join the Reactive movement! at Cake Solutions - A BAMTECH Media Company (Stockport District, UK)
item.description:
Since Cake’s inception, we’ve been a Project Delivery Consultancy that has specialised in building highly distributable, reactive systems for clients looking to use the most cutting-edge technology, and we’ve been damn good at it. Over the past 3 months, Cake has been going through its largest transformation yet, and we’re ecstatic to announce that we’re a member of the BAMTECH Media family, who are the leader in delivering direct-to-consumer live and on-demand entertainment at scale. Wanna know what makes this even more interesting? BAMTECH are now a subsidiary of The Walt Disney Company, meaning we’ll be working on the OTT streaming platforms that Disney are launching in 2018 and 2019. Pretty impressive right!


As a result, we will be massively expanding across all teams for the rest of 2017 and the bulk of 2018, so we’re seeking passionate and talented Senior Scala Engineers to join our polyglot development team in Stockport, just outside of Manchester.


More about us?


Community is a huge part of the culture at Cake, which is why we regularly attend and host local meetups, as well as sponsor the best known Scala and Reactive events like Scala Days, Reactive Summit and Scala World. If you’re ever at one of this events then we’ve also got great coffee and free swag to give away! We’re also a group of active bloggers and publishers, with new posts released weekly, and e-Books from our CEO Guy and CTO Jan ready to download (free of course).


So what does being a Scala Engineer at Cake entail?


You will have the opportunity to stay at the forefront of technology and apply a principled approach to software engineering, as well as having the opportunity to work on a wide range of interesting projects with our partners, using Spark, Scala, Akka, Kafka, Kinesis and Dynamo. We aim to build software that is distributed, reactive and scalable.


You will also have solid communication skills and will be able to interpret the intricacies of the business domain, whilst also offering technical support to Tech Leads & the Senior Team.  


What will you do:



  • Solve complex problems using the most appropriate polyglot architecture.

  • Be involved in a lively and challenging environment.

  • Use the latest technologies and tools on modern hardware at scale.

  • Work on challenging and varied business domains.

  • Develop your technical understanding to support and build your career.


What we’d like to see:



  • Demonstrable working experience with the Lightbend Reactive Platform, particularly Scala, Akka & Play.

  • Experience creating scalable and reactive web applications with modern frameworks such as: Play, ScalaJS, AngularJS, ReactJS.

  • Knowledge of applying object-oriented and functional programming styles to real-world software engineering problems.

  • A deep understanding of strongly-typed functional programming principles in Scala, Haskell or OCaml.

  • Demonstrable understanding of high quality coding and testing practices.

  • A strong understanding of continuous integration and continuous delivery practices.

  • An appetite to learn new technologies and a drive for continual improvement.

  • A keen interest in technology and self-improvement.  Examples include having an active Github account or completion of relevant Coursera courses.

  • Contributions to the technical community, either through blogs, internal workshops, meetups or conferences.


If working for our Stockport office requires emigrating please do not fear. Cake offers visa sponsorship as well as support in the relocation process. We currently house 20 different nationalities within the company and embrace a diverse range of cultures, ethnicities, and backgrounds.


We also provide fantastic benefits, some of which include, Perkbox access, informative lunch and learn sessions, gym membership, attendance at international conferences, a cycle to work scheme, unlimited holiday allowance (paid & unpaid), flexible working and a team football match every Tuesday evening!


To find out more please apply via our careers page or contact our recruitment team on LinkedIn or email:samf@cakesolutions.net

item.title: C++ Software Engineer at IMC Financial Markets (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
IMC financial markets – Where Technology drives Trading


Trading nowadays happens in a highly competitive technological landscape; the best trading idea alone doesn’t cut it anymore. Instead, only the best trading ideas that are enabled via robust, scalable and fast technology win. 


Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?


SOFTWARE ENGINEERING AT IMC:


We trade in the most competitive markets across the globe.  Our software makes millions of trading decisions daily.  We win by making better and faster decisions than our competition. As a software developer you’ll be working alongside traders to implement strategies which will challenge you to be creative with your implementation. You’ll need to timely produce high quality solutions meeting requirements and managing overall complexity of our systems. You’ll be working in a highly motivated team, controlling end-to-end product development.  We work in an environment where slight oversights can be extremely costly, while new features can be extremely profitable.  As a team we aim to balance the race to production with software quality and testability.  You’ll be placed in an environment consisting primarily of C++ and Java.  We have a build chain which has been designed around the concept of daily production releases.  A variety of systems and technologies keeps life interesting.


Upon joining you will be expected to manage your own time and tasks.  We rely on our developers to drive change by taking feedback from traders, and shaping that into an implementation.  Your ownership of the task continues until a working production release.  Our most successful developers comfortably work in any part of our stack.


Skills & Requirements:



  • Excellent C++ programming skills

  • Development experience in a Linux/UNIX environment

  • Extensive experience with OOP/OOD

  • Strong knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and threading

  • Proficiency in design patterns

  • Scripting knowledge 

  • Non-relational, distributed database experience is a plus (not a requirement)

  • Strong analytical skills and desire to solve complicated problems programmatically

  • Must be self-directed, and able to work productively under minimal supervision

  • Willingness to work closely with traders in a constantly changing environment

  • Interest in the Financial Markets; previous knowledge is NOT required


WHAT MAKES IT FUN?



  • One of the most fun aspects of the job is that we have a very quick feedback loop.  We release early and often to get incremental benefits as they are developed

  • We operate at the bleeding edge of technology.  If something new can potentially bring an advantage we will actively invest in developing and utilizing the solution

  • We really believe in sharing knowledge and technology between the different offices. Much of our technology stack is shared between all 3 regions, and we provide opportunities to travel between the regions both for personal growth and to assist where it has the biggest impact.

  • To get the best results we encourage everybody to gain understanding of both the trading strategy and how exchanges work on a technological level.

  • Working at IMC is also an opportunity to learn about financial markets. We know from experience that a lot of people really enjoy learning about a field beyond their immediate area of expertise, it’s one of the things that makes this job more interesting than others.

  • We employ a broad range of people with varying backgrounds.  What they have in common is their superior technical expertise, their extraordinary smarts and their collaborative approach. We will not accept less.


OUR CULTURE:


We are at the core a trading firm, however we value trading and technology equally and we believe that cooperation between traders and technologists is one of our great strengths. This is also reflected in our organizational and remuneration policies. We believe in fostering a truly flat environment in which great ideas can be recognized as well as put into practice from anybody within our organization

item.title: Regular and Senior Network Programmers at Crytek GmbH (Frankfurt, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced and passionate Senior Network Programmer to support the HUNT team in our Frankfurt, Germany based studio.


Responsibilities:



  • Improve, develop and take ownership for low level networking system.

  • Responsible for profiling and optimizing existing systems.

  • Improve, maintain and extend existing components of code base.

  • Take active part in design, development and documentation of new features. Contributing to development goals as part of a passionate team.

  • Mentor Junior Programmers.

  • Work closely with other programming disciplines to achieve great multiplayer experiences in the game.

  • Create accurate task duration estimates and complete all work in a timely basis.

  • Remain focused, motivated and effective on all tasks through to completion.

  • Display good communication and writing skills and create documentation where required.

  • Develop well designed software, in cooperation with leads, within project schedule to team standards.

  • Provide input to department project status meetings.


Requirements:



  • 5+ years of professional experience as Network Programmer.

  • At least a Bachelor’s degree in relevant field or equivalent work experience.

  • Excellent understanding of C++ and strong software engineering and debugging skills.

  • Experience with TCP & UDP network protocols, familiar with NAT traversal, packet routing, OSI model.

  • Past experience on network-related features for a shipped multiplayer title.

  • Experience with any game Engines preferably experience with CRYENGINE.

  • Willing to accept and provide direction, work well under pressure, and handle multiple tasks.

  • Ability to contribute innovative and original ideas towards all aspects of game production and development.

  • Experience with multithreading.

  • Team player and self-driven.

  • Willing to learn.

  • Solid English skills, good communication skills with strong affinity for transparence.

  • Willing to relocate to Frankfurt am Main area, Germany.


Preferences:



  • Experience with PSN and/or Xbox Live.

  • Passion for making great games.

  • Experience writing technical documentation.

  • Experience with multiplatform development.


What you can expect from us:



  • A refreshing yet highly professional atmosphere in a diverse team.

  • Flexible work time.

  • FUN.

  • Free public transportation ticket, which lets you use public transport free of charge 24/7.

  • Free onsite German lessons for our employees and partners / spouses.

  • Company language is English. Any additional language is a plus, but not a requirement.

  • Extensive assistance with getting visa, work permits and communication with local authorities.

  • Relocation support.

  • A company apartment for your first few months and help in finding a private apartment....and many more!


About Crytek 


Crytek is an independent videogame developer, publisher, and technology provider dedicated to pushing the boundaries of gaming with its cutting-edge 3D game development solution CRYENGINE. With headquarters in Frankfurt am Main (Germany) and studios in Kiev (Ukraine), and Istanbul (Turkey), Crytek has created multiple award-winning titles, including the original Far Cry, the Crysis series, Ryse: Son of Rome, Warface, The Climb, Robinson: The Journey and Hunt: Showdown. Crytek delivers fun and innovative gaming experiences for PC, consoles, and VR and continues to grow its reach in the games-as-a-service market. Every Crytek game is created with CRYENGINE, which can be used by anyone to create games on a Pay What You Want business model.


For more information visit www.crytek.com - www.cryengine.com and www.huntshowdown.com

item.title: DevOps Engineer (m/f) at relayr GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Build the infrastructure for the next generation of connected devices. Join relayr and build the future today.


Relayr is bringing things to life. We have three technical pillars: an Internet of Things Platform as a Service, open SDKs and a Hardware development platforms designed to allow developers and enterprises to quickly build Internet of Things solutions.


We have a growing number of internal and client projects and are looking for an enthusiastic DevOps Engineer to join our international team in Berlin.


Your Tasks:



  • Help build out and scale our platform cluster (AWS, Baremetal, different cloud and virtualization platforms)

  • Help development team to clusterize and scale all application components

  • Strive for many 9’s of uptime

  • Develop Continuous Deployment and Monitoring strategies

  • Help develop long term strategies


Your Skills:



  • A minimum of 3 years experience.

  • Experience in scaling applications, working with clusters

  • Experience with modern tools like Mesos, Consul, Swarm, Docker

  • Understanding of administration of Big Data tools like Cassandra, Kafka, etc.

  • Experience working with Cloud Providers (AWS is a significant bonus)

  • Command line and shell scripting are your friends, languages such as Python, Go and Ruby are constant companions.

  • Deep knowledge of Linux operating system (particularly Debian based)

  • Knowledge of TCP networking stack and ability to design firewalls and security rules. (iptables, ipfw, selinux)

  • Bonus: You have experience with Scala and NodeJs and can dive just a little deeper than reading the stack trace when something goes wrong in production


We Offer:



  • Flexible office environment 

  • A diverse and friendly team with people from all over the world, speaking 20+ languages, of all ages and parental-status

  • Connecting you with a network of companies and people from around the globe

  • A learning environment where you can extend and build upon your skills and interests, as well as knowledge-sharing and an expanding library of books

  • Opportunities to attend events and conferences pertaining to your discipline

  • Competitive Salary and Stock Options

  • Cool office located in Kreuzberg with a relaxation room, standing-desks, 3D printer and free fruit and drinks

  • Free German courses at intermediate and advanced level (Working language is English)

  • We offer the ability to work in a cutting-edge field with the best people in the IoT industry!


Sounds interesting? Please follow the link to apply for this position: https://relayr.bamboohr.co.uk/jobs/view.php?id=5

item.title: QA Engineer at Wallethub (Washington, DC) (allows remote)
item.description:
WalletHub is a high-growth start-up based in Washington, D.C. Our fast-paced environment and can do attitude have already earned us several prestigious awards including last year's Gold Stevie for best financial services website from the American Business Awards and a gold medal as one of the products of the year from the Consumer World Awards.  We're seeking hardworking, like-minded individuals to help us disrupt personal finance and make a tangible difference in people's everyday lives.


More specifically, we are harnessing the power of data analytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financial advisor, whose services we’re offering to everyone for free. The WalletHub brain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of the time with three unique features:



  1. Customized Credit-Improvement Tips: WalletHub identifies improvement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.

  2. Personalized Money-Saving Advice: WalletHub’s savings brain constantly scours the market for load-lightening opportunities, bringing you only the best deals.

  3. Wallet Surveillance: Personal finance isn’t as scary with 24/7 credit monitoring providing backup, notifying you of important credit-report changes.


In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHub is the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full credit reports that are updated on a daily basis absent of user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logs in. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yet they’re still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a much larger puzzle.


Responsibilities include:



  • Testing and assuring high quality performance of website

  • Reporting and validating bugs for all components

  • Creating test plans and test cases

  • Identify opportunities for improvement and make constructive suggestions for change


Qualifications:



  • At least 2 years experience in Manual Testing or in Test Automation with Java and Selenium

  • Excellent attention to details

  • Ability & motivation to work a minimum of 50 hrs per week

  • Proven ability to meet deadlines and handle multiple tasks in a fast paced environment

  • Must stay up-to-date with developing technologies and showcase them in your work

  • Proficient in written/spoken English


Note: This position does not have a location requirement and be performed remotely (outside the US) and requires an overlap with US ET business hours from Monday to Friday to facilitate working together with US team members.

item.title: Senior Data Visualisation Developer at nearForm (Tramore, Ireland) (allows remote)
item.description:
What your day looks like


You get home from the gym, you like to get there early to avoid the rush hour and it gets your energy levels up for the day. You turn on your monitor and join the hangout for your daily Standup. Call done, you hit play on your favourite playlist, tap the volume key a few times and get in the zone. The rest of the morning goes by working on that D3 component for the weekly demo tomorrow. It’s a nice fresh day so you take a brisk walk in the local park and grab your favourite sandwich from the nearby deli for lunch. After lunch you do some remote problem solving with the team and then it’s back to developing. The day done, you close down your laptop, the rest of the day is for family, friends and you.


What you’ll be doing


At nearForm, you'll be working on internal projects related to Open Source tooling for developers. You’ll be creating unique visualisations of complex software metrics to aid developers in understanding how their applications work. You will implement great developer experiences and enable developers to be far more productive.


You will join a highly skilled world-class team consisting of software architects, Node.js experts, designers and product managers. The team follows a modern agile Open Source development methodology.


What we ask of you



  • An ability to use a wide variety of open source technologies and tools

  • An ability to perform well in a fast-paced environment

  • Excellent analytical and multitasking skills

  • Must be Located in Europe

  • Availability for short-term travel on a semi-regular basis

  • Extensive hands-on experience with:


    • SVG and D3 or similar

    • Data Visualisation

    • Statistics

    • JavaScript Frameworks and raw HTML/CSS/JS

    • Versioning tools, particularly GIT

    • Browser testing and debugging

    • Cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them

    • Layout aesthetics, responsive design

item.title: Senior Security Engineer - Operations at Auth0 (Bellevue, WA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Auth0 provides an enterprise-grade platform that secures billions of log-ins every year. The company makes it easy to implement even the most complex identity solutions for their web, mobile, IoT and internal applications, as well as sophisticated identity management for employees, customers and partners. Auth0 has raised over $54 million from Meritech Capital, NTT DoCoMo, Trinity Ventures, Bessemer Venture Partners, K9 Ventures, Silicon Valley Bank, Founders Co-Op, Portland Seed Fund and NXTP Labs.


Thousands of enterprises and millions of users worldwide depend on Auth0 for authentication and authorization of their most mission-critical apps, APIs and IoT devices. Auth0’s top priorities are availability and security.


Auth0 allows anyone to authenticate and authorize users, applications, and APIs with any identity provider running on any stack and any device. Security is at the core of our product and the security of our customers and their data is paramount. We are looking for a Senior Security Engineer to join us in keeping Auth0 and our customers data safe.


The Security Operations team builds, owns and maintains the critical security infrastructure that provides visibility into Auth0’s production operations. We are looking for a Senior engineer who is passionate about making reliable and scalable infrastructure. You will build tools and drive automation - removing any manual process that will prevent the security team maintaining coverage as Auth0 grows.


This is an exciting time to join Auth0 as we are growing quickly and this role is an opportunity to drive the expansion of our Security Operations team.


Responsibilities:



  • Provide team leadership and own the delivery of security engineering projects

  • Design, build and maintain the systems that help keep Auth0 secure

  • Demonstrate the effectiveness and coverage of these systems

  • Develop tools to test, monitor and enforce security policy

  • Automate security process to reduce as much manual process as possible

  • Own and improve our security monitoring pipeline

  • Participate in the on-call rotation to support the infrastructure and respond to security events


Requirements:



  • Significant experience working as a Security Engineer and delivering engineering projects

  • Experience administering and securing AWS

  • Strong Linux experience

  • Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g. Python, Node, Go etc.)

  • Experience with log collection and storage (e.g. ELK/EFK stacks, Sumo Logic etc)

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

  • Comfort working in a globally distributed environment with a remote workforce


Extra Points:



  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent educational or professional experience and/or qualifications

  • A passion for infrastructure as code and have used tools such as Terraform and CloudFormation

  • Experience running a vulnerability management programme

  • You have used configuration management tools (e.g. Salt Stack, Ansible, Puppet, etc)

  • You write readable, maintainable code and have experience managing source code with git


Examples of our Engineering Culture:


https://auth0.engineering/


https://auth0.engineering/cloud-security-monitoring-at-auth0-part-ii-b106354a0e5d


https://auth0.engineering/detecting-secrets-in-source-code-bd63b0fe4921


Auth0 values diversity and inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

item.description:
Auth0 provides an enterprise-grade platform that secures billions of log-ins every year. The company makes it easy to implement even the most complex identity solutions for their web, mobile, IoT and internal applications, as well as sophisticated identity management for employees, customers and partners. Auth0 has raised over $54 million from Meritech Capital, NTT DoCoMo, Trinity Ventures, Bessemer Venture Partners, K9 Ventures, Silicon Valley Bank, Founders Co-Op, Portland Seed Fund and NXTP Labs.


Thousands of enterprises and millions of users worldwide depend on Auth0 for authentication and authorization of their most mission-critical apps, APIs and IoT devices. Auth0’s top priorities are availability and security.


Auth0 allows anyone to authenticate and authorize users, applications, and APIs with any identity provider running on any stack and any device. Security is at the core of our product and the security of our customers and their data is paramount. We are looking for a Senior Application Security Engineer to join us in keeping Auth0 and our customers data safe


Our engineering team builds web apps, mobile apps, and APIs, and we have customers in just about every industry. This creates many interesting use cases that we need to support while maintaining security.


The individual filling this role will work closely with our product teams, and should feel comfortable shipping bug fixes into production. We love to build tools and automate security whenever it makes sense, enabling others and reducing repetitive tasks.


This is an exciting time to join Auth0 as we are growing quickly and this role is an opportunity to drive the expansion of our App Sec team.


Responsibilities:

  • Development experience with at least one programming language

  • Deep understanding of modern web technologies, mobile and web security

  • Deep understanding of common vulnerabilities in web and mobile applications and how to prevent them

  • Proven ability to influence development teams to deliver secure code

item.title: Part-Time Student Developer at RefinedWiki at RefinedWiki (Malm, Sweden)
item.description:
RefinedWiki are looking for a student, currently studying computer science or related fields to join our fast growing company in Malmö, Sweden.


Join our team in Malmö, Sweden as a junior student developer covering a range of tasks from metric tracking to product development. 


RefinedWiki build apps for Atlassian, one of the fastest growing software companies in the world. Our apps are top selling on the Atlassian marketplace with over 3000 customers in over 90 countries. 


As a junior developer you will work together with the dev team and the business/marketing team on a variety of different projects and help set solid tools for the company to move forward with. You will have excellent problem solving skills and are a keen learner. You are able to take initiative, work well in a team and develop your skills. 


You will be paid on an hourly basis and on temporary employment contract (tidsbegränsad anställning).


Role



  • Support sales by developing and managing tools for internal use

  • Implement automation tools

  • Set up, manage, retrieve and display metrics 

  • Code for website and e-communication (html)

  • Support developers on assigned product projects


Expectations



  • Basic knowledge in at least one scripting language, e.g., JavaScript, Python, Ruby. 

  • Currently studying computer science or related fields

  • Able to crunch numbers, analyse data and identify trends

  • Able to take initiative and work both in a team and independently

  • Able to work at least 8-16 hours / week 

  • Preferably (but not obligatory) basic knowledge in HTML and CSS.

  • Preferably (but not obligatory) basic knowledge in CMS code (Wordpress etc)

item.title: Senior Software Developer / Team Lead - Full Stack Engineer at AdeptMind Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Our current engineering efforts focus on vertical expansion: building more tools and services. Current projects ranges from creating internal service to providing command line utilities as well large scale crawling and data processing.


As a senior engineer / team lead, you are expected to be the top performer of your team as well as guiding your team members through the entire life cycle of software development. This is more than a typical engineering, but we know you, the ambitious type, are ready for the challenge. We're asking for a rock star, and you will be treated like such. Please contact us to find out what we have to offer.


--


What you'll do:



  • Manage continuous delivery of Adeptmind’s products

  • Develop high performance / extensible data processing system

  • Lead development of internal tools / services

  • Use and contribute to internal build / deployment system


You should be able to check off most things from this list:



  • Experience with the Linux stack(bash, git, package management etc.)

  • Algorithm, data structure and object oriented programming skills

  • Proficiency in Python, Java and Javascript/Typescript

  • Ability to navigate large scale system for both debugging and development

  • Hands on experience managing AWS to fulfill needs of internal development


Nice to haves:



  • Experience with team software development process: design, testing, coding and peer reviews

  • Management skill for both self management and project management

  • Experience with distributed system development

  • Experience in DevOps

  • Familiarity with data platforms: MongoDB, SQL, Lucence, ElasticSearch, etc.

  • Proficient in MapReduce, Spark, etc.


Perks:



  • Competitive salary commensurate with experience/qualification: 100K-150K with equity

  • Regular learning activities: latest paper, neat techniques, best practices

  • Flat organization structure set up to help people succeed

  • Smart and knowledgeable colleagues

  • And of course, catered meals managed by food expert


--


Of course, life in a young startup can get hectic. But we spend just as much, if not more, effort to grow our engineers as well. We actively hold technical seminars, send our people to conferences and initiate manageable research project. We believe a company cannot grow until the people can.


Let us know if you feel like working here!

item.title: Senior Fullstack Python Developer for Fintech Startup at Bento (Singapore)
item.description:
Responsibilities


- Develop backend Restful API for financial applications/tools using Django Python framework to help investors build, customise and analyse their investment assets.
