item.title: Product Engineer - Fullstack JavaScript Engineer at the cutting edge of big data at Qubit (London, UK)
item.description:
Product Engineer


At Qubit, the frontend team is focused on building well engineered, beautiful products with JavaScript. Our products provide an intuitive way for marketers to modify their website, understand and target user segments and measure the impact of their changes.


ARE YOU…


A team player? We are an opinionated team looking for like minded people. Are you excited by the prospect of solving complex challenges on an interesting technology stack?


Independant thinker? We like to hire engineers that thrive in a world of ambiguity. We want people that can be given hard problems and can go off and find the best technical solution.


Experimental? We are constantly experimenting with new technologies, right now some technologies that we really like are:



  • React, Flux and Redux

  • ES 2015/16

  • Git(hub)

  • Node.js

  • SuitCSS

  • Docker & Mesos

  • Make

  • Webpack

  • Mocha & Karma


Passionate about open source? Sharing is caring after all. We always contribute back to the open source community. Qubit's array of open source projects include:



  • react-test-tree: Simple and concise React component testing.

  • cherrytree: A flexible client-side router.

  • marty: A Javascript library for state management in React applications.

  • bamboo: HAProxy auto configuration and auto service discovery for Mesos Marathon.


You'll be responsible for:



  • Writing Javascript that will be run in hundreds of millions of browsers every day.

  • Building end-to-end products with Javascript (Node.js, React).

  • Understanding business problems and translating them into technical solutions.

  • Instrumenting, testing and deploying your code to production (We like to deploy multiple times a day).

  • Working closely with our product and design teams to define feature specifications.

  • Working closely with operations and infrastructure to build and scale our applications. 


Skills & Requirements


What You'll Need



  • Comfortable with multiple programming languages, especially Javascript without the aid of frameworks.

  • Bachelors or Masters Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or related field (or equivalent experience).

  • Demonstrated mastery of building high-performance, high impact products.

  • Demonstrated technical leadership of driving projects successfully.


As a valued Qubyte, you will be entitled to the following perks:



  • Realistic performance related bonuses

  • Generous equity options which mean you’ll own a piece of the pie

  • Excellent private health and dental insurance packages

  • A relaxed approach to time off and enough holidays to see several corners of the world

  • A bank of fridges fully stocked with healthy snacks and the ultimate espresso machine for your java fix

  • Sports teams to join, free yoga and meditation classes to make sure your body is as healthy as your mind

  • Subsidised gym membership

  • Thank Qubit It’s Friday – we have lots of creative ways to let off steam at the end of the week

  • Plenty of opportunities for training and development

item.title: Impact Medical Research as Senior Backend Developer at Castor EDC (Amsterdam-Zuidoost, Netherlands)
item.description:
Do you want to make a difference in the world?


Our goal is to improve healthcare across the globe by enabling better medical research through technology. Our customers love Castor, as reflected by our 8.42/10 satisfaction score.

We are rapidly scaling up our processes and technical architecture to keep pace with our 200%+ year-on-year growth. This poses interesting technical challenges as we make our product available in countries like Brazil and Australia with the same great user experience.

item.title: Software Developer C++ at Bright Computing (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
We have positions available for enthusiastic and experienced software developers for the development of our Linux-based cluster software environment. You will be part of a team responsible for the development of our Linux based cluster management software.


There will be ample opportunity to develop your skills and to take initiative. You will have the opportunity to work with the latest hardware (e.g. GPUs, Xeon Phi and high-speed interconnects such as InfiniBand, Omni Path and 40 Gig-E) and software technologies such as parallel filesystems (e.g. Lustre, GPFS, BeeGFS), Hadoop, Spark, OpenStack, Docker, Kubernetes, Puppet, Open vSwitch and Ceph.


Our development team consists of highly skilled developers that are passionate about building a software product that meets our customers' needs today and in the future. With your help, we will be adding many new features to our product to allow Bright clusters to be used for a wider range of workloads, and to allow clusters to scale to hundreds of thousands of nodes (i.e. exascale). We will also target new CPU architectures such as ARM64 and Power8/9, and further integrate container technology into the product to allow workloads to scale up and down easily on-premise, and to public clouds.

item.title: Senior Python Web Developer who enjoys creating new digital health services at Fosanis GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Driven by the vision to improve well-being and therapy outcomes of cancer patients, we are creating a digital companion for cancer patients. As Senior Python Web Developer you will become a key player in our dynamic team. We are a young and spirited telemedicine company with our headquarter in Europe's startup capital and the passion to making a difference for cancer patients.


We care! – Do you?

  • Design and implement core features

  • Joint responsibility for architecture, development and operation of the platform

  • Learn something new every day


Your ideal profile - you've got most of this covered:



  • You have experience in developing web applications using Python, preferably with Django and technologies such as PostgreSQL, Redis, MongoDB and RabbitMQ

  • You are familiar with modern infrastructure and tooling, e.g. Docker, Swarm, Consul, Jenkins and git

  • You have sound knowledge in test-driven development, security and resilience for high-quality, highly available applications

Does this sound exciting to you? Do you want to join a young and fast-growing company with the vision to improve patients’ lives? Send your application to jobs@fosanis.de - even if this is not the job for you – we are hiring for other positions (e.g. Frontend Developer, DevOps Engineer) as well!


We are looking forward to getting to know you!

item.title: Informatiker/Softwareentwickler (m/w) als wissenschaftlichen Mitarbeiter at Bauhaus Luftfahrt e.V. (Teunz, Germany; Kastl, Germany)
item.description:
Das Bauhaus Luftfahrt ist eine interdisziplinre Forschungseinrichtung, getragen von den vier Luft- und Raumfahrtunternehmen Airbus, Industrieanlagen-Betriebsgesellschaft (IABG), Liebherr-Aerospace und MTU Aero Engines sowie einer Frderung durch das Bayerische Staatsministerium fr Wirtschaft und Medien, Energie und Technologie. Der gemeinntzige Verein ist eine international ausgerichtete Ideenschmiede. Das Team aus rund 50 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern befasst sich mit der Zukunft der Mobilitt im Allgemeinen und der Entwicklung des Luftverkehrs im Besonderen. Ziel der Forschungsarbeit ist es, das komplexe System der Luftfahrt aus vielerlei Blickwinkeln zu betrachten: Bei allen Projekten werden technische, wirtschaftliche, gesellschaftliche und kologische Aspekte ganzheitlich bercksichtigt.



Zur Verstrkung unseres Teams suchen wir zum nchstmglichen Zeitpunkt in Vollzeit einen



Informatiker/Softwareentwickler (m/w) als wissenschaftlichen Mitarbeiter im Bereich Wissensmanagement

Die digitale Wirtschaftswelt von morgen bietet der Luftfahrtindustrie neue Chancen, stellt sie aber auch gleichzeitig vor eine Herausforderung. Die Nutzung neuer Anstze in den Informationstechnologien steht im Mittelpunkt der Forschungsaktivitten im Bereich Wissensmanagement des Bauhaus Luftfahrt. Im Rahmen eines nationalen Forschungsprojektes sollen neue Anstze fr integrierte Entwicklungsprozesse erarbeitet, in Demonstratoren umgesetzt und getestet werden. Hierbei sollen Fragestellungen der semantischen Interoperabilitt in modellgetriebenen Entwurfsprozessen, des kollaborativen Datenmanagements, der kontextuellen Informationssuche und der aktuellen Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Big Data und Internet of Things (IoT) adressiert werden. Die Ergebnisse der Forschungskooperation mit der Industrie und anderen Forschungseinrichtungen sollen als Open-Source-Projekte sowie als wissenschaftliche Publikationen verffentlicht werden und leisten damit einen Beitrag zur langfristigen Umsetzung der nationalen Hightech-Strategie Industrie 4.0.




Ihre Aufgaben:



  • Analyse des Potenzials Ontologie-basierter Methoden in der Entwicklung und Fertigung in der Luftfahrtindustrie

  • Erarbeitung von Konzepten fr einen modellgetriebenen Entwurfsprozess unter Bercksichtigung der Verbindung von Modellen und Ontologien (semantic taggig)

  • Ermittlung des Nutzungspotenzials eines innovativen Entwicklungsassistenten im Kontext von Industrie 4.0

  • Modellierung und Analyse von Daten und Prozessen fr die virtuelle Entwicklung in der Luftfahrtindustrie

  • Anforderungsanalyse, Konzeption und Implementierung von Softwaresystemen als Open-Source-Software

  • Definition von Testfllen fr und Evaluierung von Softwaresystemen




Was Sie mitbringen:



  • Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium im Bereich Informatik mit Promotionsabsicht

  • Ausgeprgtes Interesse an semantischen Technologien

  • Forschungs- oder Berufserfahrung als Softwareentwickler

  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in JAVA, Eclipse und EMF sowie in Daten- und Prozessmodellierung

  • Erfahrung im Aufbau einer Software-Entwicklungsumgebung mit Open-Source-Tools

  • Wnschenswert sind Kenntnisse zu Intelligenten Agenten und Maschinellem Lernen

  • Ausgeprgte Teamorientierung und Bereitschaft zur interdisziplinren Arbeit

  • Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse





Wir bieten ein modernes Arbeitsumfeld auf dem Ludwig-Blkow-Campus in Taufkirchen bei Mnchen, eine teamorientierte Arbeitsweise, flache Hierarchien mit kurzen Wegen, Gleitzeit sowie ein attraktives Gehaltspaket im Rahmen des ffentlichen Tarifsystems mit leistungsorientierter Vergtung und betrieblicher Altersvorsorge. Die Stelle ist dem Bereich Wissensmanagement zugeordnet und zunchst befristet. Wir frdern Ihre wissenschaftliche Weiterentwicklung und untersttzen bei entsprechender Eignung das Promotionsvorhaben. Das Bauhaus Luftfahrt strebt eine Erhhung des Frauenanteils an und fordert deshalb qualifizierte Frauen ausdrcklich zur Bewerbung auf. Schwerbehinderte Menschen werden bei gleicher Qualifikation bevorzugt eingestellt.



Interessiert?
Wenn Sie die gleiche Leidenschaft fr eine anspruchsvolle und kreative Arbeit in der Luftfahrt haben wie wir, freuen wir uns ber Ihre vollstndigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (inkl. Angabe des nchstmglichen Eintrittstermins) per E-Mail unter Angabe der Kennziffer 24-1-5 an bewerbung@bauhaus-luftfahrt.net. Fr Fragen steht Ihnen Frau Michaela Richter unter 089 / 307 48 49-19 gerne zur Verfgung.
www.bauhaus-luftfahrt.net

item.title: Senior Data Scientist - Real Time Ad Targeting at LoopMe (London, UK)
item.description:
Senior Data Scientist


A full time Senior Data Scientist position for an exceptional candidate who has a keen interest in multivariate modelling, machine learning and decision automation. You will be working in the highly exciting area of real-time ad targeting.


This is a rare opportunity to be involved in creating an automated system to optimize hundreds of real-time interactions per second with online customers, and to quantify the benefits created against control groups in a live environment.


The work involves analyzing billions of records of ad-serving opportunities, ad-serves and ad-serve responses to understand what factors explain the variance in expected response value.  That understanding is then to be harnessed as an automated optimization process capable of intelligently finding and servicing the most favorable ad-serving opportunities in a way that leads to higher returns on our clients’ advertising investments.  Guidance is available from a senior analytical party who will support the work.


This is also an opportunity to become part of the UK tech start-up world and get first-hand experience into how tech start-ups operate.


Key Responsibilities:


You will work in a team of the highest calibre developers, machine-learning experts and data scientists to solve tough (but never dull) problems, such as:



  • Analysis of new data streams for inclusion in our real-time ad targeting engine

  • Prototyping real-time machine learning algorithms using cutting edge research

  • Developing applications to visualise and manipulate huge amounts of data

  • Scaling systems to handle many terabytes of data whilst still maintaining millisecond-level response times

  • Working to support the following steps in the analytical process with large (multi-million record) data sets:



  • Basic data cleansing and preparation

  • Variable preprocessing/transformation

  • Univariate analysis

  • Performing statistical tests

  • Covariance analysis

  • Generation of graphical output

  • Multivariate analysis and linear/non-linear regression

  • Preparation of data sets for predictive modelling

  • Robust predictive model building, validation and application

  • Automation of statistical processes


Skills & Requirements



  • A minimum of a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a mathematical discipline such as Applied Statistics, Maths, Engineering or Physics from a respected University

  • 2 plus years’ experience of R or Python

  • At least two years practical experience of univariate and multi-variate statistical analysis in R or Python with large data sets (millions of records and many tens or hundreds of independent variables)

  • Good experience of variable transformation and data preprocessing techniques to extract maximum predictive power such as binning, piecewise linear regression, non-linear function transforms, etc.

  • Excellent practical knowledge of multi-variate techniques such as: Logistic Regression, Decision Trees, Random Forest, Naive Bayes, Clustering, etc. and a good grasp of the strengths and weaknesses of specific approaches


Bonus Qualifications:



  • Proficient in Java/C++/C# or similar language

  • Experience of agile software development

  • For the senior role, experience of managing small teams


Education:



  • A minimum of a Bachelor's or Master's degree in a mathematical discipline such as Applied Statistics, Maths, Engineering or Physics from a respected University


About you:



  • Demonstrates a high level of initiative

  • Has an enquiring mind and a disciplined scientific approach to extracting facts and understanding observed behavior

  • Is excited by the potential of analytical intelligence to realize high-value commercial outcomes and change the way that business operates

  • Consistently delivers high quality answers

  • Want to be part of a high growth startup company with global ambitions

item.title: (Linux) System Administrator at Melexis Technologies NV (Tessenderlo, Belgium)
item.description:
Your future job


As a System Administrator at Melexis, you will



  • Automate system administration tasks by shell scripting and/or company configuration management system

  • Participate in projects to deliver business value and write/maintain all relevant project documentation

  • Analyse the root cause of recurring incidents and resolve them in a timely manner in order to avoid recurrence of the issue

  • Write and give training to global and local employees to allow them to achieve the right level of use of basic applications

  • Participate in Global Helpdesk structure to effectively resolve end users requests according to SLA

  • Ensure that all IT policies are applied and followed correctly in order to build and maintain the right environment

  • Implement approved changes on the production systems according to company standards in order to achieve 24x7 uptime of operations and continuously improve infrastructure


Skills & Requirements


Your profile



  • A bachelor degree in business informatics or computer science

  • More than 2 years of experience as a System Administrator (Linux OS administration)

  • Experience with virtual server infrastructure, preferably VMware

  • Good hardware knowledge: workstation, server, LAN equipment, WAN equipment

  • Good knowledge of databases like PostgresSQL, software (installation, troubleshooting, development) and backup systems

  • Working experience in BASH scripting or Python development is a plus

  • In-depth knowledge of Debian and RedHat is a plus

  • Excellent customer orientation

  • Effective communication skills in English

item.title: Complex Systems Engineer in a well-funded startup at OnTruck (Madrid, Spain)
item.description:
The challenge



  • The road transportation industry has been stuck in the same way of doing things for the past 30 years, with complex over-the-phone transactions that could be sped up and more efficient using the right technology. Figuring our product out and getting users to switch is a tough challenge and we want your insights and experience.


The team



  • Every one of us has had several start-up experiences and on average we have 10+ years of experience in somehow similar challenges. We know success, we know failure; we've built platforms from scratch, we've dealt with large legacy systems. We care about each other and about the product we're building.

  • Some of the past projects where our engineers have been involved before joining OnTruck are: building the billing system for one of the largest telephony operators in Spain, building up and optimising complex marketplaces handling millions of orders a month, building real time video chats, building a global oauth/identity provider, improving the garbage collector of the JVM, creating social network libraries even before Facebook existed, building the Eurofighter simulator used to train pilots, building kernel modules to deal with real-time processor allocation, creating NLP algorithms to score user comments and timeline recommendation algorithms, building software to manage a backbone network, building the mobile apps of tier 1 banks, building mobile e-readers for millions for users, integrating mobile apps with Arduinos and dealing with the logistic platform of a big supermarket chain.

  • Investors like our concept and team and we've been quite successful in fundraising and gathering resources to support our future growth.


The engineering culture



  • We value speed of iteration and best practices and we care about our craft: both our API and key components have 100% test coverage, for instance.

  • We get engineers as close to the business problems as possible, so everybody is involved in solution design. We have mechanisms to enable anybody in the company to bring their new ideas to decision makers since we believe that innovative ideas come from everywhere.


The stack



  • We have a decoupled architecture, based on REST APIs and asynchronous services. We work with React in the frontend platforms (customers and admin), native in mobile apps (truck drivers), Python/Django in the transactional backend and Elixir for real-time functional needs. Our DB is PostgreSQL and the queues run on RabbitMQ.

  • We use a dedicated ERP (Odoo) to avoid reinventing the wheel there and we also have built a DWH/Analytics platform which takes advantage of external solutions.


What we offer



  • An office in the former Palacio Miraflores in the center of Madrid.

  • A laid-back culture where everybody is encouraged to participate in discussions and contribute.

  • Opportunities for personal growth and learning (we hold regular tech talks and encourage working on different parts of the platform).

  • Good salaries and stock options packages. We want our engineers to have ownership and participate in company success.

  • Flexible schedule (though no regular remote working since we believe in face-to-face communication).

item.title: Development Operations Engineer - Elements at Envato (Melbourne, Australia) (allows remote)
item.description:
IMPORTANT INFORMATION: this role is not suitable for people who do not want to live in Australia. You can work in our head office in Melbourne or may be able to work remotely while located in Australia. All applicants may be considered for all open engineering roles across the Envato (Envato Market, Envato Tuts+, Envato Studio, etc.).




  • Join our thriving global, online business

  • Work in an environment which is unique in its scale and pace of change in Australia

  • Based in our Melbourne CBD Head Office or remote (Australia wide)


Headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, Envato is the leading marketplace for creative assets and creative people. With more than 300 staff and contractors worldwide, we've helped a community of creative sellers earn more than $500 Million. Millions of people around the world choose our marketplace, studio and courses to buy files, hire freelancers, or learn the skills needed to build websites, videos, apps, graphics and more. Recently, JobAdvisor awarded us the title of Australia's Coolest Company for Women and Diversity (2015 and 2016). We were also named as one of the Best Places to Work in Australia in the 2015 and 2016 BRW Awards. You might be surprised to know that not only do we run some of the biggest websites in the world; we’re also growing really fast!


What we’re looking for


You’ll be comfortable with application development, scripting in various languages, as well as caring about the performance of the applications. You understand the underlying environment that your systems run on and can suggest and make changes. Previous experience with build deployment pipelines and integrating monitoring systems, with the expectation that deployments can happen multiple times a day without issue. You will be a hands-on team player that will want to support other teams to do the best work they can in the most efficient way. You align with the goals of the DevOps movement in improving collaboration between the development and operations disciplines.


What you’ll be doing


We value people who can roll up their sleeves and get things done while keeping the big goals in sight. As a Development Operations Engineer, you'll be working as part of a product team, to ensure the reliability, security and performance of Envato's websites. Here's a snapshot of your day-to-day:



  • Supporting the Elements team: build, troubleshoot, and optimise deployment pipelines

  • Design and Build: AWS and Heroku infrastructure and support tooling

  • Availability: work to decrease the mean-time-to-detection and mean-time-to-recovery of all systems, both public-facing and internal.

  • Monitoring: improve the monitoring and measurement systems that support our operational scale and continuous delivery

  • Performance, Efficiency & Latency: contribute to the measurement techniques that assist in the performance tuning of the applications stack

  • Security & risk: be an active contributor to identifying and mitigating risks

  • Supporting a large public-facing web-based application


Essential requirements



  • Hands on Ruby and Ruby on Rails application development experience

  • A commitment to continual learning

  • On value with Envato’s passionate and supportive culture

  • Has provided a positive contribution to both operations-focused and development-focused work

  • Communicates well in person and in writing

  • Has built and maintained cloud-based applications and infrastructure

  • Reasonable knowledge of Linux administration

  • Good understanding of monitoring and logging tools


Technologies you'll be working with


Infrastructure:



  • Heroku

  • AWS - CloudFormation and tooling

  • AWS RDS (PostgreSQL)

  • Elasticsearch

  • CloudFlare, AWS CloudFront, and imgix CDNs

  • DDoS mitigation systems


Release engineering:



  • Buildkite, Travis

  • Git

  • RSpec, ExUnit

  • RubyGems, mix


Application:



  • React, Node.js (including server-side rendering)

  • Elixir (specifically large CQRS architectures)

  • Ruby and Ruby on Rails


Monitoring:



  • New Relic, Rollbar, Papertrail, ELK, and Datadog


What we offer


The challenge of scale and speed of change


As a Development Operations Engineer, you’ll be working on Envato’s fastest growing product, Elements. Elements is built with a microservices architecture, runs on Heroku, and handles thousands of requests per minute at peak The Elements team deploy their code changes up to 25-30 times per day, all via a CD pipeline.


A great team and culture



  • We’re careful about hiring, and have built a team of great and diverse people

  • We are all responsible for features from inception through to them being in the hands of customers. We talk directly to our customers about what they’re working on.

  • We actively work on creating a safe, inclusive environment free from discrimination.

  • We work together as a highly collaborative multi-disciplinary team. You’ll be working alongside highly skilled people from product, design, UX, and marketing backgrounds, as well as other top-notch engineers.

  • Flexible working conditions – we want you to love your work but also your life outside of Envato.

  • We invest in our people as they invest in us. There’s a generous training budget, and specific measurable personal goals to use that budget.

  • We only do continuous delivery: any team member can deploy, and we regularly do several deploys a day.

  • We publish portions of our code as open source, and encourage contributions back to open source projects we use

  • We constantly support our team to improve their craft and run regular retro and education sessions

  • A fantastic culture of creatively minded, hard-working people who are passionate about Envato and being part of its growth and success

  • A fast-paced and progressive environment where everyone has regular interaction with teammates and Envato community members from all over the world!


Read more from our staff about why they love working at Envato by visiting www.jobadvisor.com.au/envato


Who should apply?


We care deeply about diversity at Envato, and welcome applicants of all types, and from all backgrounds. If you think you have the skills and experience needed for this role then we'd like to hear from you.


What next?


Submit a cover letter, an up to date copy of your resume and answers to the application questions. Good luck!

We care about your privacy. By submitting your application you are agreeing to our Privacy Policy. If you're into reading legal documents or you're keen to know more about how we handle your personal information read our Privacy Policy before you submit your application.

item.title: Network Engineering Specialist at American Family (Madison, WI)
item.description:
At American Family Insurance, were driven by our customers and employees. Thats why we provide more than just a job we provide opportunity. Whether youre already part of our team in search of a new challenge or new to our company and ready for whats next, youre in the right place. Every dream is a journey that starts with a single step. Start your journey right here. Join our team. Bring your dreams.

Quick Stats:

Job ID: 

R7568 Network Engineering Specialist (Open)

Summary:

The Network Engineering Specialist is responsible for the proper functioning of enterprise network technology infrastructure. The network infrastructure includes core network routing and switching technologies, WAN and LAN services and technologies, mobile and remote networking technologies as well as overall network monitoring and management. Mentors colleagues on the usage of network technologies and solutions and participates in client and division projects that impact network technologies and solutions. Uses expert knowledge of specific technologies and a broad understanding of other technologies and applications to provide leadership when new approaches are needed to solve difficult problems. Stays current on trends in the industry and makes recommendations for changes and improvements. Employees in this job are responsible for identifying ways networking technologies and solutions that can be leveraged to improve customer experiences and employee productivity.

Responsibilities:

Travel Requirements

  • This position requires travel up to 5% of the time
Working Conditions
  • Ability to participate in 24x7 off hour/on call on a rotating basis.
Specialized Knowledge and Skills Requirements
  • Demonstrated experience providing customer-driven solutions, support or service
  • Demonstrated experience as a technical lead.
  • Demonstrated experience designing and implementing networking systems.
  • Demonstrated experience using software development languages and tools to integrate network technology solutions with other applications and business systems.
  • Extensive knowledge and understanding of one or more supported technologies including: network routing and switching technologies; network carrier services and technologies; WAN, LAN and SAN internetworking; wireless network technologies including WiFi, cellular, and satellite; server and storage virtualization technologies including load balancing; multimedia network applications such as voice and video; firewall, session border controller and other security technologies; and, remote access control technologies.
  • Extensive knowledge of network design and configuration.
  • Solid knowledge and understanding of capacity planning methods in a network infrastructure environment.
  • Solid knowledge and understanding of infrastructure architecture principles and frameworks.
  • Solid knowledge and understanding of one or more infrastructure technologies such as database, network, security, server, storage, and workstations.

Additional Job Information:

Preferred candidates with 7 years of experience in network technology, architect design and project management. Emphasis on Cisco data center solution, wireless mobility, citrix load balancing, hp/aruba wireless mobility and fire wall security.

Based on candidate qualifications we are open to hiring at all levels based on experience

Offer to selected candidate will be made contingent on the results of applicable background checks

Offer to selected candidate in contingent on signing a non-disclosure agreement for proprietary information, trade secrets, and inventions

Our policy restricts consideration of applicants needing employment sponsorship (visas) to specialty occupations. Sponsorship will not be considered for this position

Relocation assistance is available


Job Description:

Primary Accountabilities
Network Infrastructure & Systems Support (30%)

  • Provides third level support. Troubleshoots complex operational problems and assists technologists who are less experienced in a specific technology resolve problems.
  • Escalates problems to external vendors as necessary, ensuring prompt and accurate resolution.
  • Develops and continually improves procedures, standards and methods for team members and other I/S colleagues.
  • Evaluates the operational characteristics and usage trends of the network infrastructure and components by utilizing available tools to monitor and manage reliability, availability and performance. Works with those that support client applications to identify and resolve issues to maintain operating efficiency and work quality.
  • Builds understanding of network infrastructure technologies within the organization through the creation of self-service options.
  • Shares knowledge and mentors/assists team members and other peers who are less experienced or knowledgeable in a specific technology.


Network Solutions & Services Installation, Configuration and Maintenance (30%)

  • Participates in developing the architecture for individual projects related to network infrastructure technologies and services. Uses frameworks developed by enterprise architecture and ensures that business solutions support enterprise architecture strategies.
  • Leads and direct others in the overall administration of a specialized technology.
  • Leads network hardware and software solution installation, configuration, and maintenance following established procedures and change control standards.
  • Conducts vendor business interactions such as reviewing quotes, overseeing support or maintenance issues, etc.
  • Performs post-installation verification.
  • Diagnoses and fixes the most complex system problems.
  • Performs on-going capacity planning for network infrastructure technologies to provide assurance of proper system operation and performance as well as input to software and hardware lifecycle management.
  • Develops and continually improves procedures and documentation.
  • Works with other divisions to assist with accomplishing their business objectives (i.e. Sourcing and Procurement, Finance, Call Centers, Educations, etc.) ; shares knowledge of potential business impacts of infrastructure to critical business functions such as asset management, budgets, taxes, etc.


New Technology (30%)

  • Maintains up-to-date awareness of industry developments and best practices in technologies, tools, software engineering processes, and I/S applications related to area of specialization.
  • Leads the analysis and assessment of new network technologies, conducting vendor reviews and producing Requests for Information and Requests for Proposal as appropriate. Provides recommendations for investment in new products, which may include cost/benefit analysis.
  • Manages vendor relationships on an ongoing basis, ensuring that American Family's interests are effectively represented and the organization has access to information on new developments in technology.
  • Creates reports and presentations for peer and management review and consumption.
  • Provides input to strategic architecture planning as is related to network infrastructure solutions and services. Works with the infrastructure technology architects to validate integration capabilities and consistency with other infrastructure technology solutions as well as future infrastructure technology directions.
  • Partners with clients, consultants, applications technologists, external stakeholders, and other I/S domains to understand business and systems requirements and proactively identify network technology systems needed to support the business.


Project Management (10%)

  • Provides coordination of efforts across I/S and business areas for projects and day-to-day operations. Builds relationships with customers outside of I/S.
  • Manages own tasks within a project plan using I/S standard Infrastructure methodologies (SDLC).
  • Manages medium to large size projects, or complex parts of a project, holding others accountable to delivery deadlines and quality.
  • Complies with best practices that have been established for I/S projects at American Family.
  • Participates in or leads post-implementation reviews to identify opportunities to continually improve processes.

Stay connected: Join our Talent Community!

item.title: Senior Core Java Engineer - Geospatial Search at Elastic () (allows remote)
item.description:
Want to work for a company that's family oriented with great work/life balance. Send us a short note as to why you are a fit along with your resume!


At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. Elastic's products have achieved more than 100 million cumulative downloads. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.


Do you want to work on distributed geospatial search and analytics software which impacts the lives of millions of people? We are looking for excellent back-end Java engineers who love solving problems. We’re not interested in your previous job title. Instead, we want to collaborate with bright people with a good knowledge of Java and a desire to take on new challenges.


Our Engineering Philosophy


Engineering a highly complex distributed system that is easy to operate via elegantly designed APIs is a non-trivial effort. It requires solid software development skills, and more importantly, a sharp mind and the ability to think like a user. We also care deeply about giving you full ownership of what you’re working on. Our company fundamentally believes great minds achieve greatness when they are set free and are surrounded and challenged by their peers, which is clearly visible in our organization. At Elastic, we effectively don’t have a hierarchy to speak of. We feel that anyone needs to be in the position to comment on absolutely anything, regardless of their role within the company


Right now, we are on the outlook for a passionate and talented geospatial Java Engineer to join our Elasticsearch team. This role can be based (pretty much) anywhere in the world.


These are the kinds of problems you will work on



  • Investigate and implement optimizations for geo spatial indexing and search data structures

  • Integrate new geospatial features from Lucene

  • Implement new geospatial aggregations including spatial statistics, clustering, and hot spot analysis

  • Improve existing geospatial APIs including new intercommunication formats

  • Work closely with cross product teams to expand geospatial offerings at all levels of the Elastic stack.


What you will bring along



  • Experience implementing geospatial data structures (e.g. spatial trees, tries).

  • Familiarity with exploratory spatial data analysis and spatial statistics techniques.

  • A firm understanding of geospatial coordinate systems, map projections, and datum transformations.


Do you know the answers most of these questions?



  • When would you make a variable volatile?

  • How do you decide whether to use a HashMap or a TreeMap?

  • How do you decide whether to use a CopyOnWriteArrayList or a Collections.synchronizedList(ArrayList)?

  • When would you use mergesort over quicksort?

  • When might recursion cause stack overflows?

  • Is Math.abs(Random.nextInt()) always positive?

  • What are the pros/cons of async vs. blocking I/O?

  • What unit tests would you write for Arrays.binarySearch?


Additional Information



  • Competitive pay and benefits.

  • Stock options

  • Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices

  • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life

  • Passionate people building great products

  • Employees with a wide variety of interests

  • Distributed-first company with employees in over 30 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages! Some even fly south for the winter :)


Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

item.title: Backend Engineer at Glovo (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
Glovo (glovo.recruitee.com) is constantly looking for talented and passionate engineers to join the team in our Barcelona office. You are someone who loves working in a high-paced startup environment. You enjoy tackling different problems and take pride in delivering thought-through, well designed, flexible and easy to use solutions. You work well with other top-level engineers and value constructive feedback that helps you grow as a professional. You are not afraid of getting your hands dirty with a platform or technology that you don’t know, and are always eager to learn something new.


Responsibilities



  • Join one of the teams (Customer Experience, Logistics, Content and Partners, Growth, B2B, Platform) on a mission of constantly improving the product

  • Develop software using modern engineering approaches and agile principles

  • Own your deliverables from start to finish

  • Participate in the team’s life and contribute to decision-making


Job requirements



  • Computer Science or similar degree

  • 2+ years of relevant full-time experience

  • Strong Java skills

  • Experience with scripting languages

  • Extensive knowledge of object-oriented programming and software architecture

  • Strong will to adhere to best practices in OO development and a need to leave well-structured code in your tracks

  • The urge to write unit-tests

  • Knowledge of relational databases and other approaches to data management

  • Knowledge of concurrency and Event Driven Development

  • Analytical and problem-solving skills

  • Vivid interest in at least one area outside of coding (architecture, algorithms, optimization, automation, scalability, etc.)

  • Good English

  • Experience with Spring/Play frameworks is a plus

  • Experience with other platforms is a big plus

  • Participation in open source projects is a huge plus


Benefits



  • Attractive compensation and equity plan

  • Unlimited Glovo credits

  • Back to School Fridays  (it’s all about learning and sharing  knowledge)

  • The opportunity to change the world and see how everyone uses the product you build

  • Work in an international, dynamic and passionate environment with a great company culture

item.title: C++ Developer Disrupting TV at Appear TV (Oslo, Norway)
item.description:
The rebirth of TV puts software front and center. Appear TV look to industry trends, and work in lean product teams that take on specific projects. We need skilled developers for the next TV revolution, one where the pixelated dimension is every bit as lifelike as our own.


Who are you?



  • You have a flair for C++ programming on Linux

  • You thrive in small teams, and aspire to be the team lead

  • You get a kick out of the latest generation 64-bit ARM platforms

  • You're self sustained and curious about new technologies

  • You're an artist when it comes to efficient software algorithms


What you will do in Appear TV


On the First Day, you'll join a small product team of four to eight engineers that are passionate about their product. The team lead will introduce you to the code base. The product owner will provide you with a rundown of the overall product you'll be working on, its market application and business feasibility, as well as ongoing and upcoming releases. Policy is basically dive-in, headfirst from Day One.. 


During the First Month, you will participate in the first product release. Your contribution will directly affect important features that will be demonstrated to key customers shortly after.


Upon finishing the First Year, you're established as a core team member. Clocking in the first 365, you've made a direct impact on key solutions we provide to some of the largest TV operators in one of the most dominant industries in the world.

item.title: FPGA Engineer at Jane Street (New York, NY)
item.description:
Jane Street is looking to hire an engineer with experience in both software and hardware design to work on FPGA-based applications, and on tools for creating such applications.

We're big believers in the ability of tools to make programming faster, more pleasant, and more reliable. We  think the same is true for hardware design, and we're looking for people with real world experience in hardware design who are interested in using programming language technology to improve the process of designing, testing and validating hardware designs.

This role involves working on the ground-up design and implementation of new FPGA applications, as well as helping extend and refine the high-level synthesis and testing tools that we use internally.

You don't need experience with OCaml in particular, or any experience in the financial markets, but we do want people who can approach hardware design with a software engineering mindset.  A good background with some typed functional language and experience with using FPGAs in the context of Ethernet networking are both pluses.

item.title: Backend Developer Web at Competitoor (Carpi, Italy)
item.description:
Competitoor, the italian leader in price tracking, is searching for the italian headquarter

a web analyst/backend developer

with at least three years of experience in the role.


You will be responsible for:

  • Building new and cutting-edge features,
  • Improving technology and performance that gets tens of millions of products a day
  • Managing millions of records to databases
  • Optimizing web scrapers and web crawlers


The ideal candidate has a strong motivation, method and organization in carrying out his/her duties and a real aptitude for teamwork.


Clarifications:

  • The job offer is for the Carpi (MO, Italy) office
  • No remote work

Benefits


  • Flexible working hours
  • Casual friday with aperitif during working hours
  • Team events
  • Participate in conferences
  • Free coffee
  • Kitchen, foosball, working cabinets

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - We use Ruby to Sell Rubies! at Catawiki (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Our team is collaborating on solving some complex development tasks that result from our continually increasing numbers of sellers and buyers (14 million monthly visitors and rising!). We’ve already implemented localisations for various European countries and will be expanding even further, outside of Europe, in the near future.


That is why we need your help; we want to expand our team by introducing even more expert knowledge. You will work on challenges around scale, microservice architecture and implementing new features in Product focused innovation teams in which Front-End developers, Back-End developers, a Designer, a Data Scientist, and a Product Owner all work closely together. We are driven by A/B-testing and automated testing, which allows us to do multiple releases per day on our high-traffic website.


You will work with Ruby on Rails, nginx, MySql, Redis, ElasticSearch, Javascript, React, and Git in an agile development team of 60+ developers (and growing). We have headquarters in both Assen and Amsterdam in The Netherlands.


Skills & Requirements



  • Significant experience in building complex web applications using Rails development.

  • Excellent problem solving, communication and collaboration skills.

  • Experience with relational databases (MySQL)

  • Worked on high-traffic websites (preferred)

  • Experience with A/B-testing and conversion optimisation (preferred)

item.title: System Engineer (m/w) Platform Integration at ING-DiBa AG (Nrnberg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Wo andere von komplexen Zusammenhängen sprechen, sehen Sie logische Verknüpfungen. Mit Ihrer analytischen sowie gleichzeitig kreativen Denkweise und Ihrem IT-Know-how bringen Sie Prozesse voran und entwickeln ständig neue Ideen. Das passt? Unser Team Platform Operations freut sich schon auf Sie und Ihren Input. Jump on.


Ihre Aufgaben


Anforderungen ermitteln, Probleme lösen, Teamprozesse und Aktivitäten abstimmen – das sind Ihre Stichworte. Dabei steht insbesondere die Harmonisierung des globalen Touchpoint Architecture Programs mit dem lokalen „Welcome“-Programm der ING-DiBa im Mittelpunkt. Hier planen und aktualisieren Sie nicht nur die Roadmap, sondern erarbeiten auch Lösungen mit den jeweiligen Stakeholdern und tauschen sich regelmäßig mit den Lead-Architekten, Product Ownern sowie Integratoren aus. Last but not least sind Sie mit Ihrer technischen Expertise im Service Management gefragt und meistern zusammen mit Ihren Kollegen betriebliche Probleme.


Ihr Profil



  • Studium der Informatik, Mathematik oder Physik

  • Mehrjährige Praxis in der Architektur und Entwicklung von Unternehmensanwendungen und – als Mitarbeiter oder in der Steuerung – mit agilen, internationalen bzw. verteilten Projektteams

  • IT-Know-how in Softwarearchitektur und Entwicklung, API-Management, Application Monitoring, Security und Kenntnisse in Technologien wie Polymer, Spring Boot, JEE, Cloud Foundry, ELK und Kafka

  • Verhandlungssicheres Englisch sowie Reisebereitschaft

  • Agiles Mindset und Neugier

item.title: Researcher Internship - Computer Vision at Rakuten (Setagaya, Japan)

Rakuten Institute of Technology (RIT) is the R&D department of the Rakuten group, conducting research for next-generation technologies that can empower customers. As a research assistant, you will work on projects in small teams to bridge academic research to core or emerging businesses.  As a key member of RIT, you will conduct research, design a prototype, test and deploy it as software solutions.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in software development using OpenCV

  • Mobile development

item.title: Senior Software Entwickler (PHP) (m/w) at Town & Country Haus Lizenzgeber GmbH (Kleinwelsbach, Germany)
item.description:
Die Town & Country Haus Lizenzgeber GmbH ist seit 2007 Deutschlands meistgekauftes Markenhaus. Wir suchen fr die Firmenzentrale



Senior Software Entwickler (PHP) (m/w)

Town & Country Haus wurde vor 20 Jahren gegrndet und hat mit einem innovativenv Konzept die Baubranche fr massive Ein- und Zweifamilienhuser revolutioniert. Wir sind kontinuierlich gegen den Branchentrend gewachsen. Dieses Wachstum wollen wir mit Ihnen in der Zukunft ausbauen. Im Jahr 2016 betrug unser Systemumsatz mehr als 772,5 Mio. EUR.



Wir bieten Ihnen eine abwechslungsreiche Arbeitsstelle, hervorragende Entwicklungs- und Weiterbildungsmglichkeiten, kurze Entscheidungswege und die Flexibilitt eines stark wachsenden, inhabergeprgten Mittelstandsunternehmens.


IHRE AUFGABEN

    Geschftsprozessen

  • Erstellung von Detailspezifikationen und Systemarchitektur-Entwrfen

    Systeme, CRM-Systemen, etc.) innerhalb des agilen Entwicklungsprozesses

  • Entwicklung eigenstndiger Vorschlge zur Optimierung/ Neu- und
    Weiterentwicklung der Software-Systeme



IHR PROFIL:



  • Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik (bzw. artverwandten
    Studiengangs)

  • Mindestens 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Software-Entwicklung

  • Erfahrung in der Analyse und Design von Softwareprojekten

  • Ausgeprgte Erfahrung in der Full-Stack Entwicklung mit PHP sowie
    in der Anbindung von SQL-Datenbanken (MySQL)

  • Von Vorteil aber nicht zwingend sind Kenntnisse in den Bereichen SOA, Microservices, Continuous Integration, REST, BootStrap und AngularJS,
    Docker, Scrum, JIRA Software



IHRE CHANCEN:


Unsere Mitarbeiter als Menschen sind uns wichtig: Denn nur Menschen, die sich wohlfhlen, arbeiten erfolgreich. Darber hinaus erwartet Sie eine spannende und abwechslungsreiche Ttigkeit bei einem in Deutschland fhrenden Unternehmen im Massivhausbau. Wir frdern die Weiterbildung unserer Mitarbeiter.

item.title: Senior Data Science Engineer at Rakuten (Setagaya, Japan)
item.description:
Position Summary:


We are seeking highly motivated data science engineers to work together with our data scientists to create various data science solutions for the rapidly growing Rakuten group, which provides 50+ services to more than 80 million users in Japan and 300 million users around the world.


Some numbers:



  • 55.9 billion USD of global gross transaction volume on our various platforms

  • 31 million search queries everyday

  • 2 transactions every second on Rakuten Travel

  • 200+ million items sold every year on our e-commerce platforms

  • 2 milions active accounts on Rakuten Securities


Responsibilities:



  • Designing and building a data science platform with selecting various big data processing tools and frameworks

  • Implementing ETL process of huge structured/unstructured data sets in various data platforms

  • Solving business or development problems by proposing and implement solution with the latest data science technologies

  • Developing and maintaining production level data science products with other data science engineers and data scientists

  • Creating insight reports or implementing visualized report system


Skills & Requirements


Minimum Qualifications:



  • 5+ years’ experience in software development, especially using Python as a programming language

  • Experience with common Linux commands and Linux scripting languages

  • Experience with Hadoop, MapReduce, HDFS and Big Data querying tools, such as Tez, Hive, and Impala

  • Experience with designing and building tools based on specific requirements

  • Experience with building and maintaining data science platform

  • Experience with SQL and some of the modern relational databases

  • High communication skills


Preferred Qualifications:



  • Be able to work in a team-oriented environment

  • Be able to work autonomously in Agile Scrum processes 

  • Solid knowledge of large volumes data processing

  • Experience with Big Data ML toolkits

  • Experience with NoSQL databases, like Cassandra, MongoDB

  • Experience and knowledge in building or maintaining data science solutions

  • Familiar with data mining concepts and machine learning algorithms

item.title: Senior Java Developer - Platforms & Services at Rakuten (Setagaya, Japan)
item.description:
As an application engineer, you will work on redesigning and developing the platforms at the heart of the Rakuten ecosystem comprising of over 40 products in the field of ecommerce, finance and digital contents. These platforms are serving all clients of Rakuten and Rakuten-affiliated companies, potentially reaching out to over half a billion end-users, posing a magnificent challenge in performance engineering and scalability.  You will work in agile, culturally diverse teams and regularly interface with colleagues around the world.


Responsibilities:



  • Responsible for end-to-end backend application development (requirement definition, design, development, test, release, and service operation process in project)

  • Deal with performance tuning and review architecture to improve development productivity and availability

  • Improvement for the system's stable operation and reducing operation processes


Skills & Requirements


Minimum Qualifications:



  • Hands-on developing experience in JAVA (minimum 5 years)

  • Experience in development with DBMS (Oracle, MySQL, etc.)

  • Web application development experience

  • Basic experience and knowledge of UNIX


Preferred Qualifications:



  • Solid understanding of object-oriented programming, MVC, JDBC, and RESTful API’s.

  • Basic knowledge in NoSQL database

item.title: Java-Entwickler (m/w) Backend at ING-DiBa AG (Nrnberg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Weshalb zuschauen, wenn man auch mitgestalten kann? Sie bringen die Dinge zum Laufen. Und machen sie dann jeden Tag ein bisschen besser. Sie denken auch mal unkonventionell oder probieren vermeintlich Unmögliches aus – gern gemeinsam mit den passenden Leuten. Konzeptionelles Geschick, IT-Know-how und ein Auge für komplexe Zusammenhänge – Sie merken schon: Hier ist Ihr Können gefragt. Jump on.


Ihre Aufgaben


Wenn es um die Themen Java-Entwicklung und REST-APIs geht, können wir uns voll auf Sie verlassen. Deshalb legen wir die Konzeption, Implementierung und die Unterstützung unserer zentralen Backend-Komponenten im Bereich der Mobile-Banking-Anwendungen in Ihre Hände. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit anderen agilen Entwicklerteams begleiten Sie die Integration und Produktivsetzung. Doch damit nicht genug: Sie bringen das System voran, optimieren die Prozesse und haben Spaß daran, in Ihrem agilen Team Verantwortung zu übernehmen, finden dabei kreative Lösungen und verlieren vor allem niemals das Ziel – intelligente und komfortable Apps für unsere Kunden – aus den Augen.


Ihr Profil



  • Erfahrung mit verschiedenen Methoden der Softwareentwicklung wie Java EE, API, OAuth 2, Git & GitFlow sowie REST-Schnittstellendesign und Implementierung; idealerweise in einem DevOps-Umfeld

  • Fit in agilen Methoden und Refactoring

  • Reisebereitschaft

item.title: (Sr.) Android Mobile Developer at Nanameue Inc. (Minato, Japan)
item.description:
As a mobile developer, you will play an important role to create values to our users on our communication application platform. There are more than 30M+ installed from all of our applications combined so you will have fun solving and creating apps that a lot of people love using it. Moreover, you will have a chance to help train our young junior developers to be better and create even better products. Our team is small yet perform very well and with high attention to details, we can keep pushing out more products and values to our users tirelessly.


Your responsibilities will look like (but not limited to):



  • Develop mobile applications (Android using Java and Kotlin)

  • Develop test specs and approach for the application

  • Involve with management and business guy in product development process

  • Fix any issues that may arise tracked by error management tools such as Fabric

  • Code reviewing and grow junior developer

  • Help contribute and create best practices for the team

  • Consultant for CEO and CTO on application implementation design


Skills & Requirements



  • 3 years of object-oriented software development experience

  • 3-5 years building applications for Android devices using Kotlin (and Java)

  • Experience designing clean and maintainable codebase

  • Experience with multithreading programming

  • Experience writing unit tests and testable code

  • Knowledge of Android SDK performance tools and optimization techniques

  • Good knowledge of Git version control system.

  • Good understanding in English, if you can make a joke in English, you should be fine.

  • Knowledge in Reactive Pattern e.g. Rx Java will be an advantage.

  • Japanese or Thai knowledge will give you a certain advantage.

  • If you can code well in both iOS and Android, you will be someone we consider first.


Benefits



  • Competitive salary and bonus plus standard social security insurance

  • Re-location assistance to help you start your life in Tokyo including first-time air fare to Tokyo and put you in AirBNB for a few weeks while you searching for the dream house.

  • Unquestionable for any gears that you want, MBP, large screen even good chair (unfortunately, pajamas are not included; though, we trying to get it approved soon)

  • Free snacks, fresh fruits, and drinks of course!

  • Train fare or if you lived near the office, we even give 20k JPY monthly for your house

  • Company paid for 50% of your new mobile device every year

  • We help you pay for books, language course, fitness membership, conference ticket, and even paid apps

item.title: Data Analyst (Data Team) global eCom leader - AGODA Bangkok at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
item.description:
Data Analyst (Data Team) Bangkok Thailand

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen. What's stopping you from getting in touch?

Bangkok: While it's 30+ outside, our engineers don't sweat, knowing they have the coolest jobs out there. Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe.

We move fast - why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, Agoda people come from over 74 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

Technology is not just what we do - it's at the heart of who we are. We put cutting-edge technology in your hands so you can help us change the way people run their lives. We want you to come here so they can get there - and get your career going places, too.

Responsibilities:
  • Provide problems and analysis results with valuable insights for management
  • Work closely with Business to identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using different techniques and tools such as R studio or Tableau
  • Analyse and optimise data usage, and precise for more data capturing if needed
  • Propose actionable solutions and options to solve problems


Qualifications:
  • Bachelor Degree in Computer Science/Statistics/Math or Engineering
  • At least 3-years in Data Analyst position or otherwise in projects involving big data
  • Proficient in business intelligence tools and data warehouse i.e. T-SQL commands, Tableau and MS Excel
  • Must be data savvy and love crunching numbers
  • Strong analytical skills and excellent demonstrative ability in collection of data and analysis of trends in order to predict the conclusions and recommendations
  • Experience in R studio and data modelling is a plus
  • Fluent in English with strong communication skills

item.description:
Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen. What's stopping you from getting in touch?

Bangkok: While it's 30+ outside, our engineers don't sweat, knowing they have the coolest jobs out there. Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe.

We move fast - why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, Agoda people come from over 74 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

Technology is not just what we do - it's at the heart of who we are. We put cutting-edge technology in your hands so you can help us change the way people run their lives. We want you to come here so they can get there - and get your career going places, too.

The Business Intelligence specialist will be part of the Data team you will analyse business processes and business information requirements in order to produce a set of business intelligence and management dashboard requirements for different operational parts of the business.

Responsibilities:
  • Designs and develops BI Solutions on Big data platform (Hadoop/Vertica) using ETL tools (SSIS or in-house developed ETL), OLAP and dashboard (Tableau)

  • Works as a member of product team on Agile methodology to understand business needs and provide them the right data and reports or dashboards solutions
  • Always stay on latest data and BI technology with the team.
  • Additionally, the workload will include fast turnaround of ad-hoc reports and other technical end user support for operations.

    • Bachelor's Degree or higher in IT related field
    • More than 3 years of experience in Business Intelligence area
    • Experience in ETL tools, data warehouse design, data modelling and visualisation
    • Must have good English communication and Inter-personal skills
    • Good time management and multitasking skills
    • An ability to work to deadlines and learn quickly (due to the steep learning curve involved) are essential

item.title: Senior Full-Stack Developer for Germany's real-estate market leader at Scout24 (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The commercial team is the market segment of ImmobilienScout24 that focuses on the real estate needs of companies & businesses. Your work and decisions will have a direct impact on thousands of customers and the company’s success. We are a cross-functional team responsible for helping companies to find a great new office space for their employees, funky locations for the next trendy bar or restaurant development, high impact retail locations and any other real estate to help their businesses succeed.


We value an entrepreneurial mind, openness, adaptability, being polyglot, not being afraid to take risks, ownership & responsibility. You will develop the team from technical perspective, make technical decisions, coach the team and guide them to the right technical direction.


What we need from you:



  • You build it, you run it! Develop, test and operate with your cross-functional team high-quality software for the commercial consumers and customers

  • Participate in architectural discussions, regularly propose and discuss solutions to a system or product.

  • Work with other engineers to align and propose technical solutions for problems.

  • Participate in hiring process, help attracting and retaining great talent.

  • Support and develop other Software Engineers by providing advice and mentoring.

  • Work closely with your product owner and challenge them in product initiatives and strategy.

  • Continuously improve the tools your team develops with in a lean product development mindset.


What we need you to bring:



  • You are an engineer at heart. Proficiency in modern backend programming - preferred in the Java stack (we use Spring Boot for our services)

  • Experience with modern frontend programming with JavaScript frameworks like AngularJS, Node.js and React.js/Redux  and HTML5, CSS3/SCSS/SaSS 

  • Have knowledge of cloud environments (our Docker containers are running on AWS) and cloud based architectures (IaaS/PaaS).

  • Knowledge of prevalent build tools, such as Maven, Grunt, Gulp, Webpack and Node Package Manager.

  • Knows best practice in clean code, test driven development, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.

  • Bring some years of experience working in multi-disciplinary and multi-culture teams.

  • Prefer to prove your ideas by trying them and measuring their impact. You accept failure is part of that process.

  • Strong commitment to agility and an agile mindset.

  • Fluency in English.

item.title: Anwendungsentwickler (m/w) at Surecomp DOS GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Gestalten Sie die Zukunft des internationalen Handels: im Team von Surecomp. Als führender Anbieter von Trade und Supply Chain Finance Lösungen begeistern wir Banken und Konzerne rund um die Welt. Unsere Stärken: Wir kombinieren einzigartiges IT-Knowhow mit fundierter Expertise in der Finanzindustrie. Wir stehen für große Innovationskraft – und zu recht in dem Ruf, mit unseren hochqualifizierten Mitarbeitern aus den Bereichen IT & Finance Projekte aller Größen termin-, zeit- und qualitätsgerecht zum Erfolg zu führen: im engen Zusammenspiel unserer Entwicklungs- und Vertriebszentren in Europa, Asien, Nord- und Südamerika sowie im Nahen Osten. Und jetzt kommen Sie als


Anwendungsentwickler (m/w)


Hamburg


Ihre Aussichten:


Als Anwendungsentwickler (m/w) unterstützen Sie unser globales Team bei der kontinuierlichen (Weiter-)Entwicklung unserer Trade Finance Produkte. Dabei wirken Sie im gesamten Prozess mit - von der Definition der Anforderungen bis zur Implementierung im Gesamtsystem. Zu Ihren spannenden und herausfordernden Aufgaben zählen unter anderem:



  • Analyse von fachlichen Anforderungen

  • Eigenständige und qualitätsorientierte Konzeption der Softwarelösungen

  • Design und Programmierung der Komponenten

  • Unterstützung und Begleitung der Testphase

  • Pflege und Weiterentwicklung bestehender Anwendungen

  • Analyse und Behebung von Fehlersituationen sowie Support bei komplexen Fehlern

  • Erstellung von technischen Dokumentationen


Ihre Argumente:



  • Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Informatikstudium oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung im IT-Umfeld

  • Mehrjährige Praxis in einer Programmiersprache oder mit einer Entwicklungsplattform

  • Erste praktische Erfahrungen in einer ähnlichen Rolle

  • Sichere Deutsch - und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

  • Analytische, strukturierte und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise

  • Spaß an Dienstreisen (10-20 %)


Ihre Vorteile:

Sind Sie bereit für den nächsten Schritt in Ihrer Karriere? Mögen Sie anspruchsvolle Aufgaben und Projekte im internationalen Umfeld? Dann freuen wir uns darauf, Sie kennenzulernen! Bitte senden Sie uns Ihre vollständige Bewerbung per E-Mail an eva.oster@surecomp.com. Für Fragen steht Ihnen Frau Eva Oster gerne unter +49 40 600 001-30 zur Verfügung.

item.title: MS Dynamics 365 CRM Consultant at Authority Partners (Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina) (allows remote)

Authority Partners is hiring experienced MS Dynamics 365 CRM Technical Consultants to join our growing team! The ideal candidates will have at least 3 years’ experience working with Dynamics CRM and keeps up to date with Microsoft product roadmap.


In return, we offer the opportunity to work with people who are at the top of their field, most cutting-edge technologies and modern workstations, trainings provided at the company’s expense, and much more. We reward excellence.

EDUCATION:



  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field would be of great value, but if you’re passionate and have the experience that backs up your abilities, for us, talent outweighs degree every time.

item.title: Software Engineer Data Mining at trivago (Dsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

We’re looking for an experienced developer to manage and further improve our core hotel data. We want someone to increase the amount and quality of metadata we have by analysing, investigating and interpreting data delivered by our partners and to match these to our hotel data. If you have experience with fuzzy string matching, utilizing text retrieval, machine learning and other optimization techniques, and are confident tackling over 1,000,000 hotels worth of data then we want to hear from you!



Your responsibilities:



  • Provide the data core to make our slogan, “We know everything about hotels”, come true.

  • Increase quality and quantity of metadata by developing new automated intelligent processes.

  • Write clean, composable, and testable code and extend our current codebase developed in PHP, Java and Python.

  • Participate in architecture decisions and innovative feature development tasks.

  • Use your creativity and problem solving abilities to make a difference.

  • Work in a cross-functional team with passionate experts from various fields according to the motto: “You build it, you run it”.

item.title: PYTHON SOFTWARE ENGINEER at Croud (Shrewsbury, UK)
item.description:
OVERALL PURPOSE OF THE ROLE:


Enthusiastic Python developer required for a fast growing and technically driven digital marketing agency. The role, which is based in the Shrewsbury office, entails development of our flagship platform; Croud Control and related technologies. With partnerships with key players in paid and natural search, display and paid social, the successful candidate will be a key part of an evolving development team that is producing and managing suite of tools to manage, support and enhance high profile internet marketing campaigns.

This is primarily a Python development role, involving extensive interaction with third party services and partners, so knowledge of consuming and creating RESTful APIs is also advantageous.

There will also be opportunities for developing junior team members in the future as the team grows as well as project management through liaising with external resource to ensure tasks are completed on time.


MAIN ACTIVITIES / TASKS:



  • Working directly with the Head of Development and Product Director to build components for the Croud Control Platform in Python – Follows coding standards, builds appropriate unit tests, integration tests and deployment scripts

  • Providing essential maintenance to the platform and providing support for the users of it.

  • Contribute to the improvement of the platform - suggest improvements to code, technology, architecture & workflow

  • Work with other members of the company to help improve workflow and processes.

  • Project manage external resource.

  • Assists in defining software architectures

  • Explains progress on the development effort

  • Successful delivery of the solutions to agreed timelines

  • Collaboration with leads to explore existing systems, determine areas of complexity, potential risks to successful implementation, and learn the applications capabilities

  • Contributes to continual improvement by suggesting improvements to software architecture or new technologies

  • Ensure operations requirements are met prior to production deployment

  • Assist triage and resolution for production issues as they arise


ACCOUNTABILITIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Responsible for following coding standards, builds appropriate unit tests, integration tests and deployment scripts across the team

  • Responsible for building and implementing designs from wider team to a high standard

  • Responsible for communicating continually with the client and project teams

  • Responsible for translating specification documentation provided by the product team into clearly defined functionality

  • Responsible for developing, compiling and unit test building for delivery to QA

  • Responsible for timely planning and execution of amendments due to relevant third party API updates


REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:



  • Degree level education or relevant equivalent experience

  • 2-3 years’ experience in Python Development



  • Strong experience with Python frameworks (Django)



  • Familiarity of Python, common design patterns and modern frameworks.

  • Excellent levels of communication

  • Proactive approach to work with a high level of enthusiasm for web development - we’re always keen to learn new things and discover better ways of solving problems.


DESIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:



  • Python Expert

  • Basic front End Technology skills (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript & jQuery)

  • Unit testing experience.

  • Knowledge and experience of the following products/languages: MySQL, Memcached, Apache, Nginx

  • Experience with consuming and implementing third party web services and tools - in particular:  Amazon Web Services, Google Analytics, Bing Ads & Google Adwords APIs.

  • Experience in developing REST APIs

  • Experience working with persistence technologies (relational, NoSQL)


The successful candidate will be keen to learn, want to strive for success and have a desire to question everything. An analytical mind-set coupled with the ability to think laterally is a must for this role.


KEY STAKEHOLDERS:



  • Direct Line Manager: Head of Development

  • Key stakeholders: DevOps team, Product Director, Product Manager, CTO

item.title: Java Engineer (m/w) Login & Authorisation at ING-DiBa AG (Nrnberg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Komplexe Zusammenhänge, logische Verknüpfungen und technische Abläufe – Sie sind der Gipfelstürmer mit der richtigen Ausrüstung: Kompetenz, Verständnis und der nötige Drive sind dabei Ihre Tools, mit denen Sie die Dinge zum Laufen bringen. Und sie dann jeden Tag ein bisschen besser machen. Jump on.

Als passionierter Java-Entwickler und aktiver „Online-Banker“ wissen Sie, wie wichtig IT-Sicherheit ist. Damit bringen Sie die idealen Voraussetzungen mit, um unsere bestehenden Authentifizierungs- und Autorisierungsverfahren weiterzuentwickeln.
