item.title: Director, Digital Products and Technology at NBCUniversal (Orlando, FL)
item.description:
NBCUniversal is one of the world's leading media and entertainment companies in the development, production, and marketing of entertainment, news, and information to a global audience. NBCUniversal owns and operates a valuable portfolio of news and entertainment television networks, a premier motion picture company, significant television production operations, a leading television stations group, and world-renowned theme parks. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. NBCUniversal will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with relevant legal requirements, including the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative For Hiring Ordinance, where applicable. Golf Channel connects the world to golf through a wide array of digital and lifestyle offerings by connecting fans and viewers to the game across various platforms including: facilitating online tee times through GolfNow, the world's largest online tee time reservation platform and golf course technology partner; GolfChannel.com, which delivers unmatched coverage of the world of golf; Golf Live Extra and NBC Sports Live Extra, the 24/7 live streaming options for Golf Channel programming; Golf Channel Mobile, a comprehensive app featuring golf's latest headlines, scores and analysis; GolfAdvisor.com, the world's largest golf course ratings and reviews resource for golfers, by golfers; Revolution Golf, the largest direct-to-consumer digital platform in golf; Golf Channel Academy, a North American network of instructional facilities, and Golf Channel Amateur Tour, the world's largest amateur golf tour. The Director of Golf Channel Product and Technology is a leadership position that will oversee the development and management of Golf Channel's digital properties including GolfChannel.com and Golf Channel's mobile applications

  • Lead the product and technology teams that develop and deliver Golf Channel's website and mobile applications
  • Manage external vendor relationships
  • Work directly with NBC and Comcast technology groups to manage streaming, hosting and product delivery
  • Work with key business owners to Imagine, drive and develop new products to both United States and International markets Imagine, create and drive roadmaps for both technical and product related features
  • Research and stay up on competitor's products and offerings in the marketplace.
  • Motivate, mentor and grow the product and technology team
  • Conduct competitive analysis and drive business and product development decisions.
  • Lead the Product and Project teams; track status, resolve issues, and coordinate communication during the entire product development process and ensure timely and effective product releases.
  • Define, track and improve key product metrics.
  • Conduct research and data analysis to identify customer needs and improve product quality.
  • Provide progress updates to other technology and business leaders
  • Manage multiple development priorities from multiple business owners
  • Solve problems, creatively plan and quickly negotiate the most efficient paths to results
  • Drive the SDLC while creating new streamlined processes, destroy worthless processes
  • Work closely with the quality team in implementing test driven development
  • Work closely with quality, platform and data technology teams to create roadmaps for our future products that converge the distribution platforms and business technology products
  • Help create a great work environment for your team and peers Act, Measure, and improve Other assigned tasks

    Core Competencies:
  • Critical core competencies for successful performance in this role are:
  • Highly-developed communication and leadership skills Results/action-orientation
  • Know when to dig into technology, know when to delegate
  • Ability to work and motivate using vision and leadership across business and technical teams to deliver great products
  • Organizational and political agility
  • Able to successfully navigate with varying degrees of ambiguity in a fast-paced environment
  • Pragmatism and efficiency to find the best solution to delivering new products Requirements:
  • A bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field; Master's degree a plus.
  • Minimum of 10 years experience working with CMS systems
  • Minimum of 5 years work experience required in an applicable/transferable experience: roles in engineering and technical leadership
  • Experience working and managing relationships with vendors and internal partners in a large enterprise environment
  • Experience with building Over the Top (OTT) platforms
  • Experience delivering and securing content via CDNs such as Akamai
  • Deep knowledge of video streaming/transcoding, authentication and delivery
  • Knowledge of Native App platforms (iOS, Platforms,
  • Micro-Service based architectures
  • Curiosity and interest in developing areas of technology such as Artificial Intelligence, Automation, federated/global architectures
  • Knowledge of Golf Channel, NBC Sports, GolfNow and key stakeholders desirable but not essential

item.title: Platform Architect at NBCUniversal (Orlando, FL)
item.description:
NBCUniversal is one of the world's leading media and entertainment companies in the development, production, and marketing of entertainment, news, and information to a global audience. NBCUniversal owns and operates a valuable portfolio of news and entertainment television networks, a premier motion picture company, significant television production operations, a leading television stations group, and world-renowned theme parks. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. NBCUniversal will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with relevant legal requirements, including the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative For Hiring Ordinance, where applicable. Driven by Golf Channel, GolfNow (www.golfnow.com) is the internet's largest online tee time reservation service, trusted by more than 1.5 million golfers. Using leading-edge technology, GolfNow provides more ways for golfers to stay connected to their favorite golf courses and tee times through the web, e-mail and mobile applications. As a partner to golf courses, GolfNow provides turnkey solutions to their operations (www.golfnowsolutions.com) with the main areas of focus on: * Online marketing and distribution of tee times * Web hosting, development and customer management solutions * Revenue optimization, database expansion and other course products

The Platform Engineer manages cloud-based platform services, monitoring, tooling, continuous integration/deployment, and cluster management/maintenance for all of GolfNow's cloud platforms. The ideal candidate excels in scalable environments that process billions of requests per day, using bleeding-edge cloud frameworks and tooling. This candidate will excel in software development and possess a security-first focus with respect to all responsibilities.
  • Directly responsible for the design and development of internal and external applications in any given programming language, in support of GolfNow's cloud initiatives
  • Directly responsible for deploying code and related backend servers, as well as managing network accessibility (DNS, port forwarding)
  • Directly responsible for implementation, management, and triage of CI servers and jobs
  • Conceives and implements frameworks for rapid development of common cloud-based tasks
  • Can analyze, test, and debug code in a variety of languages and frameworks
  • Contributes to the architectural standards of GolfNow cloud platforms
  • Can analyze and triage problems in unfamiliar code and against miscellaneous server processes without assistance
  • Participates in code walkthroughs and reviews as needed to ensure quality
  • Participates in security governance for PCI and PII
  • Contributes to security posture of cloud environments, including analyzing and reporting on security gaps, and hardening existing infrastructure Contributes to SDLC standards for containerized code
  • Works directly with various GolfNow technology groups to deploy code, troubleshoot problems, and relay best practices and standards for cloud environments
  • Advocate for cloud-first across the suite of GolfNow products
  • Other duties as assigned

  • Minimum of 3 years of technical expertise in managing and/or building high traffic distributed systems
  • Minimum of 3 years of technical expertise in operations for, or development of, cloud-based platforms
  • Understanding of fault-tolerant, highly-scalable distributed microservice architectures using NoSQL and message-passing infrastructure
  • Experience with Bash shell scripting,
  • Detailed knowledge of popular SCM solutions, such as Git, SVN, and TFS
  • Able to deliver quality software, and perform platform tasks, with minimal supervision
  • A self-starter mentality, with the ability to propose, spec, and execute on software solutions independently
  • Must be a team player with strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills

  • Experience in Kubernetes and Docker
  • Go, NodeJS, HTML, CSS/CSS3, Javascript and related front-end frameworks (React, Angular, Vue, etc.), and server frameworks such as Gin and HapiJS; C#/.NET, Java, Python, and C++ a plus
  • Experience with CI pipeline software, including Jenkins, Drone, Travis, and Circle
  • Experience with popular containerized backends, such as MongoDB, Redis, Elasticsearch, RabbitMQ, MySQL, PostgreSQL - includes provisioning, maintenance, triage, and the ability to use these tools for application development
  • Experience with package management solutions in various languages (npm, glide, pip) a plus
  • Experience with common network and network application standards, including TCP, UDP, IP, HTTP, REST, SOAP
  • Experience with Linux-based environments, tooling, and networking: environment variable conventions, syslog, iptables, network interface management, security policy, cgroups, curl/wget, dig, and other common utilities

item.title: Research Scientist - Internet of Things at Siemens (Berkeley, CA)
item.description:
The Web of Systems (WoS) research group has been established in Berkeley, California as part of Corporate Technology, the research division of Siemens Corporation. For more than thirty years, leading organizations in the private and public sectors have turned to the company for its expertise in breaking down barriers to innovation and delivering real business value. With more than 250 scientists, engineers, and technical experts, Siemens Corporate Technology helps its customers and strategic partners grow their businesses in the fields of automation, production, energy, industry, information, and communications.

The WoS research group offers a stimulating research environment and rewarding career opportunities in proximity to universities, research institutes, and start-ups. Siemens is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace.

The WoS research group has an immediate opening for a full-time Research Scientist position to work on R&D projects in applying semantic technologies to Internet of Things applications in industrial, smart buildings, smart grid and traffic management contexts. The candidate will have extensive knowledge and experience in Internet and web technologies and Internet of Things (IoT). The ideal candidate will have background in the state-of-the-art, a strong network in the IoT research community and the ability to transfer methods to, and provide working solutions for, commercial, scientific or industrial applications. The candidate should be experienced in publishing scientific papers and applying for public grants. The candidate should be driven by an entrepreneurial spirit and have the passion and energy to get things done in a proactive manner.

Responsibilities
• Apply networking and processing, and semantic reasoning to real-world problems.
• Contribute to research projects and develop IoT applications to be executed on various types of systems.
• Advance the state-of-the-art in the field, including generating patents and publications in top journals and conferences.
• Fast prototyping, feasibility studies, specification and implementation.
• Work with customers to understand problem requirements, creating and delivering solutions to such problems.
• Reach out to US research institutes and start-ups for acquiring joint projects.
• Support acquisition of funds from public agencies and Siemens divisions.
• Lead research projects.
• Presentation of research results at conferences and project partners.
• Consulting to Siemens R&D divisions with regards to Web/IoT technologies and applications.
• Maintaining and developing internal and external contacts.
• Supervision of Master, Bachelor, and internship students.

Skills & Qualifications
• Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related discipline is required.
•  5 plus+ years of experience (including Ph.D. study) in related field and successful demonstration of key responsibilities. 
• Proven expertise with prototype development and deployment of IoT applications.
• Proven ability to generate and develop new research ideas as demonstrated by a strong publication record and implementation of working system prototypes.
• Strong theoretical and practical background in Web Service Technologies


• Experience with Semantic Web, Semantic Sensor Networks, Semantic Search, and Reasoning is appreciated
• Established and well connected in the IoT and ubicomp research community.
• Experience in leading research projects.
• Excellent interpersonal skills and a can-do attitude and the ability to work independently and prioritize work.
• Strong collaboration skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
• Mix of technical curiosity and feel for business relevance.
• Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills in English required.

• Successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. US Export Control laws and applicable regulations govern the distribution of strategically important technology, services and information to foreign nationals and foreign countries. Siemens may require candidates under consideration for employment opportunities to submit information regarding citizenship status to allow the organization to comply with specific US Export Control laws and regulations. Additional information on the US Export Control laws & regulations can be found on http://www.bis.doc.gov/index.php/policy-guidance/deemed-exports/deemed-exports-faqs?view=category&id=33#subcat34


For more information please refer to our website at www.usa.siemens.com/wot


Equal Employment Opportunity Statement 
Siemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, protected veteran or military status, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.


EEO is the Law 
Applicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination. To learn more, Click here.

item.title: Back End Team Engineer - Agoda Hiring Now - Bangkok Based at Big Wednesday Digital (Bangkok, Thailand)
item.description:
Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen. What's stopping you from getting in touch?



Overview:



For our rapidly growing IT organisation, we are looking for software engineers from many different experiences and qualifications to strengthen back end engineering team.

Being a software engineer at Agoda isn't just about developing software. It's about being a centre piece of the innovation and technical excellence that the rapidly changing field of online travel requires.

Do you find yourself frequently pondering:
  • How to do things faster and better?
  • How technology could interact?
  • How a new technology would help you to do new things?
  • How a customer would use your products?


If so, then Agoda is the right place for you.

Responsibilities:



When you join as an engineer we like you to think about the full life cycle of our products, and not just about a single piece of code. From customer requirements, technology selection to coding standards, agile development, unit and application testing.

Qualifications:



Some of the technologies that we work with:
  • Scala, C# or Java. You might have experience in other languages but are confident you can learn.
  • Data platforms like SQL, Cassandra or Hadoop. You understand that different applications have different data requirements.
  • Core engineering infrastructure tools like Git for source control, Jenkins for Continuous Integration and Puppet for deployment.


About You:



You might call yourself "full stack" or "back end" or you might consider yourself an authority in a certain field, but you will have a keen interest in how the different systems work together.

We'd love to hear from you if you are experienced in any of the technologies we work with (note - we are not looking for you to have them all). We are interested in speaking to persons of any level from individuals just starting their IT careers to experts in their field.

Perks:

  • Generous annual leave increasing each year with additional business and family leave days
  • 15 days of public holidays
  • Provident fund
  • Local or International health insurance options available
  • Staff discounts on hotel bookings
  • Staff discount scheme on restaurants, flights and local amenities
  • Free Thai or English classes (if you want to learn or improve these skills)


Please apply now and we will tell you all about the numerous projects we currently have on the go.

We are happy to receive CV's from both international & local applicants as we offer relocation assistance and visa sponsorship for eligible persons.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

item.title: Software Engineer (React Native, Full-stack) at Ninja Van (Singapore)
item.description:
Join a passionate team at a still-very-young startup to attack the massive eCommerce logistics space with cutting-edge software. Work your tail off alongside other smart people, get challenged every day while having fun in an organized chaos. As part of a small team, you will have a very direct impact on the success of the company.


Roles & Responsibilities



  • Design, develop and maintain software that powers Ninja Van's complex logistics operations. 

  • Work in cross functional teams with product managers, UX designers and QA engineers to ship software on-quality and on-time.

  • Write code that you are proud of, with extensibility, scalability and performance in mind. 


Skills & Requirements


We are on the lookout for world-class talent to join our world-class engineering team. We want people who are passionate about creating software that makes a difference to the world. We like people who are brimming with ideas and who take initiative rather than wait to be told what to do. We prize team-first mentality, personal responsibility and tenacity to solve hard problems and meet deadlines.


Requirements



  • Solid Computer Science fundamentals, excellent problem-solving skills. 

  • 1-5 years of backend or frontend development in a product company, with a proven track record of shipping successful software products.

  • New graduates with stellar academic records and extensive internship experiences also welcome.

  • Hands-on experience in most of our tech stack or similar technologies.

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field from a top university.


Tech Stack



  • Data storage: Percona MySQL, ElasticSearch

  • Data access, messaging: Hibernate, Hazelcast, Kafka

  • Server core: Java on Play, microservices

  • Frontend: React Native apps, HTML5/AngularJS web apps, native Android apps

  • Infrastructure and deployment: AWS, Docker, Ansible


Other positions available: Senior Software Engineer, Software Engineer Intern

item.title: Director Product and Engineering at ClearScholar (Indianapolis, IN)
item.description:
Overview


We are building a mobile product that allows students at universities to better engage with their schools.  We’re looking for a leader and full stack engineer with deep experience with JavaScript Frameworks and data integration. Our platform is powered by React, React Native, MongoDB, and Elastic Search. We’re looking for someone to serve as the leader and cornerstone of our development team. 


The role will provide leadership on: roadmap, project & portfolio management, engineering processes, staff recruitment, and development.  In addition, the director would act as the overarching product architect and would be a full stack engineer as well.


What we’re looking for:


– You’ve had experience working in and leading a team of fellow engineers.


– You are excited about the fast pace of a growing, changing startup environment, with the opportunity to manage other developers added to the team.


– You’re an experienced full-stack developer who prefers to focus on the back-end and middle-tier of applications.


- You enjoy wearing the hat of Application Architect who recommends new technologies while accurately accessing the impact of changes to the overall solution.


– You’ve built applications with progressive JavaScript frameworks (e.g. Node, React, React Native) to build and maintain world-class cross-platform applications.


- You are comfortable working with a NoSQL back-end (MongoDB, Elastic Search).


- You thoroughly enjoy integrating disparate data sources through several methodologies including APIs, secure flat file exchange and ETL.


– You are comfortable managing the deployment and hosting of JavaScript applications on Amazon WebServices.


- You appreciate well-oiled DevOps including GitHub code repository management, release management and continuous integration.


- You have solid experience working within the Apple App Store and Google Play Store.


- You appreciate the Agile Scrum framework and have served as a productive member of one or more Scrum teams.

item.title: Full-Stack Engineer (Web) at Grab (Singapore)
item.description:
The Grab web teams work on both desktop and mobile web apps, building delightful, performant user interfaces that our passengers use to access booking and ride information. Grab full stack engineers also provide the company with internal web portals that support the core business logic of Grab. 


We feel everyone should have access to transportation, so your high-quality delivery is vital to Grab and our community.



  • Design, implement and manage web apps that impact millions of users. 

  • Experience an exciting culture that uses the state of the art web technologies.

  • Grow in an environment passionate about knowledge-sharing and code review.

  • Learn software engineering practices for coding at scale: static analysis, feature flags, instrumentation, and more.

  • Design and implement RESTful APIs.

  • Build and deploy performant modern web applications in React, Redux, Webpack, ES6, and Flow

  • Architect efficient and scalable backend systems.

  • Write unit, functional and end-to-end tests.

  • Write high-quality code (Ruby on Rails, Go) that communicates with upstream backend services via HTTP APIs.

  • Identify and resolve performance and scalability issues.

  • Participate in code reviews.

item.title: Software Engineer, Mobile (iOS) at Grab (Singapore)
item.description:
Grab is currently seeking experienced and energetic iOS developers at different levels for our Singapore office with experience in native iOS app development and strong interpersonal skills. You will work in a diverse teams of mobile engineers that focus on the development of either our iOS passenger or driver applications. Our engineering teams are relatively small and product specific, which means that as a mobile engineer you have the opportunity to extensively collaborate with, and learn from others. More importantly, everyone holds accountability and directly impacts Grab’s success. Every ‘Grabber’ is equally important. You will specialise in crafting and maintaining elegant products on innovative technologies that bring our unique on-demand transport experience to millions of people, anytime and anywhere. With over 49 million mobile downloads, we are processing millions of bookings a day and billions of traffic data points per month. When you push out new code,tons of people will see what you made within seconds. Operating on this level is hard, but deeply rewarding. Our applications consist of large and complex code bases and architectures. Grab’s primary products are our driver and passenger applications, which are developed by our mobile engineers. We feel everyone should have access to transportation, so your high-quality delivery is vital to Grab and our community.



  • You will work closely with the Product, UX/UI and Backend teams to design, build and extend consumer and/or partner facing new products, platforms and features.

  • More senior engineers will act as a role model and mentor to more junior members.

  • Build re-usable iOS software components for the Grab platform.

  • Collaborate with QA on continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) as well as other automated and manual testing to make sure our app releases are always worthy of five-star ratings.

  • You will monitor the performance of the live apps and continuously improve them on both code and experience level.

  • You will raise the bar by reviewing each other's code, sharing knowledge, tips and tricks, and generally help out - within and across teams. At Grab, we call this principle 'Your Problem is My Problem'.

item.title: Front End Software Engineer (All Levels) at BGL Group (Peterborough, UK)
item.description:
As a Front End Software Engineer you will deliver innovative and robust solutions that create a world class online experience for our customers!



You will be joining a team of over 35 exceptionally talented people who are together shaking up the life insurance industry. As a Front End Developer you would be part of both our E-commerce and Developer teams, these teams are bringing to the market pioneering new technologies for our website.
In this role you have the option to use 5% of your time on whatever you want to encourage innovation and development amongst your creative team. We are not afraid to fail and neither should you be, so that we can continually raise the bar in terms of standards, processes and practices. As a Front End Developer you will encourage the creation of superior high quality designs and ensure existing ones are top of the class so that we can ensure technology always comes first!


What will it take to be successful as a Front End Software Engineer at Beaglestreet?



  • Enduring commitment to the development and enhancement of websites

  • Happy to work collaboratively with a team and deliver well thought-out solutions.

  • Ability to optimise images for the web

  • Strong track record in creating market leading designs

  • Good understanding of front-end technologies, including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery


For more Senior Front End Developers…



  • Architecting and developing complex JavaScript-powered applications

  • Use of custom written JavaScript

  • Understanding of OOP

  • Some experience in AJAX techniques

  • Experience integrating with server-side code (PHP/Wordpress/.Net) to produce dynamic pages

  • Experience designing and developing responsive design websites

  • Experience working with version control systems such as git

  • Javascript frameworks & libraries such as React or Angular to create rich interactive content

  • Strong understanding of Wordpress/PHP back-end development

  • JavaScript unit testing tools – such as Jasmine, Protractor and Jest

  • Knowledge of how to interact with RESTful APIs and formats (JSON, XML)

item.title: Senior UE4 programmer at Bluehole (Seongnam-si, South Korea)

item.title: Mobile Application Developer - Lisburn, NI at Camlin Group (Lisburn, UK)
item.description:
Role and Responsibilities:


As a Mobile application developer, you will be responsible for the implementation and support of new and existing mobile applications for both internal and external customers.  You will be working in an agile team, designing and developing software and tests.


Your Responsibilities:



  • Developing high quality software as well as unit and component tests within a continuous integration environment

  • Developing scripts to automate and streamline development activities

  • Co-ordinating with the Product Owner, team members and other stakeholders to meet business objectives

  • Participating in project planning sessions and providing estimates

item.title: Full-stack Developer (Scala, Angular) for a rapidly growing company in Helsinki at Cloudator (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
Cloudator is a Great Place to Work, because we care about our work and each other. Our goal is to provide a cutting edge Payroll solution to the international markets. We reach that goal by working closely together, helping one another and setting quality and continuous improvement as our top priorities. We are fueled by the desire to make a difference. Humor, work-life-balance and having a good time keep us energized.


Cloudator is the biggest Workday deployment partner in the Nordics and the provider of multi-country, cloud-based Cloudator Payroll solution.


We are looking for Full-Stack Developers to join our growing tech team in Helsinki.


As a full-stack developer, you get to take on a wide range of responsibilities and participate to the development and improvement of our product and ways of working. You’ll be empowered to be self-driven and put your creativity into use. There are no strict borderlines between tasks in our development team. The most central technologies at the moment are Scala, Akka, AngularJS, NodeJS, Robot, Docker, Jenkins and Git.


What will you actually do:



  • Implement new features, fix defects, automate tests on all layers of the "tech stack"

  • Continuous improvement of automation & deployment tooling, overall design of the system, processes and metrics, codebase

  • Participate to architecture workshops

  • Refine requirements and discuss them with stakeholders

  • Participate to job interviews and coding task reviews for new candidates

  • Bring up your new ideas in any other relevant aspect


This job is for you if you get your kicks out of:



  • Working with product development and seeing the concrete results of your work

  • Problem solving, using your creative mind, bringing up improvement suggestions

  • Flat hierarchy, freedom and responsibility

  • Working with a tight-knit, international team

  • Flexible working hours and laid-back work environment

  • Developing yourself and learning new technologies


What you’ll bring to the job



  • Excellent knowledge of at least Scala or Angular

  • Willingness to evolve as a developer and learn new technologies

  • Experience of working in product development

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English

  • Extra points from knowledge of our other central technologies


You can get a glimpse of our culture by checking out our Facebook page or learn more about our business on our website. If you'd like to discuss more about the opportunity, hit the apply button and get in touch with us - we're excited to get to know you!

item.title: Frontend Developer - Full Stack (f/m) - Real UI development at Younicos AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Are you keen to help shape future power supply?


Are you passionate about writing clean code?


You want to develop something real?


Then this job is for you


As a frontend developer at Younicos, you will work on our Y.Q platform, which monitors, supervises and controls various electrical components like batteries, inverters , pv plants, wind farms, thermal generators, transformers, switchgears and auxiliary systems. The development of the Y.Q platform, which runs as 24/7 service on site, is based on a distributed, messaging-based architecture. Specialized subsystems ensure the optimal control of the electrical components and implement technical interfaces for transmission line operators, energy providers and remote monitoring.


As part of an agile team (Scrum) you will work on all aspects of the UI development. Strongly modularized system architecture, documentation of the design and functional specifications, high performance UI design, test driven development, fully automated integration testing and building the final product are your day-to-day tasks. Depending on your skills and interests you might work on the general user guidance, the automation and generation of building blocks of the UI, graphical representation of live and historian data, interface to the database or interface to the messaging system to give you some ideas.


All developments are performed in close collaboration with the Y.Q development team and our technical engineers to understand and visualize the technical requirements of the electrical equipment. With your team, you will develop the best technical solutions while having the freedom and the responsibility to bring your innovative ideas to life.


Your main responsibilities are:



  • Design/maintain graphical user interfaces which allow the operators to control the systems over the web

  • Write web based reports and extract pertinent information from the SQL/NoSQL database

  • Develop new solutions for time series and event based data for monitoring and reporting


Your profile


From the technical point of view a must is



  • completed university studies in UI design, user interaction design, computer science, informatics or comparable studies

  • years of professional experience in UI development ,ideally in an agile process environment

  • Experience in user guidance and UI design.

  • Experience in developing/architecting PHP/MySQL-based web applications (LAMP) ideally for industrial applications.

  • Desire for writing and testing clean, efficient and reliable code


Welcome is



  • Hands-on expertise with JavaScript, DHTML, and CSS, Angular

  • Demonstrated experience with web user interface toolkits.

  • Experience with PHP alternatives and backend programming like Java, Node.js, Scala is a plus

  • Experience with TSDB like InfluxDB or Prometheus

  • RDBMS experience with MySQL, PostgreSQL, or similar.

  • Experience with MVC frameworks.

  • Familiarity with Agile/Scrum.

  • Familiarity with Version Control Systems (Git).

  • Experience with testing and continuous integration platforms: Selenium, PHPUnit, Jenkins.

  • Linux skills and experience with networking equipment is a plus


From personal point of view:



  • A strong focus on teamwork and a commitment to always let the best idea win

  • Exceptional attention to detail, thoroughness and accuracy

  • Basic understanding of the principles of electrical engineering is a plus

  • Basic German is a plus


Our offer



  • The opportunity to build the technology facilitating higher renewable energy shares

  • Motivated, passionate colleagues who love to get things done

  • Open discussion culture and the opportunity to shape every aspect of your work

  • Bright, spacious and comfortable offices in the lovely city of Berlin

  • Flexible working hours

  • Permanent contract

item.description:
Senior DevOps Engineer:



About the role:


Bluebeam is looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to join our team. In this role, youll work collaboratively with software engineering to deploy and operate our systems and help automate and streamline our operations and processes. You will help design and manage cloud based infrastructure that supports an ever-expanding customer base as well as internal applications. Youll build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations and youll troubleshoot and resolve issues in our dev, QA and production environments. You should have broad technical experience supporting SaaS products and related infrastructure (as well as CI/CD pipelines.)



What you'll be doing:



  • Consult on systems architecture.

  • Develop automation frameworks.

  • Develop and implement systems featuring high-availability, horizontal scalability and self-healing capabilities.

  • Improve our build and deployment processes.

  • Maintain systems related to the CI/CD pipeline.

  • Monitor, analyze and report performance statistics for cloud hosted environments.



What we'd like to see in you:



  • 5+ years of experience with building, deploying, administration and monitoring of SaaS applications and related infrastructure on both Windows (.NET) and Linux platforms.

  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure).

  • Understanding of high availability and scaling solutions like caching, CDNs, load balancing, clustering.

  • Demonstrable experience scripting with languages like Python, PowerShell, bash, etc.

  • Knowledge of both RDBMS and NoSQL database solutions like MSSQL, MySQL, Casandra, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, etc. from an Ops perspective.

  • Experience with configuration management tools such as Puppet, Chef, Ansible, PowerShell DSC or others.

  • Experience with build systems such as Jenkins, Bamboo, TFS, etc.

  • Experience with source control systems such as Git, Bitbucket, TFS, etc.

  • Hands on experience with monitoring and APM tools such as Nagios, Icinga, SCOM, SolarWinds, New Relic, AppDynamics, etc.

  • Experience with log aggregation tools such as ELK stack, Splunk, SumoLogic, etc.

  • Experience with system hardening and implementing security controls is a plus.

  • Excellent work ethic and willingness to put in extra time as needed.

  • Positive attitude and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

item.title: Director of Software Development at Bluebeam, Inc. (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
Everything that we do at Bluebeam is in an effort to create value for our customers as we serve them, partner with them and innovate on their behalf to move their work forward.



At Bluebeam, we hire for both competency and character. We are committed to hiring employees with the ability to achieve superior results while approaching their work ethically using a team-based approach.


We believe that teamwork is the ultimate long-term competitive advantage, and we hire those who can remain committed to company-wide results which create value for our customers rather than focusing on their own desires for power or career advancement. This means that every employee needs to be willing to roll up their sleeves, no matter the task, to ensure the company (not just a department or individual) accomplishes its goals.


We also believe that all employees are leaders, whether they proactively lead themselves through their daily activities, or lead a team.


We hire people who:



  • Have integrity

  • See challenges as opportunities

  • Are committed to continual improvement

  • Know how to give and receive constructive feedback

  • Demonstrate trust and are willing to be vulnerable about mistakes and weaknesses

  • Engage in positive, productive conflict and unfiltered debate of ideas

  • Can fully commit to corporate decisions, even if they disagree with some of them

  • Hold peers accountable in order to ensure we achieve our company goals on behalf of our customers

  • Are laser-focused upon achievement of Bluebeams company-wide results


Bluebeam employees are a team of people committed to winning together as we work to create value for our customers. And we are committed to winning the right way both ethically and as a team.



What We Are Looking For


Bluebeam is looking for an experienced Software Development Director to execute on the strategy and technology direction for Revu, our flagship application. If you have the desire to make an impact on the way we develop the next generation of Bluebeam products while leading a team of incredibly committed, customer-driven team members, please apply.



Role Summary



  • Strategic partner to the VP of Software Development, VP of Product Management, CTO and the leadership team with a focus on creating value for our customers by delivering world-class software.

  • Oversee all day to day software development operations for the Revu product line.

  • Promote a culture of developing best in class software by empowering our teams to follow software development design and quality best practices.

  • Inspire our product development teams to innovate, learn, and challenge the status quo.

  • Partner with Product Management to ensure we have a cohesive technology vision for Revu.

    • Identify and communicate high-level feature goals/objectives.

    • Breakdown large feature goals into manageable objectives.

    • Improve the planning and forecasting of the work being done by all Revu product development teams.



  • Set and promote development standards and processes

    • Help our team grow while maintaining a healthy code base

    • Ensure our processes are scalable



  • Mentor and develop our coaches (people managers)

    • Develop and grow talent via coaching and mentoring

    • Ensure our teams are following proper continuous integration processes

      • Pull request are completed with code metrics and build passing requirements

      • Unit test coverage is monitored and used as a success metric

      • Integration testsare executed and used as a success metric



    • Ensure Revu is ready for international adoption as we continue to expand across the world


      • Provide adequate support for language translation

      • Identify and assess any basic functionality that is essential to early international adopters, and put a plan in place to fill any technical/functionality gaps



    • Report on Revu development projects and objectives

      • Establish, monitor, and communicate success metrics







Core Competencies



  • 10+ years of software development experience in mid to large size companies with a proven track record of delivering high-quality software products to the market.

  • 5+ years of proven hands-on technical management experience.

  • Hands-on experience in leading, technically-challenging, cross-functional software development initiatives.

  • Proven experience leading projects and teams through challenging conversations and initiatives.

  • Experience with Microsoft Dot Net Technologies, in particular, C#

  • Experience designing enterprise applications using established design patterns (MVVM, MVC, etc.) and processes such as TDD, BDD, Scrum, and Agile Development.

  • BS/MS in Computer Science or related Software Engineering field.



If you think you are a good match for the Bluebeam team, please send the following:



  • Resume

  • Cover letter. Please let us know why Bluebeam and this role is of interest to you. (No generic letters please!)



Learn more about Bluebeam here:http://careers.bluebeam.com/



#LI-LM1

item.title: Senior Engineer at EE (City of London, UK)
item.description:
Senior Engineer

Location: London/Leeds

Salary: Competitive + benefits



The job:

We're EE. And we're the future of digital. As the #1 brand in an innovative, dynamic industry, we're transforming the way our 32 million customers connect with the world around them, and with us. We pride ourselves on being a truly digital-first business - whether we're providing top notch technology or smarter smartphone deals, we recognise that as the UK's biggest, fastest network, we're being trusted to improve digital lives. So we need to make sure the EE experience is the very best it can be. And that means supporting brilliant people in a collaborative culture that puts customers first. Our Digital team is at the very heart of that. This talented bunch are shaping the way we bring the right products to the right people at every stage of the EE journey. It's their impact on the way we do business that's inspired us to invest in a brand new digital infrastructure. And it's why we want to invest in you.

We're looking for a Senior Engineer with the technical expertise and strategic vision to keep us ahead of the competition. You'll manage the continuous evolution of our key systems and champion the appropriate technology and framework choices that will define how we achieve outstanding customer service, satisfaction and commercial return. You'll be designing and developing software solutions acutely aligned to the business' objectives and be responsible for implementing these using both internal and external partners. We need someone fanatical about innovation and new technology who has the passion to get others excited and turn ideas into action.

What you'll do:
  • Develop first class code as part of an Agile development team
  • Work on one of the UK's busiest eCommerce websites in a fast paced and friendly environment
  • Mentor junior developers, manage code reviews and ensure quality code delivery from other members of the team
  • Progress or develop skills in Adobe Experience Manager Java component development
  • Work closely with product owners and business stakeholders to create software that delivers real business value
  • Help create standards for all technical input and assist in ensuring compliance
  • Act as an internal consultant, offering strategic guidance and technical leadership as required
  • Proactively champion existing and emerging technology wherever it can improve outputs.


You'll definitely:
  • Have solid experience in Java development and be able to pickup new technology quickly
  • Personable and able to both fit into the team and work alongside senior business stakeholders
  • Be self starting and enthusiastic about new technology
  • Care about crafting great quality code




You might even:
  • Have an understanding of the telecoms industry
  • Have experience working on business-critical, high availability systems
  • Have past Devops experience




What's in it for you?
  • Competitive salary
  • Pension
  • Healthcare Cash Plan
  • Bonus
  • Life Assurance
  • 25 days' holiday
  • 75% discount on your personal EE mobile phone package
  • 30% Friends and Family discount from day one (conditions apply)
  • Other discounted products and services, as well as a range of other benefits




At EE, we're creating an inclusive working environment where people from all backgrounds can succeed. Diversity makes sense for us, for our customers and for our future. We value different perspectives, skills and experiences, and welcome applications from all sections of the community.

If you're thinking about working for the UK's biggest and fastest network, why not follow our shiny new recruitment channels on Twitter, LinkedIn and Glassdoor. Packed with the latest jobs, company news and career stories it could be a great move.

item.title: Senior Software Engineers at ARANZ Geo (Christchurch, New Zealand)
item.description:
ARANZ Geo specialises in the interpretation and 3D visualisation of geoscience information using software modelling. It takes a special mix of people to make our cool and innovative software, and we’re immensely proud of how far we have come.


We currently serve the mining, geothermal and hydrogeology markets. With so many talented people with passion for building great software, we are fast expanding into the energy, civil engineering and environmental sectors. Our products are built for the desktop, enterprise, and increasingly the cloud.


We are looking for experienced Senior Software Engineers to fill a number of product development roles in our Christchurch, New Zealand R&D team.


Tech Stack


Our technology stack is based on a wide array of open source tech mostly written in Python. Don’t worry if haven’t coded in Python yet, as we as have many developers who started off in C# or C++.


We are an agile development company using state of the art tools like JIRA, GIT and TeamCity to tackle complex problems backed up by code reviews and lots of exploratory and automated testing.

item.title: Senior Engineer - Manchester at ThoughtWorks (Manchester, UK)
item.description: We are looking for passionate developers & engineers who care about software excellence. We want people who are aware of latest trends and know how to adopt the most appropriate technology. We're looking for people who are strong advocates for the best engineering practices and love learning new skills. As a Senior Developer at ThoughtWorks, here's what you can do: Work on large-scale, custom-designed, multi-tier, enterprise-level software development projects using languages such as Java, Ruby and/or .NET, Scala, Clojure, Mobile and Python (to name a few) Help the team to champion software quality and engender technical vision and ensuring clients are satisfied Champion agile best practices and Continuous Delivery Be an ambassador of ThoughtWorks and safeguard our reputation Build strong relationships with business people Learn something new everyday Facilitate problem solving and work with a team to make them reality. Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchical, and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title Develop your career outside of the confinements of a traditional career path by focusing on what you’re passionate about rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all plan Help to grow the next generation of developers and have a positive impact on the industry Here’s what you’ll bring: Hands-on development and delivery experience with a broad mix of languages and technologies Passion for software engineering and craftsman-like coding prowess Great OO skills, including strong design patterns knowledge and enterprise integration Experience working with Agile, Lean and/or Continuous Delivery approaches and best practices, such as Continuous Integration, TDD, BDD, Infrastructure as Code etc, Ability to work in a variety of client settings and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment Knowledge of software best practices like Refactoring, Clean Code, Domain Driven Design, Encapsulation etc   Experience of working in a forward thinking, OSS-centric environment We work almost exclusively on customer site providing a mix of delivery and consulting services, so ideally you’ll be flexible about travel.

item.title: Data Scientist - Payments at Zalando Payments SE & Co.KG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
You Are Ready To Make an Impact

At Zalando Payments, we are processing all financial transactions of Zalando's fashion store and other consumer facing apps. Starting with a flawless user experience in the checkout over the processing of the payments to reconciliation in the backend, we cover the entire financial process to boost conversion and deliver a competitive advantage to our customers through smart risk steering.

You Are Setting Standards

Variety. As a team you will research, design and implement machine learning algorithms to improve our payment solutions.
Ownership. You will be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment.
Excellence. Share your knowledge and passion about delivering scalable real-world machine learning solutions to end users, and help your colleagues excel.

You Are Skilled

Technologies. You have already worked with big data frameworks before (we use Apache Spark). You are eager to prototype new machine learning concepts (in R or Python) and are also able to push them all the way to production. You also have experience building production systems at scale (experience in Scala or Java is a plus).
You have experience in applied machine learning and know at least one of the following methods in depth (regression, tree-based methods, ensemble learning). And you have a good understanding of the mathematical concepts that are frequently used in machine learning (linear algebra, probability theory)
Code Quality. You are ready to deploy your code to production (including testing, CI, deployment) and taking ownership.
Education. You have a degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics or another similar quantitative field (PhD, M.Sc.) and are eager to keep learning and applying new knowledge.

You Are Offered

Culture. A workplace where trust, empowerment and feedback are valued; positive, inspiring working atmosphere.
Perks. Competitive salary; great shopping discount on a wide range of products on zalando.com; discounts from external partners; office in the heart of Berlin; public transport discounts; relocation assistance for internationals; municipality services; flexible working times; family service and parent & child rooms*; additional holidays and volunteering time off; diverse sports and health offerings*. (*Depending on location)
Development. Mentoring; personal branding support focused on leadership; diverse career opportunities.
Peers. International, accomplished experts.

Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!
If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring process, please contact our recruiter Maria Garcia

item.title: Python Developer/DevOps (Reston, SF, Houston or Glendale) at Bechtel Corporate (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
• There are TWO openings on this team.

Responsibilities:


Developing new functional capabilities within software applications to meet a wide range of customer requirements and operational needs


Responsible for performing development, integration, test and documentation duties to ensure proper operation of hardware and software platforms


Integrating a wide variety of applications from various sources, and ensuring they meet performance standards for stability and resource utilization
