item.title: Senior Cloud Architect for Enterprise infrastructure projects m/f at Cloudreach (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Big dreams often start small. From an idea in a London pub, we have grown into a global cloud enabler which operates across 7 countries and speak over 30 languages.


Our purpose at Cloudreach is to “enable innovation”. We do this by helping our customers adopt and harness the power of cloud computing. We believe that the growth of a great business can only be fuelled by great people, so join us in our partnership with AWS, Microsoft and Google and help us build  one of the most disruptive companies in the cloud industry. It’s not your average job, because Cloudreach is not your average company.


Our office is located in the heart of Berlin, a short stroll away from Friedrichstraße. See what our employees love about Cloudreach: Life at Cloudreach


Which team will you be part of?


As a Cloud Architect you are part of the Cloud Enablement team. Our Cloud Enablement team helps provide consultative, architectural, program and engineering support for our customers' journeys to the cloud. The word 'Enablement' was chosen carefully, to encompass the idea that we support and encourage a collaborative approach to Cloud adoption, sharing best practices, helping change the culture of teams and strategic support to ensure success. Our Cloud Architects play a key role in designing and delivering innovative cloud solutions to our customers.


How will you spend your days ?


We are looking for a Cloud Architect to drive the adoption of Cloudreach services and to inspire customers to innovate using public cloud. We firmly believe that the technical leadership we provide as architects is only as good as our experiences implementing solutions within the industry.


You will be :



  • Focusing on one or more strategic customers to ensure a successful delivery of value.

  • Leading and being deeply involved in the hands-on technical delivery of customer projects

  • Driving solution architecture and best practices by:


    • Contributing to Cloudreach internal tooling

    • Producing white papers and best practices guides

    • Mentoring other fellow Cloud Architects

    • Producing public facing content such as blog posts and presentations

    • Implementing PoC’s making use of innovative technology by evaluating trending technologies


  • Enabling clients to visualise the possibilities of leveraging public cloud and the path to get there.

  • Willing to travel to customer sites when focusing on delivery

  • Constantly investigating and evaluating industry trends


What kind of career progression can you expect?


You can grow into a Cloud Consultant role, step into a managerial position acting as Architect Lead on customer projects or move into the Cloud Enablement Leader role to support internal teams. Lead positions bring to the fold rewarding mentorship opportunities.


There are also relocation opportunities to our other cloudy hubs.


 How to stand out?



  • Experience with architecting, designing, implementing, and supporting greenfield and/or migration projects using public cloud

  • Deep technical experience in one or more of the following competencies:


    • Software design or development (continuous delivery/integration, adoption of DevOps practices)

    • Systems Operations / Management

    • Enterprise Architecture

    • Infrastructure Design

    • IT Security and Governance

    • Automation and System Orchestration


  • You have experience with programming, preferably in Python, but at least, in a modern programming language such as Go, Ruby, Java, C++, Perl or .NET

  • Excellent communication skills

  • Customer facing experience of a consultative nature

  • You’ve studied Engineering, Computer Science or a similar subject


What are our cloudy perks?



  • MacBook Pro and new smartphone (you will have to choose between Galaxy or iPhone - make the right choice !)

  • Unique 'cloudy' culture: our people are diverse, passionate and easy to work with.

  • Enjoy our uncapped holiday policy and your birthday off.

  • Cloudy University: our continuous learning platform that will provide training and career development opportunities.

  • Monthly meal vouchers which you can use at local restaurants and supermarkets and a Cloudy Lunch on Fridays. Enjoy, it's on us!

  • Private medical and dental care package in addition to the German statutory health care.

  • We kick-off every new financial year by getting together in a cool destination in Europe.

item.title: Data Governance and Quality Specialist at American Family (Madison, WI)
item.description:
At American Family Insurance, were driven by our customers and employees. Thats why we provide more than just a job we provide opportunity. Whether youre already part of our team in search of a new challenge or new to our company and ready for whats next, youre in the right place. Every dream is a journey that starts with a single step. Start your journey right here. Join our team. Bring your dreams.

Quick Stats:

Job ID: 

R7192 Data Governance and Quality Specialist (Open)

Summary:

Responsible for defining and implementing information governance policies, standards, and processes. Sets data policies, standards, and processes to create a consistent and proper handling of the organization's data, and then monitors for compliance across the enterprise. Responsible for defining and implementing an information quality program. Oversees data profiling, cleansing, integration, augmentation, matching and standardization processes to support cost reduction, process efficiencies and risk avoidance. Develop strategies and lead adoption of additional aspects of information management to ensure support of a data driven organization.

Responsibilities:

Specialized Knowledge and Skills Requirements

  • Demonstrated experience providing customer-driven solutions, support or service.
  • Demonstrated experience executing data profiling, data quality analysis, reporting and exception monitoring and auditing experience.
  • Demonstrated experience defining and managing information quality processes, such as matching, cleansing, and standardization.
  • Demonstrated experience implementing and managing successful enterprise metadata, reference data or master data repositories.
  • Extensive knowledge and understanding of information lifecycle management, data governance and data stewardship.

Additional Job Information:

The ideal candidate will have 5+ years experience in a Data Governance Office (or Data Governance focused team), leading Data Governance efforts. Demonstrated experience with Metadata Repositories and Data Quality Tools are highly desired. We are specifically using Informatica Data Quality and MetaCenter. Experience interacting with all levels of individuals within an organization is also highly desired.

Based on candidate qualifications, we are open to hiring at any level within the job family.

  • Offer to selected candidate will be made contingent on the results of applicable background checks
  • Offer to selected candidate in contingent on signing a non-disclosure agreement for proprietary information, trade secrets, and inventions
  • Relocation assistance is available


Job Description:

Primary Accountabilities

Data Governance Oversight and Management

  • Defines and implements a data governance program that outlines the guiding principles for how the organization acquires, transforms, accesses, and uses data allowing for traceability from business goals down to services and key performance indicators for measuring the results of data services.
  • Creates and maintains a data governance framework that establishes roles and responsibilities for data governance and decision making to meet the enterprise`s data objectives and goals.
  • Creates and manages data governance standards and procedures.
  • Facilitates the data governance policy review and approval process. Drafts policy review and approval by the appropriate enterprise executive councils.
  • Coordinates efforts to partner with process owners to identify, analyze and develop key measures and recommendations for process improvements.
  • Produces metrics and scorecard reports for EIM leadership. Provides analysis and expertise related to metric consistency, trends and reporting.

Information Quality Assessment, Processes, and Remediation

  • Establishes the criteria for how often information quality is checked for accuracy and prioritizes information quality activities for the organization.
  • Leads data migration projects and ensures a consistent information quality approach is followed across the organization. Develops and executes repeatable end-to-end data migration processes.
  • Works with leadership to identify opportunities where information quality services can improve operational business process efficiency, reduce costs, and reduce regulatory compliance risks and penalty costs.
  • Completes data profiling activities; assessment of existing data for completeness and accuracy relative to the quality specifications for the data.
  • Identifies specific information quality problems and develops recommendations on how to handle them. Works with business and IT partners to implement recommendations using both manual and automated solutions.

Stay connected: Join our Talent Community!

item.title: Senior Full-stack Engineer at Trakstar (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Job Description


Trakstar is looking for experienced and versatile full-stack developers familiar with the Rails framework to join our small but efficient team in Seattle. You'll have an opportunity to have a huge impact at a fun, exciting company with significant growth potential. Trakstar is used today by 125,000+ people and 1,000+ organizations all around the world. We are continuously improving our product and expanding our value to our customers. A few more things:



  • We've experienced 60% revenue growth (YTD as of 11/2017)

  • We're highly profitable

  • We offer stock options

  • We want more fun, motivated people with amazing technical skills to join our team and help realize our crazy growth potential


Responsibilities



  • Enthusiastically engage in both product-related and technical discussions

  • Continuously evaluate and incorporate new ideas and technologies

  • Implement features across the full stack of our primary product, using PostgreSQL, Ruby on Rails, and JavaScript MVC

  • Participate in both giving and receiving code reviews from other engineers, considering robustness, edge cases, usability, and general reliability

  • Be confident releasing production-ready code with high visibility, considering our substantial user base


Skills & Requirements



  • Strong computer science fundamentals

  • 5+ years of professional software development experience

  • 2+ years of Ruby on Rails experience on a medium/large customer-facing web application

  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills


Nice-to-Haves



  • Formal software education in modern web application development and design

  • Experience with multiple front-end frameworks, especially React or Backbone.js

  • Knowledge of webpack, or another modern module bundler

  • Published code on Github or another code collaboration tool

  • Ability to build unit test coverage of implemented features, Rspec preferred

  • Ability to write feature tests with Capybara/Selenium


Technologies



  • Ruby

  • Ruby on Rails

  • PostgreSQL

  • AWS (EC2, RDS, S3)

  • Chef & Serverspec

  • JavaScript

  • JQuery

  • SASS

  • CSS


Location


Seattle, WA


We believe that spending time in our Seattle office is the most successful and efficient path towards becoming an autonomous member of our team. Remote work is considered after demonstrating efficiency and effective communication on-site!



  • Relocation not available

  • Visa sponsorship not available

item.title: Software Engineer Robotics (m/f) at incubed IT (Hart bei Graz, sterreich)
item.description:
We at incubed IT build the bridge between cutting edge mobile robotics and intralogistics. Our Smart Shuttles feel at home in numerous warehouses and production sites worldwide, solving complex transportation tasks autonomously, day by day.


We've been developing freely navigating shuttles for 6 years now and keep meeting exciting challenges in all areas of robotics, starting from motor control and sensor fusion, localisation and navigation, all the way to high-level business logic, fleet management and multi-robot coordination.


If you are an enthusiastic software developer and like to see your code in action, this is the right job for you!


As part of the SCRUM team, you will...



  • design, implement, test and document software for autonomous, mobile, intelligent and cooperative shuttles

  • analyze and further improve the Smart Shuttles' behaviour, from a robotics point of view all the way to business logic and user experience

  • work hands-on with various robot platforms

  • investigate new technologies

  • bring in your experience, motivation, skills and creativity

  • collaborate with the development team and product owner to implement projects at an international scope


Skills & Requirements



  • Solid software development background (university degree or equivalent)

  • A motivated and enthusiastic approach to the area of robotics

  • Ability to collaboratively solve tasks in a team

  • Pleasure in designing and developing sustainable software

  • Strong analytical skills and mathematical foundation

  • Experience in Java and C++

  • Nice-to-have: Understanding of and experience with ROS (Robot Operating System), navigation, path planning, obstacle avoidance, sensor fusion

  • Nice-to-have: experience with computer vision, SLAM, object recognition

  • Ability to work independently, without direct supervision

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

item.title: Technical Support Manager at McArthurGlen Group (London, UK)
item.description:
McArthurGlen Group Mission


“To create the finest designer outlet experience in Europe”


McArthurGlen Group Vision


“Continuously enhancing the quality of our customer experience, the lives of all our employees, the performance of our brand partners, and the communities where we do business.”


PURPOSE OF POSITION


Ensure the Company’s IT infrastructure enables the achievement of current and future business objectives.


KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES



  • Maximise integrity and functionality of IT infrastructure through appropriate strategic planning, design, operation, maintenance and monitoring of hardware, software and network systems.

  • Manager technical operational staff during day to day administration of the network. Identify and deliver training to staff to bridge skills gaps.

  • Ensure IT infrastructure is fully documented to audit changes and updates and to support disaster recovery arrangements.

  • Plans, organizes, and manages technical support for one or more of products.

  • Leads and participates in working with other departments to provide proactive, responsive, and timely solutions to customer and product issues.

  • Leads and participates in the management of customers and customer case escalations.

  • Participates as a proactive member of the management team by setting high standards throughout the Technical Support department and contributes to the company as follows:

  • Meets or exceeds short and long term global operating results.

  • Takes accountability and resolves any issues preventing the achievement of timely, quality, and cost effective results.

  • Takes strategic risks toward achieving operational excellence.

  • Maintains high standards of excellence and strong work ethics.

  • Ensures appropriate systems, policies, budgets, controls, and procedures are in place to support sound, legal practices in support of the strategic direction of the business.

  • Stays current with technological developments in systems administration technology and make recommendations to the Infrastructure Manager on most appropriate IT solutions to meet current and future McArthurGlen business requirements.

  • Develop policies and procedures for the effective, efficient, legal and safe use of IT assets at McArthurGlen (especially email usage, security etc.)

  • Ensure appropriate cover is maintained across the Technical Support areas at all times

  • Manage suppliers to ensure they are delivering quality services in line with agreed SLAs, and extract maximum value from these relationships.

  • Provide technical expertise in resolving problems and implementing changes to the IT infrastructure (this may result in occasional work out-of-hours or at weekends). Update Service Desk records accordingly, and help identify trends and issues which require special action.


KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES EXTENSION



  • Provide specialist support to company Partners and Directors to assist in problem resolution.

  • Manage projects as required to install new IT equipment and software at McArthurGlen sites, using appropriate internal and external resources, and effective and efficient tools and techniques, and maintaining up-to-date documentation describing the IT infrastructure at all locations.

  • Ensure license compliance and usage is maintained including the annual Microsoft audit.

  • Provide monthly/quarterly reports as required to include, but not exhaustive to infrastructure usage, growth, capacity planning.

  • Work with Infrastructure manager to ensure change control is adhered to and provide assistance for testing approved changes.


KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS



  • Educated to a minimum level of GCSE or equivalent, including Mathematics

  • MCSE

  • Proven experience of PC, server and network administration and support, using structured, formal processes and procedures

  • Exposure to an international environment is desirable

  • Awareness of current technical options for server, print, network, desktop, laptop, mobile computing equipment configuration and connectivity

  • Advanced functional knowledge of operating systems, applications, utilities

  • Installation, configuration, ongoing management and administration of IT equipment

  • Demonstrated leadership and organizational skills with the ability to motivate and develop a team of professionals capable of achieving aggressive business goals and objectives.

  • An in depth understanding of the basic principles behind technical support processes and procedures.

  • Extensive experience and high-level responsibility for security and data protection within a multi-site network

  • Small scale Project Management and implementation experience covering any of the above areas

  • Microsoft cloud technology infrastructure design and support: Azure, Office365 (email, Sharepoint, MS Office) and Dynamics

  • Requires excellent interpersonal and communication skills including verbal, written, negotiation, and platform communications.

  • Ability to understand complex issues and explain them to both technical and non-technical staff

  • Possess a strong people orientation with the ability to listen, work and resolve issues to achieve customer satisfaction.

  • Must excel in collaborative team environment.

  • Supplier Management

item.title: Senior Java-Developer/-Architekt at GATES GmbH (Mnster, Deutschland)
item.description:
Das steht an:

item.title: Senior Data Engineer (FinTech, Scala, Spark, Flink & Kafka) at Zalando Payments SE & Co.KG (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact

At Zalando Payments, we are processing all financial transactions of Zalando's fashion store and other consumer facing apps. Starting with a flawless user experience in the checkout over the processing of the payments to reconciliation in the backend, we cover the entire financial process to boost conversion and deliver a competitive advantage to our customers through smart risk steering.

As a Senior Data Engineer at Zalando Payments, you'll help us to shape the data infrastructure that supports our risk assessment models, responsible for processing Billions of euros every year. You'll be involved into defining the data architecture and given the freedom to select the right mix of technologies to solve whichever problems come your way.

Your profile



  • You are experienced processing data at scale, in batches and streams

  • Spark, Flink, Kafka, Apache Drill and others are your tools of trade

  • You are experienced with RDBMS, NoSQL databases, and have an in-depth understanding of the consistency and availability guarantees they provide.

  • You understand the properties of large distributed systems

  • You are keen on understanding the business which your systems will enable and able to balance pragmatism and vision




You Are Setting Standards

Variety. You design, develop, deploy, operate and improve important software solutions that possibly impact millions of customers.
Autonomy. Based on our Microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).
Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.
Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.

You Are
Skilled. In working with production-ready code in at least one JVM language (preferably Scala) and have prior experience in the big data technology landscape. E.g. databases, No-SQL data stores, distributed systems, big data processing frameworks (preferably with Spark)
Courageous. In taking ownership and being accountable for the results of your decisions.
Motivated. In making a positive impact on our engineering culture and encouraging knowledge sharing.
Ambitious. In delivering products that re-define the customer experience and making bold decisions about the means and tools of delivery and operation.

You Benefit From

Culture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events.
Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice.
Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.
Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.

Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!

If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Taryn Louise Bonugli

item.title: Senior Front-End Engineer - ReactJS Redux at Chegg (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Senior UI/UX Developer / Senior Front-End Engineer / Senior Web Developer / Senior Web Application Developer


Engineering | San Francisco, CA


SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER

Organization: Chegg Tutoring Platform Team


Chegg Tutors is an online learning platform that allows students to get help from high-quality tutors on demand and at affordable prices. Every day thousands of live lesson hours happen on our platform. We’re reimagining the online tutoring business, pushing the boundaries of learning on the web.  


As a part of the Chegg Tutors Engineering team, you will help to build a cutting-edge platform that will define the future of online learning. In this role, your strong skills and knowledge in modern web platforms, frameworks, and techniques will be put to the test while you help students save time, save money, and get smarter.


About the Engineering Team:


Chegg's Engineering team is a group of passionate engineers who, in close collaboration with data scientists, product managers, designers, and UX researchers, build the future of the online education industry. We build our products to scale and to last, we don’t take shortcuts (hello tests and documentation), and we take pride in delivering high-quality solutions on time.


What You’ll Do



  • Create and present full-stack architecture for complex technological challenges

  • Implement end-to-end solutions in code, leading junior engineers to help you

  • Be a role model for code quality, accuracy, and perfection of your solutions

  • Communicate and collaborate with product managers, designers, researchers, and data scientists to deliver the best user experience

  • Maintain full visibility of the status of the projects for which you are responsible

  • Continuously look for ways to improve our product and processes, provide feedback

  • Create documentation and teach at regular learning sessions

  • Have fun


Requirements



  • BS (or equivalent) in Computer Science or related discipline

  • 5+ years of experience developing web applications with modern JavaScript programming frameworks, tooling, and libraries like React

  • Strong Computer Science fundamentals with competencies in software design, data structures, and problem-solving

  • Expert knowledge of vanilla JavaScript, CSS, HTML

  • Expert knowledge of at least one popular JS framework: React / Angular / Backbone etc.

  • Experience with CSS processors: SASS (preferable), LESS

  • Experience with building tools: WebPack (preferable), Gulp etc.

  • Self-motivated; independent, organized, and proactive


Bonus Points



  • Knowledge of Java, Python, and/or Django

  • Familiarity with a modularization API such as RequireJS or AMD

  • Familiarity with front-end testing tools such as Mocha, Chai, or Karma

  • Experience with cloud service providers such as AWS

  • Experience with Unix command line, commonly used POSIX commands 


About Chegg:


As the leading student-first connected learning platform, Chegg's Student Hub makes higher education more affordable and more accessible, all while improving student outcomes. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, CA with offices in San Francisco, New York, Portland, India, Israel, Berlin, and Ukraine. Chegg Student Hub Services Include: Chegg Study, Tutoring, Writing Tools, Math Help, Test Prep, Careers Search, Internship Admissions, and College Admissions. 


Life at Chegg: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YYHnkwiD7Oo


Chegg Benefits: http://www.chegg.com/jobs/benefits
Chegg for Good: http://blog.chegg.com/category/chegg-for-good/


Glassdoor Best Places to Work 2015: http://bit.ly/GDBPTW 


For more information, visit www.chegg.com


Chegg is an equal opportunity employer


#LI-AH1

item.title: Senior Front-End Engineer -React, Redux or MV at Chegg (Santa Clara, CA)

Engineering Team | Santa Clara, CA, United States

item.title: Staff Search Engineer - Search Algorithms & Infrastructure at Chegg (Santa Clara, CA)
item.description:
Staff Search Engineer - Search Algorithms & Infrastructure
Staff Search Engineer
Staff Search Engine Developer
Staff Search Platform Engineer
Growth and Enablement Team | San Jose, CA

Goal: Lead Chegg to become the search destination of all things educational.


Role:
As the staff search engineer in Growth and Enablement team, you have the unique and enviable opportunity to lead Chegg, already the best student platform, to be the search destination of all things educational – whether it be textbooks, study/learning materials (questions and answers, textbook solutions), or real-time tutors.  Every day, you get to design, develop and deliver core search product used by all verticals at Chegg.  Your search algorithms guide and influence search experience of millions of students across all devices. Your solutions ensure a fast, scalable, reusable and reliable search platform serving the real-time search demands of Chegg ecosystem.
 
The ideal candidate is an experienced search engineer seasoned in cutting-edge search algorithms and infrastructure.  Passionate about serving the quickest, most relevant and reliable search experiences to end users, you also breathe agile and lean-startup methodologies; you love innovating with cross-functional teams; above all, you share an unwavering commitment to ensuring the best students experience. 


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate and innovate with Product, Design, Data Science and Platform teams to deliver the quickest, most relevant and reliable search experience across all Chegg products for millions of passionate students

  • Devise, test, evaluate and iterate on all areas of search – from query and intent understanding, natural language processing, ranking algorithms to recommendation, machine learning, and personalization

  • Lead scalable, distributed search backend services and product integration

  • Participate in lean and agile development process in a test- and monitoring-driven environment, from planning, scoping, estimation all the way to optimization, maintenance, and support

  • Deliver implementation that is as simple as it gets, with automated unit and user acceptance tests that enable continuous integration and delivery


Minimum Requirements:



  • 8+ years in related software development roles with successful and progressive career growth.

  • Proficiency in devising scalable, performance search algorithms

  • Experience with and background in Information Retrieval, Ranking Systems, Recommendation Systems or Artificial Intelligence

  • Experience with large-scale search infrastructure

  • Programming experience in Java, C or C++

  • BS in Computer Science or related field with 10+ years, or MS in CS or related field with 5+ years of applied search experience, or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related field

  • Strong written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills


Pluses:



  • Proficiency with Solr/Lucene/Elastic Search and Docker/ECS/containerization technologies.

  • Familiarity with developing and integrating with microservices.

item.title: Senior Java Developer - Commerce Payment and Financial Systems at Chegg (Santa Clara, CA)
item.description:
Your goal – to execute our technical strategy in the Commerce, Payment and Financial Systems Domain.  

Organization: Commerce, Payments, And Financial Systems Engineering 

The Commerce, Payments and Financial Systems team is the backbone of Chegg – supporting every business line and functional organization at the company. The team interfaces with various business units such as Marketing Services, Customer Service, Warehouse, Product, Accounting, Mobile and User Experience building technical capabilities that influence their roadmaps.


Role:  Java Developer / Sr. Software Engineer - Commerce 

Chegg seeks a passionate, results-oriented, technical and hands-on Sr. Software Engineer to be part of its Commerce, Payments and Financial Systems team. Our goal is to replace our current platform to enable the business to offer new product lines and services through acquisitions, integrations and brand partnerships while maintaining accurate financial reporting and data integrity. As part of this, we envision a hybrid strategy that involves building a solution around a third-party commerce platform.


We have a team culture that encourages innovation and expects developers and management alike to take a high level of ownership for the product vision, technical architecture, and project delivery.       

Responsibilities:



  • Serve as a technical lead on our most demanding, cross-functional projects

  • Lead technical architecture and ensure code quality of our systems.

  • Identify best practices around integrating with a third party system and help enforce it within the Commerce, Payments and Financial Systems Domain.

  • Evaluate engineering needs for new digital services business opportunities including new partnerships and potential acquisitions.


  Requirements:                  



  • 4-7 years of Java experience

  • Experience with MySQL or an equivalent database

  • Experience in designing RESTful Services

  • Experience with Mule Soft or related orchestration software.

  • Experience in designing and scaling applications in the cloud


Requisition Number: 2383

item.title: Software Engineer (Functional Programming) at Captivation Software (Fort Meade, MD)
item.description:
We are looking for a mid-level or senior Software Engineer with past experience and/or current interest in functional programming. Out of the box thinkers are strongly encouraged to apply.


This position requires U.S. Citizenship and current DoD access - candidates outside the U.S or without prior DoD experience will not be considered.


What do we mean by functional programming? 


We want developers who think in terms of map, filter, or reduce functions instead of for loops. These concepts can be found in most modern languages: Java 8, JavaScript, Ruby, Scala. Experience in purely functional languages, like Haskell or Elm, is beneficial but not required. 


Why functional programming?


Simply put: we want the best and brightest! Learning functional methods demonstrates a high level of commitment to the craft of building great software, and functional approaches are trending towards the mainstream due to their expressiveness, correctness, and testability.  


Skills & Requirements


 Must have a STEM degree and 7+ years of Software Engineering experience with working knowledge of the following:



  • Languages supporting functional concepts: Scala / Java 8 / JavaScript / Ruby / Haskell 

  • NoSQL data stores - MongoDB / Redis

  • Message queues - RabbitMQ / Kafka / ActiveMQ

  • Linux (CentOS 6/7)

  • Git


Preference is given to developers with experience in the following:



  • Masters Degree in a STEM field

  • Cloud Certifications

  • Docker

item.title: Static Object Lead Developer at Bonanza.com (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Since the dawn of software development, the ongoing struggle of Lead Developers and CTOs has been to time-efficiently understand what their team is working on, and somehow differentiate between the output of their most productive developers and the rest. It has long been assumed that the problem is just too hard -- coding & commit styles vary tremendously between individual Developers, and attempting to build a tool that can understand what's happening in the code would require teaching an algorithm to "think" like an experienced Developer. 


And yet, that is the tool we've built. Now we need you to join us and take this tool to the next level.


Is this an important enough problem? Here's what a top result from Google (from Dev9) has to say about it:


"If there is a holy grail of the technology industry, especially from a management standpoint, it's the measurement of developer productivity. You can't plan if you can't measure. If you believe [you can solve this problem], you'll be a wealthy rockstar of the programming universe. People will write books about your life and your brilliance." 


Sounds good to us.


Details


This role will be a hybrid individual contributor and leadership position that will initially be tilted toward individual contributions, but grow increasingly toward team leadership over time. 


As an individual contributor, you will help to create a system that can interpret code as you do. This means identifying additions, deletions, updates, find and replace, et. al. Armed with a well-defined concept of how code is changing over time, you'll leverage this data to help build a better diff viewer than Github (not a high bar), a means for grouping similar commits, and a collection of visualizations that make it fast and, dare we say fun, to see how a repository changes over the course of a sprint. 


As the Lead Developer, you'll help define the roadmap for what features can make CTOs, Lead Developers, and individual contributors more productive. You'll use intuition, a sophisticated test suite, and machine learning to map lines of code back to the features and bugs they implement. Since this is a nut that has never been cracked by another company, you'll be given significant latitude to take your creativity and channel it into the implementation of a product that should become essential to developer productivity across organizations.


You will work closely with the CEO, VP of Product, and other departments to coordinate the development of Static Object with our business objectives. You will join us in dogfooding this product daily, to ensure that we're building toward a direction that solves real world needs.


Job Requirements



  • 5+ years experience as a Developer in a high level language like Ruby, Python, or C#

  • 5+ years experience using git

  • Strong background in architecting large-scale systems, taming complexity using DRY principles

  • Work with the CEO to formulate the optimal set of tools to reliably measure+improve quality over time

  • Interface with clients on an as-needed basis to ensure that we are serving their needs

  • Handy with a variety of debugging techniques, never been content to settle for debugging via log statements

  • Demonstrated grit and optimism in the face of great challenge

  • Preferred: Experience with high-level programming concepts, like AI and machine learning

  • Preferred: Consuming passion for software development, including history of contributing to side projects outside one's day job

item.title: Python Developer at Optel (Ville de Qubec, QC, Canada)
item.description:
Now a Certified B Corporation, OPTEL is a leading multinational provider of traceability systems, and its mission is to use its innovative technologies to create a better world through responsible capitalism. The company's renowned solutions ensure the quality of consumer health products and help stop counterfeiting of pharmaceuticals and medical devices throughout the world. OPTEL is also adapting its technologies to create efficiencies in various other sectors from health-related industries to smart manufacturing and more, all can benefit from global traceability. OPTEL's expertise will allow diverse industries to measure, inspect, control and track a variety of elements to improve quality and make better use of resources.


We are looking for a Python Developer to join its Software team.


On being a Python Developer at Optel


At the heart of the design and integration of automated vision and serialization systems, you will thrive in a small, agile, and multidisciplinary team. This self-managed environment will provide you all the flexibility required to innovate while complying with the company's software development phases: design, implementation, tests, debug, and support. 


Everyday life of a Python Developer at Optel


As you participate in the team's daily activities (scrums, sprint planning, sprint review, and sprint retrospective), you will suggest innovative solutions to software challenges. You will develop future solutions and improve the current ones, while performing maintenance improvements on existing solutions. You will benefit from working with experienced colleagues and in interruption-free spaces that will enhance your creativity. This independence will be accompanied by the unique responsibility of providing a factual account of your work progress while remaining open to improvement.


Types of Projects and Technologies 


At Optel, we use different platforms and projects in different fields: PC-based applications, middleware, cloud, and mobile. We offer solutions and services such as inspection, serialization, traceability, and engineering for various industries, including the pharmaceutical sector. We strive to resolve widespread and major issues and therefore contribute to creating a better world.


If you are familiar with Visual Studio (2013 and up) and Python programming is your strength, Optel is the right company for you.


You will also be involved in exploratory projects to evaluate the most advanced technologies available on the market.


Working at OPTEL is benefiting from a dynamic work environment, based on collaboration with open spaces and focus on challenges. It is also a flexible schedule, activities organized by the social club each month and many stimulating projects. All of this in a friendly atmosphere with free coffee, of course!

item.title: Back End Engineer, API (Functional, F#) at Jet.com (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
About Jet


Jet’s mission is to become the smartest way to shop and save on pretty much anything. Combining a revolutionary pricing engine, a world-class technology and fulfillment platform, and incredible customer service, we’ve set out to create a new kind of e-commerce.  At Jet, we’re passionate about empowering people to live and work brilliant.


About Jet’s Internal Engine


We’re building a new kind of company, and we’re building it from the inside out, which means that investing in hiring, developing, and retaining the brightest minds in the world is a top priority. Everything we do is grounded in three simple values:  trust, transparency, and fairness.  From our business model to our culture, we live our values to the extreme, whether we’re dealing with employees, retail partners, or consumers.  We believe that happiness is the highest level of success and we want every person that crosses paths with Jet to achieve it.  If you’re an ambitious, smart, natural collaborator who likes taking risks, influencing, and innovating in a challenging hyper-growth environment, we’d love to talk to you about joining our team.


About the Job


We are looking for exceptional back-end developers to help us build a world class ecommerce platform. The role is wide ranging in its scope and will include working and maintaining the back end services that power Jet's website and mobile apps. You will also work on the shopping cart and payments system, amongst other internal services. The platform is an event driven (event sourced) system built largely in .NET and designed to run on the cloud (Azure).  This is an extension of our US team that is responsible for the back-end of all of Jet.com.


The Environment 


Our platform is largely an event driven platform implemented via a microservice architecture.   The platform runs on Microsoft Azure and uses a large number of technologies and middle ware.  The bulk of backend code is written in F# and our system of record is an event sourced system (essentially a log of all actions on the platform).  We use a mix of Redis, Elastic Search, Azure SQL, Event Store and Azure Storage for our data stores. About 50% of the platform runs on Linux and the rest Windows (although we move into more containerization we will see a shift towards Linux). 


About You


The individual will be someone with the following traits: 



  • Solid understanding of large scale, cloud based distributed systems.

  • Uptime operational management and testing experience

  • .NET experience

  • Functional programming experience

  • Experience with event driven systems

  • Comfortable in taking part in the daytime only on-call rotation

  • Excellent communication skills

item.title: Senior Java Developer at Hays Specialist Recruitment Ltd (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
Senior Java Developer

£42,000 - £48,000 dependant on experience + package with flexible working around core hours

Distrelec, part of the Datwyler group, is a leading online distributor for electronics, automation, measurement technology, IT and accessories in Europe and the exciting new Enterprise Hub in Manchester will be its first operational presence in the UK.

Working with Hays, Distrelec is looking for people who are solution seekers, ready to roll up their sleeves and who are motivated to get things done. Distrelec aspires to be the most dominant distributor in the electro component market by serving its customers through understanding their challenges and seeking solutions to meet their needs.

Located in the highly prestigious St Peter's Square development in the city centre, Distrelec are establishing their new Enterprise Hub and hiring Java Developers. The Enterprise Hub will be the European home of the Development and Digital functions for Distrelec, providing state of the art e-commerce solutions.

This is an exciting time to be joining their business. Are you up for the challenge?

The role:
You will be responsible for developing Java based software on an E-Commerce platform, reporting directly into the Head of Digital and a Development Manager on upcoming projects and technical challenges. This business operates in a fast-paced start-up culture and as a result you will be expected to identify and resolve issues independently of senior management.


Key accountabilities:
You will take on a pivotal role in the agile team to plan, develop, test and maintain software solutions to agreed time-scales and quality standards. There are a number of new projects being rolled out across the business meaning the technical landscape is changing at pace as a result new technologies and build methods will need to be researched and implemented regularly.

As a Java Software Engineer, you will also be expected to become a subject matter expert for any Java related queries from Junior Developers or Senior Management and will have a position of influence in discussions relating to new projects.

Skills & experience:
To be successful in this role, you will need knowledge or experience of the following:



  • Advanced Java or J2EE skills

  • Strong understanding of large scale e-commerce systems

  • An understanding of implementing and working within an Agile environment


Benefits:
In addition to the supportive and collaborative work environment, you can expect:



  • Excellent flex benefits package together with a bonus for every member of staff + pension

  • Flexible working around core hours

  • 25 days holiday with option to purchase/sell additional days

  • Grade A offices with great transport access

  • Opportunity to influence the way we work


By joining the Datwyler family, you will not only enjoy the security, opportunities and benefits that come with the security of a global organisation, but also experience the excitement that a start-up business has to offer. This is an experience that only a few will ever get. For more information visit http://job-essentials.com/uk/distrelec

Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited is working in partnership with Distrelec to manage the recruitment of this position.

Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk

item.title: Director of Backend Engineering at Clarifai (New York, NY)
item.description:
Clarifai is an artificial intelligence company that excels in visual recognition, solving real-world problems for businesses and developers alike. Founded in 2013 by Matthew Zeiler, a foremost expert in machine learning, Clarifai has been a market leader and predicts more than 1.2 billion concepts in photos and videos every month. Clarifai’s powerful image and video recognition technology is built on the most advanced machine learning systems and made easily accessible by a clean API, empowering developers all over the world to build a new generation of intelligent applications.


Clarifai raised a $30 million Series B in 2016 led by Menlo Ventures, Union Square Ventures, and Lux Capital. Existing investors include Google Ventures, Qualcomm Ventures, NVIDIA Ventures, Corazon Capital, LDV Capital, Osage University Partners, and New York University.


Clarifai is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.


About


You are the person that leads our backend and infrastructure engineering teams. You'll report to our CEO, manage 8 engineers, and build the team by hiring individual contributors and managers to report to you. We expect that you'll be spending 80% of your time as a people manager and 20% of your time as an individual contributor, working in the code base with your team.


You collaborate on strategy with engineering leadership and contribute your hands-on coding skills to join individual contributors in working on engineering design and complex coding challenges as we scale to 1 billion API operations per month.


You love identifying your layers' strengths, bringing people together to push awesome products to the public and putting artificial intelligence in the hands of everyone.


Objectives


In your first month, you will start off by learning the ropes. You will:



  • Coordinate prioritization and execution of projects with the product team, so that we can deploy new products and features on time.

  • Build relationships with engineers on your layer by holding regular 1 on 1's, handling their performance evaluations, and organizing their team offsites. We value conversations about career growth, learning, and development.

  • Continue to cultivate a collaborative engineering culture and actively encourage multi-functional collaboration with non-technical layers.


3 months later, start putting yourself out there. You will:



  • Work with the VP of Engineering to execute an engineering strategy motivated by the company vision and mission.

  • Drive consistency of our API across v2 and the mobile SDK by synchronizing infrastructure and backend with multiple layers and outputs.

  • Present engineering progress and updates during weekly meetings with leads from each layer.


6 months down the road, you will:



  • Help the frontend, mobile, and applied machine learning engineering layers learn how to develop successfully with our backend services.

  • Collaborate with Talent Acquisition to build a hiring plan for growing the layer in accordance with the roadmap.


In 12 months, you will:



  • Craft a plan for how the layer will evolve as we expand our artificial intelligence offerings. We want you to bring your expertise to the table on our way to becoming a billion dollar company.


Impact


As Clarifai’s Director of Backend Engineering, you will empower our engineers to embrace our mission, to understand every image and video to improve life.


You encourage our engineers to engage others within our company, but also within the wider tech community. We believe in teaching others about how they can use our AI technology.

item.title: SQL Developer at Harris (Charlottetown, PE, Canada)
item.description:

The successful candidate will demonstrate excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills as well as outstanding programming skills, with experience working in client-server and web environments, strong interpersonal skills, solid judgment, and the ability to work successfully in a support team environment. Primary Functions: 



  • Act as a Level II Triage Developer for the Support team to investigate and analyze product stability issues reported by clients

  • Troubleshoot tickets and program changes in our core CSM product as well as our suite of products

  • Regularly review the database of submitted items and proactively follow up with clients regarding their items.

  • Utilize programming skills to ensure delivered code meets high standards of quality and reusability, as per company policy

  • Communicate with both internal and external clients to ensure delivered code is properly delivered and documented

  • Assist other Support staff, as required, with complex investigations of technical issues

  • Maximize and maintain current knowledge and awareness of applications and related technologies

  • Document processes, routines, and program

  • Educate customers about the causes of software problems to prevent recurrence.

  • Confirm the validity of the problem and search for known solutions to solve the issue.

  • Monitor and follow up on ticket progress based on SLA Requirements.

  • Apply appropriate level of urgency to problems; manage customer expectations in terms of service level and communications.


Qualifications:



  • 5+ years of experience in a software support environment, 3+ in a development role

  • Outstanding analytical and troubleshooting skills with an attention to detail and focus on quality of delivered programming and documentation

  • Experience with team programming and source control best practices

  • Excellent knowledge of SQL Server, Crystal Report and Visual Basic

  • Excellent interpersonal skills

  • Experience with utility billing or local government ERP software applications an asset

item.title: Senior JAVA developer at Lemonade Software Development (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
Why join us?


Lemonade is an international software company with headquarters in Belgium, and has been specialized for more than 10 years in developing eGovernment applications and great tools for schools. We are always looking for exceptional colleagues with solid development skills to join our teams in Barcelona (Spain), Brussels (Belgium) and Buenos Aires (Argentina).

If you join us you will be working in a young and flexible atmosphere with great benefits and long term contracts.


We are looking for you!


We are now looking to expand our Barcelona team for a new 5 years multinational project we recently won. Our new client is a directorate of the European Commission (TAXUD), where we will help to manage, extend and create a set of very important applications that will have a deep impact in the international trade. To complete our team we are searching for senior software developers with proven experience in a number of complex multilayer JEE projects, who are able to work independently in a high-performance environment with top colleagues.


The profile we are looking for will have to work in close collaboration with the client, gather requirements and inform about the progress.



What you will do?


Main tasks:



  • Conduct requirements analysis, design and implementation of Java Enterprise applications (JEE);

  • Incorporate existing code and reusable assets in the development of a new application;

  • Estimate tasks required to complete various development projects including time and resources required;



What you need to win?


Mandatory requirements:



  • Software development related degree (3+ years)

  • 5+ years experience in JAVA enterprise and web applications

  • Quality oriented way of working

  • Full stack knowledge: Data Layer, Business Layer, Presentation Layer and also Clients (Browsers)

  • SQL writing and optimizing skills

  • Weblogic application server, and Oracle databases.

  • Conversational English level (B1)


Nice-to-have requirements:



  • Experience in


    • Oracle Databases, EJB, JSP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript

    • SOAP and asynchronous messaging

    • Distributed transactions

    • Unit Testing frameworks (i.e: JUnit or TestNG)

    • GIT




  • Possibility to travel to Belgium eventually (Short trips. Two days maximum)

  • Conversational English level (B2)


Personal Characteristics:



  • Flexible to perform different tasks depending on the needs of the project

  • Ability to work effectively & efficiently with various diverse work teams (Development, Testing and Project Management) who might be geographically distributed (Brussels/Athens)



What do we offer?


Contract:



  • A competitive salary package based on your experience

  • Long term commitment

  • Full time position

  • You will work in a very spacious and bright office located in the heart of sunny Barcelona.


Benefits: 



  • Relocation support if needed

  • Flexible working hours and working from home

  • Private health insurance

  • Ticket Restaurant and Transport

  • Company training programs

  • Free commodities (water, coffee, tea, fruit…)

  • Team building events

  • Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you

  • Annual trip for the whole team to different locations.


Are you up for the challenge?


We are waiting for you! Don’t leave us hanging.


Apply today!

item.title: Embedded Developer - Empower people through smart energy. at Quby (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Our Linux-based Toon Display and (wireless) connected peripherals are currently installed in more than 350.000 households in several European countries. We strive to continuously deliver new features to our customers, keeping in mind the performance and resource constraints of the Hardware. This is why we are currently looking for a passionate Embedded Software Engineer. As a member of a multidisciplinary Development team you are responsible for the Design and implementation of our Embedded Software.


Your Challenge


The majority of the Software for these devices is written in C. You will be involved in developing middleware Software for the Display, working on the QT user interface or writing (bare metal) firmware for the peripherals.



  • Develop middleware software for our Linux-based display, the Toon.

  • Develop Embedded Software for our Microcontroller-based peripherals in the Toon product family.

  • Design, implement and document in- and external APIs.

  • Implement automated tests as a part of development.

  • Maintain close communication with other Software Engineers, System Architects, Hardware Engineers and system integration teams throughout the Design and development cycle.


Who you are: 


A fast learner who thrives in challenging environments and has a creative yet pragmatic approach to problem solving. You are a team player with excellent communications skills, who is curious by nature and takes ownership at work. You have worked before in in Agile/Scrum environment.



  • Bachelor / Master degree in Computer Science or a similar field.

  • At least 3+ years of hands- on Software development experience with C, within a Linux environment (preferably Embedded);

  • Experience with Version Control systems, preferably Git.

  • Experience debugging/profiling embedded systems, for instance with GDB.

  • You like working on Home Automation / Smart Living solutions.

  • You have hands on experience with Continuous Integration and tools/technologies such as Jenkins (Job DSL), Docker and automated testing.

  • You have experience with unit testing and mocking.

  • You have experience with XML and JSON-based message protocols.


Big plus is experience with:



  • Resource constrained ARM architectures.

  • Configuration Management, for supporting different hardware architectures and product options from a single code base.

  • Wireless protocols like BLE, Z-Wave or ZigBee.

  • C++, Qt (QML), Python, JavaScript.

  • Linux kernel module development.

  • Security related techniques for embedded Software.

  • Embedded software tools such as debuggers, scopes and analysers.


What Quby offers you


First of all: just over 150 very enthusiastic colleagues that love to work with new technology and innovative solutions for energy insight!



  • Enjoy a competitive salary with great benefits.

  • Pension plan, 75% contribution by Quby.

  • Travel reimbursement.

  • Learn on the go: yearly 5% of your year salary available for personal development.

  • Flexible work hours, start the day between 8:00 and 10:00.

  • Fresh fruit & great coffee and tea.

  • Regular Friday drinks, game nights and other fun events.

  • Tech lunches.

  • 25 vacation days.

  • Bi-weekly chair massages.

  • Collective Health Insurance.

  • A buddy/ mentor to get you up to speeds as soon as possible.

item.title: Traffic Security Engineer at Wikimedia Foundation, Inc. (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Location: San Francisco, CA or Remote


Summary


We are looking for an Operations Engineer to join our Technical Operations team. Would you like to join the highly dynamic team that is responsible for the reliability and performance of a global top-10 website, Wikipedia?


The Technical Operations team has a very broad range of shared responsibilities.  The team is globally distributed, working remotely with each other in a highly collaborative and consensus-oriented fashion.  We only write and only use Open Source code wherever possible and we do the vast majority of our work in public view.


This Traffic Security position focuses more-specifically on the Security and Privacy responsibilities of our Traffic team within Operations.  The Traffic team runs a private and privacy-protecting global CDN for Wikipedia and related sister projects.  One of the key responsibilities of this position will be technical stewardship of our TLS termination for users at the edges of our network.  We’re passionate about protecting the privacy of our users against mass surveillance and manipulation, and we expect you to share that passion.  If the word “ChaCha” doesn’t make you think of dancing first, you might be the person we’re looking for!


We’d like you to do these things:



  • Protect our users’ reading and editing habits from mass surveillance

  • Keep our TLS infrastructure up to date in the face of evolving threats

  • Keep track of the ever-changing landscape of browsers and other UAs

  • Analyze and optimize our edge software infrastructure to enhance our users’ experiences

  • Assess and deploy newer protocols, technologies, and software as their time becomes ripe

  • Deprecate older ones in a timely manner while balancing the needs of legacy clients

  • Reactively respond to, and proactively engineer against, DDoS and other attacks

  • Analyze and advise on application-layer security issues exposed over HTTPS

  • Other related Traffic and Security/Privacy work as required


Experience we’d like you to bring to the table:



  • A deep and current understanding of TLS, HTTP[S], TCP/IP, DNS, and other related protocols

  • Hands-on experience working with TLS libraries and HTTP server software configuration

  • A working knowledge of modern cryptography from a systems engineering point of view

  • Experience working on general infrastructure and application-layer security issues

  • Experience with Open Source operations tooling for configuration management, orchestration, and monitoring.

  • Experience working on Open Source operations infrastructure in general

  • Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent in related work experience


And it would be even more awesome if you have any of these:



  • Experience operating TLS-terminating reverse proxy servers at global scale

  • Experience operating large web properties at a global scale

  • Programmer experience writing and/or modifying network daemons and/or libraries in languages such as C, C++, Go, Python, and/or Rust

  • Some knowledge of Linux IPVS load-balancing

  • Some knowledge of global IP routing

  • Some knowledge of HTTP caching and related CDN technologies


Some public links on the current state of our TLS termination you might be interested in:



  • https://grafana.wikimedia.org/dashboard/db/tls-ciphers

  • https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/analyze.html?d=en.wikipedia.org

  • https://wikitech.wikimedia.org/wiki/HTTPS


About the Wikimedia Foundation


The Wikimedia Foundation is the non-profit organization that supports and hosts Wikipedia and several other Wikimedia free knowledge sites. Every month, the Wikimedia sites are accessed by more than a billion unique devices. Wikipedia consists of more than 40 million articles across hundreds of languages. Every month, more than 250,000 volunteer editors contribute to Wikipedia. Based in San Francisco, California, the Wikimedia Foundation is an audited, 501(c)(3) non-profit that is funded primarily through donations and grants. It currently employs over 300 staff members.


At the Foundation, we build technology to help people everywhere access Wikipedia, across devices and in nearly 300 languages. We engineer privacy for our readers and editors so they can safely and securely explore Wikipedia. We create programs and initiatives to make Wikipedia freely available to more people in more parts of the world. We build new tools for the community of editors so they can continue to improve and grow Wikipedia. Roughly a quarter of our budget goes to supporting the community that make the site possible, including through grantmaking programs that enable volunteers and enrich the information on the sites.


The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply.


Benefits & Perks *



  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)

  • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more

  • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary

  • Flexible and generous time off - vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays - including the last week of the year.

  • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.

  • For those emergency moments - long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program

  • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses

  • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available

  • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax

  • Great colleagues - diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people


* for benefits eligible staff, benefits may vary by location


More Information


https://wikimediafoundation.org


https://blog.wikimedia.org

Languages evolve, platforms change and so you learn. You grab the chances we offer to develop yourself because you are curious and like to work with the latest tools and techniques in an ever changing technological landscape.

item.title: Embedded Software Engineer C# - Develop for Innovative Products at Sioux (Delft, Netherlands)
item.description:
Would you like to develop software for innovative products in challenging projects for high-tech customers?


Where you are 100% involved and where you can combine technology with working in an R&D environment?


Do you enjoy getting the best out of yourself and others?


Do you prefer to work in an informal environment where contributing to the company's success is equivalent to developing yourself and your career?


We have just the job for you! As Embedded Software Engineer at Sioux Automation Technology in Delft.


Skills & Requirements


Your experience lies in the area of embedded software technology and you are looking for a job that has this focus. You take responsibility for successful completion of the assignments. You are able to adapt quickly to different domains and you are always looking for ways to bring yourself and your colleagues to a higher level. In addition, you closely match the following profile:



  • you have a minimum of 5 years of experience in technical software development

  • you are familiar with the c / C++ and familiar C# programming language.

  • you are eager to learn new things and technologies (and we will support you with a €6.000 yearly learning stipend!)

Would be nice if you have experience with:

item.title: Working Student, Internship or Thesis in Berlin - Frontend, JavaScript, ReactJS at Zenjob (Berlin, Germany)

For this position we are looking for someone who is passionate about frontend development with React. You will work on complex problems with cutting-edge technologies, in a tech-driven company.


If you join us, you’ll:
