item.title: Senior Project Engineer I - Firmware at Neptune Technology Group Inc. (Duluth, GA)
item.description:
Position Summary
The Senior Project Engineer - Firmware is responsible for the design, development, and implementation of new products as well as engineering support for existing products. This individual performs product design and works as a team member with R&E, Marketing, and Manufacturing for new products while complying with project schedules and budgets.

Key Qualifications:
* Excellent C/C++ programming skills with experience in embedded system design and development
* Extensive experience in debugging embedded systems
* Experience with embedded firmware development tools such oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, DC power analyzers, logic analyzers, and protocol analyzers
* Experience with designing and developing RF products for public and proprietary networks
* Experience with ARM Cortex M3/M4, 8051, and MSP430 microcontrollers
* Experience with Keil, IAR or equivalent IDEs/compilers
* Knowledge of wireless communication techniques and associated protocols such as LoRaWAN, Bluetooth Classic and Bluetooth Smart (BLE), cellular communication (LTE)
* Familiarity with low power design practices for battery powered devices
* Familiarity with serial communication protocols such as UART, SPI, I2C
* Ability to read and understand hardware schematics
* Experience with JIRA or other issue tracking software
* Experience with TeamCity or other continuous integration platforms
* Experience working in an Agile development environment (Scrum/XP)
* Experience with unit testing and unit testing frameworks/tools such as Unity, CMock, and Ceedling
* Excellent documentation practices and communication skills
* Commitment to maintaining project schedules and delivering tasks on time

Preferred Qualifications:
* Knowledge of networking connectivity protocols such as TCP/IP, FTP, MQTT
* Experience with agency certifications such FCC, Industry Canada, and cellular carrier certifications
* Project management experience
* LabVIEW experience
* Embedded Linux experience
* C#
* Python

Requirements:

Education:Bachelor of Science degree in Electrical Engineering, Wireless Engineering, or Computer Engineering

Experience:7 years in Engineering product design and development. (5 years of experience for candidates with a Master of Science degree.); 5 years of embedded programming

Location:Duluth, Georgia or Tallassee, Alabama

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractors legal duty to furnish information.

item.title: Senior PHP/Node.js/C++ developer - Full Time - 100% Remote EU Time Zone at Cvedia Limited (Madrid, Spain) (allows remote)
item.description:
About the job


This is a remote, full time, long term position. As a developer in our team you will take full responsibility of your modules in a process intensive system. You will take charge of the development process from gathering requirements and system design through to the UI mockups and front end development. We require a high level of understanding the business logic involved and a critical mind to design and implement it effectively.


Experience with the following is desired



  • Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.

  • Working remotely with a team in multiple timezones.

  • Ability to work independently - accountable for your own actions and able to act with both urgency and integrity.

  • The ability to understand what the users and the business need.



  • Must Have: System analysis, data modelling, business process diagrams, data flow diagrams, UML.

  • Full stack development experience designing and building high volume, scalable, modular applications from top to bottom

  • Extensive proficiency with at least two RDBMSes

  • Solid professional experience in OOP using php and preferably python too.

  • Version Control

  • Linux server administration





How should you apply for this job?


Please provide your github repository


Only applicants from European time zone will be processed.


We will not reply to 3rd party software/employees agencies


Please state on the mail subject the job position and the state you reside.


Please understand that this job capacity is for a full position.





Application process:


Application usually will be screened the same day we receive it.


We will reply to you no later than two business days to set-up a short interview.


1-3 weeks after the interview you could be hired!





What we offer:


Job location is in Cyberspace.


Communication with the all team members is done through Skype


Employee will be receiving all of his social rights as stated in the law of his country.


Salary will be paid once a month with a wire transfer


Job capacity: Monday - Friday (8 hours daily)

item.title: Senior Software Engineer / Application Data at QuoteCenter (Vancouver, WA)
item.description:
Position Purpose 


Working at the world's fourth largest retailer mixes the best of many worlds: cutting-edge technologies applied to business problems, solving real needs for customers who spend billions of dollars across our stores in North America. QuoteCenter is an application Home Depot store associates use to build large product orders for our Pro customers.


What is it like to work at The Home Depot QuoteCenter?


The mission of the QuoteCenter product team is to radically reimagine the shopping experience at Home Depot utilizing the latest software technologies. QuoteCenter was a startup once upon a time and much of our startup culture still exists: the agility of a small operation and the impact that comes with being a leader in our industry. We build cutting-edge applications that facilitate 9-figure project sales at The Home Depot. We invest proactively in our people. We sponsor developer events, including PADNUG, Write/Speak/Code and JSConf where our engineers headline workshops to teach Portland-area engineers how we use cutting-edge technology to solve real world problems.


What problem will you be solving in this role?


Developing and supporting the entire application data pipeline from ingestion until handoff to the BI Engineering and Data Analytics teams.


What tools do we use?


Databases, Big Data, Data Modeling, C#, .Net


Description


An HDQC Senior Software Engineer is an experienced software engineer.  All software engineers are expected to write well designed, testable, and efficient code and to demonstrate work ethic that motivates and encourages others on their team. Software engineers are encouraged to bring fresh ideas, new perspectives, and an eagerness to learn new technologies.


Experience:



  • Build robust, high-quality data processes that support our application users

  • Modeling data for integrity and performance

  • Schema management and definition

  • Implementing data patterns and tools to present users their data correctly, accurately, and efficiently throughout the platform



Major Tasks, Responsibilities and Key Accountabilities (content CANNOT be changed by HR in the future)



  • 15% - Helping with solution design and architecture

  • 55% - Writing new code and test cases

  • 15% - Debugging existing code

  • 10% - Learning new skills

  • 5% - Mentoring


Minimum Qualifications 


Minimum Age: 18


Education: High School


Years of Relevant Work Experience: 2


Preferred Qualifications 



  • Demonstrated a good working knowledge in at least one programming language

  • Interest in learning other programming languages as needed

  • Ability to contribute to and complete a single story with some guidance

  • Ability to work independently and in groups

  • Analytical thinking

  • Critical thinking

  • Strong problem solver

  • Attention to detail

  • Strong oral and written communication

  • Thorough understanding of data structures and algorithms 

  • Knowledge of software design patterns


Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies 


Our software engineers have the challenge (and fun) of taking on a wide variety of problems and directly affecting users and the business. The following is a list of attributes found in successful QuoteCenter software engineers: 


PROBLEM SOLVING - Work collaboratively with business stakeholders, user experience designers, and your fellow engineers to create a solution. Build domain knowledge and understand the user & business problems you're solving. 


QUALITY DELIVERABLES - Good software architecture - at QuoteCenter every engineer is an architect. You are responsible for creating systems that are appropriately maintainable, scalable, and extensible.


TAKING OWNERSHIP - When a problem comes to your attention, take care of it. If you're too busy with something more important either assign it to someone else or set a reminder to come back to it later.


ALWAYS LEARNING - Be willing to learn whatever technologies, tools, or patterns necessary to solve a problem. Don't avoid a problem because "someone else 'owns' the code" - learn the code, learn the domain, solve the problem. 


ALWAYS A MENTOR – Continually look for the chance to share your knowledge and skills with others.  Even the most seasoned professional can learn new tricks from the most junior engineer.  There is always something you know that someone else doesn’t (and vice versa), so share! 


EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATION - Write and speak clearly and concisely. Be prepared to explain your work, decisions, and ideas to your colleagues. Graciously challenge ideas that don't seem right, no matter where they originate.


GOOD TEAMMATE - Have a sense of humor. Build relationships with your colleagues. Work out differences with your colleagues directly. Go to your manager if you're unable to resolve it there. Actively work to disrupt backchannel and office politics. Look for ways to make the work environment better for everyone.

item.title: Technical Lead at comparethemarket.com (Peterborough, UK)
item.description:
As a Technical Lead at comparethemarket.com you will drive the technical direction within a product team (Motor), delivering first class web solutions and contributing to an evolving culture of innovation, enthusiasm and passion.


At comparethemarket.com (CTM) our passion is creating great software, we look to push the boundaries with new technologies so that we can deliver the very best for our customers and our Technical Leads are at the heart of delivering this. We value everyone’s opinion in building top class software, the role of a Technical Lead is crucial in setting technical direction and building team consensus.


We want Technical Leads with an unrivaled enthusiasm for new and emerging technologies who work best in a collaborative team environment. We are passionate about empowering our employees and do the same with our consumers, allowing them to compare, choose and purchase the most suitable product for them.


What will you be responsible for as a Technical Lead at comparethemarket.com?



  • Leading by example in Building, Running and Owning CTM’s Platform with a focus on enhancing speed to market, stability and scalability for the whole of CTM

  • Increasing the understanding of technically complex areas within your product team

  • Ensuring that all solutions adhere to technical architecture, principles, standards and governance processes and contain all of the agreed artefacts of delivery

  • Working with the Product Owner and Solution Architect, using your technical context to prioritise the feature backlog to deliver business outcomes in an optimal way

  • Working with the Solution Architect to agree the technical roadmap to realise the architectural vision for your product whilst considering the practicalities of delivery

  • Championing quality and technical excellence at all times, contributing to the agile process and continuously improving all aspects of delivery


What will it take to be successful as a Technical Lead at comparethemarket.com?



  • You’ll be an advocate extreme programming, keen to test first, deploy often and pair program

  • You’ll have a high level of coding standards (OO, design patterns, testing approaches, TDD) with a polyglot approach to problem solving

  • You’ll be a customer focused, natural influencer and negotiator with an enthusiasm for motivating teams

  • You’ll be an active learner, with a passion for keeping up to date with emerging technologies, and able to pick up new concepts fast

  • Proven experience of coaching, mentoring and driving technical excellence from a team of engineers

item.title: Software Developer (Automated Highlight Platform - Sports Analytics) at Thuuz Sports (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Job description


Extend our platform for generating automated, personalized video highlights across all sports we cover:



  • Implement new backend services in Python on Linux/AWS.

  • Implement solutions that integrate complex components involving video processing, feature extraction, and data generation.

  • Optimize capabilities and performance of existing tool pipeline.


Skills & Requirements



  • Expert in Python with demonstrated ability to master complex systems and identify and implement optimal enhancements.

  • Experience in C/C++ to support integrating existing internal and 3rd party components.

  • Extensive experience and passion for contributing as a full stack engineer preferred.

  • 3+ years in commercial application development with shipped products.

  • Experience with video processing strongly desirable.

  • Familiarity with computer vision would be helpful.

  • Desire to work for in a startup environment.

  • Eligible to work in United States.

item.title: Senior Software Developer - Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence at Pipedrive (Tallinn, Estonia)
item.description:
Our collective number of products, services and integrations produce mountains of data, which is currently being captured into a central data hub and compiled into a data warehouse. We analyze the data to improve our software, and use predictive analytics to find out what might happen to our business in the near future.  


To take full advantage of big data, we’d like introduce new experiences for our customers that would help them to learn more about their sales. The objective is to assist them in making the most appropriate actions based on the behavioral patterns of users in combination with Pipedrive’s expert knowledge of sales management practices.


The implementation of this vision will involve:



  • Enhancing the current data platform

  • Applying different machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) techniques

  • Designing, building and running necessary microservices

  • Enriching the user interface


What We’re Looking For:

We're looking for a sharp, passionate, and capable software engineer with a desire to make an impact in the real world. You are driven to use bleeding edge technology to create intelligent and data driven solutions for customers. In this role you will be a central point of contact between Pipedrive’s data platform and different system components. You will also be working with experienced engineers, devops and product managers in a challenging yet stimulating startup environment.


What We Expect from You:

You are expected to work independently and deliver high quality code in a timely manner across a variety of product engagements. You will also be responsible for code reviews, as well as enforcing standards and best practices. You pride yourself in being an early adopter of powerful and fun tech, and aren’t the type to fall for the legacy software trap. You avoid this by consistently looking for ways to improve your stack and constantly pay off technical debt.


Experience Required to the Position:



  • Proven software development track record

  • Experience with Node.js, PHP or Go. If you have solid experience with different technologies but are willing to learn, then we're ready to talk

  • Ability to work in areas outside of our usual comfort zone

  • Able to get things done quickly

  • Thorough understanding of security threats

  • Fluent English language skills are a must


Bonus Experience:



  • Personal projects that show an aptitude for engineering

  • Experience with the following technologies: Backbone.js, React.js

  • Excited about latest big data technologies like Kafka, Hadoop, and Spark and are eager to run those in the cloud (AWS)

  • Experienced with SQL, but also interested in machine learning or other advanced analytics

  • Interest and/or contributions to the open source community

item.title: Senior Java Developer at Chrono24 GmbH (Karlsruhe, Germany)
item.description:
Als Senior Java Developer entwickelst Du unsere Plattform weiter und arbeitest an spannenden Projekten rund um unseren Marktplatz für Luxusuhren. Unsere Entwicklungs-Infrastruktur basiert auf Java 8, Stripes, IntelliJ mit Maven und GIT. Du bringst Deine Erfahrung in der Webentwicklung mit ein und betreust und wartest eigenständig Deinen Code.


Was Dich erwartet:



  • In einem Karlsruher Rechenzentrum betreiben wir die Infrastruktur für unseren weltweiten Marktplatz für Luxusuhren.

  • Auf Basis von Java 8, JSP, Stripes, IntelliJ-Infrastruktur mit Maven, Jenkins und GIT entwickelst Du unsere Plattform und Tools weiter.

  • Unsere Software-Architektur ist hoch-performant, ohne „Altlasten“, flexibel und für die Zukunft gut erweiterbar.

  • Auf Dich warten spannende und vielseitige Projekte (kein HTML/CSS).

  • Du hilfst dabei, unsere Tool- und Prozesslandschaft stetig zu verbessern.

  • Dabei arbeitest Du Dich umfassend in die zum Einsatz kommenden Technologien und Systeme ein und weißt genau, was wie funktioniert.


Was Dich auszeichnet:



  • Der Schwerpunkt Deiner Erfahrung liegt in der Webentwicklung, aber auch generalistische Qualitäten zeichnen Dich aus.

  • Du hast mindestens 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung in diesem Feld gesammelt.

  • Du sprichst fließend Deutsch.

  • Du verfügst über gute Englischkenntnisse.

  • Du bringst intensive Erfahrung mit Java und der Betreuung und Wartung des eigenen Codes mit.

  • Du hast Freude am eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten, Recherchieren und Lernen neuer Systeme.

  • Große Herausforderungen und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten ziehen Dich an.

  • Proaktives Mitdenken, Teamfahigkeit und zuverlässiges Handeln zeichnen Dich aus.


Was wir bieten:


Offenheit, Wertschätzung und Eigenverantwortung sind zentrale Werte bei Chrono24. Bei uns sind unterschiedlichste Typen am Werk, weil wir der Überzeugung sind, dass gerade diese Vielfalt maßgeblich zu unserem Erfolg beiträgt. Als Teil unseres Teams gestaltest Du unsere Entwicklungsprozesse aktiv mit und kannst deine Vorstellungen und Ideen schon in frühen Phasen unserer Produktentwicklung einbringen. Wir geben Dir die Möglichkeit mit Deinen Ideen unsere technische Ausrichtung mitzugestalten und wissen es zu schätzen, wenn Du uns mit frischen Impulsen weiter voranbringst. Unsere Software-Architektur ist hoch-performant, ohne „Altlasten“, refactoring-freundlich, flexibel und für die Zukunft gut erweiterbar. Wir haben den Anspruch in der Tiefe zu verstehen, wie die von uns eingesetzten Technologien funktionieren. Nur so können wir mit unserer Plattform auch in Zukunft den Herausforderungen eines globalen Marktes gerecht werden.


Eine zeitgemäße Unternehmenskultur mit flachen Hierarchien und eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance ist uns wichtig. Dafür sorgen wir mit individueller Arbeitsplatzausstattung und Fortbildungsmöglichkeiten, echter Vertrauensarbeitszeit, flexiblen Arbeitszeitmodellen und zahlreichen Benefits, wie Massagen, Personal Training, Gaming Zone und legendären After-Work-Partys. Das klingt interessant für dich? Dann bewirb dich jetzt und werde Teil unseres Teams.


Schick uns einfach eine mail an:


jobs@chrono24.com

item.title: Senior Android Developer to rock the world of finance within BUX at BUX (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Your Role



  • Be a collaborative and engaged member of a multidisciplinary Scrum team, along with fellow mobile and backend developers, QA, designers, and product owner, to create the best casual trading experience on the planet;

  • Push for and uphold the best engineering, development, and quality practices;

  • Create sleek user interfaces, and provide a smooth user experience through high-quality, high-performance code;

  • Be comfortable in sharing your knowledge with your teammates, and in learning from them;

  • Be the driver of your own personal development and growth, by staying up-to-date on all things Android, and constantly looking for opportunities to improve yourself and your skills;


Skills & Requirements



  • Strong experience developing native Android apps;

  • Solid knowledge of software design patterns, as well as of Android design patterns;

  • Proficiency in Java, with strong object-oriented design skills (experience with Kotlin is a plus);

  • Very good understanding of memory management, file I/O, network & socket programming, concurrency, and multithreading;

  • Demonstrable experience publishing apps to the Google Play Store (please include details of your portfolio when you apply);

  • Experience with distributed version control systems like Git;

  • Strong written and verbal English communication skills;


What we offer



  • An awesome role within a fast-growing startup in a brand new office close to Amsterdam Central Station

  • Ownership and responsibility: you will be empowered to make a difference and introduce your own ideas

  • Competitive salary

  • Bi-weekly Hackathons and fun company events

  • Conference and training budget

  • Fabulous and healthy company lunches made by our very own chef (http://www.instagram.com/buxlunch)


Please, note that BUX is not providing relocation and visa support for countries outside of Europe

item.title: Senior Java Developer to rock the world of finance at BUX (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
WHY YOU WILL ENJOY WORKING FOR BUX



  • You'll design, build, and maintain a system that is meant to scale. We went from 1000 to 1.2 million users with barely any hiccups

  • You'll work with an actor-based framework (similar to Akka), that is central to everything we do, and the heart of the scalability of our system.

  • We have a trading app that is accessible 24/7. We have a very small maintenance window, so from a DevOps perspective anybody, you'll have the opportunity to think, plan, and execute the best ways to deploy our services.

  • Because we don't have a web app, backward compatibility will always be an issue. We have tens of thousands of clients out there, running different versions of the app. Every seemingly small decision might impact some or a few of them.  

  • We have a really experienced team. Between the CTO and our tech leads, there are several decades of development experience. This is one of the smartest teams you'll have the chance to work in. It will help you push yourself to the next level.

  • Lastly, the business domain is really interesting. It's not something you see every day and, once mastered, this knowledge can be used for other companies in the trading/financial world.


WHAT WE OFFER, IN A NUTSHELL



  • An awesome role within a fast-growing startup in a brand new office close to Amsterdam Central Station

  • Ownership: you will be empowered to make a difference, and introduce your own ideas

  • Competitive salary

  • The chance to work from abroad up to one month per year

  • Bi-weekly Hackathons, weekly borrels, fun company events

  • Conference and training budget

  • Fabulous and healthy company lunches made by our very own chef (http://www.instagram.com/buxlunch)


WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU



  • Be a collaborative and engaged member of a multidisciplinary Scrum team, along with fellow backend and mobile developers, QA, designer, and product owner, to  create, maintain, and operate the most robust, scalable and reliable back-end the world has ever seen;

  • Take part in the architecture design sessions, development, integration testing, and in all aspects of the software life-cycle;

  • Push for and uphold the best engineering, development, and quality practices (including but not limited to continuous integration, release early and often, refactoring, unit testing, and code reviews).

  • Have a hands-on coding mindset, develop and maintain high-quality code base, consistently delivering stable and maintainable projects;

  • As we are a DevOps team, be part of our on-call roster, once you're up to speed. (There is a compensation scheme for when you are on-call.)

  • Be the driver of your own personal development and growth, by staying up-to-date on current, new, and emerging technologies, and constantly looking for opportunities to improve yourself and your skills;

  • Be comfortable in sharing your knowledge with your teammates, helping them grow, and in learning from them


JOB REQUIREMENTS



  • Proficiency in Java, with strong object-oriented design skills;

  • Solid knowledge of software design patterns;

  • Working knowledge of the Spring framework;

  • An Agile mindset and working knowledge of the Scrum framework;

  • Experience with DevOps tools and procedures;

  • Experience with building scalable (clustered) systems;

  • Experience with puppet, messaging systems and Elasticsearch is a pre;

  • Knowledge of reactive, actor-based systems is a pre;

  • Proactive, self-starting, can-do mentality.


Please, note that BUX is not providing relocation and visa support for countries outside of Europe

item.title: Scala/ Java Backend Engineer at dataWerks GmbH (Frankfurt am Main, Deutschland)
item.description:
Key Responsibilities 



  • Design and build new features for our platform

  • Apply Best Practices of Software Engineering on day-to-day development tasks

  • Optimize existing features and services for performance and stability

  • Research technologies for new features and core product requirements

  • Work together with other talented engineers to solve interesting technical challenges

  • Work in a cross-functional team in an Agile context


Skills and Requirements 



  • Experience in Java and/or Scala

  • Experience in functional languages is a bonus

  • Have knowledge of Continuous Integration - the benefits and challenges

  • We are working with a lot of data, so experience with databases of any kind would be great

  • Experience in developing Restful Applications

  • Problem-solving mindset

  • Eager to work with new and cutting-edge technologies

  • Be able to communicate in English


We offer



  • Attractive salary

  • Paid trainings/seminars

  • An open-minded company culture for new ideas, approaches and ways of thinking

  • Ability to work with a highly motivated team in a collaborative environment with a flat organisational structure



Do you want to experience the unique flair of a start up mindset in a Multicultural work environment? 


Come forward and introduce yourselves, we would be happy to get to know you and your professional journey. Send your CV to Constanze Eloundou: ce@datawerks.com.

item.title: Softwareentwickler (m/w) fr ERP-Software at theurer.com GmbH (Freiberg am Neckar, Deutschland)
item.description:
Ihre Aufgaben:



  • Neu- und Weiterentwicklung unserer branchenspezifischen ERP-Lösung C3

  • Mitwirkung in Second und Third Level Support

  • Koordination von externen Beratern und internen Leistungen (z.B. IU, Icons, Architektur, Beratung)

  • Projektmanagement von der Entwicklungen der Spezifikationen über die Planung bis hin zur Endabnahme


Ihr Profil:



  • Idealerweise Kenntnisse in mehreren der folgenden Sprachen und Technologien:

    • C#, VB.net, ADO.net, LINQ, Entity Framework, ASP MVC, HTML5

    • Microsoft SQL-Server: T-SQL, komplexe Abfragen, Stored procedures, Transactions, SMO, Performance Optimierung

    • Office-Komponenten, insbesondere Outlook und Access

    • PDF und JDF Formate



  • Erfahrungen mit der Entwicklung oder Anpassung von betriebswirtschaftlicher Software sind von Vorteil

item.title: Web Engineer for Machine Learning company at Matroid (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Help us solve automated intelligence. Led by professors from Stanford, Berkeley, and MIT, we are focused on moving mature machine learning research into the hands of industry. Located in historic Palo Alto, right next to Stanford campus. This is the perfect position for a Web Engineer to learn and do Machine Learning. Some benefits:



  • Tackle intellectually challenging problems

  • Free lunch, snacks, drinks, and caffeine every day

  • Gym membership with yoga and pilates classes next door

  • Health insurance, including medical and dental

  • Free onsite parking for easy commute, also close to Caltrain

  • Budget for whatever hardware you want

  • Flexible hours

  • Competitive Salary and Equity


Responsibilities



  • Develop core systems and infrastructure supporting the Matroid platform. 

  • Build front-end pages and interaction with backend services.


Minimum Requirements



  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent.

  • Experience with web applications, Javascript, HTML, CSS


Preferred Qualifications



  • MS in Computer Science or equivalent.

  • Experience with large-scale streaming analytics or machine learning systems.

  • Experience with Node, React, Jade


To apply, please send your resume and introduction to careers@matroid.com

item.title: Development Engineer - Working in Japan at LINE Corporation (Fukuoka, Japan)
item.description:
Both Japanese speakers and Non-Japanese speakers welcomed (if working in Fukuoka); there are many English speakers working with the company. Successful applicants without Japanese language skills may be asked to attend a Japanese training course for half of every working day for at least 3 months ~ 12 months after arriving in Fukuoka. This training is paid for by the employer, and is an excellent chance to pick up new language skills.


Choose your work location depending on your Japanese language skills!




  1. Non-Japanese Speakers: Assigned to Fukuoka/ Kyoto office. However, those wishing to transfer to Tokyo office may do so after attaining basic conversational skills if desired.




  2. Japanese Speakers: Can select Tokyo/ Fukuoka/ Kyoto office if Japanese skills equivalent to JLPT Level 2 or above.




Many of the world's best engineers work with the company, and approximately 30% of them hail from overseas. Experienced IT engineers who can put the user's perspective first and wish to make a positive impact on the tens of millions of daily users are encouraged to apply!


Job Description:
Successful candidates will be assigned as a server-side or app developer based on their previous work experience, as well as their career wishes. Regardless of their actual position, developers are able and encouraged to take part in all of the production process, from planning to implementation.



Specific duties will include :



  • Development of smartphone applications for the company and clients

  • Server development for the company's smartphone applications

  • Researching of new technology, followed by test development and information sharing

  • Implementation of strategies for service quality maintenance and performance improvement


Skills & Requirements


Job Requirements: 



  • At least 1 year related experience.

  • English language skills (business level or above),

  • Non Japanese speaking applicants must be willing to learn the Japanese language after arriving Japan

  • Professional knowledge of at least one programming language

  • Understanding of computer science

  • Fundamental knowledge of memory, processes, threads, and their relation to programming

  • A fundamental understanding of network technology (e.g. TCP/UDP, HTTP, etc.), databases, and SQL



Preferred Skills: 



  • Experience in developing native apps using Java/Objective-C

  • Experience in Web application development using languages such as Java, PHP, Perl, Ruby, Python, etc. 

  • A history of active participation in the Open Source community

  • Experience with development/operation of systems with large quantities of data and traffic


Working hours: 
Discretionary and flexible according to abilities and speed of task completion; if all tasks and projects are completed well and on time, you do not need to stay in the office for extended periods of time.



Salary: 
Minimum 6 million Japanese Yen per annual (higher compensation will be provided based on skills and experience and is negotiable). We also offer relocation allowance to the right candidate.


 <Please note>


Candidates CANNOT apply more than one position at a time.
You are welcome to reapply for any positions within the group again
after a period of 12 months has passed.

item.title: Linux/Unix Guru (m/f) at EXASOL (Nuremberg, Germany)
item.description:
Who you are



  • You are interested in developing our linux based architecture that we use for automation to develop, test and run our high-performance analytic in-memory database

  • You are very experienced in scripting languages (Python, Bash,Perl), complex Linux-Landscapes and Open Source Software

  • Among other topics, you are interested in the following: gdb, strace, unikernel, cloud, ssd, aws, runtime, c++11, lexical scope, process substitution, static linking, kexec, uninterruptible wait, data serialization

  • You are clever and highly motivated, and have high quality awareness


What you can expect from us



  • Interesting and diverse tasks as part of a motivated, international team of experts

  • We use a complex high performance build and test system consisting of hundreds of servers. For instance, we recently accelerated our full/incremental builds from 60/1 minutes to 5 minutes/1 second

  • Co-operative and open culture, flat hierarchy making it easy to contribute to EXASOL’s success and core values

  • A competitive, performance-related salary

item.title: Data Scientist (m/f) | Hamburg at Kreditech (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
Join the financial revolution!


Are you passionate about finance and want to make a real change? Join Kreditech and our team of over 300 professionals and become part of a transforming industry. From engineering, to design, to analytics, and collections, we do things differently and we reward great ideas, team work and persistence. We have a lot of work to do – and we want you to join us!


Your Role


You will be joining a dynamic, fast-growing, diverse, multi-functional and multidisciplinary team. You will contribute with your unique background and experience, your fast-learning ability and motivation.


This is the optimal opportunity for you to:



  • Apply data science in areas like credit risk modelling and profitability analysis; acquisition, retention and debt collection optimization; product personalization and conversion optimization

  • Work with state-of-the art stack of data processing and modelling technologies

  • Experience a wide range of problems and proposed solutions - Constantly innovate

  • Develop machine learning expertise beyond basic supervised and unsupervised learning

  • Get responsibility and ownership right from the first day along with the unique chance to spearhead the way big data is used in one of the fastest growing Fintech organizations

  • Prototype and productionize innovative, data-intensive, fully-automated, machine-learning-based decision engines

  • Feel the excitement of extracting value from data and impacting the performance of an entire organization


 Your Strengths


 Essential:



  • Bachelors or Masters with strong academic performance in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Business Informatics).

  • Expertise in Machine Learning.

  • 1 or more years of working experience in a similar role.

  • Ability to process data and build predictive models in R (R Studio).

  • Experience in analyzing complex data and presenting your conclusions in a clear and concise manner to a wide range of audiences.

  • You are familiar with SQL and NoSQL database technologies, and are capable of at least querying them for any data required.

  • You speak English fluently-any other language or German are not required but an additional plus


 Preferred:



  • PhD degree in a quantitative field.

  • 2 or more years of experience as a data scientist.

  • Absolutely fluent in R, you could call yourself an R-hacker.

  • Familiarity with Python.

  • Experience developing data products or writing production-ready code.


How to apply:


We accept applications exclusively through our recruiting platform, found under the ‘Apply Now’ link. There are a few screening questions, and we would like your CV and a short cover letter. That's it! We look forward to hearing from you.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Mac & iOS at comScore, Inc (Reston, VA)
item.description:
comScore is looking for people who love to code. We need people who want to sink their teeth into an issue to understand it and push the limits on what is possible. The Internet is a dynamic environment and we constantly need new solutions for problems that no one has ever considered before. This role sits within one of our strongest programming teams, and is one that is perfect for the hacker in you. 



This job is primarily design and development of client based macOS and iOS applications using C++ and Objective-C. We dig deep into the OS, network protocols, and other applications to understand how they work so we can find the ultimate solution. Creativity and innovation are required. We are looking for people who never want to stop honing their skills.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Participate in the design and development of new components

  • Develop components that will run on millions of computers

  • Develop enhancements to current solutions

  • Research macOS, iOS, application and network protocol internals

  • Participate in research and evaluation of new related technologies



QUALIFICATIONS:



  • Bachelor degree in Computer Science or related field

  • 4+ years of professional experience in developing client applications

  • 3+ years developing software in C++ in a UNIX or macOS environment

  • Experience developing applications for macOS and iOS in C++ and Objective-C is preferred

  • Knowledge of TCP/IP including HTTP/HTTPS

  • Experience with reverse engineering software

  • Strong problem solving, troubleshooting and analysis skills

  • SQL is helpful

item.title: Node.js vvoj na projekt DC API at Livesport s.r.o. (Praha 13, Czechia)
item.description:
Jedno z tajemství našeho úspchu se jmenuje DataCore. Bez kluk z DC API týmu by tahle obrovská sportovní databáze byla jen temná bezedná studna :), ale díky nim se na ni snadno napojují všechny weby a aplikace Livesportu.


Základní stavební kámen našich projekt te potebuje dalšího lovka, který by pomáhal spojovat svt backendu (DataCore) a frontendu (pedevším sí FlashScore). Zajímají t stejné vci, o kterých náš DC API tým mluvil na druhém Livesport Talku? Pak jsi náš lovk!


Co t eká?



  • Osvojíš si nejmodernjší informaní technologie i paralelní programování clusterového systému server-klient.

  • Dostaneš na starost vývoj interního API s maximálním drazem na rychlost odpovdí.

  • Budeš pracovat na vývoji nových funkností, ale i na optimalizaci tch stávajících.

  • Budeš se podílet na vývoji nástroj a knihoven pro náš tým i všechny ostatní.

item.title: Specialist in Automotive Penetration Testing (m/f) (109343) at BMW Group (Mnchen, Deutschland)
item.description:
THE SOURCE CODE TO THE FUTURE IS DEVELOPED HERE.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR DEVELOPING SOFTWARE.


To revolutionise the future of mobility, one has to go ahead and set standards today. Intelligent technologies that are increasingly taking over driving tasks and providing greater safety and comfort are already in use in our vehicles. Increasing our lead in autonomous driving will need visionary thinkers and creative developers. Specialists in the fields of machine learning, artificial intelligence, sensor technology and software development will work in expert teams, in centres centres of excellence networked around the world, to redefine the limits of what is possible.


Specialist in Automotive Penetration Testing (m/f)


As a Specialist (m/f) in Automotive Penetration Testing at the BMW Group, you can count on numerous tasks which will be dynamically developing in the area of electrics/electronics and software.
Future vehicle innovations are based on software, electronics and intelligent connections between vehicle systems and components. You will independently develop processes, technologies and tools for performing penetration tests. As a Project Manager (m/f), you will control and support the execution of penetration tests on components and at vehicle system level, including the interface to the backend systems, and you will ensure the coordination with all relevant process partners. You will receive input regarding the security needs, as well as risk and threat analyses developed in the team. You will coordinate the elimination of vulnerabilities from conception to series maturity. You will track the implementation, especially in cooperation with the approving KIFA specialist departments and the E/E integration.

item.title: Java Senior Developer/Consultant (m/w) at cellent GmbH (Fellbach, Deutschland)
item.description:
• Beratung und Unterstützung unserer Kunden, meist vor Ort, beim Aufbau moderner Systemarchitekturen und bei der Konzeption sowie beim Design verteilter und moderner Anwendungsarchitekturen im Java-Umfeld



  • Eigenständiges Umsetzen/Realisieren von Teilprojekten



  • Wahrnehmen von PreSales-Terminen und Aufnahme von Projektanforderungen bzw. Begleitung als technischer Experte/in in PreSales-Phasen



  • Erstellung von Entscheidungsvorlagen, Fach- und Projektkonzepten sowie technischer Feinspezifikationen



  • Verfolgung aktueller technologischer Trends, z.B. durch den Besuch von Konferenzen und selbstständige Vertiefung des erlangten Wissens in Ihrer täglichen Arbeit

item.title: Security Engineer at Varo Money (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We are looking for a Security Engineer to help us build a cloud-based, mobile-first digital bank targeting millennials. This ambitious goal provides an opportunity for an exceptional hands-on security engineer to architect, design and execute on security initiatives that will be critical to the success of the company.



  • Architect and implement security solutions; Evaluate, design, implement, and manage security tools/infrastructure such as intrusion detection and prevention systems (IDS/IPS), vulnerability scanners, anti-malware, security information and event management (SIEM) products, web application firewalls (WAF), data loss prevention (DLP) tools, web proxies, forensic toolkits, multi-factor authentication (MFA), key management, etc.

  • Perform risk assessments, vulnerability management, penetration testing and patch management for Linux, Mac, Windows systems and web applications. Work closely with engineering teams to proactively identify and fix security flaws and vulnerabilities.

  • Create framework for continuous security monitoring and incident response procedures. This includes app sec testing, scanning consolidated system logs and other audit trails on a continuous basis to detect attacks and working with internal and external parties to address events, conduct investigations, and carry out remedial actions. 

  • Oversee execution and completion of the company's application and infrastructure related security tightening activities which include access reviews, password and key rotations, encryption, code analysis, penetration testing, etc.

  • Enforce security governance and promote a security culture within the company by maintaining and evangelizing information security policies, standards and procedures. 

  • Provide support and guidance for legal and regulatory compliance efforts, including audit support and ensure that our business processes are vetted from a risk and compliance perspective

  • Be the security subject matter expert and thought leader in the company. Stay abreast with latest developments in the field which includes awareness of new threats and vulnerabilities that may require proactively taking preventive measures.


Qualifications 



  • 5+ years or more of information security experience implementing encryption and key management, intrusion detection (IDS), network security, Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools and log management, web application and network vulnerability scanning, penetration testing, etc.

  • Proficient in coding to automate security functions and processes

  • Experience with AWS security best practices and general infrastructure (KMS, EC2, S3, IAM, VPC, Route53)

  • Strong knowledge of networking concepts, protocols (TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, TLS) and technologies including firewalls, TLS, IDS/IPS system, cryptographic systems, identity management systems, RADIUS, etc.

  • Strong knowledge of application and system security, web security, TLS/SSL, web authentication protocols such as OAuth, Role Based Access Control (RBAC), privilege models 

  • Experience with identity and access management concepts such as SAML federation, OAUTH and MFA

  • Experience with systems auditing and monitoring to ensure compliance

  • Knowledge of common attack patterns and exploitation techniques

  • Knowledge of enterprise and industrial security standards such as HIPPA, SOX, etc.

  • Good understanding of RESTful designs and cloud APIs


Nice to have 



  • Experience in the Financial Services industry and working knowledge of SOX and Payment Card Industry (PCI) Data Security Standards (PCI DSS) as well as experience in the implementation of controls to mitigate PCI issues

  • CISSP certification

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at ServiceTitan (Glendale, CA)
item.description:
Senior Software Engineer


As a Senior Software Engineer will be part of the engineering team at ServiceTitan to help improve our products and build new ones. This is an exciting role for an engineer to come in and lead the major feature development in the rapidly growing startup. We build for perfection, use the most modern tools on Microsoft .NET platform, have an amazing culture, and love to solve complex problems. If you share the same values, you might find yourself in a perfect company!

What you'll do



  • Architect, design, and implement user-facing features end-to-end

  • Work with product managers, designers, and engineers to prototype and implement product features

  • 60% development  / 40% working on requirements, mentorship, supervision

  • Communicate effectively with other engineers, product managers, customers, and partners.


What you'll need



  • 3+ years of industry experience

  • Expert-level knowledge of:


    • Microsoft .NET technology stack (C# / .NET, ASP.NET MVC, Web APIs) and SQL databases (Microsoft SQL Server or any other)

    • HTML5 and JavaScript; experience such front-end frameworks as React and Knockout.js is a plus


  • Ability to empathize with our users and champion for their experience.

  • Ability to use data-driven approach for product decisions. Experience with A/B testing is a plus.

  • Strong communication and technical writing skills

  • Experience with Git, unit testing, debugging, profiling, Visual Studio, JIRA, and other tools that are typically used by developers on Microsoft technology stack.

item.title: C# language analysis research engineer at Semmle (Oxford, UK)
item.description:
Are you an expert C# programmer, familiar with the latest language features and libraries? Do you enjoy tinkering with the internals of the CLR or the Roslyn framework? Do you want to work on cutting-edge analysis of C# code?


As a software engineer working on C# analysis at Semmle, you will help people make software better by using advanced program analysis to find security flaws and bugs in their programs, creating the raw results to serve on lgtm.

item.title: Experienced Software Engineer fluent in web development at Semmle (Oxford, UK)
item.description:
Are you an experienced software engineer, fluent in web development? Would you like your work to make software better, not just at Semmle but globally?


As a software engineer with web expertise at Semmle, you will work on lgtm — both the public lgtm.com and the version for our enterprise customers. You will have wide-ranging responsibilities to take features and improvements from initial design discussions to deployment.


Skills & Requirements


All software engineers at Semmle are highly literate in computer science and mathematics, and can demonstrate that with a top degree in computer science (or related discipline) from a great university, or through their previous world-class work solving difficult technical problems.


In addition, we will ask you to tell us about the successful interactive and visual web-applications you’ve built in the past. We are looking for those who can be productive straight away evolving the lgtm frontend using React, D3, TypeScript, and server-side Java.


You have enough knowledge of visual design to articulate the design elements and principles employed in a design, and are careful about maintaining those conventions and the overall style in your daily work.

item.title: Experienced software engineer to build robust systems at Semmle (Oxford, UK)
item.description:
Are you an experienced software engineer who has helped build robust systems that span tens or hundreds of machines? Would you like your work to make software better, not just at Semmle but globally?


As a software engineer at Semmle with experience of robust distributed systems, you will work on lgtm — both the public lgtm.com that daily analyses changes to over 31,000 of the most popular open-source repositories in the world, and the private lgtm enterprise, which does the same job for our customers’ proprietary software.

item.title: Senior Front-End Developer for a real estate web/mobile app at Allthings (Freiburg im Breisgau, Germany)
item.description:
About your new job:


As a front-end developer, you will work on the Allthings client applications: the mobile web application for end-users and the administrative UIs for our business customers, as well as the equivalent native mobile apps developed with front-end technologies.


This includes developing and maintaining our React codebase, helping the backend team to design our API, implementing the user interface components and writing end-to-end tests to ensure the quality of our product. We also regularly evaluate new and emerging technologies and e.g. recently integrated a conversational chatbot into our front-end application.


What we value in front-end work:



  • Well designed front-end components that are flexible and easy to use

  • Hardened security as a focus, not an afterthought

  • Discipline in test coverage and delivering a quality product

  • No premature optimization, but performance as a key metric

  • Automate all the things!


We offer:



  • A state-of-the art technology stack (Docker, AWS, PHP/Symfony, NodeJS, React)

  • Your choice of laptop and freedom of software development environment

  • Competitive salaries and industry-standard benefits

  • Flexible work time & occasional work from home possible

  • A product, which 60 European real estate companies count on after 18 months of market traction

  • A product, which was named “best connected home solution 2015” at the 2015 Mobile World Congress in Barcelona

  • An experienced management team, a first-class technology and operations team as well as investors, who - together with us - aim to lead in our field globally

  • A company culture that fosters “what is right” instead for “who is right”


You have:



  • Senior experience writing front-end web applications

  • In-depth knowledge of JavaScript including performance and security aspects

  • Experience with NodeJS and ideally React and its ecosystem

  • A university degree or equivalent credibility as a self-taught expert in information technology

  • In-depth knowledge of JavaScript including performance and security aspects

  • Experience with NodeJS and ideally React and its ecosystem

  • Ability to relocate to or near Freiburg (Breisgau) in Germany

  • A hands-on attitude and attention to detail

  • Humor :)

item.title: Creatieve Java Specialisten gezocht at Sogeti (Amstelveen, Netherlands)
item.description:
Focus op Java.


Wij bouwen State of the Art applicaties met de nieuwste Java technologie. Dit doen we door ons te richten op de open source-oplossingen binnen de wereld van Java, alle nieuwe ontwikkelingen te monitoren en vast te leggen in onze Center of Excellence.



Community.


Het Java Competence Netwerk van Sogeti behoort tot de absolute top binnen hun vakgebied.  Deze community bestaat enkel en alleen uit passievol gedreven Javanen. Om dat zo te houden, besteden we veel aandacht aan training, kennisdeling en borging. Vanzelfsprekend maakt ook certificering daar een wezenlijk onderdeel van uit. Alle Javanen binnen het JCN zijn in het bezit van minimaal één Java-certificering, waarbij meer dan de helft zelfs meervoudig gecertificeerd is. Dit maakt dat Sogeti’s JCN de best gecertificeerde Java Community van Nederland is!


Uiteraard hebben we via onze partners Red Hat & Oracle toegang tot de laatste technologieën, tools en opleidingen.
Deze resultaatgerichtheid gecombineerd met ons uitgebreid trainingsprogramma stelt ons in staat telkens één stap voor te lopen op de vraag van onze klanten. 



Java Developer.

Jij als Java Developer gaat in deze rol een grote bijdrage leveren aan de technische realisatie van hoogwaardige Java software oplossingen. 
Kortom; wil jij met ons leading zijn in Nederland op het gebied van Java? Bezit jij onderstaand gereedschapskist en wil je dagelijks werken met de volgende technologieën en frameworks; Java EE, JBoss, Scrum, Open Source Tooling, Python en PHP? Join us!



Jouw gereedschapskist.

- Ervaring met Java EE en frameworks zoals Spring, Java Server Faces, Hibernate, Seam, Google Web Toolkit en/of JUnit;
- Ervaring met applicatieservers zoals JBoss, Glassfish, IBM WebSphere en/of BEA Weblogic;
- Ervaring met Open Source producten zoals Ant, Maven, Eclipse en/of MySQL;
- Kennis van methoden zoals Agile, RUP, Scrum en/of  extreme Programming;
- Afgeronde HBO of Academische opleiding.



Sogeti biedt jou.

Als Java Developer ben jij uiteraard onderdeel ons Java Competence Network. Mocht jij jouw certificering nog niet in the pocket hebben, dan kan jij direct vanuit Sogeti aan de slag met jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling.


Durf jij de uitdaging aan en wil je mee helpen het succes van onze Java Community verder uit te bouwen? Solliciteer  dan nu en wie weet word jij ook een Sogetist.

item.title: Technical Lead at Auth0 (Buenos Aires, Argentina)
item.description:
Marketing Engineering is the engineering team inside Auth0's Marketing organization, our goal is to provide tools and solutions to help all marketing teams be successful.

A marketing engineer is an all-terrain software engineer that can write both front-end and back-end code, and has no fear to try/use new technologies/frameworks/programming languages for solving the challenges our marketing organization faces every day. As a tech lead you'll be splitting your time between pushing features and helping your fellow team members to deliver stuff too.

The Marketing Engineering team owns and maintains Auth0's website, the blog, different websites like jwt.io, openidconnect.net, A/B experiments for all our sites and core products, the on-boarding process of our core products, and a lot of cool new initiatives (like Auth0 University).


Responsibilities:




    • Develop new customer-facing features in our website and our blog.

    • Implement marketing related features in our core products (examples: onboarding process, email subscription center).

    • Provide help and guidance to team members.

    • Optimize our sites and libraries for maximum speed and scalability.

    • Build reusable code and libraries for future use.

    • Help with the adoption of new technologies and frameworks for our sites and libraries.

    • Help implementing A/B experiments in our website, our blog and our core products.

    • Contribute to the community by open sourcing some of the tools we use/create.

    • Provide accurate timing estimates on work.






Requirements:




    • BS/BA degree, CS desired or equivalent work experience.

    • Strong understanding of JavaScript, its quirks, and workarounds. Good knowledge of ES6, ES-next or any of its variations.

    • Experience working as a full-stack developer (node.js, any JavaScript framework).

    • Knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3

    • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as git.

    • Familiarity with front-end build tools, such as Gulp.js or Webpack.

    • Motivated, self-starter. Enthusiastic, creative, and pragmatic.

    • Passionate about the web as a platform.

    • First-hand understanding of Agile development methods.

    • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

    • Excellent prioritization skills to identify and deliver the most important things first.* At least







A day in the life:




    • Co-host or host planning meetings.

    • Provide mentorship to the rest of team members.

    • Write a mini web-apps that will run inside our website (like auth0.com/university).

    • Develop websites like jwt.io or openidconnect.net

    • Build cool stuff using new libraries or technologies and showcase what's possible by example.

    • Open source apps or tools that we use everyday at Auth0, like for instance our soon to be open sourced A/B testing library.

    • Contribute to Auth0 core products through new features, requirements and input.





Auth0 values diversity and inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

item.title: Cyber Security Specialist at Sogeti (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
"Beweeg mee van veilig voelen naar veilig zijn"


Wij geloven dat Security een enabler is voor mens en maatschappij. Door Security te integreren in ALLE facetten, bewegen we van veilig voelen naar veilig zijn. De mens is daarbij onmisbaar vanwege zijn vakmanschap, creativiteit en omdenken. In plaats van te reageren op incidenten acteren wij vanuit een PaSS gedachte. (Pro-active Security Strategy). Kortom, wij zijn gericht op het identificeren, verminderen en voorkomen van security-risico’s.


Organisaties zijn duurzaam veilig en “ in control”, waardoor zij zich kunnen focussen op hun business.


Onze NL Security Community is om dit moment sterk groeiende met al ruim 100 IT GRC consultants,  IAM professionals, Ethical Hackers en Security Intelligence analisten. Samen met 300 security professionals vanuit Sogeti Worldwide helpen wij onze klanten met het integreren van Security in hun operatie, omdat we ervan zijn overtuigd dat onze klanten dan sneller, efficiënter en veiliger hun business voeren. Met 3 SOC’s verspreid door Europa (Frankrijk, Luxemburg en Nederland) bedienen we hen met services op het gebeid van Security Intelligence, Ethical Hacking, en Security consultancy.


Wij zoeken nu Consultants met een kritisch en sterk analytisch oog maar bovenal met een hacker mindset. Jij wilt liever  voorkomen dan genezen. Jij hebt reeds een proven trackrecord in oa; Security Intelligence, Awareness, Ethical Hacking, IAM of  IT GRC. Jij wilt graag jouw kennis delen en bent niet bang om een selling consultancyrol op je te nemen.  Ook op het gebied van tooling weet jij je weg feilloos te vinden; Qrader, Arcsight, Splunk, Cyberark, Oracle IdM, Sailpoint, Microsoft IdM/FIM.


Uiteraard heb jij passende certificeringen op Security gebied zoals; CISSP, CEH of CISA. Logisch vinden wij dat jij voor deze job sowieso HBO of WO geschoold bent en minstens 2 jaar werkervaring meebrengt.


Sogeti biedt jou.


Assignments waar jij met jouw kennis onze klanten op een veilige manier naar de Cloud helpt. Hun applicatielandschap eenvoudiger en beheersbaar maakt door een goed ingericht SIEM, met behulp van marktleidende tooling. Daarnaast heb je binnen Sogeti de mogelijkheid om jezelf te ontwikkelen en te certificeren via  de Sogeti Academy. CISA, CISM, CRISC maar ook relevante technische certificering (IBM, HP, Microsoft, Oracle, enzovoort) behoort tot de mogelijkheden.


Last but not least: samen werken met een grote groep collega’s die gek zijn van hun vak. Of dat nu Security, Consultancy, Development, Infrastructuur, Hightech of Testen is.


Skills & Requirements


Herken jij je in onderstaande competenties?
·        Het implementeren van SIEM oplossingen
·        Netwerk beveiliging
·        Applicatie beveiliging
·        Scripten van connectoren en schrijven van logparsers
 
Of ben jij meer van de vertaalslag naar de business?
·        Analyses van de Business van onze klanten 
·        Analyses van SIEM alerts, data, events, rules
·        Business risico analyses, use cases, abuse cases

item.title: Data Architect at Datalicious Pty Ltd (Bengaluru, India)

You are expected to bring with you extensive hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services (Kinesis streams, EMR, Redshift), Spark and other Big Data processing frameworks and technologies as well as advanced knowledge of RDBS and Data Warehousing solutions.

item.title: Full Stack Developer - End User Mexico at EBANX (Mexico City, Mexico)
item.description:
Buscamos un desarrollador Full Stack para ayudarnos en el desarrollo de productos para nuestros más de 20 millones de clientes en Latinoamérica. Si eres muy bueno y quieres trabajar en un ambiente multicultural e innovador con aires de Sillicon Valley, ven a platicar con nosotros.


Además de intentar conquistar el mundo, tus responsabilidades serán:



  • Desarrollar productos con gran calidad, rápidos (queremos siempre una arquitectura de alto rendimiento), intuitivos, funcionales y con excelente UX / UI (queremos que nuestros usuarios usen nuestros productos de forma natural, rápida y sin bugs).
